"Rocking a Belt of Gender Swap around his chest, he is ready to die in Kingdom Death, as a woman!"

Contents:

+ 1 Anonymous Survivor Miniature

+1 Anonymous Survivor Small Booklet

+ Story Events (est 1-2)

+1 Unique Base Insert

+ 1 Anonymous Philosophy

+1 Secret Fighting Art

+ 3 Gear Cards

There was once a fan who adored a creation so much that they showed appreciation to its creator whenever they could. One day, the creator, in a fit of excitement-induced madness, surprised the fan by including them in their creation.

The lucky fan whose character the Anonymous Survivor's design is based on will be assisting with the design for this "micro expansion" promo set.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Pups: Promo Pack
description:
The Pups Promo Pack includes 5 new cards:

The Legendary Pups and the Underdog card can be added to any game of Pups for a new play experience!

The 4 Legendary Pups are: Cerberus, Argos, Laika and Saurr, and they respectively take the highest seat of power (10) for each suit.

The Underdog acts as a special catch-up card awarded to whatever player trails behind most in the game.

Each Pups Promo Pack also includes a rules card.

name: Madrasso
description: Madrasso, also known as Mandrasso or Magrasso, is perhaps the most popular and widespread card game in Venice and the surrounding region, where it has over the last 50 years practically replaced the older game Scarabocion. In the ranking and values of cards and the presence of a trump suit it is related to Briscola, but because of the necessity to follow suit (as in Tressette) Madrasso offers greater scope for sophisticated card play technique.

name: Ascension: Valley Guardian Promo Card
description:
Valley Guardian is a promo included with an Ascension carrying case sold by Legion Supplies.

Effect: Banish a card in the center row. You may banish this to acquire a card in the center row with cost 6 rune or less and put it into your hand.

name: Paranoia: Troubleshooters
description:
A card game based on the Paranoia RPG.

You live underground in a giant complex controlled by a paranoid computer. This complex is called Alpha Complex. The Computer is your friend. Traitors are executed. Good Citizens help root out Traitors. Mutants are traitors. Secret Society members are traitors. You are a Mutant and a Secret Society Member. You know very little because of your (Red) low security clearance. You have been assigned to a team of Troubleshooters. Troubleshooters shoot trouble. Stay Alert! Trust No One! Keep your Laser Handy!

Each player has a family of 6 clones. Every time your clone is killed, one of your remaining clones takes his place. When all six have been killed you lose and are out of the game. Players try to survive while killing off their opponent’s clones.

There are 2 decks: The Mission Deck and The Paranoia Deck. Cards are of 4 types: Combat, Comprehension, Communication and Treason.

Each turn has 4 Phases:

1. Requisition Phase
- Each player fills their hand to 5 cards from the Paranoia Deck.

2. Mission Phase
- Flip over the top card of the Mission Deck. This describes an encounter all players must face. The encounter will be one of three types: Combat, Comprehension, or Communication. Each player must play (discard) one Paranoia card of a matching type to survive. If a player cannot play a matching card his Clone is killed.

3. Action Phase
- The current player may initiate one or more actions. Actions require the expenditure of Paranoia cards. He may continue doing this until he has no cards left in his hand. The Actions include:
• Situational Awareness: Discard 2 Comprehension cards to draw 3 Paranoia cards and put them in your hand.
• Accusations: Play one or more Treason cards onto an opponent. The opponent may play Communication cards to discard Treason cards on a one to one basis. If a player has 3 or more Treason cards and no way to discard them, that clone is immediately terminated by the computer.
• Shoot the Traitor: The player picks a target opposing player who has at least
one Treason card. Both play combat cards from their hands. The player who plays more combat cards kills the opposing player. If both play an equal number of cards then roll 1D6: The higher roll wins. If still tied, both are killed.
• Special Actions: Some cards allow for special actions when played. These special actions (SA) are described on the individual cards.
- All played cards from Action Phase are discarded.

4. Debriefing Phase
- Max hand size is 5 cards. Discard any excess cards.

The aim of the game is to kill off all your opponents’ clones and be the last one alive.

name: Polar
description:
Polar
Square board, 9x9 or 11x11 or 13x13
Black and white pieces




RulesPieces are placed on empty intersections of the board. Connections are orthogonal only.

The board is initially empty.

One of the players takes two pieces (black and white) and places them on any arbitrary adjacent spaces. The other player may now decide on which color to play.

Black starts, then players take turns placing one of their pieces on an empty space according to the following rules.

Connected pieces form a group, and same-colored connected pieces within a group are called a section. A group may never consist of more than two sections.

Player may only pass if they have no moves left. They must play again in a successive turn when moves are available again.

The game ends when both players have to pass.



ScoreGroups with one or equally sized sections score zero points. For any other group, the player holding the majority section gets the triangular number section points:
T(n) = n*(n+1)/2

The player with the highest total score wins. Games can end in a draw.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Blightwar
description:
War rages across the Mortal Realms. The focal points of the first great battles were those magical portals known as Realmgates, doorways through reality with immense strategic importance. The wars over these were brutal and bloody, and while Sigmar’s glorious Stormcast Eternals can lay claim to victory, it was not quite the all-conquering victory for which they might have hoped. It was not long before the Dark Gods marshalled their counterattack – and none were so febrile and repulsive as those of Grandfather Nurgle…

Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Blightwar is a great-value boxed set, featuring 32 plastic Citadel miniatures split across the armies of Nurgle and the Stormcast Eternals. It focuses on the Blightwar – Nurgle’s dastardly plan to befoul the realm of Ghyran using his Grand Cultivator Horticulous Slimux, and the heroic attempts to stop him by Neave Blacktalon, deadly huntress and swift-footed assassin of the Stormcast Eternals. Contained in the box:
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Karnivore Koala: Insects Expansion
description:
The hunt for mutated insects has begun and this expansion offers you 18 new mutant animal, 16 new workbear, and 5 new Koala King cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Steamroller: Tannenberg 1914
description:
"Steamroller" is a highly playable, tense, operational look at 1914's pivotal Tannenberg campaign. Command either the German 8th Army or the Russian 1st and 2nd Armies in the battle that decided the early course of the Great War on the Eastern Front. The game is the latest iteration of the system used in Hermann's earlier "Race to the Sea 1914", (as well as "Dead Reckoning") with corps, divisions, and brigades traipsing around the wilderlands of East Prussia and northeastern Poland.

Game components include one 11 x 17 game map, one sheet of 88 die-cut counters, and an array of cards used to bid for initiative and determine combat results.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Banana Games, Flying Pig Games, Tiny Battle Publishing

name: Stellar Siege
description:
Brace for Impact! The raging war between the Antillians and the Morkolytes has reached its highest peak. In a final ferocious siege, the rival aliens battle for control of the star system. Each species gathers their forces, planet by planet, as tensions grow. In the end, command of the star system can fall under only one dominion, but whose?

Stellar Siege is a 2-player tactical card game in which you play as one of the rival alien species. You will deploy aliens from your hand into your siege forces at each planet. Hand management is the key to victory, because the number of cards in your hand dictates to which planet you will deploy your alien that turn. Outnumbering your opponent at a planet means you conquer it. At the end of the game, the player who has conquered the most planets wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Hood's Last Gamble
description:
1864. After some maneuvering in northern Georgia in an attempt to disrupt Sherman's supply line, John Bell Hood moved the Confederate Army of Tennessee westward and then to the north. George Thomas's Army of the Cumberland, which was dispersed but growing, stood in the way. Hood's plan had objectives such as defeating scattered Union armies, bringing in thousands of recruits from Tennessee, taking the city of Nashville, and after that even moving into Kentucky and beyond. These goals were optimistic in the face of Federal strength, but Hood was determined to gamble…

Hood's Last Gamble is an operational-level game for two players exploring the 1864 Franklin-Nashville Campaign. It shares some similarities with the designer's earlier games More Aggressive Attitudes and Objective Shreveport!, but has its own identity and flavor. This one has a larger map with many tricky terrain challenges and more Special Event Cards around which to build your strategy. It utilizes a streamlined approach to the tracking of unit Strength Points that reduces counter clutter and allows for more elegant hidden movement opportunities. Supply counters are crucial to getting the most out of your units, and with winter just around the corner, the Confederate Player must act quickly and decisively in order to change history.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Hedgehog Hustle
description:
It's dusk in the meadows and the owl is on the prowl. Mama Hedgehog is calling all her children home before the owl arrives.

Draw a card and look at the number of balls: you have that many chances to forage for the food needed on the card. Check your targets and bounce your hedgehogs into the correct pockets on the board. Have any balls left? Try and win the game automatically by hitting the owl out of the sky with a perfect shot.

Players win if there are 6 food icons facing up. Players lose if there are 8 owl icons facing up.

Contents: 3-Dimensional Forest Scene with Plastic Target, 5 Hedgehog Ping Pong Balls, Ping Pong Ball Holder, 16 Cards, Rules

name: GIFT
description:
You’ve been invited to a party where everyone’s dead. You’re having a great time when you suddenly realise… you’re dead too! The only way to get back to life is to appease the God of Life. The God of Life seeks sacrifice, but not of the physical kind. You must speak witty sentences and entertain for your passage home.

Letters appear before you, made from the bones of those who disappointed. Each word in your sentence must start with these letters. The God of Life loves certain keywords. If you can secretly put a keyword from a Key Card into your sentence then you gain a Body Part. Collect all 5 to win.

However, the God of Death is also listening. If other players can guess your keyword then they take your Body Parts. Can you outwit the God of Death and entertain the God of Life with some Good Interesting Fun Times?
mechanics: Acting, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Virus!: LadrÃ³n de Corazones
description:
Promo print & play card released by Virus! designers.

Celebrate St.Valentine's Day playing Virus!

Steal a RED organ (heart), from any player, even if it is immunized.

Later released in Argentinian "Especial Festivos" promo pack as "San Valentín". (*)

(*) In "Especial Festivos" rules, an immunized organ cannot be stealed.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medical, Print & Play
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: CaÃ¯ssa
description:
Caïssa is one of the "Atlantis Triplets" that employs different implementations of the "atlantis effect," the gradual disappearance of the playing area, eventually leaving one king or the other without refuge.

The other two are Shakti and Cyclix.

On top of that, Caïssa introduces another absolute novelty: "capture by exchange," which is in fact no capture at all.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Modular Board

name: Crystal Tiger Dice
description: Crystal Tiger Dice is a simple dice rolling game where players roll a 20-sided die, a small crystal pyramid, and a tiger figurine to score points based on the way each piece lands. The first player to get exactly 100 points wins.

name: Panzer Grenadier (Modern): 1967 â Sword of Israel: Soviet Airborne
description:
This is the twenty-second of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 24 additional counters as well as additional scenarios.

[Includes] a battalion of Soviet paratroopers to battle the Israelis in the threatened but never executed intervention into the Six Day War.

The Soviet Army's 103rd Guards Airborne Division is a well-trained and well-armed outfit, in the midst of preparations for the Dnepr 1967 exercises - a complete contrast to the Arab armies the Israelis face in the standard scenarios in 1967: Sword of Israel.

The Soviet parachute battalion of 1967 is very much a light infantry outfit - air-droppable armored carriers would only start to arrive the next year, converting the airborne formations into far more capable all-arms units. To make up for that lack, the battalion wields a large number of support weapons: Sagger anti-tank missiles, heavy mortars, recoilless rifles and the diminuitive ASU-85 assault gun.

From the Publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Riga: Die Statue
description: Riga: Die Statue is an expansion for Riga that includes one additional card for each player. You may now decide whether you want to use 2-4 of the "Riga" cards out of the five available (four from the base game, plus "Statue"). The Statue brings you 1 VP for every three coins you have left over at the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Folklore: The Affliction â Shield-Maiden Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Folklore: The Affliction.

This promo adds a new Militia card to the game. The shield-maiden has the following ability: "+5 Defense. Blocks the first hit against you during a skirmish."

This promo has card id "CO#FP04".

This promo was included in Game Trade Magazine #222 (August 2018).

This promo was also included in the Folklore Missing Card Pack (GNEFL47).
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Master of Orion: The Board Game â Galactic Convention Promo Card
description:
After building for 3 Food and 2 Production:
Gain 2 VP for each of your sets of 4 basic card types (each card may be a part of only one set).
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Dreamland (fan expansion for T.I.M.E Stories)
description: 1892 N.T.: Two families came to the town of Promise, Nevada with the same dream—to work the land, gather its riches, and create their own slice of heaven. But as their rivalry grows, will they find hell instead? Legend says a fireball from the sky burned down the entire town, but the T.I.M.E Agency knows one of the family elders is the culprit. Can you stop the right one in time?
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Storytelling

name: Math Genius
description:
Math Genius is a tile-based color and shape [For color blind person] matching game for 2 to 4 players, designed by Mike Ooi and published by Empire Game. Math Genius game mechanism shares some characteristics with the games "Qwrikles" and "Scrabble", It's combination of both game mechanism.

How to Play the game in 3 simple steps:
1. Player match the same color of the tile side by side, the color would determine the arithmetic operation. The Player will replenish his/her tile rack from the tiles bag once he/she end his/she turn.
Green = Addition
Blue = Subtraction
Orange = Multiplication,
Pink = Division

2. Then Player calculate the score for the turn in a piece of paper.

3. Player win the game either with the highest score or the lowest score, depending of the game objective mission on an agreeable rounds.

—description from the designer

name: The Everrain: Art Book Promo Material
description: 2 Ship Improvements, 2 Denizen, 3 Expedition and 1 Sea Event cards. It was given out together with the Art Book for The Everrain.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling, Tile Placement

name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): Warriors of Chaos
description:
Warhammer: Warriors of Chaos is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 128-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Warriors of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Eighth Edition): The Empire
description:
Warhammer: The Empire is an expansion to the 8th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect The Empire faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: The Duke: Reinforcements â Gunpowder Uprising
description:
8 new tiles for The Duke!

After players select their bags of Troops Tiles and the gameboard is setup, they take their appropriate-colored tiles from Gunpowder Uprising and add them to their bags.

name: Gryphon Delivery Service
description:
Gryphon couriers have always been the backbone of trade in Dsyx. Fast, discreet, and formadible in the face of pirates and bandits. But Gnomish airships, Dwarven "Grease Tunnels" and the ever improving field of teleportation magic has left gryphon-run delivery services hustling for work. Coordinate your last few couriers on the most profitable run possible, contending with unpredictable winds, mischevious fairies, and coniving goblins, and maybe you won't have to close your doors.

Gryphon Delivery Service is a solitaire roll-and-write game where players attempt to move three characters -- gryphon couriers -- along a track from start to finish, while picking up and dropping off various items to turn a profit. Each space either yields an item, allows an item to be sold, or represents an encounter with one of the Dsyx world's various races that can offer players a windfall... or catastrophe. Instead of being sold outright, items can also be used instead to influence various markets, raising prices for (hopeful) future sales. Players must manage each of their characters, their special abilities, and their inventories well, because as soon as the first character reaches the end of the track, the game is over, and any items that were left undelivered represent lost opportunities to make precious gold.

The easy part is getting to the end of the game. The hard part is having anything to show for it. Succeed, and the courier service will live to see another day; fail, and hard-working gryphons will blame YOU for their unemployment.

—description from the publisher


Released in the July 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Phase Order

name: Panzertroops: Infantry Assault
description: 15mm Paint'n'Play box set. INFANTRY ASSAULT contains a squad each of Germans and Americans plus rules, paints and a painting guide. This is one of two games in the Paint'n'Play Panzertroops series. The companion game, TANK ATTACK, used the same rules, but contained tanks as well as infantry.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Congress
description:
Congress is one of several games playable with the Katarenga board and pieces. This game is invented by the author of Katarenga.

The pawns start on the edge squares of the board. The goal of the game is to be the first one who gets all of his pawns together in a connected group, with each orthogonally adjacent to at least one of its fellows.

name: War in the Outposts: The Madagascar Campaign
description:
An official Europa scenario published in The Europa Magazine 87 (Vol.XV,No.5).

It covers the British campaign to seize Madagascar from the Vichy French, which took up most of 1942.
The game uses typical Europa system rules, and includes a map of Madagascar (not on the normal Europa scale, with insert maps of Mauritius and Reunion), but players must supply counters from other games and create counters of their own.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Legends Untold: UKGE 2017 Promo Adventure
description:
Originally handed out at the U.K. Games Expo in 2017.

This promo adventure has now been included in both the Retail Edition and the Kickstarter edition of Legends Untold: Weeping Caves Novice Set.

The UKGE promo adventure is comprised of 4 Location cards, a double sided adventure card, and the three loot cards.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Chaos Battletome â Disciples of Tzeentch
description:
Chaos Battletome: Disciples of Tzeentch is the guide to fielding the mortal and daemonic servants of Tzeentch in Age of Sigmar.

This book contains the dark history and deeds of Tzeentch and his minions. It also includes a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules, battleplans, warscrolls and allegiance abilities for fielding the Disciples of Tzeentch in Age of Sigmar.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Afrika 1944: A Panzer Grenadier Expansion Book
description:
Shattered in the Battle of Alamein in late 1942, Germany's once-formidable Afrika Korps stumbled back from Egypt across Libya, to meet its end in Tunisia. Axis and Allied armies had surged back and forth across the Western Desert for just over two years, each time managing to recover from defeat and eventually stage a counter-offensive.

...could the stalemate have continued? And now we've answered with this 24-scenario supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series, complete with 130 playing pieces. Certainly each side had difficulty bringing sufficient force to bear, and both German and Italian leaders thought they could continue the war in the western desert after Alamein. Significant events would have to place in other theaters of war to allow the Italian Navy to maintain supply lines across the Mediterranean and prevent the United States from bringing its massive resources to bear.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Epic Card Game: Lost Tribe â Evil
description:
The Lost Tribe is a set of four 15 card packs, one for each alignment (Evil, Good, Sage and Wild). Combine any two packs to create a 30 card, two-color deck and you are ready to play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Awkward Pucket Extension pack
description:
The Awkward pucks include: the flying saucer, whose rounded edges cause it to fly up when fired; the fatboy, who only just fits through the gate; the wedgie, specially shaped to wedge under the elastic on the other side; the long face, who only fits through longways; the crab’s claw, that must be fired wrist-first; the two timer, which forces you to get two pucks through at once; and the lopsidewinder, whose embedded weight makes it swerve off to one side. The pack includes two of each kind of puck plus instructions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Camp Pinetop: Nature Expansion
description:
The Nature Expansion adds another layer to game play. During set up players will pick one of four animals: Otter, Trout, Elk or Beaver. One of these animals will start on a random space. Next, the Bear and eagle will be placed on a random space as well. Players will also place a weather icon above a random column.

Adding in different animals and weather elements will increase the depth of the game. Animals have special powers that can help or hinder your ability to complete achievements in the game. While you can not play with all the animals at the same time, you will choose a set of animals for each game when you play this is delightful expansion. Animals and weather will move through the wilderness throughout the game. This will give a more realistic feeling of camping out and completing your achievement patches!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Travel
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: GYÃMI: Lemon Promo Card
description:
Shuffle the lemon promo cards into the base Gyumi deck then prepare it as it’s written in the game rules.
When a player draws a lemon card in its own round it’s obligatory to keep it! After placing the card the round is over. At the end of the game the obtained lemon cards should be scored as if they were normal fruits but with a minus sign!

—description from the designer

name: Milites Mundi: Ancient and Medieval Wargames Rules for Smaller Scale Figures
description:
Milites Mundi is a 'big battle' games rule set for fighting actions in the ancient and medieval periods.

Games of Milites Mundi involve hundreds of figures per side arranged into multiple units.

The game is designed to last for two hours and encourages the use of historical tactics and formations (without being prescriptive) and emphasises the the need to maintain cohesion in the army's battle line and sweeping flank attacks.

—description from the publisher

name: Quo Vadis
description:
The light of the beginning!
The gods who created the world next wanted faithful servants who worshiped themselves.
The gods breathed life into the soil that they created to resemble themselves, and five races were born in this world.

This is a war game depicting the rise and conflict of various races.
This is a strategic-level game that competes in how to invade territory, eliminate foreign enemies, and spread and maintain your own prints. Because of the narrowness of the map, pacifism does not work. Somewhere in the game, you will almost certainly get into war.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: They Fell Like Stones: Isandlwana
description:
"They Fell Like Stones: Isandlwana" is a solitaire tactical simulation of the January 22, 1879 battle. You control the British Imperial forces and solitaire rules govern the Zulu side. As the Imperial commander, you must array your forces as best you can to meet the Zulu attack. Several scenarios are available including the full use of Glyn's Detachment, which historically was sent off on a wild-goose chase, dividing the Imperial forces.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers â Shadow Boss Expansion
description:
Add to your Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers collection with these individual Boss expansions. Each expansion introduces unique challenges with a new Boss and Track to play on. Bosses can also be used as additional Racers. Collect ALL 4 Boss Expansions!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Racing, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Illuminati (Second Edition): Alternative Truths
description:
The world is crazier than ever. Help it along with alternative truths!

The expansion Illuminati (Second Edition): Alternative Facts consists of 125 cards (including three blanks) for use with the Illuminati (Second Edition) base game. Look for New World Order cards and Artifacts that will allow "Shangri-La" to use the "Spear of Longinus" during a period of "Fanatics Unite" to take over the suddenly cooperative "Paparazzi" with the "Special Persecutor".
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Neo-Morphosis: Infestation â The Brood Queen Expansion
description:
This expansion features the Brood Queen, a giant miniature, and new map tiles for two huge new rooms. Behaviour cards introduce new twists to Boss bug AI, and obstacles on the map create new challenges for the crew.

Expansion includes:
- Brood Queen miniature
- 4 Behaviour cards
- 4 Encounter cards
- 2 double sided map tiles
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Death Battletome â Legions of Nagash
description:
A dread figure casts its shadow across the battlefield, a skeletal giant clad in osseous armour and wielding a skull-tipped staff that casts a sickening glow across the earth. A nimbus of shrieking spirits swirls around this nightmarish form. The avatar of undeath gestures with a fleshless hand, and the ground beneath it erupts as hordes of skeletons burst from shallow graves, falling upon their new master’s foes with rusted blades swinging. Nagash, the Great Necromancer, surveys the carnage with cold approval. Even as his enemies are torn apart, they rise again, slaughtering those they fought beside mere moments earlier. Such is the will of Nagash, and such is the fate he desires for all living things.

In the 120-page hardback Battletome: Legions of Nagash, you’ll find:

- The Lord of Undeath: a description of Nagash’s place in the grand scheme of the mortal realms, the undead creatures that serve him and an overview of the plans he has – elimination of all life and the expansion of his empire;
- The Missing Souls: previously, an uneasy alliance – or at least a mutual respect – existed between Nagash and the God-King Sigmar; in this section, learn how that alliance fell apart;
- The Realm of Death: a description of Shyish, a realm of endings and underworlds uncountable, and Nagash’s domain;
- The Legions of Nagash: an overview of Nagash’s armies, and how Mortarchs are employed to lead them into grim battle;
- A Legacy of Darkness: a timeline covering Nagash’s exploits dating back to the Age of Myth, with key events and battles leading to the present time;
- Detailed background on the forces available to Nagash, including his Mortarchs, Soulblight Vampires, Nighthaunt Spirits, The Deathrattle Legions, Deathmages, and Deadwalkers;
- A showcase of beautifully-painted Citadel miniatures, with an example army;
- Painting your Legion: expert painting advice including stage by stage examples of painting bone, zombie flesh, rusted blades and banners, with special effects including adding gore, grime and dirt to your miniatures.

Rules

All the rules you need in order to get your Legions of Nagash army ready for the gaming table are here:

- 33 Warscrolls, covering every miniature in the Legions of Nagash faction;
- 6 sets of Allegiance Abilities – the Grand Host of Nagash, Legion of Sacrament, Legion of Blood, Legion of Night, Soulblight, and Death – each with their own unique Artefacts of Power, Command Traits, Battle Traits, and Command Ability;
- 2 different Lores of the Dead – Lore of the Deathmages, and Lore of the Vampires;
- 2 Battleplans, each featuring guidance on army compositions, objectives, specific Command Abilities for both sides, set-up and victory conditions;
- Rules for setting up a Legions of Nagash warband for a Path to Glory campaign, including a Champion Rewards Table, Monster Followers Rewards Table, Followers Rewards Table, and Path to Glory warband roster;
- Pitched Battle Profiles for every unit and miniature featured in this Battletome.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Owly Tribe: Promo tiles
description:
New location tiles to add to the basic game.

Promo found in Plato magazine 122

Tile #1: Leave one of your warriors at this location for the next round

Tile #2: Copy the power of the location with the most warrior owls
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Spirit Duels
description:
Spirit Duels is a fast-paced card game of dice-driven combat. Lead a team of magical creatures known as Spirits into battle against your opponent! Command and evolve your Spirits to gain the advantage in combat and defeat your rivals!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Warfighter: Expansion #55 â Medals
description:
This expansion gives you Medals for: Israel, Germany, Mexico, UK, Australia, Canada, Poland, Russia, France, South Korea, Italy, and the US.

How Medals work: Your Soldiers are awarded Medals after a Mission by achieving the requirement specified for each Medal. You then peel-off a Medal sticker and apply it to the Soldier card. The Soldier keeps the Medal sticker, and its bonus, when you select them for future Missions. Each Medal has an RP value for Mission balance. Should the Soldier ever get Downed in a Mission, you remove all of their Medals.

This expansion offers 47 cards, along with a sticker sheet, including:


14 Medals (US)
3 Medals (Israel)
4 Medals (Germany)
3 Medals (Mexico)
4 Medals (Italy)
2 Medals (South Korea)
2 Medals (France)
3 Medals (Russia)
4 Medals (Poland)
3 Medals (Canada)
3 Medals (Australia)
2 Medals (UK)


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Gloomhaven: The Lucky Meeple (Promo Scenario)
description:
This is a digital promotional scenario for Gloomhaven created for backers of the Man Vs Meeple Season Two Kickstarter campaign.

The promo consists of two files: one 3-page PDF and a JPG of an event card.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Traintopia: Starting Tile Promo
description:
This promo adds another Starting Tile to the game. Simply mix this tile with the other Starting Tiles before giving each player a random tile as part of setup.

This promo was given to retailers at GAMA 2020. Retailers were encouraged to give these to their customers as preorder bonuses.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Set-up

name: Kobolds VS Goblins
description:
If you were picked on your entire life, would you consider finding a way to fight back? In Kobolds Vs. Goblins that's what happens! When the leader of a small tribe of Kobolds has finally had enough of being picked on and ridiculed, he comes up with a plan. Not just "a" plan, "the" plan! If the ones picking on him are doing it because they are stronger and bigger than him, he'll find someone bigger and stronger than THEM!

It's a foolproof plan. He decides to swear allegiance to the Mightiest of them all, the great red dragon. But, he knows he can't just go alone. The great red dragon wouldn't even bat an eye at a single Kobold seeking to join his ranks. The plan calls for a much larger number of Kobolds to show up and wear their allegiance. He isn't sure, but he thinks 30 sounds like a pretty large number.

So, the plan, to reiterate, is to recruit 30 Kobolds to join the cause and follow the great red dragon, then, make fun of all the ones that have made fun of us because we'll have the protection of the great red dragon!

This is the perfect plan, well it was! Unfortunately, the Goblins (Another of the puny races that always gets picked on and our bitter rivals) heard about "the plan". The Goblins have decided to copy the plan and only change one little detail... they are going to swear allegiance to the Great Orcish Chieftain! How dare they steal the plan that took me the whole time I was on the poop pot!

The plan has changed, well, no, not really. But now we have to do it faster than them! Then, we'll have the great red dragon smoosh those little green meanies!

Oh, I've gone on a tangent haven't I?

Ahem...

You'll love the fast paced nature of Kobolds Vs. Goblins with the rapid dice rolls, the press-your-luck mechanics blended perfectly with Roll & Write tracking system for a sweet 5-15 minute game that you'll want to play again and again.

—description from the publisher

name: Splendor: 2019 Promo â Shen Wansan and Zhou Ying
description:
Two new nobles tiles to be used for Splendor.

Artwork included one male and female noble---Business people Shen Wansan (æ²ä¸ä¸) and Zhou Ying (å¨è¹).

The bottom right hand corner of each tile is marked with a “p” to indicate that it is a promotional noble.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Renaissance

name: Little Ladybug
description:
Little Ladybug is the game for children.

A first player receives the ladybug doll and puts it on their hand.
Then in the clockwise order, the next player rolls the dice.
If the dice shows color, the player puts the corresponding color token on the ladybug.
If the dice shows a ladybug, the ladybug doll will be moved to that player’s hand.

Play continues until every seven space on the ladybug doll has been occupied by color token, and the player with the ladybug doll wins the game.

name: 60 Second Cocktail
description:
Players all have a colour coded hand of four cards. This hand contains one spirit, one garnish, one mixer (like soda or tonic) and ice. Most of these cards have a time amount associated with them.

Each player plays one card in front of them face down until there are 4 cards on the table. Then, similar to Sculls n Roses, players may play a card or or bid on how many cards they can flip face up without busting out of 60 seconds. Once a bid has been made other players get a chance to up bid. A player must flip all their own cards first and then must flip other players cards top to bottom.

If you bust out over 60 seconds or fail to make a cocktail (no spirit). Your boss docks you one dollar (out of the game).

If you flip your bid without busting (and made a cocktail) you get a tip from the middle of the table. If your cocktail has two ice cards you get an extra tip

The game continues until the tips in the middle of the table are used up and the person with the most coins wins.. ..or there is only one player not washing glasses.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Boss Monster: Santa Epic Hero Promo
description: Santa Claus was created as a promo during the Digital Boss Monster Kickstarter campaign. It was released on December 24th, 2014. It is the first Hero to have 9 base Health.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Bad Guy Nonsense
description:
Bad Guy Nonsense is a unique strategic family card game where you compete to capture fantastical BAD GUYS. It features wild pop culture-rich artwork on large OVERSIZED glossy linen cards making it unlike anything else that has come before.

You’ll need all your wits and gaming skills to employ BOUNTY HUNTERS, BANDITS, BURGLARS, HEROES, MONSTERS, and a WITCH to capture high-value BAD GUY targets. Battle your opponent to steal their captures while defending your own.

The goal of the game is to score points by capturing the most Bad Guy Cards before the deck runs out. You'll need to get the right card combos to make a capture and score points. The higher the value target, the harder the combo is to acquire. You make captures and score points while the SPECIAL CARDS (HEROES, BURGLAR, BANDIT, WITCH, MONSTER) all cause massive havoc between you and your opponent(s). The game gets intense as each turn passes because once the deck runs out, the game is over. When this happens, uncaptured BAD GUYS count as negative points. So you'll want to start discarding them when the deck runs low! However, your opponent(s) may be able to pick them up and use it against you... It's impossible to tell how many turns are left as you don't know how many cards the next player will play!

—description from the designer

name: Blood Red Skies: Campaign Pack
description:
Strafe the Allied forces storming up the beach-head,
fly reconnaissance missions,
sink battleships
and much more in these varied Blood Red Skies, originally part of the D-Day 75th Anniversary Campaign scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Goblivion: Goblinosaurus
description:
The Goblinosaurus is a single-card Kickstarter expansion for Goblivion (but came with Dinoblivion Kickstarter). It came in a separate ziplock bag outside the base game's box.

The Goblinosaurus is a Boss.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Prehistoric
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Tower of Silence: The End of Prophecy
description:
Beneath the waves the bodies float. Silently drifting towards the shore. Drawn by a prophecy that soon they shall become. A crumbling tower rises before them. Strange lights burning within. One final effort and then no more. One final no more.

Tower of Silence is a dark and brutal game of abandoned hope and apocalyptic prophecy. Players take on the roles of shipwrecked souls washing ashore at the base of a mountainous tower slowly crumbling away into the icy seas. Drawn like moths to the flame that burns high above, they begin a long and harrowing climb which will either see them lost in the shadows of death or transformed in the fires of prophecy.

Each turn players take control of a new soul (up to a maximum of three souls per player) and roll their starting hope and location. As souls crawl about and make various efforts, their hope dwindles, and once it is all gone, they become shadows of death further draining the hope of those who follow after them. If a soul manages to reach the top of the tower, the player controlling it burns the corresponding standee in a black candle and draws a prophetic uttering. Once all souls have either abandoned hope or been consigned to the flames, the utterings are lined up to produce a unique prophecy for that game only.

Tower of Silence is the first installment in the Trilogy of Lost Hope which continues with Iron Mountain and Pesta. It comes with a dedicated soundtrack (Stilhedens Tårn) recorded and released by dungeon synth artist Offermose. Players are encouraged to listen to the album as they play. A streaming link is provided in the rulebook.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Legacy Game, Player Elimination, Resource to Move, Take That, Variable Set-up

name: WolfWalkers: The Board Game
description:
The board game is based on the film WolfWalkers.

ABOUT THE FILM

In a time of superstition and magic, a young apprentice hunter, Robyn Goodfellowe, journeys to Ireland with her father to wipe out the last wolf pack. While exploring the forbidden lands outside the city walls, Robyn befriends a free-spirited girl, Mebh, a member of a mysterious tribe rumored to have the ability to transform into wolves by night. As they search for Mebh’s missing mother, Robyn uncovers a secret that draws her further into the enchanted world of the WOLFWALKERS and risks turning into the very thing her father is tasked to destroy.

ABOUT THE BOARD GAME

The objective of the game is to find three parts of the wolf soul in one colour and bring it back to the Lair before soldiers, who start in the town area on one side of the board, reach the Lair on the opposite side of the board.

The central board has a grid (called road) with fields marked with four different symbols. Some of the fields are connected with a path to the area with stacks of tiles. There are rune symbols at each intersection which represent the runes players collect during the game to buy the tiles. The grid is divided into three town areas with two fields marked for soldiers at the top of the board and nine forest areas at the bottom with the Lair area where players start the game – each with their own Wolfwalker figure.

Each area has a stack with a certain number of tiles which depends on the mode players choose. In general, there are four types of tiles: a) tiles that move soldiers toward the Lair; b) wolf souls that the players try to find (three parts in three colours); c) tiles that help players find the wolf souls or change the soldier movements and d) neutral tiles. Each game mode adds some tiles or changes their meaning.

On their turn, the player rolls a die and moves along any road. They have to stop on the first field with a symbol matching the symbol on the die. Then they count the rune symbols they passed on their way and take the rune tokens which are used to buy the tiles. It is possible to get more than one rune in one turn (if you pass two rune symbols, you get two runes, etc.). If the field they ended their movement on is connected with a path to a stack of tiles, they reveal the top tile(s). If they reveal a soldier tile, they have to move one of the soldiers in the direction shown on the tile. If the tile has a price (wolf souls, tiles that help players) the player can buy it with runes they collected. If the bought tile is a wolf soul, they place it in front of them. If it is any other tile, they have to use it immediately (e.g., you have another turn; move one of the soldiers in any direction).

Additionally, there are two special symbols on the die that allow players to either reveal any top tile on the board or buy any revealed tile on the board.

The game has three cooperative game modes with each adding additional rules and new tiles (e.g., look at the top tile of any stack, then place it on top of any pile face down) or more soldier tiles to make the game more difficult. The fourth mode is the competitive mode with the player who collects the completed wolf soul and brings it back to the Lair first winning.

At the end of the rules you can also find achievements (e.g., win three games in a row, play solo with two Wolfwalker figures) and challenges that change the rules a bit in a unique way (e.g., win with soldiers being at the two rune symbols at the top of the board at the end of the game; each player looks at two chosen stacks of tiles in secret before the game starts. For the rest of the game you cannot communicate.)

-description from publisher
categories: Children's Game, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Carnival
description: In Carnival you start with a handful of creature cards. You can play these in front of you or to contribute to the central pile. Creatures in front of you will earn you points, but only if there are more creatures of the same type in the central pile. How many creatures are you going to contribute to the central pile?

name: Monopoly: Dragon Ball Super
description:
Fierce competition is rife for Dragon Ball enthusiasts and challengers in Monopoly: Dragon Ball Super, where a battle with Beerus, the mythical God of Destruction, sets the stage for a Tournament of Power where the strongest fighter will win.

Buy, sell, and trade characters from the Dragon Ball Super universes to come out with the most riches. The custom sunburst game board features 26 spaces named for your favorite fighters, including Goku, Jiren, Gohan, Piccolo, Frost, and Vegeta in various forms, around a collage of other series characters such as Androids 17 and 18, Kamesennin, Hit, Toppo, Tenshinhan, and more!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Roll and Die
description:
Roll and Die is a roll and write game in which we will summon monsters to kill the humans invading our town. In each round we will use dice rolls to define how many humans appear in different areas of our town and also how many monsters, and from which areas, we can summon. At the end of six game rounds whoever leaves the fewest surviving humans will be the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Under Ten Flags: Hunting the Raider Atlantis 1939-1941
description:
Under Ten Flags starts early in 1939 when the German merchant raider Atlantis made its way into the South Atlantic to sink and capture Allied cargo vessels. Its crew used their skill in disguising the appearance of the vessel to aid its encounters or avoid enemy warships. The journey of the raider Atlantis lasted for over 600 days and traveled over 100,000 miles.

Follows the 100,000 mile journey of the German "auxiliary cruiser" Atlantis, a "merchant raider" capable of changing its shaped and configuration as well as its flags. Atlantis is probably the most successful merchant raider of all times when combining total tonnage sunk and how long it forced the Royal Navy to chase it; plus, it captured documents of strategic importance that actually impacted the war. The "adventure" sounds like something from a movie, and in fact, did inspire one from which our title comes. Each player is challenged to "do better" than their historical counterparts.

-description from publisher's website

name: Die Legenden von Andor: DÃ¼stere Zeiten â Zwei junge Bewahrer
description:
Promo for Die verschollenen Legenden: Düstere Zeiten

It is a single card expansion. A camp is placed on the board at the start of the game. One hero has to stay in the camp at the end of the day to protect the two keepers. Otherwise all heroes will loose two willpower. The heroes may gather equipment for the keepers so they can protect themselves. Then a hero will gain 2 willpower at the end of the day if he stays in the camp.

It was offered at the Kosmos online shop during the Spiel.digital 2020.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Wargaming in History: Waterloo
description:
The purpose of this 'Wargaming in History' series is to offer, in detail, hints, tips, and advice on specific periods and wars that are wargaming favourites. All the necessary information, - campaigns, battles, weapons, tactics, etc. - is included and the books are illustrated with tactical diagrams, maps, contemporary illustrations and photo¬graphs.

Waterloo. The end of Napoleon and the end of an era, was actually a series of involved attacks and counter thrusts in mid-June of 1815.

All the intriguing subterfuges, night marches, treachery, command decisions, strategies, and tactics that transformed a tiny part of Belgium into a household word for decisive warfare are brilliantly described, with special attention given to meticulous mapping of the flow of armies in combat.

A sensible sets of rules for engagement, including movement, infantry battles, and when, by chance or skill, a depleted force must be removed from the firestorm and acrid smoke of battle.
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Ice Cream You Scream!
description:
ICE CREAM YOU SCREAM! is a family game for all ages where you each own a competing ice cream shop. You roll 7 dice to dish out ice cream cones complete with whipped cream and a cherry on top. Players roll up to seven dice per turn trying to build their treat with a flavored cone, cherry, whipped cream, and 1-4 specific scoops to score points. As long as one die on your roll can build onto the cone you've started, you can keep rolling to complete it or risk your progress to add more scoops and freeze out your opponents. Push your luck too far and you'll end up with brain freeze and find your chances of victory dropping precipitously.
Once one player has sold cones of all four flavors, whoever has sold the most total scoops wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: The Belgian Beers Race: Characters expansion
description:
18 cards with characters to give asymmetrical player abilities.

The expansion is BYR Games exclusive and part of the all-in Kickstarter pledge.
mechanics: Area Movement, Movement Points, Race, Variable Set-up

name: Cactus Town: Stampede
description:
This expansion introduces another new asymmetric party to Cactus Town: The Cowboys and their herd of cows.

In the mix of Spaghetti Western parties, the cowboys don't want to stay behind. And they are not alone, they have brought their cattle with them. This is the craziest of all factions, the cowboys need to steer their herd through Cactus Town, guiding the lifestock to the cattle train waiting at the other side of town.

On their way, the herd will create stampedes, with the cows taking on anyone who stands in their way. Chain reactions are possible and no one is safe from the beasts. But then again, maybe you don't want to, because their movement effect might help you in your own objectives.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Programmed Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Hecatomb: Last Hallow's Eve
description:
Released on October 28, 2005, this expansion added 144 cards to the base Hecatomb collectible card game, using the same themes from the base set.

The base game description via the Wizards of the Coast website:

In Hecatomb, each player is an Endbringer, an evil genius bent on the destruction of the modern-day world. Endbringers summon monsters from myth and nightmare, breeding hybrids that can destroy an enemy's forces, eventually building up enough power to destroy the world. After a world is destroyed, the Endbringers travel through dimensional portals to other, parallel worlds where the contest begins again.

Hecatomb's unusual stacking mechanic gives the game a three-dimensional feel. Five-sided Hecatomb cards depict a variety of horrid creatures, from terrible beasts and demons to crazed shamans. Cards feature four clear edges, with scores for power and abilities on the fifth edge. Players can create frightening creature hybrids called Abominations by stacking cards on top of each other. Each Abomination combines the powers and special abilities of all the creatures used to assemble it. The clear edges allow players to see the total power scores and abilities of up to 5 cards stacked together.

Hecatomb was discontinued as of 5/24/2006.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Hecatomb: Blanket of Lies
description:
Released on February 24, 2006, this expansion added 72 cards to the base Hecatomb collectible card game, with a theme of extraterrestrial invasion.

The base game description via the Wizards of the Coast website:

In Hecatomb, each player is an Endbringer, an evil genius bent on the destruction of the modern-day world. Endbringers summon monsters from myth and nightmare, breeding hybrids that can destroy an enemy's forces, eventually building up enough power to destroy the world. After a world is destroyed, the Endbringers travel through dimensional portals to other, parallel worlds where the contest begins again.

Hecatomb's unusual stacking mechanic gives the game a three-dimensional feel. Five-sided Hecatomb cards depict a variety of horrid creatures, from terrible beasts and demons to crazed shamans. Cards feature four clear edges, with scores for power and abilities on the fifth edge. Players can create frightening creature hybrids called Abominations by stacking cards on top of each other. Each Abomination combines the powers and special abilities of all the creatures used to assemble it. The clear edges allow players to see the total power scores and abilities of up to 5 cards stacked together.

Hecatomb was discontinued as of 5/24/2006.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: The Endless Odyssey: A Mythic Storytelling Card Game
description:
Fire your imagination with these fun Endless Odyssey storytelling cards. Reviving the Victorian craze for ‘myrioramas’, the 20 picture cards can be placed in any order to create seamless scenes. Almost infinite combinations of cards provide endless storyscaping possibilities.

Enter a strange land of winged horses and vengeful gods, where one-eyed monsters feast on human flesh. Perhaps you will stumble across buried treasure or receive a favourable prophecy, but watch out for the sinister boatman. He is waiting to transport you across the river, a journey from which no one has ever returned … Where will the story take you?

There are over two quintillion storyscaping possibilities, and you can build a seamless panorama stretching up to 5 1/2 feet!

—description from the publisher

name: A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic â Deadly Fields
description:
Towering over the sweeping cornfields, the ominous windmill creaks and sways as its blades turn in the dark autumn sky. There are evils that lurk within the fields, and a darkness growing below the mill’s musty wooden floor.

This 16 card supplement for Dark Gothic is themed around the Windmill location as well as the cornfields that surround it. With new cards for Minions, Allies, Gear, and Events, it also features a new Special Location card type for the Cornfields. Sitting below the center line when revealed, the Cornfields gives an extra risk and reward to players that acquire any of the cards above it…collected from within the sinister, maze-like crops that have dried and withered with the taint of evil.

—description from the publisher

name: Hellboy: The Board Game â End of Days
description: End of Days includes new playable agents – Ted Howards, Sledgehammer, Evolved Abe Sapien and Flaming Liz Sherman – plus the Eviction Notices Case File, character-specific Deck of Doom cards and Requisition Cards. Use these new agents to tackle the new expansions or return to your favourite missions from the original game and play them again with a fresh cast of heroes.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Ð¨ÐµÑÐ»Ð¾Ðº Ð¥Ð¾Ð»Ð¼Ñ (Sherlock Holmes)
description:
In Sherlock Holmes, detectives venture to the darkest parts of London trying to solve one of six different Sherlock Holmes cases.

At the start of the game, each player is given one of the six cases to solve (kept secret). On their turn, players move their detective piece one or two spaces on the board. Travelling from location to location, they collect clues to be the first to solve their case. Once all their clues have been collected, the player must arrest the criminal before the case is finally solved. Once a player has solved a case, every other player has ten turns to solve their case (losing 1 point each turn). The game ends once all players have solved their case (or if the last players have reached -10 points). All players who have solved their case count up their points (from their case tiles and if they successfully found the criminal) and the player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Formula OviNE
description:
A sheep racing game where 3-6 players blind bid matchsticks and those who don't bid the same as another player(s) get to move; the aim being to race your sheep around 'the Barn' and back over the finish line before the other players.

Each sheep comes with a 'driver' with a special power and a terrible sheep pun for a name eg. Jenson Mutton, A Lamb Prost etc.

—description from the designer

name: ThreeTale: Moonglow
description:
ThreeÐ¢ale - Moonglow is an expansion for ThreeTale.

New heroes : Wheat Bread, Krali Marko and the Blind Girl are on their way to the Last Blacksmith or the Darkness at the End of the tunnel
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Modular Board, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Storytelling, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Publish or Perish: WiÃ±ay Kawsay
description:
Machu Picchu has captivated the imagination of the world and academia alike. There's been plenty of theories about what its purpose could have been. Was it a lost city? Perhaps a citadel? Or maybe something else entirely? That is for you to decide!

In Publish or Perish: Wiñay Kawsay — roughly pronounced win-nyay cow-say — you will step into the shoes of historical scholars. Uncover artifacts, reexamine evidence, publish your histories, and navigate the impact of your actions on this enigmatic wonder. In the deeply competitive world of publish-or-perish academia, will you succeed in influencing perception of what Machu Picchu really was? Or will your theories be one of many forgotten attempts at unravelling this mystery?

In slightly more detail, over the course of the game you place researchers to pick up evidence cards across the site of Machu Picchu, then commit evidence cards to support different interpretations of Machu Picchu's past to win publications and bonuses, while also trying to mitigate your disturbance of the site by returning artifacts to the land.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Apogee: Mission Stellar Stride
description:
A small expansion that adds an orbital station including 6 Mission Cards for Co-op mode!

contains :

1 rulebook
1 Orbital Station board
30 Orbital Station Technology cards
4 European Mission Director cards
6 Coop Mission cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Space Exploration

name: Escape From A Dying Planet
description:
Who knew that landing on a potentially unstable yet exponentially profitable planet would’ve had consequences? Lo and behold, the predictable has happened and the planet has started to collapse. But fear not! The Planetary Development Corporation (PDC) has sent along a life pod with your expedition in case something bad happened. However, they’re not going to just let any old survivor of a cataclysmic event in! You have to prove your value to the PDC, and you do that by bringing back the rarest and most priceless artifacts from your expedition. If you can, it looks like a life of leisure and riches await. If you can’t, then you don’t have to worry about it for very long…

Welcome to Escape from a Dying Planet, a push your luck style card game where you and the other members of your doomed expedition fight to make it to the escape pod, grabbing as much treasure along the way and get off the planet! This game is a 2-8 player card game where players must try to overcome challenges and bid on treasures over the course of 10 turns. Be careful as you can gain contamination which will clog your deck and gain you negative points. Whomever has the highest value of treasures at the end wins!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game â Lannister 2021 Card Update Pack
description: Find all the cards from the 2021 update in this pack of cards for Lannister players.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Measurement Movement, Worker Placement

name: Die Abenteuer des Robin Hood: Licht und Schatten
description:
Postcard Mini-Expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood. Handed out as a part oft the KOSMOS catalog at Spiel 2021.

Card text (translated): Place this card is below the Hope banner so that the dark arrow points to the 6. Each time hope would rise in the land, you could instead slide this card 1 to the left.

The card has special effects for the Minstrel (Minnesanger) character.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Freedom Rings
description:
Freedom Rings is a game based on the idea that an economy is a community that can be free and fair to all. The richest don’t always win and victory is what you choose it to be. The game board is inspired by a thriving city; with the greatest land values in its heart, medium land values in the suburbs, and the lowest land values in the rural areas. Freedom Rings’ blends economics, ease of play, and short time to finish.

Each player receives the 7 goal cards and chooses a single goal card to secretly play. The game is played with the 3 playing pieces, one for each of the three property rings. Before each turn, the player must choose which ring to play. The first time a player plays a ring, if it’s with a die roll, the playing piece starts at the Pay Interest Street. The playing pieces move clockwise around the board. Every turn, except for the first turn and power plays, requires a die roll. The die roll isn’t to determine what property you claim, but to keep players moving around the board and to see if rent is due to another player.

When the game begins, all players have no money, no property, and no debt. Acquiring property is the way for a player to achieve their goal. The community is the bank, so players will volunteer to watch the flows of cash and debt as needed. Turn by turn, players accumulate properties. Tactics to win can include the following: acquiring properties after a die roll, purchasing other property, consolidating properties, trading acquired property for vacant property trading with other players. Other tactics become available as the game’s economy grows and include earning the ability to change production point values, interest rates, and even your chosen goal. Only the wiliest will make the most of what is freely given in this game.

A player wins by achieving a goal chosen from seven goal cards available. Victory can be had with much wealth, or little wealth, depending upon the chosen card. Players claim property squares on the board with every turn until they’ve acquired what’s needed as stated on their chosen goal card. Final scoring is calculated with the value for each property square, less the player’s debt.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Income, Investment, Loans, Market, Trading

name: Guyenne
description:
Guyenne is a card game of bluff, hand management and castle conquest, with a historical flavour.

The name "Guyenne" refers both to the hereditary duchy of the English crown resulting from the Treaty of Brétigny signed in 1360 and to the battle cry of the Anglo-Guyenne armies during the Hundred Years War.

Players compete in successive rounds. They play the cards in their hand to take control of as many of the castle defences as possible that face them. But their forces are limited, and they must be used at the right moment to get the final victory.

Each game turn consists of two phases (laying cards and resolving battles) during which both players are alternately attacker and defender.

—description from the designer

name: Time Travel Entertainment, Inc.
description:
The year is 2754. The multimedia conglomerate Time Travel Entertainment Inc. uses propietary technology to deploy its patented actor-bots anywhere in time and space.

With a complex goal and minimal programming, the hapless bots are turned loose for the audience's delight.

Each installment of their unscripted adventures is broadcast to trillions of eager viewers hungry for scenes of heoric triumph and hilarious failure.

In Time Travel Entertainment, Inc. players take on the roles of actor-bots. Choose the action from one of your CPUs for your next devious plan and share it with your fellow actors. If they do not approve you will need to rethink and try again, but once you have impressed them, use the die to find out if you plan succeeded. Beware - failing may damage your CPUs, removing them from the game. Achieve your goals or outlast the other actor-bots to win the game.

—description from the publisher


Before play begins, all players must agree together on what the premise of their robots' adventure in this game will be. To do this they must answer three simple questions:

Where did they travel to?
What year did they travel to?
What are they trying to do?


Each player will select a robot type and take all three CPU cards. Select a player to set the scene with a short narration and then play begins with the player to their left.

On your turn, you will take exactly one action from your available CPU cards actions. Once you've chosen your action, explain to the group how you are going to use that action and the outcome you hope it will achieve. The player to your right will then decide if your proposed action is reasonable.

If your action is denied, you must choose a different action or a different resolution. If your action is approved, rotate the card so that a new action is available and roll the die to see if it succeeds. Your odds of success are based upon which CPU your action is coming from.

If your die roll was successful, you plan works. The player to your right narrates your success. If your action fails, they narrate exactly how you ended up failing. Then they narrate some consequences.

If you fail, roll a six-sided die to see if your failure results in any damage, by losing a CPU of your choice.

If a player loses their last CPU, they are dead and out of the game. Play continues until either you all accomplish your goal or everyone dies by losing all their CPUs.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: ã³ã³ãã©ã¹ã (Contrast)
description:
Contrast is a two-player abstract board game in the same vein as Shogi, Chess, and Checkers; with the simple goal of reaching the other side of the player board.
The transparent pieces with black and white arrows change in appearance and effect based on the background under them (a black background will hide the black arrows, a white background will hide the white arrows, and a grey background will show both).

A mysterious gimmick with simple rules, but deeper strategy than meets the eye.

name: Regatul lui Enroh
description:
An epic board game. The heroes of the Romanian fairy tales meet in the Kingdom of Enroh, a magical place that hides the most coveted gem: "Youth without old age". Be the strategist of the team made up of 12 fantastic 3D characters from the Land of Fairy Tales: Leprechauns, Braves, Beard-Elbows, Fate, Emperor Green, Giant, Fairy Fairy, Handsome Boy, Ileana Cosânzeana, Solomonar, Wanton Horse, Master Bird or you can choose the 12 fantastic creatures from the Other Land: Undead, Pricolici, Water nymph, Witch, Moloch, Kite, Shrew, Mother of the Forest, Dragon, Corcoaia, The Squirrel or Werewolf.

On a map with 135 squares, the players should conquer from a total of 4 castels (1 Victory point each), 4 dangeros areas (1 Victory point each) and 1 center where is located "Youth without old age" (3 victory points), at least 9 victory points. Other methods are to conquer all Castles + center, or all dangerous areas + center. The last posibility is to have with 8 prisoniers more than the opponent.

Each hero have a certain value and movement on the map. The players can buy and use the heroes on the map to collect gold, special cards and conquer the objectives. The players can move the heroes based on the road indicated by the dices. Each dice have a corespondance with a road.
There are 27 special cards with different options, and allows to block a road or a hero, win gold, rob a castle, organize ambush, cure, spy and others.

Enroh's Kingdom is a 100% Romanian board game, made in Romania and contains:

1 map
2 individual boards for the players
36 cards with heroes
88 special cards
16 conquest cards
50 gold cards
2 dices
game instructions

We invite you to a fascinating world of heroes from Romanian fairy tales, with places, expressions, customs and traditions from our mythology, where each person has a story, where luck usually takes you otherwise. , and the inspiration and the strategy guide you to a magic crystal, which hides the secret of Romanian stories: "Youth without old age"!

name: Dungeon Drop: Torture Trap
description:
This adds a Torture Trap to the game. The choice is 1 hero and 2 monsters OR 2 heroes and 3 monsters.

This was released as part of the Dice Tower Kickstarter 2021 "Promo Pack C"

name: Can't Touch This
description:
An abstract in-hand game for 1-2 players in which players sequentially slide paperclips onto a card in order to capture symbols. Each symbol has a different effect, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins (for solo, the goal is to earn the most points). The game has light area control strategies, and generally rewards capturing many of the same kind of symbol.

—description from the designer

name: I'm Right You're Wrong: NSFW
description:
What if petty arguments were like a card battle game?

Would you be mean or would you be nice?

I’m Right You’re Wrong (NSFW) is an imaginary argument for adults. Your hand is filled with comebacks like “F*** YOU” and “MY BAD”. Battle it out until one player is left standing, and FOREVER CORRECT!

Sometimes nice guys DO finish last. So, will you take the high road and call a TRUCE? Or, will you tell your opponents to STFU?

Here’s the catch… Most cards suck and there’s only so much kindness to go around.

Pick your battles wisely and don’t shoot yourself in the foot.

How To Play:

1. Draw a card at the beginning of each turn.
2. Play one from your hand and follow the rule on the card.
3. Run out of cards or break a rule, you lose.
4. Get caught cheating, you lose.
5. Game ends when one player is left standing.

Creator’s Comments:
The message of this game is: WORDS HAVE POWER. In a world growing increasingly combative, people matter. Relationships matter. Whether Right or Wrong, let kindness lead the way.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Take That

name: ããã¦æ·±æµ·é­ã¯ï¼ã«ãªã (And The Deep Sea Fish Becomes Zero)
description:
ããã¦æ·±æµ·é­ã¯ï¼ã«ãªã (Soshite Shinkaigyo ha 0 ninaru) is a card game from Japan, and means something like 'And The Deep Sea Fish Becomes Zero'. Players are trying to get their tableau of cards down to the lowest total. If a top and bottom row card match, those two equal zero. At the end of the game, the lowest total score wins.

The deck is numbered 1 to 8, with one 1, two 2s, three 3s and so on. Each number is a different sea creature.

Players have a tableau of six cards face-down in two rows of three. Two are turned up and the highest total starts. On their turn, a player draws either from the deck or from the discard pile. The player then uses the drawn card to replace an existing card in their tableau. The new card goes face-up, the old card goes face-up to the discard. If the player drew from the draw pile, they can discard it instead.

In this way, cards gradually get turned up. The game ends when either the draw deck is exhausted, or a player has all six cards face-up. The totals are calculated, and the lowest total wins.

However, the game has certain twists. For example, the 4 card is actually -4. The 5 card forces another player to turn up a card, possibly ending the sooner. Sharks must be placed as shown on the shark card, and so on.

Because there are more high number cards, it is harder to get the score down. But players have more chances to match pairs and make them go to zero.
user summary
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Town Builder: Coevorden â Promo Cards
description:
5 promos released as part of the Kickstarter.

Ceremony: 2VP. Building Type - Commerce. Resource Cost - 2
wood. Ability Type - Scoring. Building Ability -
Score 1VP for each judge you did not claim.
Resource - Straw and Stone.

Fields: 6VP. Building Type - Military. Resource Cost - 4
wood. Ability Type - None. Resource - Straw.

Granary: 1VP. Building Type - Housing. Resource Cost - 1
Straw. Ability Type - Star. Building Ability -
Discard this building to take 2 actions. Resource
- Wood and Stone.

Guildhall: 2VP. Building Type - Social. Resource Cost - 2
Stone. Ability Type - Build. Building Ability -
Gain a resource from the discard pile for each
award you claimed. Resource - Wood.

Monument: 2VP. Building Type - Culture. Resource Cost - 1
Gold and 1 Stone. Ability Type - Star. Building
Ability - Pay 1 Gold to complete a foundation
requiring only one more resource. Resource - 1
Straw. Also gives 1 Gold.

name: Batman: Gotham City Chronicles â KGBeast
description:
During the time of the Soviet Union, Anatoly Knyazev became the KGB’s most ruthless assassin. His ferocity and extreme methods earned him the codename ‘The Beast’. Even after the collapse of the USSR, he remained nostalgic and committed to the ideals of the Soviet era. As a mercenary, he still favored political targets, including the President of the USA. When a contract brought him to Gotham City, he caught the attention of Batman and the two formidable warriors clashed in a series of brutal fights. Though Batman eventually defeated the mercenary, he earned himself a sworn enemy.
