A former KGB agent and seasoned mercenary, this efficient killing machine is highly skilled and has mastered hand to hand combat and the art of the killshot, which is reflected in his awesome action bonuses.

He has remembered everything he learnt while following his wartorn path, especially anything explosives related.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: MineraÅy: Promo 2 â NarzÄdzia
description:
Additional tools
Two-sided tiles with new tools. Use them interchangeably with tools from the basic game. Before each game prepare 5 tiles with tools (each one with different mineral color) in these order: white, blue, pink, black, gold.

name: Sagrada: Promo 13 â GalÃ¡pagos Jogos
description:
Sagrada promo card with the Galápagos Jogos logo.

Originally available through localization partner Galápagos Jogos.

This is a 3 and 5 difficulty card.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Sagrada: Promo 15 â Geekach Games Window Pattern Card
description:
A new double sided player card to build the stained glass window. Shuffle into your deck and procede as normal.

A 3 & 6 level difficulty card showcasing localization parter Geekach Games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: The Gig: Encore! Expansion
description:
The Gig: Encore! Expansion introduces 3 new instruments to the game, each with their own unique mechanics and a set of matching dice!

Use a quick hand to balance your drums with The Congas! Balance gentle harmonies with The Flute! And show off your natural scatting skills with The Scat Singer!

The Encore! Expansion is compatible with all game modes in The Gig, including solitaire mode!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Pattern Building, Re-rolling and Locking, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: G.I. Joe Deck-Building Game: Shadow of the Serpent Bonus Box #2
description:
A promo pack for G.I. Joe Deck-Building Game containing:

2 Promo Character Cards (Solo Snake Eyes & Team Player Scarlett)
Punchboard G.I. Joe Base Backdrop
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: W Krainie BaÅni
description:
Letters, glasses, ladders, brooms and other everyday objects got lost in the vicinity of Cinderella's Castle, Snow White's hut, Aladdin's market and many other wonderful places. In "W Krainie BaÅni" players take on the role of fairy-tale detectives, whose task is to find these items.

This is an observation game with several game modes. In the main mode, each player draws one board at random. When everyone is ready, the card showing the item is revealed. Now the players try to find the item on their board as quickly as possible. Whoever does this first, receives a card as a reward. Finally, the person with the most cards wins.

name: CiechanÃ³w: Przasnysz 1939
description:
The game simulates the military engagements that took place in September, 1939, between Polish and German forces in the area near the towns of Ciechanów and Przasnysz (north of Warsaw, near the border with what was then German East Prussia).

The game was included in Taktyka i Strategia magazine no. 44. It consists of 1 map and 3 scenarios. It uses the WB–95 wargaming system developed by Taktyka i Strategia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Flick or Treat
description:
Who will win this Halloween, a horde of candy-chasing kids or one kid-chasing ghost? Find out in Flick or Treat, a quick and colorful micro-dexterity game designed by Julio E. Nazario! Featuring custom 3D-printed pieces, a fun flick-and-roll mechanic, and a way to play using actual pieces of candy, this game just might become one of your new Halloween traditions.

Flick or Treat takes around 15 minutes for 2-5 players to enjoy. One player will be the ghost, whose sole objective is to capture all of the kids. All other players play cooperatively as the kids, racing as a team to collect all of the candy before the ghost can grab them!

On their turn, each player will move their piece by pushing them with the Hallowheel. When they make contact with their target object (kid or candy) without falling over, they capture it! If the kids collect all the candy, they win! But if the ghost can capture all the kids first, the ghost wins!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Flicking, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Race, Team-Based Game

name: Pa Que Me Invitan (Si saben cÃ³mo me pongo)
description:
Pa'Que Me Invitan is the first expansion of Mójate el Potito, and is a drinking-themed variant of the base game (not required to play the expansion). With over 60 cards (between questions & challenges), it can turn your party on by it's own.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Pa’Qué Me Invitan es la primera expansión del aclamado y ultra hiper mega reconocido Mójate el Potito.

En esta expansión pondrás a prueba a tus amigos con chistosas preguntas, y la nueva mecánica de mini juegos Momento MEP.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: ã¬ãã¿æ¸©æ³éæè¨ (Nukumi Onsen Kaitakuki)
description:
In Nukumi Onsen Kaitakuki, players develop vacant lots in the onsen town of Nukumi.

Nukumi Onsen Kaitakuki is a bag building game, with many paths to victory. Many characters and helpers from the previous game, Nukumi Onsen Hanjouki, also appear in this game, supporting the player in various ways!

On their turn, players gain helpers, and resources and then complete actions by drawing tokens from their bag. Players can move their pieces around the central game board, and build buildings, developing the profile of the town as a fun place with delicious foods.

Player gain victory points bu building buildings, playing helper cards, earning money, and a number of potential bonuses! At the end of 5 rounds, the player with the most victory points is the winner!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Mystery Party in the Box: SueÃ±o de una Noche junto al RÃ­o
description:
This original game from Japanese lands swells the catalogs of the murder mystery genre, increasingly widespread in the international recreational arena.

What is a murder mystery?
In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of clarifying a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are fundamental pieces to solve the crime, but we must not forget that the murderer is one of you. You cannot believe everything they tell you, but neither can you win without trusting someone ... Enjoy this unique experience that, although used only once, will leave you wanting more.

England, late 16th century. A man is found dead in a town in the English countryside, apparently after his executioner plunged his head into the river that runs next to the inn where he was staying. The guests, the white witch so beloved in the municipality and the employees of the establishment themselves look at each other suspiciously trying to identify the culprit.

name: Zombicide: Second Edition â CMON Comics: Vol. 2 Promos
description:
Zombicide - Dead in the Water comic and the associated pre-order exclusive content:
8 Survivors, 4 Zombies, 8 ID Cards, 1 Abomination Card, 4 Double-Sided Tiles, and 2 Missions.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: MOGUTTE (ã¢ã°ãã)
description:
ã¢ã°ãã MOGUTTE is a hand-building game from Japan, with the theme of sea otters' ecology.

In this game, each player is a sea otter that aims to eat its fill of favorite foods! The otters predate on foods like clams, urchins, and crabs. These all have a hard shell, so you need to use the stone to break shells, in order to eat the prey. You can also find many of these preys that live on the seafloor by diving deeper, with the stone as a weight.

Orcas and sharks, the natural enemies of the sea otter, may be lurking offshore. Don't forget to wrap yourself in the kelp bed so you don't get swept offshore.

ãMOGUTTEãã¯ãã©ãã³ã®çæããã¼ãã«ããææ­æ§ç¯ã²ã¼ã ã§ãã
ãã®ã²ã¼ã ã§ã¯ããã¬ã¤ã¤ã¼ãã¡ã¯ã©ãã³ã¨ãªã£ã¦ã3ç¨®é¡ããæã¦ãªãææ­ãããããããªãããã«ã¤ãã¦ããã«ãã¨ãã£ãç²ç©ããè¹ãã£ã±ãé£ã¹ããã¨ãç®æãã¾ãã

publisher's summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Totemix
description:
Totemix is an asymmetric cooperative game, resembling a dynamic puzzle. Players take on the roles of totem animals with unique powers fighting to defend their lands.
The game includes several starting map layouts, different difficulty settings and two game modes (standard or real-time).
Your options are limited making each action critical: your can move to an adjacent tile or activate your special power.
End game conditions depend on the selected scenario.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: In the Pocket Bowling
description:
In the pocket Bowling is a ten-pin bowling simulation using dice and cards based on real player statistics to generate the results of a frame in one or two rolls. The better players will statistically roll more strikes but there is still a chance of them being "out of the pocket" and a second roll, referenced against the OOTP chart, will dictate whether or not they picked up a spare.

It is primarily a solo game but can easily be played with more, each choosing a different player card to run a championship.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Origins: First Builders â District Promo Cards
description:
Originally available as part of the Man vs. Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

10 new District cards, marked #P01-#P10, to be shuffled into the existing deck of District cards.

After adding these District cards to your copy of the game, this end-game trigger:


There are 3 or fewer colors of Tower disks remaining in the stock.


... should be played as ...


There are 3 or fewer colors of Tower disks remaining in the stock AND at least half of the District cards (rounded up) have no Gold above them.


You may adopt this change as a variant rule even if you do not own a copy of these District cards.

name: Pokkadott
description:
Pokkadott is a climbing game that uses dominoes. It can be played individually with 2 or 3 players or as a team game with 4 players (2 vs 2).

Because Pokkadott uses only a single set of double 9 dominoes, all of the playable combinations are a form of run:

A toppadott is a run where the suits (the top) are all the same and the ranks (the bottom) are consecutive. A single domino, with a different top and bottom, is a toppadott.

A pokkadott has a run on the top and a different run on the bottom.

A dammodott has the same run on the top and on the bottom. A single domino, with the same top and bottom, is a dammodott.
mechanics: Hand Management, Ladder Climbing, Team-Based Game

name: Zombicide: White Death â Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Timecrash
description:
TMNT Zombicide: Timecrash is a full-fledged expansion for Zombicide: White Death.

The world of New York has collided with the world of Zombicide Fantasy through a portal! Necromantic magic is afoot, and Shredder is taking full advantage of it to raise a Zombie horde and invade New York. It’s up to the Turtles to stop him from amassing power and bringing it back to their home city! 10 exclusive new quests in this expansion follow the Turtle Team through the streets of the Zombicide fantasy universe, taking down Zombies, Foot Ninjas, and Shredder himself. This strange new land is also rife with mystical energy that the Turtle Team can channel into their attacks to better defeat the Zombies. And it turns out, there’s still some pizza too!

—desciption from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Miniatures, Zombies

name: Ð¢ÑÐ¼Ð°Ð½Ð½ÑÐ¹ Ð½Ð°Ð¼ÑÐº (Hazy Hint)
description:
Love finding images in the clouds and sharing your findings with others? Do you like party games with simple rules?
Ð¢ÑÐ¼Ð°Ð½Ð½ÑÐ¹ Ð½Ð°Ð¼ÑÐº ("Hazy Hint") is just such a game.

In each round, the active player has to find an image in one of the clouds on a given theme and voice it. Other players try to guess which cloud he has in mind. The more players choose your choice the better. But beware, not everyone thinks as you do!

Pick and guess associations by theme, reveal the other players' hints and you'll win.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: One Page Space
description:
Advanced human colonies in deep space suffer from attacks by a hostile alien civilization. The invasion spreads across the galaxy, so humanity creates an advanced experimental starship. This fighter must blast through the invasion of hostile monsters and destroy three alien flagships one by one to end the war.

One Page Space consists of a series of moves. Each turn, the player chooses where the ship will move on the star map. Each move the player finds himself in a certain location and must fulfill its conditions. To win the game, you need to destroy all three alien flagships and after that the final points are calculated.

-description from designer
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Food Trucks
description:
What could be more fun than getting delicious food out of a truck? Serving it! In Food Trucks, you won't be eating (although the food may make you hungry), but you'll be the proud owner of a food truck, and your main goal is to have the best food truck in town.

How will you get there? Easy, the customers will give you orders and, during your turn, you'll have to choose between preparing orders or serving them. If you choose to prepare orders, you'll be able to pick up dishes from the common market, but think carefully what you choose, as you can't mix up dishes. If you want to serve orders, give the customers their food and get those sweet coins, and be quick, as the customers are hungry and will punish you if you are too slow.

—description from publisher

name: Highland Whist
description:
Highland Whist is a casual trick-taker for four (4) players in fixed partnerships.

Teams score based on the number of tricks captured. The scoring has several peaks (that score more than 0 points) and valleys (that score 0 points).

The scoring valleys are at 0, 3-4, 7-8, and 11-12 tricks. Try not to fall in…

—description from the designer

(The rules now include a trick & draw variant for two players.)

name: Il Califfo
description:
A group of (male) friends on vacation have to face the usual question: how many girls will they be able to hook up with? Who will be the Califfo, the one who manages to seduce the most and most beautiful women?

Everyone takes his best car, prepares to pay for dinners and bouquets of flowers, makes the most of his qualities of beauty, poetry, sympathy, and even imagines a few lies. And, given that it is a challenge, even putting a spanner in the works of others is legitimate…

Il Califfo is a game in which the protagonists compete for all the free girls who are around for each evening of their holiday, making the most of the qualities of their characters and the resources represented by the cards in their hands. Approaching the most beautiful can be a temptation, but be careful: a girl is not always as charming as she seems at first sight, and sometimes she can hide real surprises, positive or negative!

DISCLAIMER

Il Califfo is a diseducative and politically incorrect game, but any criticism in this sense is rejected as idle by the authors. Most games aim to variously kill and/or massacre your opponent, when it's not about crushing the world under the heel of your own armies. Acting as a Don Juan and collecting women like trophies is not very edifying, but trying to make love with consenting girls is still considered by the authors to be less unseemly than breaking people's heads.

—description from the rulebook (translated)
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Catch the Leader

name: Fate: Defenders of Grimheim
description:
Freyja, the Norse goddess of fertility, joins Thor in Asgaard for a wedding along with all the proven warriors from Grimheim.
You’re not one of them.
Loki, the trickster god, sees his chance to destroy Freyja’s sacred well in Grimheim. Soon, monsters appear from all directions, advancing towards the small village where you are now the only defenders left. The fate of Grimheim is in your hands.

Fate is a cooperative game for 1-4 players who take the roles of talented but unexperienced heroes. Together, they defend Freyja’s well against trolls, the dead, and the fire horde monsters approaching from all sides of the game board.
Kill monsters to gain experience and upgrade your hero, solve quests to discover weapons and equipment, and stand shoulder to shoulder with your friends against the mighty monsters of Norse mythology.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Terraforming Mars: Milestones & Awards
description: Gives Players a chance to randomize or customize their setup of Milestones & Awards. Rules include a complete index of all Milestones & Awards and explanations.
publishers: FryxGames, Intrafin Games, Rebel Sp. z o.o., Stronghold Games

name: Overcrowd
description:
Overcrowd is a roll and shade type of game, where players choose a grid, 14x14/17x17/20x20. The starting player rolls 3 dice and the players shade the board in their liking. Dice roles are ranging from height and the width of the cells, to the number inside the cells, which we call the anchor!
You gain a points equal to adjacent anchors, everything that isn't shaded counts as negative points.
But be sure to be quick, as players gain rewards if someone finishes before you!

name: Maid Knight Saga: The Story of Faltisia â Complete Edition
description:
Welcome to the nation of Faltisia—a land blessed with lush vistas, bustling towns, and economic stability. You’re a girl born within the borders of this flourishing domain, and your only dream is to become one of the nation’s coveted Maid Knights—a position essential to the country’s national security.

However, due to the importance of the Maid Knight occupation within Faltisia, only the most elite are allowed into the academy that grants Maid status, and only the best of those go on to graduate and become official Faltisian Maid Knights. Fortunately, you’ve passed the Royal Academy of Faltisia’s entrance exam and now have three years to polish yourself. How will you spend your school life?

The Complete Edition includes the base game, Maid Knight Saga: The Story of Faltisia, the expansion, The Battle for London, and a brand new Solo mode.

Translation by Samuel Allen

name: Kelp: New Pursuits Mini Expansion
description:
New Pursuits features objectives for the Octopus and the Shark to complete throughout the game.
Only the first player to complete these goals will receive a powerful boost.

The expansion is Kickstarter exclusive.

—description from the publisher

name: Kelp: Brilliant Behaviours Mini Expansion Set
description:
Dive even deeper into the world of Kelp! A set of 6 mini-expansions adding new strategies, shenanigans and tons of replayability.
They can be mixed and matched or even stacked. Change the board. Ride a jellyfish. Feel the thrill.

The BRILLIANT BEHAVIOURS Set consists of 6 different Mini Expansions:
- The Jellyfish
Ride a Jellyfish and let it steal energy from the Shark.

- The Zones
Now it's your turn as the Shark to manipulate the board. Obstruct the plans of the Octopus, but raise the stakes for yourself in return.

- The Coconut
Hide the Octopus under a coconut, and make it harder to attack! Or don't... and stick the coconut on a shell to confuse the Shark!

- The Dens
Visit your dens to collect powered-up growth tiles.

- The Urchins
Place spiky Urchins on the board.

- The Reflexes
Upgrade your Shark with powerful dice from a new growth tile.

name: Panda Panda
description:
In Panda Panda, players carefully manage their cards to try to make specific hands. On a turn, players can discard a card, draw from the deck, or draw from an opponent's discard pile. If a player discards an "A" card, everyone has to pass one card to the right.

To win, yell "Panda Panda!" when you start a turn with a completed hand. Can you collect the right cards, figure out what your opponents are going for, and time the "A" cards correctly?

—description from publisher

name: Last Code Standing
description: A game of quick thinking and clever deduction presented by Will Shortz, NPR's puzzlemaster and crossword editor of the New York times. Take number/color tiles to make your hidden code. Force opponnts to give clues. Strengthen your code. Guess and reveal opponent tiles. Be the last code standing to win.

name: Dungeon Murder
description:
Dungeon Murder! consists of a large deck of cards, featuring different types of cards such as "Dungeon Chamber" cards, "Action" cards, "Gold" cards, and various, "wild" cards. The objective of the game is to be the first player holding three complete Dungeon Chamber card sets.
Dungeon Murder is an original game, with inspiration from many "collect and trade" style games.

Dungeon Murder is fast paced, with each game lasting about 15 minutes. It is easy to learn but requires strategy to win, making it an enjoyable game for both casual and experienced players. It's also a game with lots of humor and has some great illustration work, making it a fun and entertaining game for all players.

—description from the designer

name: Monster Dates
description:
In this party game, players will take turns acting as monsters from the Monster Prom video game franchise. Each round one player will act as the "Bachelor" (or "Bachelorette" or "Bacheloraire") and will judge and score all the other players, who will be the "Romantic Interests."

The Bachelor places a Monster Card of their choosing face up. They can then introduce themselves, including an explanation of how they will judge the Romantic Interests. The Romantic Interests each choose a Monster Card and place it face down, these will be a secret until the end of the round. The Bachelor draws a Question Card and reads the first question. Each Romantic Interest then choose an Answer Card and place it face down. One by one, the Romantic Interests will reveal their answers and can elaborate a bit to try and woo the Bachelor.

The Bachelor chooses their favorite answer and the Romantic Interest who gave the winning answer scores one point. This process is repeated with the 3 questions on the question card. The round is won by whoever scored the most points. If there's a tie, the Bachelor decides who deserves the win based on their overall answers. The winner then reveals their Monster Card. The Monster Cards from the winning Romantic Interest and the Bachelor are placed together and each player scores an extra point.

The Bachelor role is passed to the next player and a new round begins. Play as many rounds as it takes for everyone to have been the Bachelor at least once. Whoever won the most points overall wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Ada's Dream
description:
Work with Ada Lovelace to help build the first computer, fulfilling her dream in this alternate history Euro Game.

Take dice from the Workshop Rondel, Give Lectures in Prestigious Institutions, Travel the UK, and Complete Assignments from Ada.

Add Dice, Gears, and Programs to your blueprint Board to build the Analytical Engine.

Using dice rondel and manipulation mechanics and literal "engine building", Ada's Dream is the first of the Great Thinkers' trilogy and part of the popular Alley Cat Games advanced line.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Rondel, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Shoal
description:
Create the highest scoring shoal as you decide which fish stay and which fish go.

Every fish can help or hiner your overall score so strategically pick the fish you wish to add, cover or keep as you layer your cards to achieve goals and create your very own shoal.

On you turn simply play a card then draw a card from 2 piles. Shoal only has 4 easy rules to follow so its quick to learn but hard to master.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Layering, Tile Placement

name: Shadow Ninjas
description:
Shadow Ninjas is a hidden movement game of one versus many for 2 to 5 players. All the Ninja players are allowed to move any of the shadow tokens, some of which hide the Ninjas of individual players. This means players can accidentally - or not so accidentally - move other players’ tokens into danger or away from victory. To be a Ninja player you will need a good poker face and an ability to bluff so that no one can guess which shadow hides your Ninja. To be a Guard player you must be prepared to be outnumbered, but not overwhelmed, by all of the shadows that need to be investigated to protect the Shogun’s prized koi carp.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Line of Sight

name: Dog Park: Dogs of the World Expansion Pack
description: Dogs from Kennel Clubs across the world are coming to Dog Park! The Dogs of the World expansion includes 29 cards and 3 new abilities: Friendly, Fusspot, and Globetrotter.

name: The Deadland
description:
A group of us treasure hunters landed on this island in search of a golden city that was lost long ago.
Legend has it that the island's civilization was destroyed by the wrath of an ancient god. Immediate-ty upon arrival, we were attacked by an unknown monster. Its tentacle-covered form was shrouded in fog and could not be fully identified. We sent a distress call, threw everything away, and ran for our lives. On the way, we encountered every danger imaginable, including the tentacled monster, zombies, pirates, etc., and we helped each other...though sometimes abandoning some to sacrifice...but we managed to get through it.

But just when we thought we had it all figured out, we were cornered on a suspension bridge over a great valley! There are zombies in front of the bridge, the tentacled monster behind us, and pirates in the river at the bottom of the valley, all trying to kill us. There is nothing left to do. This is an extraordinary island, which is infested with all kinds of evil things! But it's too late for regrets... We must somehow survive on this crazy suspension bridge until the rescue helicopter sees the distress call and comes for help!
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Movement Points, Track Movement

name: Super Power
description:
Super Power is a card set with special rules for 30 of the best Pegasus games of all time! The special thing about it: After using a Super Power card, the owner has to give it to one of her/his fellow players.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: 1869: USA West
description:
1869 is an 18xx-series game set in the western US, combining the 2D stock-market of 1830 with the an 1835-style fixed company opening order, wherein each 'group' of companies must be sold out before the shares of the next may be bought. 1869 also features one shares of variable sizes depending on the corporation, an idea obviously descended from Moon's 'Reading Variant' for 1830. There are also 'bonus runs' for some of the companies, which provides them with additional money for running trains between given cities.

1869 by Alan Moon is a game that is unlikely to see the light of day in published form, especially given its long (even for an 18xx game) play time. However, there are several copies of it circulating, and is played by (e-)mail by several groups.

UPDATE: As of July, 2014 this game is available direct (from Germany) via Marflow Games.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â U.S.S. Prometheus Expansion Pack
description:
The USS Prometheus (NX-59650/NX-74913) was a 24th century Federation Prometheus-class starship operated by Starfleet. Prometheus was an experimental prototype designed for deep space tactical assignments and equipped with regenerative shields, ablative hull armor, and multi-vector assault mode. She was the fastest ship in Starfleet with a warp factor of 9.99 when she was launched from the Beta Antares Ship Yards on stardate 50749.5 in late 2373. The vessel was also equipped with holographic projectors on every deck, allowing its EMH Mark II free range of movement throughout the ship.

This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

U.S.S. Prometheus Federation Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 15 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Central City: Heroes
description:
Central City: Heroes is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players. Each player takes on the role of a unique Superhero with their own unique powers. Players work together to battle minions, complete missions, recruit other heroes, and unlock their upgrade cards. This will all lead up to the final showdown with the Superhero's Nemesis. The Players must complete five missions and defeat the Nemesis in order to win the game. Heroes will accomplish these things by moving around and exploring Central City.

The board consists of 16 interchangeable location hex tiles that make up Central City. Every time you play the city itself will change.

Players will begin by creating their characters. To do so they will get a Superhero Player Board, a Super Power Card and a Secret Identity Card. Combining the Hero Board with the Super Power Card will create the Player's Hero Persona. With 6 Player Characters and 12 Super Power Cards, there are 72 different Hero Personas in the Central City: Heroes Core Set. The Players will also receive their own Secret Identity Card which the game will be trying to force players to reveal.

Are you ready to become a guardian of Central City?
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift â Promo deck
description:
This is not available for sale, but given for promotional purposes. It introduces four of the most accomplished game designers of PM:AR as Acolytes of the Cult (Timo, Thomas, Dan & Ruyman).

Using these acolytes instead of your current standard acolytes will make scenarios a bit harder, but mostly add flavour.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Puzzle
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Monster Lands: Promo Card Set
description:
This group of 4 Mercenaries introduces multi-color dice contributions, making the Mercenaries very versatile and powerful in the Dice Pool generation phase. The set with 4 new unique illustrations comes with a cardboard mini punch board for the respective Assignment tokens. If you backed at kickstarter monster level, you will already have the wooden tokens needed.

Brawel - Jungle Affinity that contributes a purple/yellow & purple/red dice. His talent is to reroll purple dice x3.

Krysta - Water Affinity that contributes a purple, red, and purple/red dice. Her talent is one purple die gets +3.

Mithu - Fire Affinity that contributes a purple, yellow, and red/yellow/purple dice. Cancels a monster die. At 12 cost, one of the most expensive mercenaries in the game but one of the most powerful.

Saneela - Air Affinity that contributes 2 red and 1 red/yellow dice. Her ability is one red die gets +3.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: å¿ã®ãã£ãã (Shinobi no GakkÅ)
description:
Shinobu no GakkÅ, roughly, Shinobu School, is a climbing game where each player has two hands of cards and is adding and removing cards from a central tableau.

Players are dealt a hand of cards, and then divide, as they'd like between a closed hand they hold traditionally, and a face up hand on the table.

Two cards are dealt face up to the table that form the initial cards the players will add or subtract from. Players can play higher or lower cards than are currently on the table, and play them to that end of the column. Players must play at least the same number of cards as what is present at that end, but could play more. If one end of the column has more cards than the other, that end is "locked" and cards cannot be removed or added. As an alternate to playing, players can remove the last cards from either end of the column.

Each turn players get to take one of these actions (or pass) with both of their hands.

The first player to play all of their cards wins the round and is granted points; the other players lose points depending upon the sets left in their hands.

The person with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

name: Set a Watch: Hulking Amalgam promo
description:
Promos included in Tantrum House Kickstarter. Season 7

Ongoing: Each time a Reveal effect is resolved, resolve it an additional time as if it had been triggered by Hulking Amalgam.

—user summary

name: Panzer Grenadier: West Wall
description:
West Wall is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier series of games, with 10 scenarios based on the battles around the city of Aachen in late 1944. West Wall includes just this booklet; you'll also need to use boards and pieces from Battle of the Bulge, Elsenborn Ridge and Road to Berlin games and some pieces from our Cassino '44, Beyond Normandy and Afrika Korps games.

West Wall is sold BOTH via .pdf download and as a printed booklet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game â Spoils of War
description:
"Your prize will be the doom of you. Krakens rise from the sea, Theon, or did you forget that during your years among the wolves?"
–George R.R. Martin, A Clash of Arms

Spoils of War is the first Chapter Pack in the "Conquest and Defiance" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. In Spoils of War, each of the six Great Houses of Westeros enjoy the plunder and glories of their victories...even as those trophies place them at risk to lose their positions of power. Among the Chapter Pack's sixty cards (three copies each of twenty individual cards), you'll find captives, spies, vengeful schemes, righteous fury, and deadly, crippling treachery.

Many of the new cards from Spoils of War feature the "prized" keyword, which balances tremendous risks and rewards in deck-building and play. These cards lend material, in-game value to the riches you plunder, the captives you seize, and the castles you successfully siege. But can you hold them once you win them? Prized cards give your opponents power when they enter your discard or dead piles, so it’s up to you to leverage your spoils toward victory!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Dwar7s Fall: Covil Promos
description:
Dwar7s Fall promo pack that was included as a stretch goal during the Covil: The Dark Overlords Kickstarter campaign. It includes 10 cards, as follows:

Secret Goals:
Dark Overlord
General

Ogre Cards:
The Cook x4
The Henchman x4
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Pathogenesis: STD Expansion
description:
Pathogenesis STD adds the fourth tract to the body, the Genitourinary tract, introducing pathogens, traits, and virulence factors appropriate for this area of the body. Further, keeping to the science, the Genitourinary tract has no toxin cards but instead a new mechanic has been introduced, Collateral Damage cards!

Collateral Damage cards add the damage from the immune system's attack against your pathogens to the damage your pathogens deal to the body if your pathogens survive the immune system's attack.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Medical
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Krimi Total Fall 1: Der Duft des Mordes
description:
Translation - "The smell of murder"

This Essen 2005 release could be a fresh start for the "murder/mystery games", that were quiet popular in the eighties in germany.

All players (4 male, 4 female + 1 m/f) should be dressed up and act out their role to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer (wich is the only person, who´s allowed to lie).

name: Factories in Flames
description:
(from the World in Flames: 2008 Annual:)

FiF is an optional rule which introduces variety and greater detail into the construction and repair of units, as well as adding new units and options, yet adding little more complexity to the game (in some cases it's even simpler).
FiF can also be played with America in Flames and Patton in Flames.


Supplement for the World in Flames family, included in the World in Flames: 2008 Annual.
Contains 200 counters and production charts for all the playing countries.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Formule DÃ© Circuit â 11: JAPAN GRAND PRIX â Suzuka Circuit
description:
Eleventh course for Formule DÃ© by Ludodélire.

42" x 13"; 148 spaces; 6 corners (one "3", two "2"s); straights 35, 21, 19, 18; longest straight starts & ends with "2" corners

RAIN : 1-5 VARIABLE : 6-13 FINE : 14-20

name: Fireteam Zero: Monster Pack D
description:
Think you've seen the the worst that the Artifacts can throw at you?

Not even close.

Challenge your squad with these all new creatures for Fireteam Zero, each with their own unique and devastating abilities!

Contains a miniatures and monster reference card for each of these creatures:


Maggot Hounds x4
Mangled
Lunger
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Emergent Games (II), Play & Win, Ulisses Spiele

name: Monster Highway
description:
Monster Highway is a board game where 2-4 players are building roadways using tiles to get to your Home Base. After a nuclear meltdown at a power plant, the lake next to it was quickly saturated with radioactivity. An alligator in the lake transforms into a road smashing, car crushing monster. Be the first to build your roadway and drive your car from ground zero to your home base to win the game. Beware of the monster and of your opponents. No one is safe on Monster Highway!

To start players are all dealt at random 5 road tiles and 1 monster buster card for their hand.

On your turn roll the two specialty dice that have images of a car, monster or road. If road comes up, play a road tile from your hand. If a car comes up, roll the six sided die to see how many spaces your car can move. If monster comes up, draw a monster card and see what space the "monster" lands on.

The goal is to create a roadway out of road tiles that leads from the center of the board "ground zero" to the players home base. The players car moves along the road built and once the car makes it to home base, that player wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Tile Placement

name: Rick and Morty: Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind Deck-Building Game â Promo Rick
description:
Promo Rick originally was included with the first printing of Rick and Morty: Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind Deck-Building Game, and was subsequently made available via other means.

It is compatible with any Cryptozoic Cerberus Deck-Building game.

Promo Rick has the following ability: At the end of your turn, if you bought or gained two or more different card types, draw two extra cards, and then discard a card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Gen Con 2019 Genevieve Promo Pack
description:
For this year's Gen Con, SlugFest Games got to partner with the convention to produce this 3-card promo pack featuring the show mascot, Genevieve! In these cards, Genevieve the red dragon is visiting The Red Dragon Inn, ready to share her Morsel of Wisdom, a Dragon's Flight of wines, and The Best Four Beers in Greyport!

—description from the publisher

The print run was limited to 2000 copies.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Captain Flip: In the Jaws of the Kraken
description:
Hobby-next Goodies.
In the Jaws of the Kraken is a secret episode in the story of Captain Flip.

name: The Complete Brigadier
description:
A boxed miniatures rules set that included die-cut counters for about 150-figures worth of troops, enough to form a standard brigade. Game is very strongly oriented to the player as the brigadier, leading his black powder-era brigade against a similar force. Includes scenarios from the French & Indian War, American Revolution, War of 1812, Mexican American War and Civil War. Includes data for warfare throughout the period 1680-1880 and all over the world. Besides a well-indexed and nicely illustrated rule book, there is a second booklet with a comprehensive introduction to miniature wargaming.
The game system is diceless and order based, resulting in a chess-like atmosphere when pitting two similar forces against each other.
A typical brigade under the rules consists of the brigadier, four 24- to 30-figure line infantry units, one 24- to 30-figure light infantry unit, a 24-figure cavalry unit and a 2-3 gun artillery battery with 12-18 gunners.
categories: Age of Reason, American Civil War, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Age of Steam Expansion: 1890 Berlin
description:
An Age of Steam Expansion included in the german game magazine Fairplay, issue #90, january to march 2010.

Includes a map of berlin (2 pages DIN A4) and the rules. The new rules modify the choice of action, rail building, transport of goods and the supply of goods.
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: La Princesse aux Echelles
description:
Princess Ladder is a cooperative and communication limited cardgame, for 3-6 players.

Based on a princess-abducted-by-dragon story, the game drives the players to the highest window of dungeons, where 4 sisters princesses are to be saved, by using numerical ladder cards. The active player knows (most of time) the exact height and asks others for the good card to add to his own ladder. Alas, he can only speak with 2 words : “More” or “Less”. More, the princess as well as the current page of the story book tell the players how to save her.

When each player ended the round, ladders are added and the total is compared to the dungeon height. If equal, princess is saved, otherwise, dragon takes the princess away and players turn another page of the story book. At the end of the book, if all princesses are not saved, the game is over and lost.

There’s some variant rules in the booklet to increase game length and/or difficulty.

-description from publisher

name: Trideo
description: The starting set-up is always the same in Trideo, but once you start playing — trying to find the fastest way to get one of your own colors into a winning position — things start getting difficult, especially since your opponent will keep placing their pegs in your way time and time again.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Building, Square Grid

name: Rank & File: Horse & Musket Rules 1740~1900
description:
Rank and File are a set of horse and musket rules that cover the period from 1740 through to 1900. The basic game mechanics are simple and easy to learn with the aim of being able to play large games within a reasonable time frame.

The mechanics use a fairly standard D6 system for table top games with both sides taking their actions in phases - either alternate for movement or simultaneous for firing, morale and melee. Units can represent anything from battalions to brigades and are made up of a number of stands. As losses are taken stands of figures are removed and the unit is forced to take morale tests, multiple failures remove the entire unit.

The rules are broken down into basic and optional rules - at the most basic level the game is fast and simple, the optional rules add more detail and realism but also add more time to the game play.
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Return of the King Journeybook
description:
This supplement allows you to fight out the battles and encounters of The Return of the King book and film on your own tabletop, painting the miniatures and building the terrain you need as you go.

This is a supplement for Games Workshop's The Lord of The rings Strategy Battle Game - you will need a copy of the rules in order to play.
(publisher website)
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: Warhammer Quest: Kislevite Shaman
description:
This is an expansion for Warhammer Quest and was available through mail-order. The rules allow a player to play the Kislevite Shaman Warrior.

Description:

KISLEVITE SHAMAN

The Kislevite Shaman uses Mana to cast Blessings much in the same way the Wizard uses Magic to cast Spells. The Shaman begins the game with a Totem Staff and either a Raven or a Wolf Spirit Familiar.

Basic rules, Advanced Rules, and Roleplaying Rules are included. For example, rules for the Spirit Familiars are listed in the Basic Game, while 38 Blessings are included for the Shaman to cast in the Advanced Game, as are rules for visiting Settlements. A description of how the Shaman might act and react to people and events in the Old World are mentioned in the Roleplaying Section.

This pack contained only a rules booklet and contained no miniature, cards, or counters.

This is not a complete game, a copy of Warhammer Quest is necessary to use the contents of this box.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Bolt Action: Ostfront â Barbarossa to Berlin
description:
Take charge of Operation Barbarossa and drive towards Moscow or command the steadfast defenders of the Soviet Union. From the early battles for Leningrad and Sevastopol to the tank clash of Kursk and the bitter urban warfare of Stalingrad, this new Theatre Book for Bolt Action provides wargamers with new scenarios and special rules that give them everything they need to focus their gaming on the Eastern Front.

Contents:

Introduction
Special Rules
Scenarios
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 â Messerschmitt Bf.109 K-4
description:
From the publisher:

The Messerschmitt Bf.109 was one of the first truly modern fighters of WW2. Originally conceived as an interceptor, the Bf.109 fulfilled multiple roles, as bomber escort, fighter-bomber, ground–attack aircraft, and reconnaissance aircraft. The final production version of the Bf.109 was the K series, or “Kurfürst.” Externally similar to the G series, it had a large number of internal and aerodynamic changes that improved its effectiveness and remedied existing flaws, which kept it competitive against rival fighters.

Messerschmitt Bf.109 K–4 (9./JG3)
Belonging to the proud Jagdgeschwader 9, which fought throughout the war, this Bf.109 defended German borders from the Allied advance.

Messerschmitt Bf.109 K–4 (1./JG77)
Jagdgeschwader 77 used the last version of Bf.109 to fight in the Reichsverteidigung (defense of the Reich) during the last days of WW2, to slow the inevitable German defeat.

Messerschmitt Bf.109 K–4 (Hartmann)
Major Erich Hartmann, the greatest Ace of all time with 352 aerial victories, piloted many different airplanes, including the latest versions of Bf.109.

Each WW2 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Materia
description: Materia is an alchemy themed casual card game. It is similar to other rummy-style card games that include drafting and hand management. Each round, a new set of transmutations (sets or runs) is played for everyone to see. Players must match their hand of cards to the combination the table to earn points. Other special alchemy cards create player interaction and can change the course of the round. Once a player has run out of cards, the round is over and points are awarded. The number of points to win is adjusted according to the number of players.

name: Scream, Aim, Fire Pacific
description:
Scream, Aim, Fire Pacific! is a solo tactical game of squad-level combat set in the pacific theatre of WWII. The player takes the part of American infantry and armor pushing inland to take objectives, using a dice-roll action system that gives you a guaranteed number of actions each round, but not always of the exact type you need. A card-driven action system manages the Japanese defenders, including veteran units, machine-gun nests, pill boxes and even tanks. Victory is based on objectives and American Morale score, and game complications include lack of supplies and surprise Japanese reinforcements, so even on the edge of victory, it pays to be cautious. But with a time limit on every scenario, not too cautious. With five scenarios of increasing difficulty and complexity, Scream, Aim, Fire Pacific! is a challenge you will have to rise to and a challenger that is always ready for you.

—description from the publisher

name: Battle of Yorktown Game
description: Battle of Yorktown is a low to moderate complexity tactical wargame covering the Franco-American attack and siege of Yorktown during the American Revolutionary War. One player commands the British and their Hessian mercenaries and the other player commands the Franco-American forces. The game takes about 90 minutes to play
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: Pins & Needles
description:
Pins & Needles is a climbing/shedding game for 2 to 3 players using 2 to 3 sets of double six dominoes. Your goal is to shed out all your tiles.

The unique twist to this game is that you can climb up or down the ranks depending on the combination lead to the play. Each player gets a double blank tile, which is a wild tile, to offer flexibility.

When you shed out, for each opponent with 5 or more tiles in their hands, you score bonus points. Therefore, you must skillfully shed out all your tiles while also denying others from getting bonus points.

This game is inspired by Sean Ross’s domino games (Clackerjack, Daiquiri, and Fiddich). Pins & Needles is a gentler introduction to those games by being easier to setup, quicker to parse through the hand, and without the complexities of partnership play.

name: 55 Days at Peking Game
description:
55 Days at Peking is a low to moderate complexity tactical wargame on the Chinese siege of the Legations at Peking in 1900. The game takes about 90 minutes to play. One player commands the Chinese forces and the other player commands the various Allied forces defending the Legations.
Action and Event Cards vary the game play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control
publishers: Blue Panther, The Historical Game Company, LLC

name: Mandamina
description: In the co-operative, abstract puzzle game Mandamina, players take turns relocating one wooden marble at a time on the one free spot of a 7x7 grid. Cluster the marbles by color in as few turns as possible — and in silence.

name: Krosmaster: Arena â Yugo Young King Promo
description: Promotional Figure for the Krosmaster: Arena game. Offered Through the Krosmaster: Quest preorder.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering â Planechase: Elemental Thunder
description:
Elemental Thunder is a red-green deck.

Planechase was released in 2009.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. When the game begins, the player going first reveals the top of his or her planar deck (or the shared planar deck), which is the plane the game starts on. Each plane card has a name, a type, one ability that applies at all times (either to all players or to whoever is the turn player at the time), and one "Chaos" ability.

Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." Each Planechase pre-constructed deck comes with a "planar die" that has four blank faces, one "Planeswalk" face with the "Planeswalker" symbol, and one "Chaos" face with its own symbol unique to Planechase. During a player's main phase, that player can roll the planar die, with three possible outcomes. A blank roll of the planar die does nothing. If "Chaos" is rolled, the "Chaos" ability of the current plane card triggers. If the "Planeswalk" symbol is rolled, the player "planeswalks away" from the current plane (put it on the bottom of its owner's planar deck) and he or she reveals the top card of his or her planar deck, which becomes the new plane that has been "planeswalked to." A player can roll the planar die as many times as he or she likes, but successive rolls cost an additional one mana for each time the planar die has been rolled this turn.

Other than the above, the normal rules of the game are followed, and Planechase can be adapted to any multiplayer variant.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Magic: The Gathering â Planechase: Strike Force
description:
Strike Force is a white-red deck.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Magic: The Gathering â Dominaria
description:
Dominaria is the 78th Magic expansion. It was released on April 27, 2018. It is not part of a block.
Dominaria is the first set to follow the Three-and-One Model, which abolished blocks. Richard Garfield is on the design team, for the first time since the original Innistrad set.It contains 269 cards (20 basic lands, 101 commons, 80 uncommons, 53 rares, 15 mythic rares), and includes randomly inserted premium versions of all cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Silent Death Annex: Rules of Warfare II
description:
From the back cover:

RULES OF WARFARE II
" Ha!" screamed Erik as disrupter gun fire flashed through the space beside his Marut. With just a squeeze his impulse gun scored a ravaging hit against the offending Chupacabra. The mangled Chupy tumbled through space scattering un-launched missiles like a trail of breadcrumbs behind it. With a flick of his wrist Erik saluted his fallen opponent "Bye-bye goat sucker."

Rules of Warfare II (ROW 11) is the Silent Death supplement for scheduling tournaments, and organizing Silent Death Events.

Rules of Warfare II includes:
• The Rules of Warfare II official tournament guidelines
• Pre=constructed ROW II fleets for:
- Prize Ships - Kashmere
- ASP - Espan
- Sunrunner - Sigurd
- Yoka-Shan - Fighter Tactics
• Crew allocation system optional rule
• A House based league system
• Full color counter sheets
• A fold-out map for tabletop play
• A Millennium Warriors ranking program update
• Refits for the Silent Death prize ships:
- Dolphin II
- Orca Alpha
- Piranha II
- Executioner II
- Snarling Badger II
• The official Millennium Warrior event sanctioning procedure
• 2 Smash style events: - 4 Ship Smash - House Smash
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: City of Iron: Clockwork Fortress and Cave Market Promo
description:
Clockwork Fortress and Cave Market are a set of two promotional cards for the 1st edition of City of Iron.
These cards are added to the "E" buildings; that is, they are available to build from the start of the game.
The Cave Market adds one coin to your income for each different type of good you own.
The Clockwork Fortress allows you to change the order of your citizen and military decks each time you refresh that deck.

These cards may also be used with the 2nd edition of City of Iron, where they are placed above the usual row of buildings and are not removed until they are purchased.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Economic, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Bankett: Teil 2 â Der Fluch des Diamanten von Ramanpur
description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Although the robbery of the Ramanpur diamond was cleared up after the banquet, some puzzles remain unsolved. An illness afflicts the kitchen staff, an inexplicable red fog covers the hotel grounds and finally the von Schwarzburg twins have to undergo psychiatric treatment after they have mysteriously disappeared.
Are these events related to the curse of the diamond?

According to legend, the diamond curses anyone who gets hold of it. Uncover if there are indeed higher forces at work here or if there is a logical explanation for all events.

name: Golem Arcana: Gudanna Dominion â Valkali Colossus Expansion
description: The Great Khan is dead, plunging the world of Eretsu into total war as the Khan's heirs square off against outsiders and each other for control of his shattered Dominion. The combatants' most fearsome weapons are Golems, magically animated behemoths created and piloted by powerful sorcerers. Now it's your turn to take control of a Golem army to fight for the honor of your liege!
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Above and Below: G@mebox Building promo card
description:
A promotional card given out during the 2016 Essen Spiel convention by Kulkmann's G@mebox (www.boardgame.de). Later available as part of a draw, entry by commenting on the G@mebox website guestbook.

This promo introduces a new key Building Card that you can use in the game. At the end of the round, you can discard a villager that you have and gain a new one from the row for free. You can only select from the remaining villagers on the board before refilling villagers for the next round.

The G@mebox unicorn logo is depicted on the red banners of the building.
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Storytelling, Trading

name: Stop Thief!: Ernie "The Axe" Garry Promo Card
description:
A promo card given out to customers who purchased a game from the Restoration Games booth at GenCon 2017.

Text from the card:

Ernie "The Axe" Garry

When Captured: You find a +5 Potion of Speed. Take this card. On a future turn, discard to move 5 extra spaces. $8000
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering â Return to Ravnica
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ravnica: the metropolis of the Multiverse. Though the Guildpact spell has been broken, the ten guilds live on in this city-covered plane. Five of them lie within. Choose your allegiance carefully, Planeswalker.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Who Goes There: Caldwell and Connant Character Expansion Pack
description: Each character has their own unique abilities and specialty cards ready to help them. With this character pack, Who Goes There can expand to accommodate 5-6 characters. Characters are also interchangeable and can be swapped out to create different teams and add more variety to your game.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Traffic Control
description:
User Summary

"September 1944. Your squad has been scouting ahead of the division in an attempt to locate German Reinforcements reported to be gathering for a counterattack. Your squad has reached a small village at a vital crossroads. Headquarters has ordered you to stay put and report any enemy movement in the area."

Originally published in Victory Games Insider #7 (1985). This scenario provides an additional mission (Mission VI1: Traffic Control) for the original Ambush! game. The designer of this scenario, Paul Fasoldt, would go on to design the Ambush! Silver Star module in 1987.

This scenario includes rules for a new weapon type (the Flamethrower), along with 4 summaries for new vehicles (Armored Car with Light Machine Gun, Halftrack, Motorcycle with Sidecar, & Truck).

Additionally the scenario comes with 3 pages of Paragraphs, 2 double-sided Mission Cartridges showing 4 conditions (printed on normal weight paper), and a sheet with 11 Character/Vehicle Cards (also printed on normal weight paper).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Riga: Die VitalienbrÃ¼der
description:
Victual Brotherhood is threatening the Baltic Sea!

Nine pirate ships enter the game of Riga in the Die Vitalienbrüder expansion and make it more expensive to build some of the building cards. You have to pay more every time you take a building with a pirate ship, but you gain additional victory points in the game end scoring for each ship you defeat. The problem is that pirates eliminate figures (knight, merchant) on your cards, too!

Riga: Die Vitalienbrüder can used in games with up to six players.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Pirates
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Take That

name: French & Indian War Battles
description:
French and Indian War Battles is two player grand tactical wargame system for simulating battles in North America during the French & Indian War (1754-60). While these battles often involved small armies for the era, they decided the fate of the continent.

This game includes three scenarios: Lake George (Sep 1755), Fort Oswego (Aug 1756), and Quebec (Sep 1759).

Each battle has its own map, special rules and counters representing the military formations which participated in the original action. Each game turn represents from 10 minutes to one hour depending on the pace of operations. Each hex represents 50 to 150 yards, depending on the scenario. Combat units represent anything from a wing (two or more companies) to a battalion. Each combat strength point represents 40 to 150 men, depending on the quality of training and weaponry. Each artillery unit represents two to six guns. Leaders represent a single great commander plus staff.

Published in S&T #340

name: Strike on Sarhu 1619
description:
Strike on Sarhu 1619 (æ±ºæ°è©ç¾æ»¸1619) is a two-player board wargame that simulates the Battle of Sarhu, March 1 to March 5, 1619.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sarhu

Each turn represents one day and each hex is about 10 km across. One player commands the Later Jin (å¾é) Eight Banners (å«æ) and the other player commands the Ming (æ) matchlocks and cannons. This is a decisive battle near the Sarhu Mountain Pass in Chinese history and sets an important foundation of the future Qing Dynasty.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Nordkapp: Los Convoyes del Artico (1942-1945)
description:
Alea Magazine issue 29.

This issue includes the game Nordkapp, a naval game of the Arctic convoys in WW2.

Double blind, Midway type wargame on the Arctic convoys to Murmank during World War 2. Unit scales: individual capital ships and submarines, small groups of escorts vessels and merchantmen, squadrons of 20-40 aircraft. 1 game turn equals 8 hours of time.

name: Disaster on Kangchenjunga
description:
Disaster on Kangchenjunga (or "K13" for short) is the third game in Tom Decker's 'Disaster on' series.

A plane has crashed high up on the slopes of Kangchenjunga, the world’s third highest mountain. One of the passengers was carrying plans that contain secrets that if exposed or delivered into the wrong hands, could threaten world security. Your nation has sent you to join an expedition intent on reaching the summit of Kangchenjunga (Kangch), but you have different orders. You must reach the plane wreck, find the secret plans, and continue the expedition as if you are just one of the team. However, there is a spy among you who will try to sabotage your efforts and steal the plans away from you. There may also be another nation’s team on the mountain with similar interests. It’s a race to the plane crash!

The game begins at midnight at High Camp on Kangch. You will control the movements for your entire team, most of whom are trying to reach the summit. Each turn, you will move climbers towards the summit (and plane crash) and then back down again. However, at some point in the game, the spy will be revealed, changing the rules drastically and forcing you to make decisions about who will summit, who will find and protect the secret plans, and who will try to just survive!

Your decisions will not only determine the lives of your climbers, but may also stop the Cold War from heating up. Think you have what it takes? Play Disaster on Kangchenjunga to find out!

name: The Gentlemen of the South Sandwiche Islands
description:
Jules and Hodge are competing for the attentions of the Lady Ashley. Each wants to speak with her alone. They must do this by crossing bridges to leave the others behind.

There are 6 pieces on the board. You control a master piece and a servant piece. On your turn you can move one, or the other, across a bridge and decide who follows. (The bridges only permit a certain number across.) Some players try to lead her away from the group, and others use their servant to lead others away. The game is very easy to learn. At any time a player only has several choices... but be careful, there are more than 300,000 different possible arrangements for the 6 pieces on the board.

name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Scouring of the Shire
description: The Scouring of the Shire is a Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game supplement providing Rules for small battles between Hobbits and the agents of "Sharkey".
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Wargame

name: BattleTech: Campaign Operations
description:
BattleTech: Campaign Operations is the sixth core rulebook in the Battletech: Total Warfare line. It contains force construction and campaign rules the BattleTech system.

Campaign Operations contains rules for creating and running forces, whether a down-on-their-luck mercenary battalion, or a fully-supplied House regiment. The volume also contains complete rules for devising solar systems, allowing players to recreate existing star systems or craft all-new worlds to challenge each other. The final sections of the book bring several options to the table for campaign play. Building off of previous sections in Total Warfare and Strategic Operations, the Narrative Campaign, Map-based Campaign, and Chaos Campaign rules allow players to build exciting, fun campaigns of almost any stripe for their newly-minted forces!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Pattern Recognition, Role Playing, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Grim Ironjaw â Star Player
description:
The Slayer Cult is a strange but well-documented aspect of life for a Dwarf, seen as the only option for those who have committed a shameful act. Shedding their worldly possessions and symbolically greasing their hair with pig fat, these contrite Dwarfs seek only a pure death in combat against the most terrifying foes imaginable. Traditionally, they had sought their fate on the battlefield, but all of that changed when Grim Ironjaw joined the Black Mountain Blades.

Following a successful first season, Ironjaw spent several years moving from team to team, always striving to move up in the league rankings. After all, as he saw it, the most glorious death to be found on the pitch must surely be at the Blood Bowl itself, facing off against one of the NAF’s most accomplished teams. In the years since he has yet to compete in the fabled tournament, but with each passing season, his chances are greater and his legend grows ever more impressive. Who knows – maybe this is his year!

Field Grim Ironjaw as a Star Player in your Dwarf Blood Bowl team with this resin kit. He’s a particularly stocky example of Dwarf strength, with bulging muscles beneath a frankly glorious beard featuring plaited-in details (skulls! He has skulls in his beard!) His mohawk is tall, and his fist clutches a terrifying-looking blade – truly, he’s an all-crushing Slayer and a half.

This resin miniature comes as 5 components, and is supplied with a 32mm Blood Bowl base.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: War Along the Gulf Coast
description:
Volume II in the War of 1812 Game Series follows up the successful limited edition of War Along the Chesapeake (Volume I).

War Along the Gulf Coast allows gamers to refight Andrew Jackson's campaign against British General Pakenham's British invaders. The game uses the proven Blue & Gray combat system where morale is as important as the number of soldiers.

You are limited in how many units you may move based on the number of action points you receive, plus a random number of action points based on your commander, and play an Event Card, not necessarily in that order. This means no two games will play alike. Movement is location to location. When the two armies end a move in the same location a battle occurs and the action moves to the battle board.

Components:
Mounted Game Map Board showing the gulf coast
30 Large Red Blocks (24mm)
30 Large Blue Blocks (24mm)
2 Sets of Labels
4 Red dice
4 Blue dice
2 Rule Books
2 Player Aid Cards
2 Battle Boards
Game Box
Exclusive Kickstarter Book
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Witless Wizards: Druid Deck Mini Expansion
description:
Druids are friends of nature, using it to heal in more ways than usual. But their attack might should also not be underestimated.

An addtional eight card deck for Witless Wizards
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Blood Red Skies: British â RAF Expansion Pack
description:
RAF expansion material for the base game.

This pack contains additional cards for Blood Red Skies. Datacards for the following Royal Air Force aircraft are included:
• Spitfire Mk Vb
• Spitfire Mk XIV
• Typhoon 1B
• Tempest V
• Wellington IC Medium Bomber
• Lancaster III Heavy Bomber

This pack also includes Action Deck cards which cover the aircraft presented plus a wide variety of other aircraft used by the RAF.

Contents:
22 Trait Cards
3 Theatre Cards
3 New Doctrine Cards
2 New Equipment Cards
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Tekhenu: Noble Buildings
description: The Noble Buildings is a small-module expansion for Tekhenu: Obelisk of the Sun. During setup, each player receives a special Building tile. Once per game, when constructing a Building, whether as a workshop or quarry (Osiris God Action), around the Temple Complex (Hathor God Action), or in a foreign region (Seth God Action), you may place this tile underneath the newly constructed Building. If you do so, double the rewards received.

name: Battle Of The Breweries
description:
Battle Of The Breweries Season 1 Card Game is a fast paced and strategic game, that pits rival breweries against each other.

The worlds first Trading Card game featuring real world breweries and beers.
130 breweries are a part of Season 1 from 30 countries!

Take control of a world renowned brewery as a brand new co-owner!
Your first task? Build the greatest taproom in the world for your fans to flock to.
Along the way, you'll have to source beers within your fans favourite ABV% range, stock beers that are linked to your brewery, find the glassware that compliments your beers and locate your breweries Pet or Mascot.
It all sounds too easy, but your rivals have decided to copy your plans. You won't know who they are or what they're trying to source themselves, and you'll have to defend yourself from thieves and attackers that are out to steal your items.

It's time to fight your way to glory and become the greatest brewery in the world!


Includes the Trading Cards of 15 breweries inside, along with everything you need to take on your rival breweries in a strategic, fast paced and exciting game.


—description from the designer

name: Onitama: Hornet and Centipede Promo Cards
description:
A set of 2 cards packaged together in Pack E of The Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.

These cards provide new movement options for your pieces.

name: Floh im Zoo
description: In Floh im Zoo, you want to remove all the fleas from the four animals under your care. They'll hop back and forth from one animal to another, but if you manage to de-flea your animals first, you win!

name: Queen of 12: KreuzzÃ¼ge
description:
Turn Queen of 12 into a real Roll & Write game with this expansion.

It includes a completely new game mode with new rules for game preparation, 2 completely new score sheets and 2 new characters (8 cards).

Instead of starting with 4 cards as in the basic game, you have directly a big deck of 8 cards.

The gameplay is the same, but the sheets work much differently: per die, you may check the number shown AND the color. Of course, you still want to have a lot of both, but now it is even more important to get exactly the ones you are missing.

You can specialize or work towards set bonuses. Colors also give bonus points, but more importantly, certain color combinations let you use powerful extra abilities. And if you weren't allowed to make any crosses, or you got exactly one die, you get to pick a special bonus, or save up for an even more powerful bonus.

So the question of which dice you get becomes even more important, and sometimes you may even want to intentionally not take any dice at all. So it's even more important that you keep an eye on the others and their cards!

All in all, depending on the card selection, there are a number of different strategies you can use to get the maximum points out of your slips.

There are also refill sets that include scoring blocks for both the base game and the expansion.

Translated from the crowdfunding page
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Magic: The Gathering â The Brothers' War
description:
Get ready for a blast from the past as Dominaria's heroes must launch an expedition into ancient history in order to stop the New Phyrexian planar invasion in the present day! This Magic: The Gathering expansion uses time travel as a framing device in order to revisit the epic conflict first glimpsed in 1994's Antiquities in the form of excavated artifacts. Nearly 30 years of real-time later, the continent-destroying war between the two brothers, Urza and Mishra, is finally getting its time in the spotlight.

The Brothers' War is packed with soldiers, armies, giant robots, and all the horror and destruction of mechanized warfare. It boasts two new mechanics: Prototype, which allows players to cast a less powerful version of an artifact at a lower mana cost; and Powerstones, artifact tokens that can tap for mana that can't be used to cast nonartifact spells. Joining them are the returning mechanics of Unearth (first seen in Shards of Alara) and Meld (first seen in Eldritch Moon).

Similar to the Timeshifted cards in Time Spiral or the Mystical Archive in Strixhaven: School of Mages, there is a bonus artifact sheet in The Brothers' War: every booster pack of The Brothers' War contains a reprint of a classic artifact, from Magic's past, in the retro frame.

Two preconstructed Commander decks featuring Urza and Mishra were released alongside the main set. Additionally, to play into the "giant robots" theme, this set also includes a crossover special in the form of 15 cards depicting characters from another Hasbro intellectual property about giant robots fighting: Transformers.
