These cards are not in draft boosters, but can be found in set boosters, collector boosters, and bundles.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Income, Interrupts, Melding and Splaying, Take That

name: DAN DAN DAN
description:
ãã³ãã³ãã³ dan … dan … dan The hilarious shoot-‘em-up card game for 2 to 4 players aged 14 and up.

Say good-bye to your old, boring identity and find yourself as member of the Tekiya! They form Japan‘s more or less honourable group of food stall operators and hucksters. Once they‘ve paved the way for the notorious Yakuza, but no need to retire: the Tekiya are still around and active today. And, of course, they are all one „big family“. Except when talking money. Then they suddenly all turn into greedy bastards. And now this: Ichien san of the kakigori stall claims to make the best shaved ice, while all the other guys merely hawk inferior crap. Man, that means trouble! Anyone who publicly puts himself above the others is breaking law and order. No Tekiya will ignore that. But should you make a snitch out of yourself at the Oyabun and in the worst case lose your finger, Yubitsume style? No way! Breaking taboos is something you only do among yourselves – in an ominous corner of the park. And then, then, then it‘s dan ... dan ... dan! Which in our simple translation means „Bang, bang, bang!“. Here’s the good thing: Whoever survives the shootout of the gun toting brawlers will have a few more food stalls in the near future.

IN PLAIN LANGUAGE: WHAT IS IT ALL ABOUT?
Quickly and in turn, you turn over cards from your own stack and place them face up in the centre of the table. There, a full arsenal of handguns accumulates. Every time a loaded gun is pointed at two of you with its grip and barrel, a shootout takes place. If you are shot – or make a mistake beforehand – you are punished and must take all the cards from the centre of the table. You grease the police with the top card, the rest go face down under your stack. Then you continue the game by turning over a new card. And on it goes...

The first player who has no cards left, wins the game.

In addition, various abstruse special cards fuel future game rounds and keep the game challenging.
What more could you wish for?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Fighting, Mafia

name: Inventions: Promo Cards
description:
Stretch Goal Promo Cards from the Inventions: Evolution of Ideas Kickstarter.

Includes: 6 Promo Idea Cards

—description from the publiher
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: B17: The Fight for Air Supremacy
description: B17 The Fight for Air Supremacy is a solitaire roll and write war game. The player takes control of a B17 bomber and its crew, the B17 must reach its target and get back home without taking too much damage and trying to keep the crew intact. The player will face many challenges in the form of German fighters, flak and mechanical problems. Can you keep your nerve and take to the skies and help to reduce German fighter production.

name: DiversiÃ³n con Banderas
description:
Diversión con (Fun with) is a trivia game system played in 12 rounds.
In each round, a question card related to three randomly drawn knowledge cards is read.
Simultaneously, everyone at once chooses an answer, getting a point if the answer is correct.
Whoever at the end of round 12 has scored the most points wins the game.

In Diversión con banderas (Fun with flags) questions are related to the name, capital, population, temperature and surface of European countries.

name: Villages of Valeria: King's Herald Promo Card
description:
Promo card for Villages of Valeria.

You gain 3 Victory Points for every set of 1 Worker, 1 Soldier, 1 Holy, and 1 Shadow Building you have built in your Village at the end of the game.

Per designer/publisher: usually given out at conventions.

This card was later added to all pledge levels of the Villages of Valeria: Landmarks Kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
publishers: Daily Magic Games, Games Factory Publishing

name: Mammoth
description:
Players take on the role of mammoth herds by moving around barren tundra and transforming the board from invading brambles and trees to beautiful flora and grasslands. Mammoth is a tile laying game that appeals to ages 8 and up. Players place tiles to grow their specific color of flowers and to increase the size of their path as their mammoth moves through the plains. The game has both competitive and co-operative versions of play.

To begin the game, players place their mammoth to begin a field of colorful flowers. At some point during the game they can also place their other prehistoric mammals to claim a path. Then as they take their turns players place an octagon tile or square tile to increase their color grouping or path. They can score maximum points placing a tile directly next to their mammoth and growing more color groupings instead of just their own. The last round starts when the last octagon tile is played. The winner is the player who gained the most points by successfully transforming the barren tundra.

In the co-op version of the game the players work together to accomplish a random color and path goal. The players play as scientists planning how they are going to guide their mammoths through the park. Players discuss what actions they want to take and then reveal the available actions for the turn. Players then choose their actions without discussion and then complete them in turn order. If the players succeed in accomplishing their goals and reach a required point total before the last octagon tile is placed, the scientists are successful and have transformed the bleak tundra into a beautiful plain.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: Postcard Barbarossa!
description:
NOTE: As long as you keep (only) my copyright statement, its Dedication, and my war&history quotes on it, you are - ANYone is - free to print off copies of my English language edition in postcard 4"x6"/A6 format to send to family and friends or whomever.

VERY fast and simple hex-and-counter Postcard Barbarossa! postcard size/format board wargame about the 1941 Nazi German invasion of Russia. 4 bi-monthly turns. 3 !! hexes Warsaw to Moscow. Plays in 30? minutes.

3 German Army Group, 4 Panzer Group, 2 Army, and 1 Panzer Korps pieces, plus a Romanians Army Group piece.

4 Russian operational Tank Groups - Rokossovsky, Lelyushenko, Katukov, Vatutin - 8 Fronts, and 1 Siberians pieces.

Simple, basic mechanics, but with lots of basic combat options.

Unlike Barbarossa Brief from which it was adapted, Postcard Barbarossa! uses a simple factor differential/comparison combat system which can be (and usually is) made nightmarishly unpredictable by a Special Factor Pressed Attack or Desperate Defense rule. This makes it an excellent solitaire game.

China's Banner of War will soon be publishing the game in larger, boxed format with already mounted pieces. The postcard is also being translated into Russian in Volgograd/Stalingrad!

—description from the designer
categories: Educational, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Set-up

name: Planet Flipper
description:
In an age where extraterrestrial stabilization technology is no longer science fiction, you set out to find your fortune settling the final frontier.

Your job is to comb the galaxy in search of hospitable planets, stabilize those planets with necessary facilities, and then sell them to wealthy clients in the market for their own private planet.

The more facilities and structures you develop, the higher your planet’s value will be, and the more your clients will pay. However, time is not on your side! With only a finite supply of oxygen available to you on your travels, you’ll have to get the job done quickly or go home empty handed.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action/Event, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Word Hustle
description:
Can you arrange your letter tiles to make the highest-scoring crossword grid?

In Word Hustle, after a letter draft during setup, you'll press your luck and roll your dice to gain more letter tiles. Then, you’ll race against others to make a high-scoring crossword grid. Over three rounds, you’ll try to maximize the scoring power of your personal letter set to win. Word games like Word Hustle – that let you move your letters around to find words – are incredibly satisfying.

In this word game, you won't be sitting idly waiting for your turn. There's simultaneous word-building and player interaction in each phase – you can steal or share letters and make strategic moves to win.

Word Hustle’s unique challenge of having to make new and better words with the same letters each round means the game gets MORE and MORE exciting. It turns out, the human brain loves this challenge. Word Hustle will lead you to consider moves like:

• Should I steal that valuable tile or go for more tiles for myself?
• Should I make words quickly and put pressure on my opponents or take my time and make high-scoring words?
• Can I outscore my previous round using the same letters but new words?

The player with the most points after three rounds is the winner, unless they are challenged to an Ultimate Hustle! In the optional Ultimate Hustle, the winner hands over their letter set to see if their final round score can be outdone… But, it won't be easy – the challenger only has two minutes and can’t use any of the words the winner used in the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Re-rolling and Locking, Real-Time, Spelling, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Hibachi: Fried Egg promo
description:
Each round, before players throw any chips onto the board, the current head chef throws the egg chip onto the board. Then players will begin throwing their chips on the board as normal, starting with the head chef.

Any chips sitting on the same spot as the egg at the commencement of the Cleaning the Cooking Area phase are removed from the board and the space is not resolved this round!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Economic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Set Collection

name: Battle of Shanghai
description:
"Battle of Shanghai" reproduces two Shanghai incidents of different nature in completely different game systems.

The "First Shanghai Incident" is a zonal wargame that represents the military scalade that ensued the January Incident, in 1932. One player plays with the japanese army and the other plays the Kuomintang Armed Forces. The game is played in only two turns, one for february and one for march. Each turn both players alternate in taking actions by expending logistic points until they exhaust their points or both players passes consecutively.
The map depicts the countryside north of Shanghai, in a zonal map. The goal of the Japanese is to score enought victory points by occupying some key areas by the end of each turn or else eliminate all KMT troops from around Shanghai. The KMT wins elseway. The counters represent regiments or brigades, with few support counters.

In "Shanghai / Nanjing Operation", is a more classical wargame, that simulates the 1938 thrust to Nanjing. The map represents the region between Shanghai and Nanjing, and it's an hexagon's map. The units are at divisional level for the japanese and at army level for the Kuomingtang.

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game â The Prize of the North
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Every faction finds new tools to hatch intrigues and win battles in The Prize of the North, the fifth Chapter Pack in the "Conquest and Defiance" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. New Bannerman characters open possibilities for multi-House decks, and fourteen out of twenty cards (three copies of each) in this expansion possess the new Prized keyword. Whether players man the Warships of House Greyjoy, march to the Wall with House Baratheon, or join another Great House, they'll find plenty of new paths to power.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Novel-based
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Officer Cards Resource
description: The Officer Cards are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "Battle of Sector 001," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, The Collective. It is considered a Resource, and costs 3 Squadron Points per officer (up to 4 officers).
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: One Deck Dungeon: Mist
description:
Mist is a new hero for One Deck Dungeon.

Mist's heroic feat allows her to build up power by using spells. In any encounter which you cast a spell, you add a black dice to the character card. During the heroic feat phase, you can increase all dice here by 1, or gain them all. This allows you to continue to increase the dice power until you really need it.

Her 1 player skill allows her to spend blue dice to store yellow or pink 2 on her heroic feat. This continues to expand her forward thinking ability by making use of leftover dice from encounters.

Her 2 player skill allows the party to reuse any spells that were previously used in the encounter.

This promo was given out at Gen Con 2019 to promote Aeon's End Digital.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Battleground Historical Warfare: Second Punic War 218-201 BC Reinforcements
description: This reinforcement deck for Battleground Historical Warfare: Second Punic War 218-201 BC Basic Game features 50 additional unit cards for both armies, along with a scenario booklet, design notes, and an historical overview of the war.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Majors Promo Cards
description:
The Majors Promo Cards are a set of promotional cards that were given away at GenCon 2001 to promote Risk 2210 A.D.

The cards are powerful (but expensive to activate) command cards to supplement each commander's card deck. The art on the cards pays tribute to several people involved with the creation of Risk 2210 A.D.

Five cards are included:

Major Power (Diplomat Command Card)
Major Flöwerz (Land Command Card)
Major Death (Naval Command Card)
Major Pain (Nuclear Command Card)
Major Destruction (Space Command Card)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: SNCF: Germany Expansion
description:
David V. H. Peters' SNCF: Germany provides specialized rules to reflect the creation of the railroads in Germany. SNCF: Germany includes a two-section map of Germany and features an additional action choice that players can perform on their turns as well as a different endgame condition. By balancing company expansion and adding to your portfolio, your goal is to earn more than your fellow rail barons over the course of the game.

SNCF: Germany is one of the two games and seven expansions in the Winsome Games 2011 Essen Set and is fully playable with Paris Connection, the Queen Games version of SNCF.
categories: Deduction, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: La guerre de Jugurtha
description:
La guerre de Jugurtha (also known as "the Jugurthine's war") is a strategical game covering the war fought by the king of Numidia, Jugurtha, against the Republic of Rome.
Jugurtha met initially successes against poor roman leaders and a poorly trained roman army (-111 to -110), but had later to cope first with the aristocratic general Quintus Metellus (-109 to -108) and then with the famous Caius Marius, head of the Populares party (-107 to -105).
Finally, he was betrayed by his father-in-law, king Bocchus of Mauretania and fell in roman hands.

La guerre de Jugurtha is published in Vae Victis 170.

One turn = around 2 months
One counter = around 4000 infantrymen or 2000 cavalrymen
Complexity: 4/10
Solo playability: 4/10
Duration: 2 to 3 hours
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Zone of Control

name: Babylon 5: A Call to Arms Starter Set
description:
From the back of the game folio:

The Call to Arms Starter Set provides everything you need to begin playing and offers an ideal introduction to the award-winning A Call to Arms, the game of spaceship combat in the universe of Babylon 5.

The Starter Set focuses on the War of Retribution, a bloody era from the Babylon 5 universe's history and covers the basic rules of the game in an easy-to-learn format. A number of scenarios are also included, each of which recreates a battle from the War of Retribution -- an ideal setting for your first few games of A Call to Arms. The book includes full rules for the ships which took part in this conflict, along with counters to represent them on the tabletop so you can begin playing immediately.

name: Starmada: The Admiralty Edition â Rules Annex
description:
An expansion to Starmada: The Admiralty Edition, The Rules Annex is a compilation of game related data from the following Starmada: The Admiralty Edition supplements: Imperial Starmada Sourcebook, Starmada: Dreadnoughts, Starmada: Hammer and Claw and Starmada: Iron Stars. This annex does not contain the have the ships, scenarios, and background material that is included in the first four expansions.

40 pages of appendices listing options for starships, weapons, combat, and fighters. Also provides information for setting up campaign games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Amarillo Design Bureau, Inc., Majestic Twelve Games

name: The Battle of Dertosa 215 B.C.
description:
Why did Hasdrubal fail at Dertosa, while his brother Hannibal had succeeded at Cannae?

Find out in this expansion for SPQR, found in GMT's C3i Magazine Nr4. It simulates the Carthaginian defeat at Dertosa, a battle bought 215 BC in Spain. Hasdrubal tried to envelop a Roman Army, only to fail due to a lack of cavalry and veteran troops.

The scenario is described as being like Cannae, only more balanced.

name: Sum On
description:
Sum On is an abstract strategy game of clever move chaining, for two players. You must use both your pieces and your opponent’s pieces to make bonus moves, so step wisely!

Your pieces are numbered 1–8. On your turn, you move one of your pieces one step orthogonally or diagonally forward. Then, look for a bonus move: Choose an axis through that piece, and sum the values of all pieces along that axis (including the one you moved, any of yours, and any of your opponent's!). Now you get to move your piece whose number matches that sum, and so on until you've run out of bonus moves. Finally, it's your opponent's turn.

The game ends when someone cannot make their opening move for the turn. Each player sums the values of their pieces that made it all the way to the other side; higher sum wins!

The rules also offer two variants, which means there are 4 ways to play the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Planet Apocalypse: Lord Jabootu
description:
"Jabootu, a new Demon Lord – the evil spirit of terrible movies and television!"

This expansion contains a new Lord figure to switch up your game.

Contains:

1 Lord figure (Lord Jabootu)
1 Lord Sheet


A Crossover from Planet Apocalypse officially published by Petersen Games makes this miniature compatible with Cthulhu Wars.

For Cthulhu Wars it is also a Independent Great Old One with the following powers:

Deadly Tedium (Pre-Battle): If Jabootu is in play, the enemy rolls 1 less combat die in any battle against you.

Spellbook - (Criticism) Requirement: Jabootu is in a battle declared by another player.
Criticism (Post-Battle): From now on, if Jabootu is in a battle, the enemy receives 1 less Kill result (minimum of 0).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: StolemÃ«
description:
Stolemë – become an ancient giant .

Stolemë are Kashubian Giants. They are strong and feisty. They fiercely fought amongst each other, throwing huge rocks at each other as if the rocks were made of feathers. When the rocks hit the ground, they accidently shaped the landscape of the Kashubian coast. Under their thick skin, however, they hid their kind hearts. They had families. They loved their giant wives and cared for their giant children.

The goal of the game is to prove other giants wrong, with precise rock throws.

Every Stolem family is unique. In game, players may use the variety of actions, movements, gods’ disapproval cards and rock throws, which not only will make them win over the other families, but also will shape the kashubian cost in unique ways.

The game is highly replayable, after every game the shape of the kashubian coast is different.

—user summary
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Educational, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: The Legend of Drimek
description:
The Legend of Drimek is a co-operative board game for 2-4 players in which you take control of one of the heroes from the kingdom of Drimek, one of the four allies that live to search for treasures and relics in the depths of the dungeons.

But one day, they discover an open gate that had been closed for centuries. When they access the dungeon and collect all the treasures, they accidentally wake up an evil necromancer from its slumber, who entraps them in the testing grounds. That's why our heroes must find a way to escape the testing grounds, by cooperating to fight and solve the different tests that each level will throw at them to return to their home. It seems like the testing grounds' legend is true. The Legend of Drimek is real.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Events, Variable Player Powers

name: Village Builder
description:
Medieval cities: they’re cramped, muddy, and generally unpleasant. You want something more. So, you’ve set out on your own to forge a new path. Start a village from meager beginnings and perhaps someday it will grow into your very own cramped, muddy, and generally unpleasant city!

Village Builder is a hand management tile laying worker placement game. The goal is to accrue as many victory points as you can by building a bustling village.

Use workers to collect resources from your existing building tiles and increase the size of your village. Points are accrued by laying tiles in sets of matching residential and industrial tiles, along with non-matching commercial tiles. Increase your score by upgrading buildings to Level 2 or 3; transform the Peasant Hut into the Noble House! Bonus points can be accrued by strategically placing buildings like the Workshop, Vineyard, Blacksmith, and Tanner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, City Building, Medieval, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Layering, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Monopoly: Godzilla Monster Edition
description:
Demolish the competition in a city-terrorizing twist on the classic board game with MONOPOLY®: Godzilla. Begin the invasion by buying, selling and trading locations like Monster Island, Goro’s Workshop, and Kitakami Lake and take over the board with Facilities and Bases. Custom sculpted tokens of giants such as Mothra, Godzilla, King Ghidorah, and Mechagodzilla easily impose on anything in their path!

Includes:
1 Game Board
6 Collectible Tokens: Godzilla, Mothra, King Ghidorah, Minilla, Mechagodzilla, Rodan
28 Title Deed Cards
32 Houses renamed FACILITIES
12 Hotels renamed BASES
16 UNGCC Cards
16 GODZILLA TOWER Cards
1 Pack of Kaiju Credit Currency
2 Dice
Rules

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Campaign Trail: Dirty Politics Module
description: The Dirty Politics Module adds 24 trickery and take that cards to the game. It was included in the original Campaign Trail base game through stretch goals, and became a separate module with the release of the second edition.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Sandwich Masters: Bread Roles
description:
Bread Roles brings an added layer of chaos to the classic Sandwich Masters experience by introducing 10 new role cards, each of which boasts unique game-bending powers. What's more, Bread Roles allows six people to play together for the first time by adding extra cards to the core game.

Assume the identity of the Undercover Health Inspector, Flavatron 5000 or Colin the Bear (among others) and let battle commence. Your name may have changed but the challenge remains the same: defeat your rivals and become the one true Sandwich Master!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Mosaic: GenCon 2022 Promo Pack 1
description:
A 5-card promo pack including cards for the "Wars and Disasters" expansion (2023).

This card pack was handed out at GenCon 2022 to customers who ordered the Colossus edition of Mosaic. Later available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign.

Includes:
Gears
Glass
Jewelry
Naval Ram
Plantations

All are marked as promo cards with an star in the top right corner.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Body of Evidence: Best Served Cold
description:
When notorious local Chef Christain LeClair is found dead on the eve of his restaurantÊ¼s grand reopening, Thornhill P.D. needs your help to crack the case. Bring all of your detective skills to bear in this interactive murder mystery - with a grisly twist!

Study the evidence, gather clues, and sharpen your scalpel as well as your wits to perform a forensic autopsy in order to bring the perpetrator to justice. Conduct your investigation solo or with friends in this fully-offline experience, fit for veteran sleuths and rookies alike. ItÊ¼ll take a keen eye, an iron stomach, and a steady hand to make the cut in Body of Evidence, THE murder mystery autopsy game!

Your story begins as all good mysteries do - with a question: What happened to Christian LeClair?

Body of Evidence will guide you through a deductive investigation across several files, challenging you with questions as you build a picture of the case. However, it's not just your field work and evidence from the scene that will lay the truth bare - you'll be heading down to the morgue for an investigation like no other .. To categorically solve this case, you'll need to conduct an autopsy and follow the grisly clues towards the truth.

As your understanding of the case deepens, the documents, clippings, and physical evidence revealed in each new fill will either strengthen your suspicions, or turn the case on its head. It's up to you to keep a close eye on every new development, motive, and alibi. Definitive proof of the matter awaits to be uncovered by the coroner's scalpel, so make sure you wield it wisely.

Follow the clues, exonerate the innocent, and confront the culprit.

-description from Kickstarter campaign

name: Downlink: The Game of Planetary Discovery
description:
In Downlink, players lead a space agency to develop missions of planetary exploration. Resources are limited, and players must constantly decide where to allocate them best to score the most points. They can choose to specialize in launching rockets, delivering spacecraft to targets, downlinking science data, or spread their resources across multiple areas to increase the likelihood of success. Key events require dice rolling, and team training is available to stack the odds in player's favor.

The game ends when a player reaches 30 or more points on their turn or if there are no cards left for a player to restore their hand to six cards. When one of these events happen, each player gets one last turn. The game can be lengthened or shortened by adjusting the number of points needed to win.

After each player completes their last turn, they total up the number of points scored. The player with the highest total number of points wins. In the case of a tie, the player with the highest Discovery points wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Vinyl: Jukebox
description:
Bring your bag of quarters because the party is about to begin! Jukebox is a fast-playing 2-player game that is easy to learn and plays in around 20 minutes.

In Vinyl: Jukebox, your goal is to create the best playlist by organizing your 45s in not-so-easy ways. All the while, racing to earn public scoring conditions and completing private goals for maximum points.

Jukeboxes play records called 45s and they come in five genres, three decades, and have great songs on side A and B. To collect these 45s, players must draw a variety of coins from their bag until certain record-earning conditions are met- but no fast, bebopper! Draw too few coins and you might not earn any record. Draw too many coins and you might end up helping your opponent!

As 45s are acquired, they need to be arranged in a 3x3 grid inside your jukebox. When a row or column is completed, their arrangement will affect which public scoring bonuses you can earn and determine if you have completed your private goals. As you fill your jukebox with records, you’ll be pulled back and forth between the competing needs of the various scoring objectives. Which ones do you go for? Did your strategy work? Will you end up on top? We’ll find out when a player acquires their ninth 45s and the end game is triggered. Count up your points the person with the most wins!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Dystopian Wars: Operation Shadow Hunter
description:
Set in the waters around South America, Operation Shadow Hunter pits two bitter enemies against each other: the Empire of the Blazing Sun and the Federated States of America.

In territory that once belonged to the Republic of Argentina, the forces of the Empire of the Blazing Sun are once again on the move. Their plan is complex, their overall objective still a secret, but the dice have already been rolled and the battle lines drawn. The eastern forces have a new and deadly ally. The infamous Wani have returned from exile, contributing never-before-seen technology to seal their new pact of service with the Empire.

To the north, the Federated States of America has responded with speed to the loss of its own vessels, both military and civilian. In a bid to counter the mysterious 'Ghost Ship' the chief scientists of this great nation have accelerated development of their own secret weapon - the Boston Class Submersible - and the American Admirals are eager to prove it in battle. Designed to engage and destroy even the most formidable enemy ships, the Boston Class comes armed with the latest advanced weaponry and a complement of Assault Subs.

The scene is set for lethal conflict as two of the deadliest naval forces on the planet clash in the once calm waters off the coast of Brazil.

Dare you take command in Operation Shadow Hunter?
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering â Coldsnap
description:
In this final set of the Ice Age block, the island continent of Terisiare is beginning to thaw, and a secretive society of mages vies for power. Will they succeed in shrouding the continent with their chilling magic?

Released 10 years after its predecessor, Alliances, this final set of the Ice Age block contains 155 cards with randomly inserted premium cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Comanauts: Drake Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as a pre-order bonus from the publisher.

Drake, the ex-soldier promo avatar! Drake comes armed with the Grapple Gun, a special weapon that allows him to traverse difficult terrain with ease, and the magical Katana of Speed, which grants him an additional level of protection. Drake also has the Valiant Willpower ability, which gives him a burst of heroic energy each time he uses it.

Includes:

1 Cardboard Standee
1 Avatar Card
2 Item Cards: Grapple Gun, Katana of Speed
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Epic Card Game: Lost Tribe â Good
description:
The Lost Tribe is a set of four 15 card packs, one for each alignment (Evil, Good, Sage and Wild). Combine any two packs to create a 30 card, two-color deck and you are ready to play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: ParanauÃª
description:
It is the end of the 19th century and Capoeira, Brazil's cultural heritage today, is unfairly prohibited by law. You are a Mestre in Capoeira and you are about to structure your own roda, but you still need to get some more members, instruments and teachings so that it is fully formed.

Collect materials to make your musical instruments, get parts of clothing to call members to your circle, use Capoeira strokes strategically to duel your colleagues, manage to introduce educational values ââand elevate your group's experience. And be very careful! You will not want the police to hit your capoeira circle making your objective more difficult.

Are you ready to be part of the most known and respected Capoeira group in the world?

In Paranauê, you are a capoeira master who is disputing with other circles which is the strongest and most influential.
Join new members, produce instruments, duel and teach your values! At the end of the game, the player with the most Victory Points will be the winner.

Players take their turns until a player reaches the score according to the number of players below:
2 players - 25 points
3 and 4 players - 30 points
5 players - 35 points
When any player reaches the stipulated score the game will end as soon as the first player's turn begins.

So everyone adds up their
a deal with:

Victory Points - Your current score on the trail.
Objective Card - reveal your objective card. If you are finished, count the points.
Wheel members - Add the value of each member to the wheel.
Musical Instruments - Add the value of each instrument on the wheel.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Negotiation, Sports
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points, Negotiation

name: Mini Crimes: L'Ultimo Natale
description:
In your hands you have an investigative case that you can play alone or with friends. It takes little space, a bit of time and a lot of ingenuity.
But remember, one case leads to another!

Six chapters for six compact boxes to carry with you in every situation: the box itself contains the rules of the game, and along with the deck of cards contained in it, it will be enough to get all the clues necessary to the resolution!

Mini Crimes is a cooperative investigative game in which you'll put your observation and deduction skills to the test to solve a mysterious case. You'll analyse a crime scene and up to 10 clues.
Choose carefully and solve the mystery!

In Mini Crimes: L’ultimo Natale (Mini Crimes: Last Christmas), the rich Sir Cartwright was found by the butler in his living room, with a bullet in his head... a classic suicide case on Christmas Eve... or maybe not?

— description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: Zombag
description:
Zombag is a competitive zombie apocalypse game utilizing a pool of 6-sided die, a bag, and the tokens that represent survivors, weapons, zombies and more. Each player is vying to score the most points by fighting zombies to make the bag a safer place, scavenging the wilds to gaining much needed supplies, and using your hard earned tokens to complete missions. The player with the most points by the end of the game wins, and is crowned the greatest zombie apocalypse survivor of all time.

Zombag is the first game to come from the creative minds at Glass Cabinet Hobbies. Ryan Morgan (Owner/Designer), Chris Miranda (Creative Director/Designer), and Grant Giles (Assistant) bring to you a party game fit for all ages. It can be played anywhere and ranges from 5 minutes-45 minutes thanks to the adaptive end token system.

Components:
1 Game Box
1 Bag
1 Rule Sheet
40 Missions Cards
150 Tokens
48 Zombies
12 Bullets
10 food and water
6 Conflicts
6 Raids
3 of each Character
3 of each Weapon
3 Infections
1 Cure
2 Dogs (Character/Weapon)

name: Panzer Grenadier: North Wind
description:
(From Avalanche Press Site) North Wind is a supplement focusing on the battles from the last German offensive in the Western theater. There are ten scenarios, or separate game situations, based on battles between the inexperienced American divisions of the Seventh Army and German units varying wildly in quality from inept volksgrenadiers to the tough 10th SS Panzer Division.

This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Road to Berlin, Battle of the Bulge, Eastern Front and Airborne games and our Red Warriors and Iron Curtain supplements.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Shadows over Normandie: Axel
description: Shadows over Normandie KickStarter exclusive promo, featuring Axel of Devil Pig Games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Heroes of Normandie: Karl von Croc
description: Kickstarter exclusive mini expansion with one new hero, Karl von Croc, Snake Lover...
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Solomon Kane: Heart of Africa
description:
"The red pulsing Thing was lurking toward Kane like a thick cloud of blood in the air, that continually changed its shape and form..."
- R.E. Howard, Wings in the Night

In Solomon Kane’s time, Africa was a deeply mysterious and dangerous land. Little explored by Europeans, it was a place of near-legend. Kane is one of the few who dares to brave the trek to its shores, and fewer still who venture into its interior. For this reason, he is a stranger in this endless land of magic and cannibals, and has to rely more than ever on his inner strength and the blessings of his immortal companions. Unsurprisingly, it is not long before Solomon Kane is in the middle of a deadly situation once more.

This expansion adds 2 new adventures in the dark continent! These are the Wings in the Night and The Footfalls Within. Between them, these Adventures have a total of 5 Acts (50 chapters).

Wings in the Night: As soon as Solomon escapes from some dangerous cannibals, he falls straight into the fire from the frying pan, walking into a ruined village that has been terrorised by the inhuman akaana. These strange flying creatures seem to be a horrible amalgam of bat or bird and human, and they strain Kane’s definition of “God’s creatures” to breaking point. Solomon undertakes to protect the innocent villagers, and when this plan goes tragically wrong he swears vengeance as atonement for his error. Are they part of the strange natural world in this alien land, the work of the devil, or some dark summoning from the mind of a sick wizard? Any of these seem possible. And any of them are, depending on the path you take and decisions you make. Remember: You and your friends make the decisions in your games, and perhaps your skill or your luck outstrips his previous efforts! Fighting a numerous foe, who can fly as well as fight, makes this a unique challenge for the Puritan hero.

Footfalls Within: Solomon Kane does not approve of slavery. In fact, it utterly disgusts him, and his first thought, on finding a train of Arab slavery is: “Sons of iniquity, the wrath of God is upon ye.”
“The fury Solomon Kane felt would have been enough at any time and in any place to shake a man to his foundation; now it assumed monstrous proportions, so that Kane shivered as if with a chill, iron claws scratched at his brain and he saw the slaves and the slavers through a crimson mist.” So, despite the fact that he is alone, he cannot help himself. He must confront the slavers…

Contents:

8 double-sided tiles
14 Fight cards
8 Fight Effect cards
191 Discovery cards
29 Miniatures
2 Storybooks (5 Acts/ 50 Chapters)


This is an expansion, and cannot be played without the base game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures, Novel-based
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Rolling Realms: Apiary Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Apiary.

To play this realm, you will use low dice rolls to attract new bees, and high numbers to age those bees, bringing resources along the way. Age all 6 bees into hibernation to score all stars.

-description from publisher

name: Yashima: Promo Pack #1
description:
Alternate Art Pack: These special, limited edition cards have alternate art and can be used to replace the original versions in the base game of Yashima: Legend of the Kami Masters. Comes with full 23-card Phoenix kami deck and 25-card Tiger kami deck. These cards will only be given out as exclusives to early Kickstarter backers or at special events, so grab them while you can! Cards only.

Level Up Pack: But that's not all! This promo pack comes with level up cards! Adding card numbers 11-13 to each kami master's battle deck, every master included gains 3 new unique cards to add variety and new strategy to their play-style. 18 level up cards total, 3 each for Akiko, Hikaru, Kenta, Rosamu, Mitsuo & Saru, and Yuki. Cards only.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology

name: Keyper: Leader
description:
The Leader country tile was published as a Kickstarter stretch goal for Keyper at Sea.

When a player places a keyple on the Leader country tile, it enables them to additionally play two same-coloured (or white) keyples onto another tile or field and get double the actions or rewards. As a consequence a player can play their team of keyples more quickly and profitably than would otherwise be possible, but are then also likely to have fewer different types of laydown actions to choose from. The leader is a very strong country tile, but is tricky to play optimally and its inclusion should be agreed by all players before starting a game of Keyper or Keyper at Sea.

The Leader was not included in the base games as a regular tile as it seriously disrupts the normal flow of a game. Full details can be found in the files section. It is part of a punchboard in the Keyper at Sea box.

—description from the publisher
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Medieval
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Campaigns & Commanders: The King's Officers â The British and Italian Armies 1940-1944: A Panzer Grenadier Campaign Book
description: The King's Officers includes the campaign games "The Desert War 1940-1941," "The Desert War 1941-1942," and "War in the Hedgerows, 1944." It also includes historical articles and strategy tips on how to use Leader Characters in battle. It is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Afrika Korps, Desert Rats and Beyond Normandy to enjoy all of the campaigns.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Marital Bliss
description:
Re-released with updates for 2023: 69 all-new images and 10 new mission and reward cards. It's also now printed in the USA on certified paper and card stock from responsibly managed, sustainable forests. A free print-and-play version is available on the company's website.

At the start of the two-player card game Marital Bliss, each player draws seven missions that they must complete in secret for their partner over the next seven days. Mission cards range from housework chores (such as taking out the trash) to more complex activities such as organizing a weekend away. Each mission card also has a brownie point option that can be completed for extra points.

Players can choose to discard any number of mission cards at the start of the game if they feel they cannot complete them. Different missions are worth a different number of points, and any uncompleted missions at the end of the week are worth negative points. If the other player guesses a mission you are attempting (or recently completed), then you gain no points for the mission.

Strategy cards are mixed with the mission cards and allow players to change the rules of the game by making the other player discard missions, allowing some free guesses, or simply gaining points for a guessed mission.

Players also draw five reward cards and choose the one they would most like to win. A players cards are keep secret from their opponent.

The player with the most points at the end of the week earns a reward card to be used at their discretion.

name: Fleurus 1794
description:
La bataille de Fleurus (8 messidor an II) deals with the battle fought on 26th June 1794 between a french army under the command of Jean-Baptiste Jourdan and a Coalition army (Austrians, Dutch, Hanovrians and even a legion of french émigrés, that is royalists) under the command of Prince of Coburg.

La bataille de Fleurus is the 3rd battle of the series Les Soldats de la République.

The game includes an A2 map, a color player aid and 216 counters and markers.

Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).

—description from the designer

name: Rivages
description:
In Rivages, players explore the legendary islands of Myr, searching for remains of its long-forgotten wisdom.

Each player starts with their own map of an island that's divided into several colored areas. Every turn, they strike out the available symbols from one of the two cards in their hand, check matching fields on their map, then pass the cards along to their neighbor. By exploring certain areas, achieving goals on the island, looting treasures, and progressing on their own wisdom tree, they gather valuable parchments. Reaching a boat allows them to move to a new island full of new opportunities.

Whoever has the most parchments at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Connections, End Game Bonuses, Hexagon Grid, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Khan Singh
description:
Star Trek: Attack Wing - Khan Singh, a promotional item that debuted at Gen Con 2013, consists of the Khan Singh captain card and its corresponding game tokens. A player can assign Khan Singh as the captain of an existing ship from Star Trek: Attack Wing.

This promo was also available as part of the Swag Bag at the Alliance Game Distributor Open House 2013, and at Essen 2013.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Pixel Glory: Achievements
description:
An expansion to the popular dungeon-crawling card game Pixel Glory.

Achievements adds 9 unique achievement cards that enable players ways to earn bonus fame.

This expansion is a Kickstarter & Convention exclusive by Zafty Games
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Meeple Bros Promo Card
description:
Promotional card offered by "Man vs Meeple Season One Kickstarter".

Hero. 3. Can attack 2 buildings.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: De Bello Punico
description:
Grand tactical system simulating four battles of the Second Punic War: Trebbia 218 BC, Beneventum 214 BC, River Po 203 BC, Zama 202 BC.

1 hex = 100 meters. 500/1000 horsemen for cavalry units, 1000/2000 soldiers for infantry units, 10/20 for elephant units, 30 minutes/turn.

Parabellum magazine IX, Spring-Summer 2021
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Euphoria
description:
From the back of the box (translation from spanish):

"Each night two teams will fight to be a step closer from the goal, that big target, the dream of everyone of them, the great $300.000 reward to make their dreams come true. There is no rules, all is allowed, and for once It is the end that justifies the means.

Take your seats, get ready to watch something will leave no one indifferent, the newspapers will write about it for days, at your home, at your work, everytime, something never seen before on TV.

EUPHORIA, THE ULTIMATE REALITY SHOW IS ABOUT TO BEGIN-"

Euphoria is an estrategy game for two players with 2 teams of 4-6 miniatures (clones for the "show") each. There is no, factions, armies, countries, or whatever, each team is a band freely arranged by the player up to a maximun cost of points called "audience" here.

Each character has different attributes, skills and special rules and habilities/powers (once per "show").

You either can play a mission scenario with an objective (i.e. Rescue a character) or massacre game trying to defeat your opponent's team. The match is limited to 10 rounds (Typical game: 1 hour long with Audience 800 and 4-6 minis per team in a 120x90cm table).

Starter pack ("VHS box" package) content:

- 4 Metal miniatures (Nikolai, Madeleine, Kabuki, Sooyoung) and 2+2 round bases (30mm and 40mm)
- 3 Resin barrels
- 5 10sided dices (2 white 0-9, 2 blue 0-9, 1 blue 00-90)
- 4 Dials (0-15, required assembly)
- 20 "drop" counters (adrenalin, healt, grenades, etc).
- 65 Pags. color printed rulebook
- ID Player Card
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Ancient Battles Deluxe Expansion Kit 2: Hell's Horsemen
description:
From the publisher's website:

They rode swiftly across Eurasia over steppe and across plains under the Great Khan, or from Byzantium in armor as Cataphracts. Man, beast, and bow has long been a weapon of shock and maneuver. Now you can find out as you re-write the pages of history's great battles like those featuring massive Persian cavalry formations at Thymbra (547 BC) and Platea (479 BC).
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Wargame

name: FUSE: Tool Box Promo Pack
description:
Four new cards to use in your games of FUSE.

During setup, designate two areas on the playing surface: one for inactive tools cards, and one for active tools cards. Shuffle the four tool cards, then select two of them at random and place them in the inactive area, face up. Return the two remaining tools cards to the game box.

During the game, players may allocate their chosen dice to the tools cards in the inactive area. When all spaces on a tool card are filled with dice, return those dice to the bag and move that tool to the active area. That tools card can now be used at any time.

To use a tool card, carry out the listed ability, then flip the card face down. Each card can only be used once a game.

Note: When rerolling the unused dice at the end of a round, you are never required to remove dice that have been placed on tool cards.

Originally contained in Level Up Loot: One
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Krimi Total Fall 3: Die zweifelhafte Welt der MÃ¤rchen
description:
Translation - "The doubtful world of faery-tales"

This Essen 2005 release could be a fresh start for the "murder/mystery games", that were quiet popular in the eighties in germany.

All players (4 male, 4 female + 1 m/f) should be dressed up and act out their role to solve the mystery, because one of the guests is the murderer (wich is the only person, who´s allowed to lie).

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing â Stone Giant Elder Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Stone Giant Elder Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #6.3: The Whispering Gate.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 1st El Alamein
description: 1st El Alamein is an operational level simulation of the World War II battle between Axis and Allied forces around El Alamein in Egypt, conducted during the period of the 1st to the 4th of July 1942. Axis Field Marshal (FM) Erwin Rommel launched his attack against the Allied forces of the British 8th Army.

name: Mysthea: Solo Mode Expansion
description:
In Mysthea Solo Expansion you will find yourself facing the very skilled former Champion Maliath who, after years of endless travels through the Mysthea Mist, now is back, stronger and more stubborn than before. Maliath's forces rose like an unstoppable plague, driven by unfathomable hatred for everything our people have touched.

Maliath is a highly skilled strategist and a relentless fighter who has no intention of leaving you alone while you fight for the control of the five unexplored floating islands.
It will get in the way of your plans in many ways, compromising island attunements, interfering in fights with monsters, and even directly starting battles against you.

The solo mode expansion of this area control and hand-management eurogame will make you meet an incredible new opponent, but beware, she will be an actual player, just like you, and she’s not easily fooled!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: DiversiÃ³n con PelÃ­culas
description:
Diversión con (Fun with) is a trivia game system played in 12 rounds.
In each round, a question card related to three randomly drawn knowledge cards is read.
Simultaneously, everyone at once chooses an answer, getting a point if the answer is correct.
Whoever at the end of round 12 has scored the most points wins the game.

In Diversión con Películas (Fun with films) questions are related to the name, year, cost, budget, total income and awards from a selection of iconic films from the last 50 years
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: El Reyno
description:
These are complicated times in El Reyno. The Archduchess is plotting in the shadows to overthrow the King, the Dukes have already taken sides, Marquis and Counts are hoping not to make a mistake in choosing a side, and the Hidalgos are willing to do anything to improve their position. They all enter the game of the throne to quench their thirst for power, but what they ignore is that they are not the protagonists, but mere puppets in the hands of the real players: you.

In El Reyno, players take on the role of advisors, competing to manipulate the personalities of the court like puppets in order to gain maximum power.

When it is their turn, the players choose between

Conspire: adding puppets to their collection and using their spies to find out about their opponents' collections.
Intervene: discarding a card from their hand to perform actions such as cheating, stealing, or challenging a rival puppet to a duel.


When all the cards have been played, the players show their collections. The player whose collection gives him the most power wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Brass Empire: New Canton
description:
The serene frontier town of New Canton has discovered a vast deposit of Brass. The discovery of Brass brings with it the inevitable influence of corporate greed and espionage. Powerful corporate factions desperate to control this natural resource are already sending their emissaries to the region. In an effort to secure New Canton’s Brass, each corporation has selected an employee for the task of establishing mining operations in the region.

In New Canton, a deluxe campaign expansion to Brass Empire, you select a hero and play through an epic legacy story of greed, corruption, love and tragedy. As you play through the twelve game legacy campaign, you will be changing the rules, unlocking cards, customizing decks and progressing through a unique character's story between every match. Your story doesn’t end with the campaign. When the campaign is over, all of the cards you unlocked can be added to the original Brass Empire like a traditional card game expansion. Furthermore, You NEVER destroy any components and can play the campaign again and again from a different character’s perspective.

New Canton adds a 6th corporate faction and supports play for up to 6 players and also introduces several new card types and game mechanics. What lies beneath New Canton is up to you to discover.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Cube Monster
description:
The Cube Monster awakens, and the race begins!
Your village chose you, their champion, to climb up Mount Kubia and beat your opponents to the top. No matter your craft, you are first and foremost a builder. It is in your blood. The climb will be far from easy. Play by the monster’s rules – feed it, worship it, build for it – and be rewarded greatly! However, fail to meet its demands, and disaster will befall your people.

Cube Monster is a strategic engine-building game where players take the role of champions racing to the top of Mount Kubia, sacrificing cubes on their way to the mountaintop. Take turns feeding the monster and awaken its desire for offerings. Use that wisely to reap rewards as your opponents suffer its wrath.
Do you build structures planning for amazing cube-generating combos, or do you brute force your way to the top?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Events, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Race

name: Mission Complete
description:
Mission Complete is a unique cooperative card game of ever changing communication rules. Play the right cards at the right time & use each opportunity to communicate your common mission to win the game.

All players are working together in order to complete 3 missions before the deck of cards runs out.

Each round players are playing a single card that will change their communication restrictions for the following round.

If players manage to play all cards of different colors, they gain 1 part of their mission - a Target or a Task.

Once both the Target & the Task is known, the correct player has to complete it. That is why communication is key to success.

Use every possibility to communicate and plan your turns ahead, because each player will only be able to talk 3 times at most during the game. And a mission can’t be completed without being able to talk!

Everyone loses together if the deck of cards runs out -OR- everyone wins by completing 3 missions first!

—description from publisher

name: Mage Wars: Stumble Promo Card
description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized Play. This is part of the Allegiance in Blood story arc.

Stumble

Enchantment
Target: Non-flying Creature

Cost 2 Mana to cast. 1 Mana to Reveal

You may reveal Stumble when this creature is activated. It stumbles and may not take a move action during its action phase. Then, destroy Stumble. Has no effect on creatures with the Unmovable trait.

Non foil stamped version was released in the druid vs Necromancer Expansion (6 copies)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game â Words of Power Asylum Pack
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Knowledge is both powerful and deadly in Words of Power, the second Asylum Pack from the upcoming "Revelations" cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game.

Filled with eldritch Tomes, hidden Libraries, and the Relic Hunters determined to uncover their secrets, Words of Power heightens the different factions' quests for knowledge. While Independent agents offer their services to different groups, the Order of the Silver Twilight works in harmony to plunder the wealth of ancient journals. Research assistants at Miskatonic University delve unwittingly into danger as their study of powerful artifacts leads them across shadowy strangers, Cultists, Servitors, and monstrous black dogs.

The sixty cards in Words of Power (three copies each of twenty new cards) will promote exciting, new synergies with the Relics from the "Ancient Relics" cycle as well as with the musty, old cards lying dormant in your collection. Dark secrets in dusty tomes will determine the fate of the world. Who will find these Words of Power?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Novel-based

name: Trial of The Gods
description: Trial of the Gods is a competitive game for 2 to 4 players. Build your deck to manage your actions, gain the favor of the Gods, and access their incredible power. Travel among the islands of the Aegean Sea in search of the Golden Fleece, compete in Olympic challenges, and tame mythological monsters. Recruit your Argonauts and choose your winning strategy. Olympus awaits you!

name: My First Adventure: Discovering Atlantis
description:
Today, you're setting off on an incredible adventure. Today, you're going to roam the sea to find a hidden treasure. Which submarine do you want?


The Behemoth?
The Manta?
Or the Swordfish?


Choose carefully and plunge into this rather unusual story, a story in which each choice you make will change your adventure.

Discovering Atlantis is the second book in the My First Adventure collection of stories in which you are the tiny hero. Choose your character and plunge in this rather unusual story, a story where each choice you make will change your adventure.
publishers: Board Game Box, DV Games, Fable Fox Press, Game Flow

name: Wana
description:
Each player has 8 marbles of their color. They are placed on divot at the intersection between the lines.

On your turn you must move one of your marble. A marble can move as far as you want along a line. A marble cannot move through, or onto the same space as another marble. A marble that travel off the board will appear and continue traveling from the opposite side.

If you have a marble that cannot be moved at the beginning of your turn you lose the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Enclosure, Line of Sight, Pattern Movement

name: Cold War
description:
At last, peace breaks out! But, obviously, your previous allies will use the breathing space to re-arm, ally themselves with the enemy and invade us! As the President, it is your sacred duty to beat the other countries to the punch. The time for decisive action is now!

Each player has his own little country map, divided into conceptual areas: political, military, communications, production and population. Each player also has a production card, 60 people tokens, 6 Action cards, 3 ships, 2 carriers and 1 airplane. The players share 30 missile markers (power 5, 15 or 30) and 15 Goal cards.

The Goal cards represent your secret victory conditions (see below). People will eventually spread not only over your own areas but the other players' --giving you a say in each player's destiny as will be seen below.

Play is in rounds, with each round beginning with a Player Order and Political phase, and then a varying number of player turns.

Player Order phase: The order of play is determined by each player's Communications area. Each player counts his people in that area, and each other player with people in that area either adds, subtracts or stays neutral (his choice). Largest score goes first during the round and so on.

Political phase: Place up to four of your six Action cards (keeping at least one), face down, in front of the other players, in any ratio. This phase is resolved in sequence by all players. Next come the individual player turns.

Production phase: Each player's production card is progressively filled up with people markers; the level reached indicates what can be produced. Producing anything, even something way below the current "fill line", empties the card (the people go back to the player's Production area).

Embarkation phase: People of your colour (up to 10) may be embarked on one of your ships. Missiles (up to 30 total power) of a controlled colour may be embarked on a carrier or airplane of a controlled colour which happens to be off the missile's shores.

Action phase: The player must play one of his Action cards (the ones he kept earlier plus those played on him). Political clout (people in your Political area) can be used to instead lay a card aside for a later round.

These player turns continue until all players pass. The players then recover their Action cards from the discard pile. Cards laid aside during the round are put back in the player's hand --so you may end up with a smaller or larger hand than usual. A player without any people in his Population area, or with less than 5 total people markers on his country (diasporas don't count!) is eliminated.

Goal cards indicate either a player to eliminate (you win even if another player is responsible for your target's elimination) or two players to dominate politically or demographically.

The Action cards are:

Transfer - Transfer up to 5 people of your colour from one area to another, within your country.

Disembark - Up to 5 embarked people on one of your ships off another country's shores disembarks into any area.

Growth - For each 5 people of one colour in your Population area, add two more. Enemies also grow if present.

Production - Move up to 5 people from your Production area into the production display. They may be of another colour if their owner agrees.

Move - You can move one ship of your colour, or one carrier or airplane of a colour you control by one country. Ships and carriers move clockwise or counter-clockwise, airplanes move anywhere.

Shoot - Fire a missile on board a carrier or airplane of a colour you control onto an area of the country where it currently is. The missile kills as many people as its power. The more powerful missiles can spill their effect over into other areas of the target country. Casualties must be fairly spread between the colours present in the area (if it matters).
categories: Card Game, Negotiation, Political, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Team-Based Game

name: Cacciatori di viverne
description:
Cacciatori di viverne is a classic simulation boardgame of air fighting, but with a generic fantasy setting. On a modular map with an hex grid (terrain features have been included for decoration and further modules on ground combat that never appeared) little flying armies fight each other in fierce air battles.
The armies are bought with a point system: flying beasts can be manned by different quantities of soldiers equipped with several kind of weapons. Creatures are of good, neutral and evil alignment: three of the counter sheets include good and neutral creatures, the other three evil and neutral ones (good and evil ones can not be taken together). Each of the 6 sheets includes 140 counters depicting classic and less classic fantasy fliers such as dragons, wyverns, pegasi, flying carpets, elephawks, winged snakes, giant eagles, chimeras and so on.
The rules have two different difficulty levels. The basic system has an initiative check for a variable movement order. Several optional rules are provided for them, while the advanced set of rules has a simultaneous planning of the movement.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Yellow Submarine
description:
This game simulates the BEATLES and their rise to stardom.

Game players represent John, Paul, George and Ringo along with the manager Brian and the RECORD INDUSTRY. The game begins in 1962 and lasts through 1970 when the group breaks up. The object is to have the most victory points. Each player accumulates victory points at a different rate for doing particular things (Records, Movies, Tours).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Legends of Araby
description:
From the Designer: "Legends of Araby bridges the gap between traditional wargaming and role-playing games."LOA" marks the beginning of the new Role-Playing Lite system where players can create personal characters and travel through the world of Talomir interacting with the people that live there.

Players can rise from humble beginnings and through wits and weapons advance to legendary status. Cast potent spells or swing a mighty sword, it's up to you!"

Tables included in the game allow the game to be played solo or up to as many players as desired cooperatively or competitively.
categories: Adventure, Arabian, Book, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Manege Frei
description: Children's game, Ages 3 and up. Players take turns being animal trainer in a circus. The trainer closes his eyes, and the other players select one of the 8 different animals. This animal is in a bad mood today. Then the animal trainer opens his eyes and starts calling the animals into the ring, one by one. As soon as the trainer calls for the selected animal the other players yell "HALT" and the trainer's turn is over. For each animal that he succeeded in calling into the ring he scores one scoring stone. As soon as all 80 stones have been won, the player with the most stones wins.

name: Erotic 4 real
description:
As the name indicates it's an erotic game, but not the sleazy kind. It's the perfect game for the couple who wants to get to know each other better.
There are 3 categories of questions (ethics, emotions and passion) The first player reads the question and tries to guess what the partner would answer. The partner decides if this is the right answer or not. If the answer was right the first player rolls a dice and moves his/hers checker and picks up a gender card according to the first players gender. The gender cards tell you what to do to the partner. The winner is the player who has the least number of questions wrong and gets to choose one of the 10 winner card which can be anything from receiving a nice homemade dinner etc.
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Renegade Legion: Interceptor â Renegade Fighter Briefing
description:
This book is an expansion set for the game Renegade Legion: Interceptor from FASA.

It introduces 19 new Commonwealth fighters, 1 corvette and 3 new Commonwealth weapons systems to the gameplay.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Tapestry
description:
From the Mesomorph Games website:

"Tapestry contains three attractive new strategy games for two or four players played with a unique set of stained wooden tiles and colored pawns.

In the first of the games, called Tapestry, players build the board as the game progresses, adding light and dark tiles, placing pawns to access regions, and sliding tiles to strategically alter the landscape and block opponents. When the board is complete, the player whose pawns access the most territory triumphs.

In Towers the board starts off full size but shrinks as players race to construct towers before bearing them off the board to earn points. It is tempting to try for the high-scoring tall or single-color towers but if you take too long or allow your towers to become isolated, your opponent may end the game before you are ready to score.

Conveyor is a strategic race game in which the object is to move pawns across the board, starting from your seating position. Each turn players also have an opportunity to alter the pattern of light and dark tiles by shifting a row or column. Players strive to be first to move all their pawns across the shifting landscape of the board.

Each of the three games presents different challenges and satisfactions lasting 30 to 60 minutes, and the unique tile distributions each time insure that no two games are ever the same. The Tapestry set includes 26 light-stained tiles, 26 dark-stained tiles, 8 red pawns, 8 yellow pawns, 4 white pawns, 4 black pawns, a cloth bag, and a rule booklet. The games are best played on a smooth surface such as a glass or wood table."

name: Warfighter 101: The Guards
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The Warfighter 101 System

The Warfighter Series is a played on maps with 1 hex = 1000m. Pieces are platoons/sections, with some single command vehicles. The innovative ZOC system allows players to establish fires while movement is taking place. Combat is resolved using one of three different tables, depending on weapons systems. Game turns represent 10-15 minutes. Games typically last 40-60 minutes for Warfighter 101.

Warfighter 101: The Guards

This new game features new rules for civilians, a British infantry battalion, government militia that switches sides, and 4 geomorphic maps. Demonstrate the actions of a British light infantry battle group in sub-Saharan Africa, including several unique new mechanics that deal with civilian populations and the ability of insurgents to hide within the population. Tribal politics also play into the scenarios.

name: Amazing War Stories: Pulp Action in World War II
description:
From the publisher:

Amazing War Stories: Pulp Action in World War II is the second supplement to the .45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era rules and covers Pulp-style action set around World War II. It introduces new military archetypes to the game from the greenest GIs to the veteran Super soldiers; Rocket powered troops to Nazi Zombies.

It also provides new abilities and 12 new scenarios for players to start their own two-fisted war action. And half of these scenarios are straight war-time action, heroics, and pulp excitement (without the weird stuff).

But you can use the archetypes for more than just wartime scenarios as well; rocket troops rescuing a scientist, German expeditions to Tibet, and super soldiers sent to the center of the earth are all possible scenarios for which you can use the heroes and villains presented.

So grab your steel pot and M-1 and get ready for some Amazing War Stories!

Expands:

.45 Adventure: Crimefighting Action in the Pulp Era
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dragon Bones
description:
From the publisher:

The time and place is Mongolia of the 1920s. Warlords and free-roaming bandits battle for control of the countryside. Your team of researchers and explorers must race against time to recover the fossils and get them out of the dangerous warzone and back to the safety of the International Zone in Shanghai.

The scenarios in Dragon Bones: Adventures in the Gobi Desert are designed for 2 to 6 players. There are four chapters (scenarios), each is capable of being played in a single evening or several can be played at one session.

This book also introduces nine new archetypes to .45 Adventure; including Professors, Bandits, and the Dragon Lady. There are new rules for Mounted models and eight new skills you can add to provide even more diversification for your figures.

So put on your campaign hat, strap on your .45 and get ready for Dragon Bones: Adventures in the Gobi Desert!

44 Pages
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Humor, Miniatures, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Tactica Aeronautica
description: The first expansion for the of the Aeronautica Imperialis, an aircraft miniatures game set in the Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition) universe. It is a 128 page hardcover book that expands the game and features new aircraft, scenarios and rules. It also includes hobby material, a variant campaign system and a new campaign narrative on the Typha-IV conflict, depicting a desperate air war fought between the Imperium and the Tau Empire.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Hoplites
description:
A free web-published card game based on GMT's SPQR. Each player uses a deck composed of cards representing ancient military units (infantry, cavalry) and special commands (flank, rally). Cards are drawn from these decks and played on a board representing the battlefield. The board is divided into three zones, the center and two wings. Units on the field may move, missile fire and shock with the enemy.

The game features a variety of historical armies and commanders, as well as fantasy forces.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting

name: Brawl in the Dark
description:
“November 1942, South Pacific. The Imperial Japanese Navy has been tasked to deliver reinforcements to Guadalcanal and support the offensive to retake the airstrip, Henderson Field, from the US Marines. A task group of 14 Imperial warships is proceeding south down ‘The Slot’ between the Solomon Islands to bombard Henderson Field and destroy the aircraft there in order to allow the slow, heavy army transports to reach Guadalcanal safely."

"Thirteen US warships are steaming north through Ironbottom Sound to intercept the Japanese. The two forces nearly collide with one another in the pitch black night. Star shells, flares and searchlights probe the darkness as ships intermingle and attempt to sort out friend from foe.
