Fuji 99, titled "Fujisan chika 99 kai" (99th basement floor of Mt. Fuji) in Japanese, is a press-your-luck game to draw cubes from the bag and try to advance your player token. If you draw a certain number of red cubes, your turn ends without advancing. The player who manages to effectively use various card effects and be the first to reach the 99th basement floor of Mt. Fuji wins!

Only the winner can read the ending story on one of the Storybooks to unlock the mystery of the 99th basement floor of Mt. Fuji!?

ã»Game Flow
1. Draw as many cubes as you like from the bag!
2. Your turn ends without advancing if you draw a certain number of red
cubes!
3. You can advance your player token according to the number of cubes
you draw!
4. Use various effects to outdo your rivals!
5. The first player to reach the 99th basement floor wins!
6. The winner can read the ending story!

—description from the publisher

name: Goulet
description:
In this game, you'll need to beat all three opponent's characters in order to win.
One player get the grey characters (the Magician, the Knight and the Archer), the other get the purple ones (the Dragon, the Dark Lord and the Skeleton). They are placed in a single line, grouped by color and each character begin with 10 out of 12 life points. All six characters's token are then drawn at random: this determines the play order.

Each turn, the player who owns the active character rolls 5 six-sided dice, up to 3 times, and can store as many dice as he/she wants between rolls (like in the classic game Yahtzee).
Dice showing 1, 2 or 3 must be used by two: one die used as an attack value, the other as a distance value. (For example : dice 1 & 3 can be used to deal 3 damage to a character directly adjacent to the attacker or to deal 1 damage to a character with a distance of 3.)
Die showing 4: allows two adjacent characters of same color to swap places.
Die showing 5: allows the active character to heal 1 damage (health bar is limited to 12 max).
Die showing 6: move the active character's token one space in the play turn order. This character will now play earlier in the upcoming turn order sequence.

As soon as a character's health hits 0, it is removed from the game, reducing the distance between the characters.
When a player has more characters still in play than his/her opponent, he/she plays with 4 dice instead of 5.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Phase Order

name: Pokemon TCG: Blazing Volcano Theme Deck
description:
The Blazing Volcano Theme Deck from the Lost Thunder expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game predominantly focuses on Fire and Grass type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Entei.

Like other Theme Decks, Blazing Volcano includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, an Entei deckbox and a TCGO deck access code.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Schatten der Macht: Graue Eminenzen
description:
Aventuria - Contintent of adventures and dangers. In Schatten der Macht, powerful grey eminences forge their plans, spies are send out to undermine organisations, adventurers are hired to complete dangerous challenges.
In the opaque game of secret societies, no-one knows where the opponent will strike next, to bring his secret plans to fruition.

Graue Eminenzen is an expansion for Schatten der Macht. With the playing pieces and rules contained in this box, up to six factions can face each other at the same time, and battle for influence and power on the continent of Aventuria. Six new factions allow for more choice in grey eminences and special rules. Missions ensure that the game remains diverse and challenging after multiple plays.

—description from the publisher (translated)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order

name: Munchkin Cthulhu: Sanity Check
description:
Time for Your Checkup!

Being a Cultist is a lot harder than you might think. It's good to stop occasionally and make sure you're OK. Add these 30 cards to your Munchkin Cthulhu game for the ultimate test of your sanity!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Coliseum
description:
Simple one to one gladiator combat rules in Ancient Rome.

Turn sequence:

Movement phase: each gladiator
Combat phase: hand to hand fighting resolution with facing adjustements, fatigue


Use a 2D6 for combat resolution and initiative.

Game was published in Vae Victis Hors Serie N 1 Armées Miniatures, in French.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Vietnam / Sahara
description: This is part of the 2019 expansions for Age of Steam. In the Vietnam map (3-4p map) there are two scenarios and contains flooded hexes. In the Sahara (3-5p map) map you will need water to build in the desert hexes.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation

name: Paper Pinball: Holiday Gauntlet 2019
description:
Paper Pinball is a dice game that tries to capture the feeling of playing pinball. All you will need is a pencil, three dice, and about five minutes.

Each round, roll two dice and fill in one of the scoring zones. Some zones need to be filled in a certain way, and most will cause some sort of effect, so the order you fill them in is important. If you ever can't fill a zone, you'll lose a ball. Lose three balls and the game is over. Try to fill as many scoring zones as possible while triggering multipliers, opening tunnels, and getting the coveted multiball.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck

name: A la Mesa!
description:
All famous chefs are cooking tonight only for me!

A la mesa is a creative cooking game designed by Josep M. Allué and Yohan Goh. In a round, one player takes the role of a "guest", while the other players become chefs and draft four ingredient cards. Before doing this, the guest draws as many condition cards as the number of chefs, then gives one card to each chef.

After drafting their ingredients, each chef presents their dish, explaining how they prepared it, after which the guest awards victory tokens according to their favor. Then another player becomes the guest to play the next round.

The game ends after each player has finished their three dishes, and whoever has collected the most victory tokens wins.

—description from publisher

name: El Grande & Carcassonne
description: 2-game compilation of El Grande and Carcassonne (German language) in large tin box. Aside from the front cover art for each game, the box has no other text, photo, or descriptions. (A strip of paper with additional information, barcode, etc was originally shrink-wrapped around the tin.) It was sold exclusively at Tschibo coffee shops.

name: To The South: The Honshu War, 1950-53
description:
The Honshu War, 1950-53 (HW) is a two-player, low-to-intermediate complexity, strategic simulation of the war that could have resulted had Japan ended up divided between Communist and US occupation forces at the end of World War II. The Soviet player is mainly on the offensive, attempting to win the game by seizing key objectives within the territory of the Western-allied Republic of Japan. At the same time, though, the situation allows for and at times demands the launching of sharp counteroffensives by the United Nations player.

Each hexagon on the map represents 25 miles (40 kilometers) from side to opposite side. The units of maneuver for both sides are divisions. Each full turn represents from one to two months, depending on the season. By seasonally telescoping time in that way, the turn-by-turn movement and combat capacities of the units can be held as a constant.

name: Tri Peaks
description:
The game starts with eighteen cards dealt face-down on the tableau to form three face-down "pyramids" of six cards each, and a row of ten cards beneath. This is built by dealing out ten cards face-up in a row; then nine cards face-down above them, offset by half a card to the right; then six cards above those, offset by the same amount (and leaving a one-card gap after the second and fourth cards); then three cards to cap the three pyramids.

The twenty-four remaining cards make up the stock. The first card from the stock is put in the waste pile (sometimes known as the foundation/discard). For a card in the tableau to be moved to the waste pile, it must be a rank higher or lower regardless of suit. This card becomes the new top card and the process is repeated several times (e.g. 7-8-9-10-9-10-J-10-9-8, etc.) until the sequence stops. Along the way, any face-down cards that are no longer overlapping are turned up.

In case the sequence is stopped, i.e. no card on the tableau can be put over the top card of the waste pile, a card is placed on the waste pile from the stock to see if it can start a new sequence. Cards are transferred from the stock to the waste pile one at a time as long as it does not begin a new sequence with the cards on the tableau.

If there is no scoring being tracked, the game is won if all three peaks are cleared before or after the last card from the stock is discarded to the waste pile. However, the game is lost if there are still cards that cannot be placed on the waste pile after the stock has run out.

name: Munchkinomicon
description: The Chinese (å°ç½ä¸ç´ ç©¶æ¥µé­æ³æ¸), French, and Spanish (Munchkinomicón) editions of Munchkinomicon also include the Munchkin Reloaded!, Munchkin Marked For Death, and Munchkin Monster Enhancers cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: RisiKo! Sturmtruppen
description: The most played strategy game in Italy, together with the most irreverent series of military characters ever made. A perfect combination for an evening of pure fun, together with the legendary Bonvi (Franco Bonvicini) characters!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Sakura Extra Box
description:
Every spring, the cherry trees blossom all over Japan. The Japanese celebrate this occasion, as according to their traditions the goddess of Fuji mountain, Konohana Sakuya Hima, revives the fallen flowers at this time. The cherry flower is a symbol of vitality called "sakura".

The players in Sakura aim to play cards without taking any hands. They have to play two cards each time, one on each side of the Jin-Jang card following the rules, which by default require higher number on the Jin side and lower on the Jang side in the same color. (Alternatively, a player can place the same number in any color.) Also, the players are aided in their success by several characters, who require payment (money). The game ends when everyone has only two cards left in their hand. The player who earns the fewest points wins the favor of the goddess and glory will be theirs until next spring.


This edition contains previous Kickstarter extras (not exclusive).

name: ELITE: Epic Strategic Board Game
description:
Elite is a tabletop strategy game for 2-4 players. Themes include global expansion, resource production, political tactics, economy management, military action, controlling the fate of your dice, planning and timing, completing achievements, and more.

“Players will produce resources, move Elite and armies, assemble new civilians, and spend resources to perform actions. At the end of three Acts, the player with the most Victory Points wins!” - per the designer.

name: Keepsakes
description: In Keepsakes, players create a line of memories, competing to select, arrange, and recall those memories in order to gain the most Keepsakes, representing the player's score. Players start with two Keepsakes, and may gain or lose more as they complete challenges and recite the line of memories, represented by various face-up and face-down cards. Players take turns by drawing a new memory card, adding it to the line of memories, defining the memory, and reciting the line of memories in order, starting with the first one played. Players may then call out if the person seems to have done something incorrectly, with Keepsakes trading hands accordingly. Each memory card is different; they may require players to say something only they know, something they can see, something that they prefer, etc. Sometimes tasks appear, requiring players to complicate their turns, or players can opt for available challenges to increase their Keepsake collection. Some memory cards may reorder the memory line or be turned face-down, forcing players to reorient themselves or risk losing Keepsakes. Play ends when any player has zero Keepsakes remaining or the memory deck runs out, and whoever has the most Keepsakes wins (ties permitted. With that in mind players can opt to play cooperatively instead to attempt to gather the most Keepsakes collectively.

name: HistÃ³rias de Pescador (EdiÃ§Ã£o Mini)
description:
Histórias de Pescador (Edição Mini) reimplements Histórias de Pescador, but in a small and portable format. The gameplay remains the same as the original.

It is the last fishing season of the year and everyone got together to tell stories of their biggest catch. Anything goes to get the group's admiration and the title of best fisherman.

During his turn, a player must lower at least one card from his hand, face down, and declare a type of fish. The other players can choose to believe or ask for proof. If the other players don't believe him, the player must reveal his card(s) and, depending on whether he is being honest or not, win or lose points.

The game continues with the players until someone successfully discards the last card in their hand, telling their last story and becoming the best fisherman in the group.

--description from publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Storytelling

name: Llama Farmer
description:
Light-strategy tabletop card game. Each player takes the role of a mountain Llama Farmer trying to make the most money ('Bucks') selling llama-wool rugs.

Players start with their own small herd of randomised primary coloured llama cards. Each turn players expand, shear, weave or sell.
Expanding adds new primary coloured llamas, or expands the llama 'family-tree' making more complex colours and patterns available.
Shearing produces wool, either unpredictably with a repeatable 'light shear' based on selected dice and numbers on the llama cards producing wool for any farmer or a one-shot 'close shave' which guarantees wool at the cost of a chilly looking llama!
Weaving combines wools into new colours or rugs and selling trades rugs for bucks in the markets. High-fashion markets want specific rugs and pay well, but a general market will buy any rug cheaply.

The game ends when all the high-fashion markets close, and the farmer with the most bucks wins.

Strategy choice comes from choosing the right rugs and llamas to go for, balancing expanding and shearing and knowing when to apply a close shave.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Building, Race, Random Production, Variable Set-up

name: Crystal Miners
description:
In the land of Arzium, the Southern Mining Guild has found a passageway that leads to a vast cavern filled with giant slugs, glowing fungi, and glittering crystals! Your task is to gather up this valuable trove for the survival of the guild members and their families.

Crystal Miners is a roll-and-write game featuring one of the factions from Now or Never, the Southern Mining Guild. Each turn, you roll dice and place them on actions on your player sheet, using money to hire new miners, buy upgrades, and establish new places to mine. Gameplay is simultaneous and quick, lasting only eight turns. The player who most effectively manages their mining company is declared the winner.

Crystal Miners is currently only available as a print-and-play game.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Fast Check
description:
Players, attention!!

Flip a card and look at the color on the pile to find the mistake in the challenge you just discovered. The card challenges change with each round and will use your visual perception better than the other players:


you will have to find the correct word
check if the numbers are equal or not that indicated result
find the differences between images
build figures with geometric shapes
count the elements of the indicated color
order the letters to form correct words


Will you capable of finding out if it's okay or say what's wrong before everyone else?



¡Rápido, presta atención!Dale la vuelta a una carta y fíjate en el color que aparece en el montón para encontrar el error en el reto que acabas de descubrir. Los retos de las cartas cambian en cada ronda y pondrán a prueba tu percepción visual:


tendrás que encontrar la palabra bien escrita
comprobar si los números suman el resultado indicado
encontrar las diferencias entre imágenes
construir figuras con formas geométricas
contar los elementos del color indicado
ordenar las letras para formar palabras correctas


¿Serás capaz de descubrir si está bien o decir qué es lo que falla antes que los demás?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Math, Number, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Pattern Building, Real-Time, Set Collection, Speed Matching

name: Divinus: Shadow of Yggdrasil
description:
Gather your friends and experience this 8 scenario prequel campaign, playing as four gods of the Norse Pantheon. Rewrite this epic story with your own choices and face the shadows lying beneath the ancient tree of life, Yggdrasil.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Academy: The West Point Board Game
description:
Academy is a family-friendly worker placement game with four rounds, each representing a year at West Point. During the game, players place their “Cadets” around the West Point campus to conduct training and face off in competitions. The goal is to become the Valedictorian by scoring the most points in the three pillars of the Academy (Academic, Military, Physical).

Just like at the real West Point, players must carefully manage their Competitions (e.g., IOCT or Term End Exams) with their Training (e.g., studying or doing duties). Drawing Training cards doesn’t score points, but players need Training cards to win Competitions. Remember that the most successful cadets play their cards well to graduate at the top of their class!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Worker Placement

name: TÃ­pico de Machirulo!
description:
A game to identify scenes of micromachismo. Whoever identifies them the fastest wins!

Típico de Machirulo! is a speed game where players have to find combinations of cards to win. In these cards are hidden figures that represent different scenes of micromachismo in our daily lives.

It also comes with an ideal pedagogical proposal to work on the subject in schools.
mechanics: Action Timer, Pattern Recognition, Speed Matching

name: Siege of the Eternal Night
description:
History repeats itself but no one remembers what happened last time, the silence was interrupted by war songs, the moment had arrived…

Object of the game: Defeat all the enemies (grey squares) on the Battleground grid before the End of the Night (9th Turn).
Roll 2 dice at the beginning of each turn. The results will be used to either deploy troops outside the gate, cast magic spells or launch a crossbow volley towards the enemies.

After Turn 9 count the number of unmarked enemy squares on the Battleground , the total is your score. The lower the score, the better.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol â X-23 & Honey Badger
description:
Laura Kinney, or X-23, is the 23rd attempt by the Facility, an offshoot of the Weapons Plus Program, to create a genetic copy of the mutant Wolverine. She was born to be a living weapon and had minimal human contact to enhance her savage and killer instincts. X-23 is a peerless fighter and assassin with all the mutant abilities of Wolverine, including a superhuman ability to heal from any injury, lightning-fast reflexes, and retractable adamantium-coated claws in her hands and feet.

Alchemax Genetics created Gabrielle Kinney from the building blocks of X-23’s genetic makeup. She was trained by Alchemax to serve as a bodyguard and elite fighter who possessed the same regenerative ability as Laura Kinney and Wolverine, as well as retractable bone claws. Her creators further enhanced her to be impervious to pain through an Alchemax nanite therapy, a painful process that shortened the lifespan of its subjects. She ultimately broke free from her cruel makers in Alchemax with the aid of her rebellious sisters and assumed the identity of Honey Badger as a member of the X-Men.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Knockdown: Cleito â Queen of Atlantis
description: The Queen of Atlantis does her best to rule over the Arena. Use the powers of the glorious Cleito from Lords of Hellas to knock down your enemies and become a winner in the Great Tournament!

name: Santiago Campaign 1898
description:
Santiago Campaign 1898 is a two-player simulation of the campaign for Santiago de Cuba, which historically ended in the surrender of all Spanish forces on the island.

Units are battalions and regiments. Each hex is 1.6 km across. Turns represent one day each. To win, the US player must conquer most objectives and force the sortie of the Spanish fleet before the Yellow Fever season sets in.

Paper Wars Magazine #102, January 2023

name: Block and Key: Adventurers Pack
description:
Four cards with special adventurers:
- Keysmith allows you to place any 1 key at the bottom of either altar and then draw top card
- Sculptor allows you to discard at the end of your turn any number of blocks and to draw new ones
- Architect allows you, once per turn, after placing one block, to discard 1 block to place another
- Curators allows you, after placing a block, to draw one from any excavation sites closest to you

name: PowerCore: Call of Cthulhu
description:
Lurking behind the thin vale of sanity, ancient beings of imaginable power lurk, forever ready to bring the world to its knees. These godlike beings from beyond time and space can warp the mind, break the will, and obliterate the body. Now, as they stand against each other, the world will be plunged into a maelstrom of horror and madness. Will your hand guide the victors - or will your eternal legacy be wiped out by a being more cunning, more ruthless, and more malevolent than you?

Welcome to a world of unspeakable horror inspired by the works of Howard Phillips Lovecraft, and the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game, where beings older than time itself manifest on Earth and fight each other, as they prepare to dominate our world.

During the game, you will take on the role of an alliance of two nightmarish creatures from the Cthulhu mythos. Your cards will generate Horror that will allow you to power especially formidable abilities and effects, including summoning your Avatars to the field of battle.

At the beginning of your turn you rotate the Power Cores on the Character cards and other cards in play area, dealing damage to the opponent, gaining defense and raising horror - a special resource used for powerful actions. Then you can play up to two actions, chosen from: rotating a chosen Power Core again, playing a card (ally, ability, item or maneuver), drawing a card or sometimes summoning an Avatar. At the end there is an obligatory card draw. You win if you deal enough damage to the opponent's Characters or if your opponent has to draw a card from an empty deck.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Bandada: Promo Pack #1
description:
What do I see at the bird feeder? It's new birds, ready to join your Bandada!

Promo Pack #1' contains 3 NEW BIRDS that can be added straight into your copy of Bandada.

The Red-Tailed Hawk is ready to swoop in and swap the values of one blue die with one yellow die. It can also score you points for the lowest value blue die.

The Goldfinch can potentially set you up for a big turn by letting you set one black die to ANY value. But its scoring section is all or nothing.

And the Mockingbird is going to live up to its name by copying the action of ANY visible bird. Then it shows its individuality by scoring based on the difference between the highest blue and the lowest yellow dice.

—description from the publisher

name: Earth 2053: Tipping Point
description:
In Earth 2053: Tipping Point, players represent countries that work together to prevent a global climate catastrophe. The main scoring happens on a physical seesaw board where "prevention" tokens are placed on one side and "pollution" tokens on the other. Filling the prevention side lets all players win (with optional placements based on who contributed the most). However, if the board tips towards the pollution side, all players lose.

Each player has their own country board with their own special ability, where they track their economy and their population's need fulfillment. Increasing the fulfillment levels of certain needs will unlock more and more powerful rewards, but at the same time threatens to create additional pollution.

One of the major goals of the game is to use your country's board setup to create "influence" tokens which can then be used to prevent climate events from (such as species extinction) from occuring in a negotiation about who is willing to invest how much per event. Stopping these events creates prevention points, while failing creates pollution.

The primary way of increasing need fulfillment is playing cards onto a grid shared between all players. Some cards have special effects depending on which other cards they are played adjacent to. Playing cards of the same category next to each other comes with its own set of bonuses.

—description from the publisher
categories: Civilization, Economic, Environmental, Political, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Hand Management, Investment, Negotiation, Square Grid, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Cult of Cathulhu
description:
The Cultists of Cathulhu have gathered: their Great Eldritch Ritual nears its end. There is just one thing left: choose one of them to Ascend and finish the ritual. It’s a simple choice, really. They are all the same — any of them will do! There is just one problem: some Investigators have infiltrated the ritual, pretending to be Cultists. And choosing any of them would ruin it all!

Cult of Cathulhu is a fast-paced hidden role game for 4-11 players. Engage as a Cultist, trying to find trustworthy brethren with your unique skills and solve the lie-filled riddle -- or as an Investigator, trying to sneak you or your comrades in to halt the Cultists’ world-ending plans.
Each player has two hidden cards: their alignment (Cultist or Investigator), and a separate skill card. Investigators are in the minority but know each other, while Cultists have to use their otherworldly skills in a search for just one Cultist they all can trust.

The game consists of three phases: Mission briefing, Council, and Voting.
Mission briefing lets the Investigators know each other, as well as other Investigators' skills.
In Council, players can freely discuss and use their skills. Most skills either give information, e.g., by seeing others' cards, or help other players use their more powerful skills.
Investigators can use their skills just like Cultists to fool them, with an extra advantage: they can use skills from any card, not just their own. Skill cards are always discarded after use, face-down. The Council is timed; after the time runs out, Voting begins.

In Voting, all players simultaneously vote for another player. All players with the most votes are chosen to Ascend, and the game ends. If all chosen were Cultists, the ritual succeeds and all Cultists win; if any of them was an Investigator, the Investigators win, instead.

–description from designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Hidden Roles, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Real-Time, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Snapshot: Flora Expansion
description:
Plants

ï»¿8 new Flora cards – two for each habitat – that are shuffled into the Animal cards and add new and interesting decisions to the gameplay.

Plants are guaranteed to photograph successfully but are not worth prestige at the end - you could use them to complete a Photography Award or even trigger the end of the game... but is it worth missing out on the prestige?

You can use these cards at any player count to add tactical depth.

Solo Mode

You can now play the game solo using the "SnapBot" that uses a deck of cards to simulate another player to compete against for solo players.

SnapBot has a range of difficulty settings and recreates different player-interactions for an exciting and variable 1-player experience.

5th Player

By adding in the 8 plants, there are enough cards in the Animal card deck to sustain a 5-player game. The game plays much the same as the 2-4 player version so there are no new rules to learn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Kingdom Builder: Anniversary Edition
description: 10th anniversary edition of Kingdom Builder featuring 28 printed resin ability tiles, 212 plastic miniatures, 8 game board sections with new art, 30 extra large terrain cards with new art, and 4 Queenies including The Emperor's Choice (first seen in Kingdom Builder: Empire Edition.

name: Cartzzle: Curieuse basilique
description:
Curious basilica is a new opus from the Cartzzle range. Cartzzle is a new concept of board game containing a game, a work of art and puzzles.

The box holds a single Cartzzle, an endless one you can make with both sides of the 50 cards. Cartzzles are pictures you must first piece together by laying cards on top of each other (with or without the template, depending on your dedication). Then, start again, using challenges this time! Removing cards, flipping them, and laying them elsewhere will change the picture and also allow you to meet some challenges.

name: Benzene (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
In this expansion map, the players are researchers in a chemical laboratory, creating Benzene-based aromatic compounds. A research phase is added before cube production in which players can exchange cubes they have delivered to move up on a research track.

The track includes spaces for gaining additional cubes, cash, points, or unlocking certain locomotive levels.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: è¯æ­¦æ³! (Kabuken!)
description:
è¯æ­¦æ³! (Kabuken!) is a battling game with the theme of a tournament of martial artists from many different countries, fighting to decide the true success of the legendary martial art "Kabuken!". The goal of the game is to be the player with the most HP at the end of the game, after player(s) are KO'd or the draw pile has been depleted a number of times.

In this game you can either replenish your hand or play 1 of 6 types of melds to attack the opponent to your left. This in turn can be raw damage taken, defended (reduced damage), or counterattacked by the defending player. Counterattacking involves playing 1-3 specific cards which cause the next clockwise player to take damage, this in turn can be counterattacked, and so on until the player that does not counterattack takes damage (and replenishes their hand).

The advanced rules of the game include personal Character Cards that have different special abilities and Special Technique Cards that have either 1-time or passive effects.

While normally this game is only playable by 2-4 players, there are 5-7 player variant rules included which retain many of the same rules, with the addition of a first KO incentive.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Card Sale
description:
"A game of creating ludicrous products & sabotaging the competition. "

The game starts with selecting a judge, or "Buyer". The rest of the players each draw cards and create and pitch a product they think will be enticing to the buyer, by using 1 "Thing" card and 1 "Feature" card. After this "initial pitch", players go around the table again, each playing one more feature card. This time features can be played on ANY product in play. Players can either attempt to improve their item, or sabotage the competition. Throughout the round players pitch their product, or try to knock the competition down a peg or two by arguing over the utility, value, and even the meaning, of the products and their features. After everyone has had a turn, the buyer eliminates their least favorite, and removes that item from the sale... But if you get knocked out, don't worry. Eliminated players get to continue playing by helping a buddy's product, or by crushing someone else's hopes and dreams.

Rounds continue with each player playing one feature card each round before the buyer eliminates another product. Products get more amazing, absurd, hilarious, or disastrous with every card and the game continues until only one product remains, which decides the winner and the buyer for the next game!

Unlike many judge-based games, Card Sale allows players to creatively "build" funny hands rather than just being rewarded for drawing the funniest pre-written punchline card.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Interrupts, Player Judge, Storytelling, Take That

name: Kosovo i Metohija
description:
Kosovo and Metohija take you to the medieval world of endless fertile fields, next to which the most beautiful cities and monasteries rise.

Gameplay Overview:


A mix of tile placement, resource collecting, and city building
Every round one general event is activated that affects gameplay in various ways
Build walls and recruit armies to save your precious lands from attacks
Connect tiles and make yourself opportunities for crafting your own buildings which will bring new effects into the game, thus giving new ways for making points and making you closer to the victory
Includes solo variant


—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Events, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol â Malekith
description:
Malekith, the thirteenth son of a thirteenth son, is the ruler of the Dark Elves of Svartalfheim and a bitter enemy of Thor, who uses magic and deception to bring his enemies down and wage war across all the Realms. He transforms mortals into his unwitting agents as a master manipulator with a silver tongue and the capacity to assume the form of another.

He is the Master of the Wild Hunt with the means to summon an army of voracious hounds to pursue anything he wishes.

Contents:
1 Miniature
â£ Malekith
1 Round Scenic Base (65mm)
1 Character Stat Card
2 Team Tactic Cards
7 Tokens
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Stones & Rivers
description:
Stones and Rivers is a thoughtful game of mindful placement. Each player has 14 pieces with two sides, a stone side for blocking and scoring and a river side for sweeping movement and scoring.

Will you flip a piece over and reveal a river for you or your opponent to use? What piece could you push? Where is the best place to place your stone piece? Balance your pieces and be mindful to be the first to place 5 stones in your opponent's score area!

—description from the designer

name: Stadt Land Vollpfosten: Das Kartenspiel â Party Edition
description:
The principle is as simple as it is ingenious. Whoever thinks that Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten can't work well as a card game will soon be proven wrong.

The game is explained in no time and the fun can begin. There are no open questions and the game rounds are entertaining and exciting. Due to the 200 different categories there is always enough variety.

The official card game of STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN with 120 playing cards for an unforgettable gaming experience among friends.

How to play: Each player is randomly dealt 8 letter cards. Now each player must place a word matching one of his letter cards as quickly as possible. Important: The first letter of the word counts and you do NOT have to form a term from the letter cards, as is sometimes the case in other games, e.g. Scrabble.

So it gets exciting: The 60 category cards contain a total of 200 different and funny categories:

Who can put down a "profession" first? Or a "reason for separation"? What about a "city abroad"? Can you quickly think of a "Famous Dead Person" or a "Famous Actor" for your letter cards?

Important now: The FASTEST player wins each round and at the end the player who first got rid of all letter cards wins the game. The 10 additional action cards make the game especially exciting.

Of course, there are also FULL FIX cards in the game that either act as jokers or are used as tricky counters.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Hochwertige Klappdeckel-Schachtel in coolem Design made by DENKRIESEN.

Das Prinzip ist so einfach wie genial. Wer glaubt, dass Stadt-Land-Vollpfosten als Kartenspiel doch nicht gut funktionieren kann wird schnell eines besseren belehrt werden.

Das Spiel ist im nu erklärt und der Spielspaß kann beginnen. Es bleiben keine offenen Fragen und die Spielrunden sind kurzweilig und spannend. Durch die 200 verschiedenen Kategorien ist immer für genug Abwechslung gesorgt.

Das offizielle Kartenspiel von STADT LAND VOLLPFOSTEN mit 120 Spielkarten für ein unvergessliches Spielerlebnis unter Freunden.

200 kreative und lustige Kategorien bringen jeden Hobbydenker ins Schwitzen. Spaß Garantiert!

Durch die 5 verschiedenen Editionen, ist eine riesige Vielfalt geboten. Neben der familienfreundlichen Classic Edition bringen die kinderfreundliche Junior und die unanständige Rotlicht Edition die gewisse Abwechslung in den Spieleabend!

Spielablauf:
So wird gespielt: Jeder Spieler bekommt per Zufallsprinzip 8 Buchstaben-Karten ausgehändigt. Nun muss jeder Spieler möglichst schnell einen Begriff passend zu einer seiner Buchstaben-Karten ablegen. Wichtig: Es zählt jeweils der Anfangsbuchstabe des Wortes und man muss NICHT aus den Buchstaben-Karten einen Begriff bilden, wie es in anderen Spielen z.B: Scrabble manchmal der Fall ist.
Es wird also spannend: Die 60 Kategorie-Karten enthalten insgesamt 200 verschiedene und lustige Kategorien:
Wer kann zuerst einen “Beruf” ablegen? Oder einen “Trennungsgrund”? Was ist mit einer “Stadt im Ausland”? Fällt dir zu deinen Buchstaben-Karten schnell ein “Berühmter Toter” ein bzw. kommt Dir sofort ein “bekannter Schauspieler” in den Sinn?
Wichtig nun: Der SCHNELLSTE Spieler gewinnt jeweils die Runde und am Ende gewinnt der Spieler das Spiel, der zuerst alle Buchstaben-Karten losgeworden ist. Durch die 10 zusätzlichen Aktionskarten wird das Spiel besonders spannend.
Natürlich gibt es auch VOLLPFOSTEN-Karten im Spiel die entweder als Joker wirken oder als kniffliger Konter genutzt werden.

—description from the publisher

name: A game about seriously surreal creatures and trying to identify them after someone makes noises.
description:
This is a 'reimagining' of AGAWWCATTITASMN and AGACCCATTITASMN. 80 new creatures that beg the question, "What sort of noise would this creature make?"

Five seriously surreal creatures are shown in a central display. One player (the noise-maker) randomly chooses a target creature.

Everyone else closes their eyes whilst the noise-maker makes noises.

After opening their eyes and having time to consider, everyone votes which creature they think may have been the target creature.

Anyone in the majority gets a point, whether right or wrong. It was a sensible guess, as determined by your peers!

Now the target creature is revealed. If the majority was correct, the noise-maker gets a point. It was a good noise!

If the majority was NOT correct, then any player who made a correct guess also gets a point.

Replace the creatures. Repeat.

After everyone has had a chance to make a noise, the game is over. Most points wins.

-description from designer

name: Liangzhu Civilization
description:
In this game, each player acts as a tribal leader of Liangzhu in ancient times. By selecting cards in three eras and completing task cards as much as possible, develops agriculture to increase taxes and develop warrior against foreign enemies, use craftsmen to make handicrafts, and also need to pay attention to building aqueducts to stop floods. After three ages, the player leader of the tribe with the best development wins the game.

mechanics: Bingo, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Square Grid, Variable Set-up

name: Investigation Files: Meurtre Ã  Berlin
description:
The investigation files arrive in Berlin! The League, an international detective agency, has been contacted about the death of Laura Werner.

The Berlin orchestra lost its first violin, Laura Werner, the day before their winter festival. Rumor has it that she was murdered by another member of the orchestra.

Join the league, an international detective agency and find out what really happened. Who killed him ? What was the motive? And comment?

In the investigation game Investigation Files - Murder in Berlin you will have to decipher codes to solve puzzles, read police interrogation reports and witness statements, analyze clues, unlock new stages through advance of your deductions.

The mystery awaits you! The League needs you!

name: Wandering Towers: Mini Spell Expansion 2
description:
Mini spell expansion 2 includes: Close Ravenenskeep and Draw 2 Cards.

Close Ravenskeep
Effect: Place this spell face down (bramble side up) atop Ravenskeep. While it is there, no wizards can move into (or onto) Ravenskeep, and no one else can cast this spell. At the beginning of your next turn, remove this spell from Ravenskeep and place it face up with the other spells; Ravenskeep is now open, and the spell is available again.

Draw 2 Cards
Effect: Draw the top 2 cards from the deck. Note: You will not draw to fill your hand to 3 cards at the end of your turn until you have fewer than 3 cards.

name: Final Girl: The Marrek Murders
description:
Final Girl Feature Film Box

The media has become fascinated by an unorthodox killer being referred to as The Tormentor on account of her method of placing her victims in deathtraps that are escapable... in theory. Why she does this is still being investigated, but people are dying and now you find yourself in one of her deathtraps...

Marrek Warehouse is a mid-sized warehouse that handles shipping and fulfillment for a variety of departments store brand catalog sales. The operators have won awards for the efficiency of their floor layout and particularly the formation of the pallet racks. The warehouse security system is state-of-the-art with a timed locking and unlocking mechanism for all of the exits including the bay doors. The management (or whoever is in charge, ahem the killer) can control everything both coming into, and leaving, the warehouse.

- description by the publisher

name: ãã¦ãã£ã½æ®ºäººäºä»¶ ï½ç¦æ¾¤å®¶ã®è½æ¥ï½(Aimless Murder Case: Sunset of the Fukuzawa Family)
description:
On that day, a clandestine meeting was held at the Fukuzawa mansion, which even servants were not allowed to enter. But the next day, something happened. The body of a family member was found in the mansion, covered with bundles of money.
Everyone had alibi, so the search was bogged down, and the beleaguered police had to invite several detectives to assist.

Players will become detectives in the game, and their goal is to guess the character covering the card in the center of the field, that is, the prisoner, faster than other players. Use card swaps or special effects to gather clues and express your own reasoning. It is possible that the first round will be the watershed that determines the outcome... In such cases, it's all about guessing!
