name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing â Movanic Deva Angel Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Movanic Deva Angel Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens, and includes Campaign Adventure #4.3: The Ever-Watchful Eyes.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Spurs: A Tale in the Old West â Pioneer Promo
description: The Spurs Pioneer Promo adds a new character to the Spurs Universe known as the Pioneer. He is a balanced character whose special ability is he reduces terrain movement costs.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, American West, Real-time
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Survival Park
description:
The park systems are down and some of Earth's fiercest dinosaurs have escaped. You are in the middle of the jungle after the attack of one of them. Try to reactivate the electrical energy and ask for help from a phone so that they send a rescue helicopter...
Will you survive?

Survival Park is a card game of the survival-horror genre in which you have to escape from an island with free-roaming dinosaurs, while fulfilling some objectives along the way to finally be rescued.

On your tour you will visit different areas: jungle exteriors and building interiors; where you will face terrifying dinosaurs. To advance you must perform different actions (play cards from your hand). You can run, escape, hide and collect objects that can be useful to you; but you must manage them wisely. Additionally, there is the pressure to reactivate the energy and ask for help by phone. If you reach the helipad with some health, you will have won.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle, Science Fiction

name: Burke's Gambit: Xenobiologist
description:
A single promotional card. The power of the Xenobiologist is that once per game you can look at your own parasite card.

This card was included in Game Trade Magazine #201.

name: Invasion of Monster Island
description:
This is the second expansion to Monster Island and currently is only available as an electronic document downloadable from the publisher or RPGNow.

Expands:

Monster Island


From the publisher's website:

Invasion of Monster Island, the thrilling sequel to the Origins Award-nominated Monster Island: The Game of Giant Monster Combat, features expansion rules for creating and fighting alien fleets bent on world conquest. It also contains new monster powers, new human army units and rules for battles in outer space or other planets. You must have Monster Island and Escape from Monster Island to use this expansion.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Thorn 1779 / USS Atlanta 1781
description: An additional American flagged, Swan class ship-sloop for adding to your forces in Sails of Glory. In addition to the different paint model, the pack includes a set of 'G' maneuver cards as well as stats for two ships using the model. Components are language independent.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Fantastiqa: Curious Companions and Rarest Relics Expansion
description:
Fantastiqa: Curious Companions and Rarest Relics Expansion

Note: this new expansion set is compatible with both the original Enchanted Edition of Fantastiqa AND the new Rucksack Edition. You must have one of these editions in order to use this expansion.

CURIOUS COMPANIONS
Tucked away inside the Beast Bazaar is a Cantina crammed with Curious Companions. They will happily aid you on your Adventure -- for a price! Curious Companions have two ability symbols displayed in the upper-left corner of the card, of two different types. When Adventuring and Completing Quests, you may use either or both symbols shown on the card.

RAREST RELICS
Hidden in the attic of the Artifact Tower is a secret stash of arcane lore -- and it’s now for sale! Rarest Relics work exactly like regular Artifacts, but with more powerful effects -- and greater expense. Play a Rarest Relics card from your hand as a Free Action.

Rarest Relic cards (7 total)
The purchase price for each Rarest Relic card is 5 Gems.

• Bionic Bard: You may commit this card to any Personal Quest. Receive a +1 Point Bonus Token when this Quest is completed. Discard after each use.
• Enchanting Automaton: Play this card in front of you. Draw or release one extra card whenever you visit a Statue. This card stays in play for the rest of the game. You must draw or release cards as your Turn Action to perform this Free Action.
• Gem Golem: Draw two Gems from the supply.
• Mechanical Mule: Play this card in front of you. You may store one card, face-up, at a time on it; discard or play it at will. The Mechanical Mule stays in play for the rest of the
game. (It is okay to make the Mechanical Mule carry a Peaceful Dragon!)
• Rod of Raven-Prodding: Play this card in front of you. If this card is in play when the Mischievous Raven attempts to steal your Gems, he ignores you and steals from another player if he can. Discard this card after each use.
• Sceptre of Summoning: Name any card ability symbol from the Circle of Subduing. Draw from your deck, one card at a time, until you find a card with that symbol and add it to your hand. Discard the other cards. If you run out of cards to draw, claim none
of them.
• Steam-Powered Scout with a Luminous Snout: Travel up to two Regions away.

Components
• 18 Curious Companion cards and 1 Curious Companion token
• 7 Rarest Relic cards and 1 Rarest Relic token

Setup
• Shuffle all the Curious Companion cards and set them face down
in a single deck, directly next to the Beast Bazaar cards. Put the
Curious Companions token next to this deck to identify it.
• Shuffle all the Rarest Relic cards and set them face down in a single deck, directly next to the Artifact Tower cards. Put the Rarest Relics token next to this deck to identify it.

Rules
• If you occupy a Region with a Beast Bazaar, you may draw three
cards from either the Beast Bazaar OR the Curious Companion
deck (not both). You may claim as many as you can afford.
• If you occupy a Region with an Artifact Tower on your turn, you
may draw three cards from either the Artifact Tower OR the Rarest
Relic deck (not both). You may claim as many as you can afford.
• “+S” Special Powers work as usual to let you draw additional cards
from either of these new decks.
• Claimed cards go in your discard pile as usual. Discard unclaimed cards face up beneath the source deck. Reshuffle this deck if you ever run out of face-down cards.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Team-Based Game

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â I.R.W. Haakona Expansion Pack
description:
The I.R.W. Haakona is one of the many Romulan Warbirds patrolling the border of the Neutral ZOne. At the helm is Sub-Commander Taris, a military leader who, though judicious, is also quick to distrust others’ seemingly divisive excuses for “accidentally” wandering across forbidden borders. While investigating one such suspicious Federation vessel, the U.S.S. Yamato, the Haakona downloaded some information from the ship and then witnessed its inexplicable self-destruction.
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

I.R.W. Haakona Romulan Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 12 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: World in Flames: 98 Annual
description:
(from the publisher's website:)

Australian Design Group's 1998 World in Flames Annual gives you all the strategy tips you need to play World in Flames final as an expert.

Its highlight is Leaders in Flames, a 140 counter optional add on to World in Flames that provides every major character of World War II.

Now you can finally see why Guderian and Rommel were so superb at tank warfare, why Cunningham was an admiral par excellence and how damaging Spaatz and Harris could be in the air.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Battle of Changsha: Sept. 1941 - Jan. 1942
description:
The Battle of Changsha is a two-player, operational level game of the second (September to October 1941) battle for Changsha, China, capital of the Hunan Province. The second battle in 1941, resulted in the city being captured by the Japanese, and then being recaptured by the Chinese 9th Army Group commanded by Gen. Xue Yue. The third battle was originally intended by the Japanese to gain control of the city and prevent Chinese forces from reinforcing the British forces engaged in the defense of Hong Kong. When Hong Kong fell on 25 December, the Japanese decided to continue the offensive to gain control of Changsha thereby dealing a major blow to the Chines war effort. Ground units represent battalions and regiments with artillery and Japanese air power being represented with the use of fire support markers. Each hex is 3km across and each game turn represents 1 to 2 days.

—description from the publisher

name: Plunderbund: Promo Recruits
description: Promotional pack of cards containing the recruits Closer and Fixer. The pack contains 3 cards of each type to be shuffled into the recruitment deck.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mafia
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Tintura
description:
Tintura is a family game for 2-6 players,for ages 8+ and +20 min in which you will have to get the colors to dye the clothes and get dressed first.
You have to get the dyes to be able to dress in a garment of each type, top, bottom and a complement. It doesn't matter if it's stained.
The game ends when a player get the 3 clothes and the one with the most points wins.

—description from the designer

name: Coral Sea Solitaire
description:
Coral Sea Solitaire places you in command of American carriers in the Pacific in May 1942 against an opposing Japanese autonomous player side, referred to as the BOT side. The object of the game for the American player is to earn the victory points of the mission goal BEFORE the Japanese invasion convoy reaches Port Moresby.

You lead the aircraft carriers Lexington and Yorktown as they sortie into the Coral Sea to stop the Japanese invasion that threatens Australia. You must contend with 3 Japanese carriers roaming the Coral Sea determined to finish off the US Navy. The Bookgame contains 4 game sets, and each game set is against a different Japanese carrier strategy. There are 5 distinct missions within each game set for you to win and defeat the Japanese.

This Bookgame contains 4 game sets, and each game set is against a different Japanese carrier strategy. There are 5 distinct missions within each game set for you to win and defeat the Japanese. Making a total of 20 distinct game plays.

You will need to provide two 6-sided dice to play the game.

Coral Sea Solitaire can also be played cooperatively. For example, one player commands the Lexington, and the other commands the Yorktown.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Quicky Quack
description:
At sunrise, the sleepy ducklings wake up. The morning is wonderful, it is sunny, a colourful rainbow stretches across the sky.
While the sun shines from the sky and the morning is warm and pleasant, the mother duck hurries to take her children to the pond for a swim. But a cloud appears in the sky and wants to hide the sun. If it is cloudy, the ducklings will not want to go swimming. Therefore, mum and her young ones should hurry to bathe while the sun is still shining and inviting them to swim.

On your turn roll the die and resolve the result with one of the ducks: if flower/mushroom/cherries comes out go to the first free tile with that symbol; when arrow comes out take a step in the indicated direction (forward/backward); if sun comes out take a step along the rainbow. To dive into the water, any symbol will do: insert the duck in the hole and turn the pond to show the next hole. Important: Mother Goose shows the way and can never be overtaken!
Players win the game when the last duck dives, while they are defeated by the sun reaching the cloud.

name: Crystal Palace: Cards no 31
description:
Two promo cards, with number 31, first given to the first 300 people who registered for the digital event Camp Capstone.

The invention is the Bandage-o-Matic, the person is Elizabeth Blackwell.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Income, Loans, Modular Board, Set Collection, Take That, Turn Order: Auction, Worker Placement with Dice Workers
publishers: Brain Star, Capstone Games, DiceTree Games

name: Timeline: Il Ãtait Une Fois L'Homme
description:
Timeline is a card game where each card depicts a historical event, invention or discovery on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred, invention or discovery was made on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

In this version cards represent all the tools and discoveries of the humankind, from the first stone tools to the rovers on Mars.

name: Arctic Race
description:
Arctic Race is a competition across the ice.
Jump on to ice floes and choose your strategy, take short cuts through the arctic universe to be the first to cross the finish line.
Move one of your five different race contestants, but take care not to be pushed out by your opponents, or you will have to start all over again.

In Arctic Race all players control five different racers each, competing in different races but on the same track affecting each other. Players simultaneously choose a card to move a racer or take a secondary action. Cards are revealed in turn and the start player token is of high value as the board can change a lot with racers and ice floes moving.

The game ends when one or more players have finished the race with three of their racers, or when there are no more ice floes to put in the river.
The winner is the player with most points for finished races.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Programmed Movement, Push Your Luck, Race, Take That

name: Alien Frenzy
description:
At just 103,027,000,000,000kms from Earth and orbiting a tiny little star in the constellation Virgo is a planet we call Ross 128b. The rest of the galaxy however know it as Sorr, named after the Sorras who today became the first Alien civilisation to make direct contact with Earth. In an ominous and undoubtedly mocking tone, their message, 'The Sorras are approaching. Your planet we are poaching.' immediately caused people to wonder if the rhyme was intentional, or just a lucky coincidence. Seconds later it plunged the world into chaos.
When will they arrive? What do they want? Will they ever leave? No one knows. One thing's for certain though, they're not just coming for a cup of space tea.

Alien Frenzy is a wildly chaotic and suspenseful card game that plunges players head first into an Alien Invasion. The game unfolds in two thrilling phases with game play designed for 2-4 players.

The game begins in the Preparation phase, before the Aliens have invaded. Here, players take turns playing and drawing cards to improve their hand and mess with opponents. However, the tension builds as players desperately try to avoid drawing a dreaded UFO card, as this triggers the Invasion, and places that unlucky player at the forefront of the action.

During the Invasion phase, players take turns playing cards, and revealing Invasion cards. Here players come face to face with the Aliens and must fend off their attacks with Character cards. Once a player has no Character cards left, they are eliminated from the game.

Who will be the last player standing amidst the frenzy of the Alien Invasion? Only the most strategic and resilient will emerge victorious.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Matching, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Axles and Alloys
description: Axles and Alloys is a FREE miniatures game about futuristic vehicular combat. Build your car, then send it out to combat other players to see who the King of the Road really is...
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation

name: Ninja Camp: Participation Ribbon
description: The first player to pass their turn receives the Participation Ribbon worth victory points at game end.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Verdant: Multiple Choice Tantrum House Season 8 Promo Cards
description:
Three new cards that can influence the scoring of plant/item/room goals, plus a Rules/Title card.

Originally available as part of the Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter campaign in 2022. The promo cards have a dark green star icon with a “T” in the lower left corner.

COMPONENTS:
4 cards (56x87mm):

Plant Goals - One True Love: 1 point for each plant of a type of your choice.

Item Goals - Implement of Choice: 1 point for each token used of a type of your choice.

Room Goals - My Happy Place: double the points from a single room of your choice.

Rules/Title card.
categories: Card Game, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Puzzle
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Medieval Empires
description:
In Medieval Empires each player controls three different empires which attempt to control as much valuable territory as possible. The game is driven by cards, which are used to acquire troops and to fight battles. Players each have a piece which moves around a track by die roll; the space landed on determines how many cards the player draws and how many troops are auctioned off (bidding is conducted with cards). Sets of cards can be turned in for troops in addition to those auctioned off. The track is also the game clock: there is a neutral piece which moves around it and determines when scoring occurs and when the game ends.

The game was produced in an edition of 100 copies.

name: Op Tile
description:
Op Tile is aimed at adults, unlike most of Schaper's line. The main equipment is a set of plastic tiles in various rectangular shapes and sizes (also in different colors, but this has no effect on play). Players get tiles via die roll and place them on individual boards in an effort to cover as many spaces as possible and to get the high-scoring tiles on bonus multiplier spaces. There are action cards to add some variety (place a tile on an opponent's board, etc.).

No publishing date is printed on the box.

name: The Polish Never Quit!
description:
VAIPA QUARTERLY, issue #3.

For two decades after WWI Poles drank the sweet elixir of freedom. But envious neighbors saw them not as a country, but as a prize. Finally, the storm clouds broke and armies from East and West marched into Poland.

The Poles fought hard for their country. For six long years they fought. They fought in Poland, they fought in France, they fought in Norway, they fought in Britain, they fought in North Africa, they fought in Italy, they fought in Russia, and finally, they fought in Germany, all the way into Berlin and the Brandenburg Gate. They fought in the air, they fought on the seas, they fought on the land, and they fought behind enemy lines.

They had hoped that their unwavering opposition to the Axis would earn them the right to freedom after the war. Their motto was, "We don't ask for freedom. We fight for freedom!" However, only one of their foes was conquered. The other was now master of Eastern Europe. It would be four more decades until the Polish people would taste that sweet elixir again.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Warzone: Casualties of War
description:
This book expanded significantly on the Imperial megacorporation, adding more Wolfbanes to those found in the base rulebook. As well, it adds new troop types, and personalities to the other corporate, Brotherhood, and Dark Legion armies. It also adds some counters, templates, force sheets, new rules, rules corrections, weapons, abilities, and more.

A copy of Warzone - A Fast and Furious Miniatures Battle Game 1st edition is required to use this book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warzone: Beasts of War
description:
From the back of the book:

GLORY TO THE BRAVE!

"The roar of the Necromower's twin diesels was deafening as it cruised the desert landscape in search of prey. Within moments, its Wolfbane driver spotted a familiar yet horrifying outline against the horizon - a pair of Pretorian Stalkers leading an assault group of Legionnaires, Necromutants and Centurions. Without a second of doubt, the driver turned his beast of war to face the new threat..."

WARZONE COMPENDIUM 2 is the second official supplement for WARZONE - the dast and furious techno-fantasy miniatures game. Included are:
- VEHICLE RULES for use in your Warzone game. Have your Capitolian Purple Sharks strafe the Dark Legion scum in the venusian jungles, or your Necromower squads cut blody swathes of destruction through ranks of Legionnaires in the martian deserts. Beast of War includes full stats and descriptions of ten vehicles, including the Mishimese Dragonbike, the TA6500, the Imperial Necromower and Twin Barracudas, and the Brotherhood Death Angel.
The vehicle rules have been designed specifically to capture the fast and furious atmosphere of Warzone, and works in small skirmishes and large all out battles alike.
- NEW TROOPS, including large sections of the Secret Kohorts - the heretic forces of Algeroth - and the Imperial Clans' numerous special forces.
- RULES UPDATES, clarifications and additions.
- VEHICLE REFERENCE CARDS and a new template.
- NEW WEAPONS for use with or without vehicles.

Get ready to enter your Beasts of War!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Descartes Editeur, Heartbreaker, Target Games, Wydawnictwo MAG

name: RÃ¼lerball
description:
"In the future, a new high-tech sport will become popular. One-third football, one-third motocross, one-third fighting, it is so violent players often don't survive the game.

People love it.

It is played on a circular track with two goals located opposite of each other in the wall surrounding the track. Ten players from each team — three motorcyclists, two catchers and five skaters — move counterclockwise around the track and work together to field the steel game ball and put it in their team’s goal. The object seems simple enough: score more points than the opposing team."...

- From the Rulebook introduction.

Board game based on the movie "Rollerball".
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Zombies vs Werewolves
description:
It’s one of the great questions of our time. Which is scarier: zombies or werewolves? For generations this has puzzled commoner and philosopher alike. But now, the question will be answered. Which supernatural entity has the power to cause the most terror in the unsuspecting citizens of some nameless town? Only you can decide.

Zombies vs Werewolves is a fast-paced card game for 2 players that takes roughly 15 minutes (or less) to play. It’s simple, competitive, and all about determining who can score the most Terror Points before the game ends by frightening an assortment of random Citizens.

Play begins by selecting 6 Citizen cards at random and laying them out on the table face up. Each person chooses one deck of cards (either Zombies or Werewolves) to play with. During each player's turn, they will be able to play a card from their hand and then draw back up to a hand limit of 5 cards. Cards played are either Terror cards (cards with a number from 2-6 and 8) or Special Event cards (unique cards with special abilities that can be used once a game each). Each side plays Terror cards on Citizens to try and meet or exceed the Citizen's Courage rating; the player that meets or exceeds the Courage rating first frightens that Citizen and prevents the other player from claiming them at the end of the game. Play continues until all Citizen cards have been frightened. Then the total Terror points played on all frightened Citizens is added up on each side.

The player with the most Terror Points at the end will be declared the victor, proving once and for all (or until you play again) that their side is the scarier of the two.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Pastiche: First Edition Commission Cards
description: The First Edition Commission Card pack contains all 34 Commission Cards for the original Pastiche First Edition. These cards have been edited and re-formatted for the Pastiche International edition and can be substituted for the original first edition cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Sails to Steam
description:
In Sails to Steam, a game for 2–5 players, each player takes charge of a different empire that it must lead to economic prosperity.

Starting with a small fleet comprised of a few meager sailboats and a canoe, players will build boats, settle colonies, and even found new countries in an effort to spread the influence of their mighty empire. As their influence and power expands, players must carefully gauge and react to the global economy created by their fellow players and attempt to leverage their advantages to push out other empires if they plan to become the mightiest empire.

name: Death or Victory: The French and Indian War
description:
Simple strategic game on the French and Indian War. Point to point movement. Actions other than movement are controlled by command point dice or chits subject to some special moves limitations. Players recruit combat units, move units and conduct combat during alternating game turns. Units include regulars, militia, indians and rangers. Special rules provide additional historical flavor and provide some historical constraints faced by each side. Victory is attained by capturing certain locations of the opponent or by reducing the opponents morale level to zero.

The goal was to build on concepts of the One Page Wars effort by Alex Kremer and Mark Goss with a little more chrome and history, a little more complexity and a slightly larger map, but still playable in a small format. Think a Small Map Wars series.
categories: Age of Reason, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Conquering Corsairs
description:
Conquering Corsairs is a card game in which you take the role of pirates, trying to gain gold and reputation to become the most feared and famous ship to sail the Silver Seas. You will take your ship to strange and dangerous locations, recruit new crew members to your cause, do battle with other pirates, and put plunder in your hold!

During the game, players take different actions during each of the four seasons of a turn. In Spring, you play pirates on to the deck of your ship. They will be needed to attack locations and recruit new shipmates in the following seasons. In Summer, you sail your ship between islands in the Silver Seas and can either try to conquer them or explore new locations, looking for plunder. In Fall, you recruit new pirates, taking them from either common supply piles or a personal supply that only you have access to. In Winter, you can stow treasure (cards) in your hold, that will gain you plunder at the end of the game. The Pirate King is also determined in Winter, based on the prestige that each player has obtained from their locations and any powerful pirates still in play.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board

name: Vampire Mafia
description:
Please welcome the re-invented classic: Vampire Mafia — the secret identity party game! Some might say that Vampire Mafia is inspired by Werewolf, but quite the opposite is true as Mafia first appeared in the USSR in 1986, then later emerged in the USA in a much softer form as Werewolf.

Vampire Mafia is the TRUE Russian mafia-like game, based on a few decades of player feedback. It includes the most interesting cards and scenario variants, extensive guide for the moderator. Be prepared for the challenge; see the game the way it is meant to be played!

Did we mention that Vampire Mafia inhabits a unique setting, one in which vampires are good guys who are ready to spill the blood of the vampire hunters, who are the forces of evil? Well, there it goes!
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Hobby World, Pendragon Game Studio

name: Trenches of Hell
description:
PiekÅo Okopów (Trenches of Hell) is a game where you take the role of infantry battalion commanders on the Western Front in the First World War. You have three nations to choose from – the conservative British, the offense-inclined French, and the extremely effective Germans. Each nation has a different battalion structure, and thus a different set of tokens representing units and nation cards that you play in the game. Your task will be to get as many victory points as possible, which you receive from carrying out orders. This, in turn, determines which fields in the enemy’s system of trenches must be occupied only temporarily, or kept completely. The battle takes place on a board representing both players’ network of fortifications, separated by a narrow strip of No Man’s Land.

PiekÅo Okopów lets you feel the excitement of giving commands in order to get a few meters of land that are bought with the blood of thousands of soldiers. The game’s mechanics allow you to use successful tactics employed by the commanders of the Great War. You will use artillery preparation, gas attack, try flexible defense, or the use of fire to take enemy trenches.

A separate publication included with the game reveals the secrets of trench warfare in the First World War.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Power Legion
description:
Power Legion is a fast-playing tabletop wargame ruleset. Each player controls a team of heroes or villains, each with their own attributes, traits, and tricks.
Create any hero from comics, animation or film with a flexible point-based system. Use 3 to 5 figures per side or play larger games. Playable on a 3'x3' table using any figures you already own.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement

name: Fianco
description:
In Fianco, which is Italian for "side" or "flank", you want to be the first player to move one of your pieces to the opponent's back line.

On a turn, you move or jump with one of your pieces either forward (whether orthogonally or diagonally) or sideways; backwards movement is prohibited. You must take an opponent's piece, if possible, but only one at a turn. Control over the sidelines is important since pieces there cannot be jumped as easily.

name: Mr. Maksimov's Manor
description:
Mr. Maksimov, the town's wealthy recluse, has passed away and many old rumors are swirling about. Some say that he was descended from royalty, others say that he was an adventurer or a smuggler, and there are even those who claim he was a wizard. Whatever they believe, the towns people are wasting no time rushing to his estate sale after his death seeking answers to the mystery around him... and to get their hands on as many of his possessions as they can. Some of Mr. Maksimov's possessions could be worth a fortune but others might end up being worth nothing.

Mr. Maksimov's Manor is played in four rounds. In each of these rounds players will bid on Maksimov's possessions during his estate sale. Item cards that players can gather will either build on each other for more points or cause the player to lose points. When bidding, players need to balance how much value can be gained from the available items with what cards could hurt them. Also, if Mr. Maksimov's will turns up, it could change everything!

Mr. Maksimov's Manor is a casual game that both non-gamers and strategy gamers can appreciate. Casual gamers will enjoy the game's easy to learn rules and the feelings of excitement and anticipation that the game play yields. What will keep strategy gamers coming back is the ability to manipulate the game's odds, constant risk and reward decisions, and subtle elements of social deduction.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Billionaire Banshee: Australia Booster
description: Billionaire Banshee: Australia Booster consists of ten new Perk and ten new Quirk cards for Billionaire Banshee that feature Australian-based traits.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Video Game Theme

name: 5150: Fringe Space
description:
5150 Fringe Space is about living life on the edge. Sometimes that means salvaging space wrecks, hunting space pirates, or hauling cargo and passengers from one world to the next.
But it also means carousing in a city, rescuing crewmembers from Alien abductors, and fistfights in a low end bar. 5150 Fringe Space is a RPG Lite game that can also be played as a man to man or ship to ship combat game. Inside you’ll find:

A variety of Classes, Attributes, Professions, and Alien Races to make your characters unique.

Man to man combat rules for when you’re on a planet.

Ship to ship combat rules for when you’re out in Space.

Rules for character improvement that rewards you when you succeed and brings you down when you don’t.

Light bookkeeping Campaign and Economic systems that enhance the game instead of bogging it down.

Color paper character and space ship counters.

And much more…

5150 Fringe Space is designed to be played solo or same side against the game mechanics, but also works just as well when played head to head against your friends.

Playable with any figures you may already have or just with the paper counters we’ve included. Play it any way you want, just play it!
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Promo Tiles Set 1
description: This is a set of 5 previously released promo tiles for Neuroshima Hex. It comes with a nice color printed rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Catan: Das Duell â Sonderkarte 2016: 20 Jahre Catan, das Spiel fÃ¼r 2
description:
User summary (English):
Promo card available at Spiel 2016 in Essen (German version) and Gen Con 50 (2017) in Indianapolis (English version). It remembers 20 years of The Rivals of Catan. It is a neutral action.

Card text:
Choose an action: Take 1 resource or select a specific card from a draw stack. Your opponent may perform the action you didn't choose. If you own a Town Hall, you can take 2 resources or select 2 cards from a draw stack.

User summary (German):
Sonderkarte von der Spiel 2016 in Essen. Sie erinnert an das Jubiläum "20 Jahre Catan - das Spiel für 2". Es handelt sich um eine neutrale Aktion.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Trading

name: Raven
description:
A classic trick-taking, bid-making card game for contemplative players. This medieval-themed game combines elements of collusion, misdirection, risk taking and deduction. Successful players must manage the tension and uncertainty surrounding 4 Specialists, including the powerful Raven.

The game is played with 56 suited cards — Shields, Swords, Axes, and Waters numbered 1 (low) to 14 (high) and 4 special cards (specialists). Each hand features a different trump suit. Players must sacrifice cards from their hands to bid the number of tricks they will take. Each suit conveys a bid value: 0, 1, 2, or 3. The suit (not the rank) of the cards chosen determines how many tricks the player must take. Score 1 point per trick taken, plus a bonus for an exact bid.

The specialists are:

Raven — the highest trump
Wolf — the highest non-trump
Shaman — a half-step higher than the card it immediately follows
Dwarf — the lowest card


Each player tries to take (win) the exact number of tricks bid. Deception and collusion are allowed and include saying: how many tricks you bid; what cards you hold; that you want a particular trick; that you won’t take a trick; and lying about any or all of these things. You can say what you like, but you cannot show your cards before you play them.

Card play mechanics are typical for the trick-taking family of games: The player left of the dealer leads. Play proceeds clockwise. A player who can follow suit must either (1) follow suit or (2) play a specialist. A player who cannot follow suit may play any card.

The player with the most points after 8 hands wins. In case of a tie, the player (of those tied) who earned the most bonuses is the winner.

name: Bedouin
description:
The discovery of the Z10 gas put the planet's spotlight on all the corporations of Earth. The treasure that hides under the sand changed the peaceful lives of the bedouin tribes that inhabited the planet. Used to the hard life of the desert, these tribes soon became the most valuable allies in the gas-extraction business. You are the new leader of your tribe and must guide your people to find the gas wells and to build extraction ducts that will reshape the landscape forever. Use your people wisely to control the most strategic places on the map and keep an eye on the movements of rival tribes. Don't forget that the powerful and greedy corporations of Earth pull the strings in the shadows and are capable of helping you...or making your tribe disappear between the dunes.

Bedouin is a strategic game whose main mechanisms are area control and hand management. There is a high interaction between players as they collect the tokens of the gas fields that their tribe controls; these tokens are worth different amounts of victory points, and their value can be modified by different actions during the game. The modular construction of the desert guarantees that you will not find two games the same. Every action counts under the burning sun of the bedouin's planet!

name: Tanks: Lee Tank Expansion
description:
The M3 Lee sported a 75mm main gun mounted in a limited-traverse side sponson, as well as a smaller 37mm gun in its turret. This odd, ungainly vehicle was far from perfect, but it was nevertheless an effective tank that filled a much-needed role at a crucial time.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Â¡AdiÃ³s Calavera!: Character Expansion 3 Â¡Muchas Gracias!
description:
¡Adiós Calavera!: Character Expansion 3 ¡Muchas Gracias! features Jorge, a nice neighbor who can be played by both players, the living and the deceased, and it counts in the calculation of movement as with any other figure.

Each player is allowed to move the neighbor, however, only after one's own move and only by one field.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Point to Point Movement

name: TRITT Reloaded
description:
TRITT RELOADED is a reimplementation of TRITT, that was solved in 2009.

This new set of rules fixes the problem and also changes the game experience completely, as now lines of 3 or more dots can only be created as a result of a tritton movement. It also includes more pieces than its predecessor.

COMPONENTS

A hexagonal board with 91 connected dots.
20 trittons (10 of each type).
Carrying case.

RULES

The game begins with an empty board.

Each player has an allocated colour (Orange or Blue) and takes all the trittons that have their colour in the middle.

The Orange player starts the game by entering one of his trittons somewhere on the board. The three dots of the tritton must be placed over 3 free aligned dots on the board.

From now on, and starting with the Blue player, players in turn must do these 2 things in order:

Legally enter one of his trittons on the board.
(Optional) Move an opponent’s tritton (if any) any number of steps along the line it is laying on.
It is forbidden to enter a tritton on the board so that a line of 3 or more dots of the same colour is created. Lines of 3 or more dots can only be created as a result of a tritton movement.


As a rule of the thumb, you place trittons that have your colour in the middle, and move those that have your colour on the sides.

END OF GAME

The game ends in one of the following cases:

One player wins by making a line of three (or more) dots of his colour but not making a line of at least three dots of the opponent’s colour at the same time.

One player loses by making a line of three dots of the opponent’s colour.

One of the players loses by not being able to make a legal action.

The game ends in a tie at any moment if both players agree.

-description from designer

name: Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game: Dementor Adventure Pack
description: The Dementor Adventure Pack expands the Harry Potter Miniatures Adventure Game with a character card, a spell card, and a quest card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dragon Scary-go-round
description:
This is a fun cooperative game in which archers work together to defeat the circling dragon, while avoiding the ghosts.
Reduce the dragon's life to zero before it injures an archer or your run out of time, and your archers will be victorious.
Watch out for the ghosts, if they grab all the archers, that may spell your doom.

How to play
Decide which one of your action card to play to determine the sequence of events.
If you can, grab a book of magic spells to help your archer group out.
With your friends work together to setup your archers so they may attack the dragon at the beginning of the next turn.
If the ghost appears, move the ghosts according to their speed and dice roll. Try not to get caught.

The game is full of choices for the player to make. Choose the right choices to lead your group to success.
Will you let the dragon move first or will you move first to avoid the ghosts?

—description from the designer

name: Floresta Encantada
description:
Call your friends and venture into the Enchanted Forest in search of treasures, but beware, it is full of dangers.


On your turn, discard a character card from your hand and


move your pawn to the next square where there is an icon of that character.

When a player plays a character card that takes him to a space containing a score marker, it collects the score marker from the top of the pile.
The game ends when the last castle token is collected, even if other score markers along the trail have not yet been collected.

name: Middara: Psyche, Aphorism of Love Resin Kit
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

Psyche
An exceptionally detailed resin model of Psyche. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

This resin kit includes a Psyche miniature on a 50mm base and Aphrodite on a 25mm base, 1x Adventurer card, 2x Loyal Esper Cards, 2x Opposing Esper Cards, 2x Initiative Cards, 6x Item Cards, and an Art card.

Requires assembly.

-description from publisher's website

name: Code Crackers
description:
Code Crackers is a two-player card game that encourages players to utilize critical thinking, deductive reasoning, and code-cracking intuition to beat their opponent before getting their own codes cracked.

The beginning of the game moves quickly with players attempting to obtain the smallest inkling of what their opponent's code might be. Players will record their opponent's answers to their questions on their dry-erase Reference Cards. As the game progresses, gameplay becomes less about asking questions and more about deductive reasoning and critical thinking to crack your opponent's 3, 4, and 5-digit codes. The first player to crack the code wins.

Code Crackers is exhilarating for all ages (Given that they can add numbers between 0 and 10!)

name: La Carpinchada
description:
La Carpinchada is a game for 2 to 4 players, where each person will have to lead a whole family of capybaras that will seek to dominate most of the entire Argentine wetland field. The first player who manages to dominate more territories than the rest, will become the winner. So the other groups of capybaras will have to look for a place in other territories, we recommend the south of Entre Ríos or north of Buenos Aires.

After setting up the play area, each player will have 4 cards of which they must play 1 on their turn, these will give them control of the number of capybaras to move and the directions or coordinates to move. Or those cards can also be actions of wildlife animals, which will give benefits that will be satisfactory in the game. Then the player will pick a new card from the deck to end their turn.

The game is over when a player wins by mastering his fourth game territory, and positions his domain token.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Square Grid

name: Almadi: Fuhni Promo Card
description:
Promo card that was available at Spiel 2021. The card reads:

Fuhni
Fennec fox

When you recruit Fuhni, move up to 4 Landscapes of your realm (without performing triggered effects).

name: Old MacDonald
description:
This game is based on Phat, a Scottish member of the All Fours family (whose members include Pitch, Pedro, and Don).

Twenty-one tricks are played each hand; the object is to peg points on a Cribbage board for capturing valuable cards. The game end is triggered when someone pegs 180 (or more) points. The hand is completed and the player with the higher score wins.

The game is quite simple to teach as it uses standard must-follow trick-taking. To increase balance, one player will pick a trump suit and the other player will pick the rank order (which cards are high or low). What elevates the game is its distribution of card points among the ranks; in particular, trying to avoid giving up the high Phat points for capturing the middle-ranking 9s makes for some interesting and sometimes quite tense decisions.

name: La Frontera
description:
La Frontera is a co-operative game for two players in which one player represents the migrants, a group of people who for different reasons have had to leave their country and seek to settle elsewhere. The other player takes on the role of an NGO whose mission is to facilitate the entry of migrants. Both players must work together, taking care of their confidential information, so that the greatest number of migrants reach the Residence, avoiding bureaucratic, political, social, and economic obstacles before it's too late.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Events, Roles with Asymmetric Information

name: Codenames: Singapore Edition
description:
Singapore Edition of Codenames, using Singlish words in addition to standard English words. It contains 200 double-sided cards. About 60 of them contain words that non-Singaporeans will probably not understand, like Kelong, Angmoh and Samsui. It also contains about 40 words that are standard English words, but that have a special or different meaning, connotation or significance in Singapore, like Orchard, Causeway or Hawker. All the local cards have non-local reverse sides, so if you select cards randomly and a local card comes up that somebody is not familiar with it, you can easily solve the problem by turning the card. There are no overlaps with regular Codenames cards, so it can be used as a standalone expansion.

Two rival spymasters know the secret identities of 25 agents. Their teammates only know the agent’s Codenames. The team that contacts all their field agents first, wins.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: The Rent
description:
An autobiographical game about the real face of poverty.

Playing solo, you need to balance your physical, emotional, social and financial wellbeing while making the rent each month.

This game asks players what they need to sacrifice in order to pay their rent. The difficult decisions that come with the cost of living versus living a good life. Will you be able to have savings? Maintain relationships? Afford basic necessities? A serious game about what it means to survive.

TRIGGER WARNING:
This game is designed to simulate life in poverty or near-poverty, and how much we sacrifice just to get by.

Even if you win, you will lose a lot. If you or someone you love has experienced this cycle, the game may be extremely emotional for you to play.

Take steps to ensure you have self-care available before and after you play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Economic, Mature / Adult, Print & Play

name: Clash of Decks: Belligerency
description:
Create your own deck with 8 creature or incantation cards and face off against other Lord-Sorcerers to destroy their Stronghold!

This 36-card standalone expansion from Clash of Decks Season 3 adds Counter-Order and Retreat special abilities.

Counter-Order: When the owner is played, move the leftmost creature or incantation card to the rightmost in its owners hand.

Retreat: During the Invocation phase, you can sacrifice the owner in order to gain half its Mana cost, rounded down.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Clash of Decks: Bogged Down
description:
Create your own deck with 8 creature or incantation cards and face off against other Lord-Sorcerers to destroy their Stronghold!

This 36-card standalone expansion from Clash of Decks Season 3 adds Reinforcement and Enchain special abilities.

Reinforcement: When the owner returns to its owners hand, summon the leftmost available creature with Mana cost 4 or less from and without the Reinforcement ability from your Hand.

Enchain: When the Owner ist placed, take the leftmost creature card or incanation from the enemys hand. Place it under the owner. When the owner is destroyed, return the face down card to its owners Hand.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Masters of The Universe: Fields of Eternia The Board Game â Rise of the Snake Men
description:
Adds Snake Men Faction.
6 new characters, 10 dice, 15 soldiers.
Path of Destiny Quest,
133 cards
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Uluk: Ancestral Spirits
description: Ancestral Spirits increases the level of player interaction and tactics by introducing two new types of cards: Mystic Vision and Ancestral Wisdom. You start the game with one Mystic Vision card and get one more whenever you send a triber to the Temple. They grant you special one-time bonuses and an ability to interfere with your opponents’ actions. You also get two Ancestral Wisdom cards at the start, and one more per each visit at the Shaman’s Hut. They are secret objectives that get you extra Happiness Points whenever fulfilled during the game, not at the endgame scoring.

name: Cubed: Wild
description:
Add a new level of strategic play with 16 pieces to add to your main game to really mix it up.

Mix expansion pieces face down with main game pieces. Blue Wild sides can play or be played or be played on by any colour. Heights must still match.

Expansion Rules:

- Full Wild -

Play this single-coloured blue wild piece in any available space, except adjacent to blocking pieces. Once played, the player can play a second game piece.

- Blocking Wild -

This piece works like a normal Blocking piece, but the blue Wild coloured side can be placed against any colour game pieces, except another Blocking piece. You must still wait untill after the third game piece has been played before playing a Blocking wild piece.

- Colour Wild -

Play the blue Wild side in any available space, except adjacent to blocking pieces. You can also play a matching colour side, leaving the Wild side exposed. Another player can play any colour against the w=Wild side. If the Wild side is partially exposed, a player must match the colour that the Wild side is attatched to or used another wild.

name: Tiny Epic Crimes: Deluxe Edition
description:
The Deluxe edition of Tiny Epic Crimes includes Tiny Epic Crimes: Crooked Capos Mini Expansion packaged inside of the base game's box.


Tiny Epic Crimes is a fast-paced, crime-fighting, deduction game for 1 to 4 players that offers multiple ways to play. The game can be enjoyed competitively, cooperatively, or solo.

Players take on the role of detectives, and depending on the game mode, will be working either together…. OR separately…. to crack the murder case. Time matters, and the first 48 hours after any crime are the most critical. Players race around Echo Ridge City collecting evidence, such as the murder weapon, forensics, or the getaway vehicle. This secret evidence is sifted through using the novel Tiny Epic Decoder System, which keeps all of the murderer’s other evidence hidden. This knowledge eliminates suspects and helps identify the true killer.

But crime doesn’t stop for one investigation. Players must answer the call of duty, juggling their time as other criminal activities arise across the city. Resolving these events allow players to gain useful alibis and powerful Force Cards, but knowing full well that their actions will take them hours closer to a reckoning.

In their final hour, players will stake their careers on a final guess: who they think the murderer really is… hoping that their wits and detective skills are enough to bring the correct suspect to justice. Can you hold this city of crime together long enough to crack the case, or will it go cold and your time on the force run out?

Crooked Capos has 2 separate modules that can individually be added to the game: "Crooked" and "Capos." In the Crooked module, players are dealt Loyalty Cards which state whether they are “CLEAN” or “CROOKED.” Players can investigate whether another cop is crooked, getting either big rewards (if they are right) or big penalties (if wrong). In the Capos module, the Capos represent an extra challenge and reward for the officers! Capos are treated like mobsters while in the city, but are not like regular mobsters. Instead, each can only be arrested by following the requirements listed on their card.
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Bardwood Grove: Kickstarter Exclusive Pack
description:
Additional game play content backers received. Comes in a tuck box separately packaged from the base game.

Includes:
Bard Cards
Alma Aspirante - Bagpipes
Breck - Organ Grinder

Bard Meeples:
Alma Aspirante - Bagpipes
Breck - Organ Grinder

Fan Cards:
Smooth Jazz Fan
Rubba Dub Dub Step Fan
Arrr & B Fan

Improv Cards:
Shuffle x2
Inhale Exhale
Crank

Instrument Cards:
Bagpipes
Organ Grinder

Creature Cards:
Rattleshake x2
Croakzart

Muse Cards:
Quick Step
Highland Huff
Grace Note
Crow
Like a Record
Magnus Opum
Moonlit Pinata
Daydream of Blue

Skill Cards:
Goodfeel Think x2
Quick Step
Highland Huff
Grace Note x2
Crow x2
Like a Record
Magnus Opum
Moonlit Pinata x2
Daydream of Blue x2

name: The Mandalorian: Adventures
description:
When offered a lucrative job, a lone bounty hunter begins a journey that will put his skills to the test and redefine his world.

The Mandalorian: Adventures allows players to experience a new part of the Star Wars universe on their tabletops. Navigating unique maps and missions, players must co-operate to accomplish their goals and avoid defeat. Play as one of eight unique characters, each with their own deck of cards and strategies that will help you fight enemies and solve dilemmas to complete mission objectives. All of the action takes place in an illustrated map book as players recreate iconic moments from season 1 of the hit Disney+ series. With an intuitive system that's easy to teach, the game grows with new rules, components, and mission types added over time – some even featuring a hidden traitor mechanism...
categories: Adventure, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Traitor Game, Variable Set-up

name: Epic Card Game: Lost Tribe â Sage
description:
The Lost Tribe is a set of four 15 card packs, one for each alignment (Evil, Good, Sage and Wild). Combine any two packs to create a 30 card, two-color deck and you are ready to play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Prehistoric
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Corunea RCG Adventure pack #1: Noloc Shulius & Makual
description:
A deck of 61 cards featuring 3 adventures to play with 2 to 4 players:

The Searing Valley
The Emerald Embassy
The Necropolis of Makual


Each adventure comes with a scenario describing the starting situation, the forces involved and the amount of equipment each player can allow to his character. Depending on its length, each adventure has a different number of site and non-player character (NPC) cards that are placed face down on the table and drawn when the players execute the explore action.
The NPC can be neutral, follower or adversary, and can also change behavior depending on the allegiance of the player character that is in the same site.

The adventures add a layer of strategy and depth to the game for players already familiar with the base game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Zhadu: Legend of the Sharing
description:
Each player has 5 stones that have a numerical value - 1 stone, 2 stone, 3 stone, 4 stone and the (1,2,3 stone - it can be the value of 1,2, or 3). The value of each stone
determines the number of spaces it can move on the board.

The objective of game is to "remember the Sharing". This happens when the total value of your first and last capture equals four. Other stones captured "in-between" are simply removed.

Here's break-down taken from the rules:

"If the first stone you capture is the:


(4 stone), then you have successfully "remembered the Sharing"
(123 stone), then you must now capture the 1 stone, 2 stone or 3 stone to win.
(3 stone), then you must capture the 1 stone or 123 stone to win.
(2 stone), then you must capture the 123 stone to win.
(1 stone), then you must capture the 3 stone or 123 stone to win. "

name: Vinyl: Publisher
description:
This expansion adds a second side to the player board. With this player board tracks for each publisher and for the late and early decade are added. This will allow players to track the progress of these things and unlock usable powers (shopper cards) that are asymmetrical. Each player can only have two shopper cards and you can mix or match them in any way. If you already have two cards and you unlock a third opportunity to get a new card you may swap out cards at that time.
In the Publishers Expansion you get double sided player boards, 25 colored cubes and 24 Shopper Cards.

—description from the publisher

name: DÃ©corum: Movin' Out
description:
You and your partner have mastered moving in together. You’re totally fulfilled! But wait... Now you have to move out!? How will your relationship hold up when the moving van runs out of room for all your precious curios?! When your smart car can’t carry your boxes, your partner will surely pack them for you... right?? Onto the next adventure - Decorum: Movin’ Out. Let’s get movin’!

Play through 20 unique scenarios, as you wrestle with the best ways to persuade… erm, agree... on which vehicle to pack your lamps and antiques in.

The Movin’ Out expansion introduces new challenges, including moving boxes, bubble wrap, and vehicles!

Explore how best to wrap your breakables, what goes on top of the car instead of in it, and of course, what stays in the house while you move out!

-description from publisher
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Star Fleet Battles: Module Omega 1 â The Omega Sector
description:
Part of the Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition line.

From the back of the cover:

BEYOND THE VOID LIES... OMEGA!

Beyond the galactic void, beyond the ISC, lies the Omega Sector, where mighty empires wage war, conquer vast territories, and are in their own turn destroyed. Unlike the relatively stable Alpha Sector known to SFB players, in the Omega Sector, there is no such thing as a fixed border, and the survival of races depends on the skill of a gunner, the ingenuity of an engineer, and the valor of a starship captain. It is a place of danger, death, and opportunity.

Module Omega One is the first in a new series of adventures for Star Fleet Battles players. It includes 46 new ships, 11 new races, 24 new weapons, and many new systems. The mighty Mæsron Alliance seeks to dominate the area, but is opposed on all sides by the antimatter weapons of the Koligahr, the implosion bolts of the Trobrin Empire, the particle beams of the Vari Combine, the fireballs of the Loriyill, the bioelectric bolts of the Alunda, the energy howitzers of the Chlorophon, the kinetic waves of the Sigvirions, and the hypercannons of the robotic Drex Unity.

Five scenarios only hint at the savage wars, titanic battles, and devastating conquests that mark the dangerously unstable Omega Sector. Enter at your own risk!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Sicily
description: The Age of Steam: Sicily expansion is a bit more cutthroat than usual. This new expansion is for 3 players.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Trains, Transportation

name: Wayfarers of the South Tigris: Inspiration Promo Cards
description:
A set of 2 promo cards first offered during the Spielbox 2023 Kickstarter campaign. Later available as part of Game Boy Geek Season 11 Kickstarter campaign.

Also available in the Spielbox magazine Issue #1 - 2023.

Card A requirement: At least 3 Upgrades featuring a Pigeon
Card B requirement: At least 1 of each Worker in your supply
mechanics: Set Collection, Worker Placement with Dice Workers, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Ganz SchÃ¶n Rolf (fan expansion for Ganz SchÃ¶n Clever)
description:
This is a full fan-made expansion using the same dice colors as the original game. There is a new kind of special action - the "freeze" effect - introduced, as well as a new grey sector that is related to all colors.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: B17 Twenty Five Missions
description:
Awards:
-1 Place best innovative mechanic in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best Solitaire game in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best game in: 12th roll and write design contest.
-2 Place best foreign language game in: 12th roll and write design contest.

B17 Twenty five Missions is a game in which we will live the experience inside a B17, and in which we will bomb various targets to overcome the goal of 25 missions to return home.

This is a Roll And Write mechanics game for one player with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

To play it is recommended to have:

The bomber sheet, the objectives sheet and if you are playing in campaign mode the mission report sheet (It is recommended that the sheets be with a polypropylene protector)
An erasable marker.
-Various D6 Dice


Objective:

Complete 1 match without the bomber being shot down.
Complete all 25 missions (campaign) with a single bomber.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Magic: The Gathering â Planeshift
description:
The Planeshift has come, and the Phyrexians are taking no prisoners. Wield low-cost monstrosities that return an ally to your hand, creatures that reduce the costs of all your spells, tricolor mana Dragon Lairs, and double-Kicker Battlemages. Two worlds. Many ways to die. Will you survive?

This 143-card, black-bordered set features the mechanics of the Invasion block and cycles of Familiars, Battlemages, and “Dragon Lairs.”

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Origins: First Builders â Ophiuchus, the 13th sign of the Zodiac promo card
description:
This is a single promo Zodiac card for Origins: First Builders along with its accompanying Zodiac tile.

During setup, the Ophiuchus Zodiac card can be added to those from the base game.

Ophiuchus lets you choose to resolve the bonus action of an Encounter Site instead of one of the actions normally available.

Ophiuchus is a large constellation straddling the celestial equator. It is sometimes used in sidereal astrology as a thirteenth astrological sign in addition to the twelve signs of the tropical zodiac. The constellation Ophiuchus is situated behind the sun from November 29 to December 18.

The 13-sign zodiac, based on IAU constellations, would be:




Sign

Dates



Aries

April 18 to May 13



Taurus

May 13 to June 21



Gemini

June 21 to July 20



Cancer

July 20 to August 10



Leo

August 10 to September 16



Virgo

September 16 to October 30



Libra

October 30 to November 23



Scorpio

November 23 to November 29



Ophiuchus

November 29 to December 18



Sagittarius

December 18 to January 20



Capricorn

January 20 to February 16



Aquarius

February 16 to March 11



Pisces

March 11 to April 17

name: Lost Legacy: Orb of Prophecy
description:
In the distant past, a starship from a faraway world appeared in the sky. Damaged in battle, the craft broke apart and traced lines of fire across the horizon. These falling stars crashed to the surface, and in the ages to come, became enshrined in legends as the Lost Legacy. Discover where the Lost Legacy can be found and win the game!

Lost Legacy: Orb of Prophecy can be played independently or mixed together with other Lost Legacy sets to create a unique custom set. This version was released at AEG Big Game Night at GenCON 2015 and won't be sold for retail.

As for how to play, Lost Legacy is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
End: If there is at least one card left in the deck, the turn goes to the next player; if not, the investigation phase starts. Using the investigation speed indicated on the card each player has in hand, players take turns guessing which player (whether yourself or someone else) holds the "Lost Legacy" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. The player who guesses correctly wins; if no one finds the Lost Legacy, then everybody loses.



By combining different Lost Legacy sets (while keeping only a single Lost Legacy card in play), up to six players can compete at the same time.

name: Dungeons & Dragons Fantastic Locations: Fields of Ruin
description:
D&D Miniatures Fantastic Locations Map Pack: Includes Scenario and 4 printed maps.

Map Locations:
Keep of the Fallen Kings 1 and 2
Dungeon of Blood
The Kings Road
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures

name: Frisian Checkers
description:
"Oer Alles" (translates as "Over All")
aka "Frysk damjen" (Frisian) or "Fries dammen" (Dutch) or "Frisian draughts" (English)

Frisian draughts is closely related to the now standard game of (Polish) draughts and can be traced back to at least the late 1600s, when the games of the Draughts Family were sweeping through Europe from the French base. It has retained its unique rules ever since, and presently has its own league, founded in 1932, and is still widely played in its natural home of Friesland. Friesland is now a province with its own language and culture in the North of the Netherlands.

The "normal" version of draughts only slowly made its way into Friesland, and is known there as "Oer Hoek" (over corners) or "Hollânsk damjen/Hollands dammen". These days you are more likely to hear people talk about "Frysk Damjen" than "Oer Hoek".

The set-up and basic movement is identical to the commonly known game, but it won't be long before the main difference will become very apparent: capturing isn't restricted to just diagonal jumps, but can be executed horizontally and vertically as well. Yes, a piece can capture in all 8 directions! If you think that makes it easier to solve, try it. It has a lot more action but it doesn't become easier.

There are other subtle variations:
A promoted King can be moved only three times in succession when a player still has normal pieces. After that it must be "released" by a capture (which can be made with the same king) or by moving another piece. When a player has nothing but Kings then this rule is ignored. When you can capture, you must, but if a King and a standard piece can both capture a stone, or stones, of equal value, then it is the King that has to make the capture. When there are multiple capturing opportunities of equal value than the one that includes most Kings must be taken. The moment a player obtains a second King (and his opponent has only one), than that player has seven moves to finish the match or it automatically becomes a draw. Kings can make long jumps.

A few more names:
The Frisians are still proud sailors and it should come as no surprise that there are more pockets along the North Sea and Baltic Sea that play the game, where it is known under many names that all refer to the erstwhile important Frisian harbour village of Molkwar/Molkwerum, famous in the Netherlands for its ad-hoc infrastructure. Early Dutch literature (mockingly) refers to Frisian draughts with its free-form any-direction capturing as "Molkwerums dammen" as an homage to the labyrinthine village.
"Molkwerums dammen" (Dutch). A similar game is "Makvær" (Danish) or "Marquern" (Swedish), however, it is played on an 8x8 board and, in Makvær, a King doesn't only move diagonally, but also orthogonally, that is in 8 directions.

And more still:
"Jeu du Dame Bablionique" (French), "Babylonian Draughts" (English)

There is even a game played in Siberia that follows very similar rules to Frisian Draughts, except that it is played on a 64 field chess board.

name: En Pointe Toujours: France 1940
description:
The 4th wargame using the En Pointe Toujours (EPT) company-scale tactical combat game system. The scenarios cover conflict in France and Belgium in 1940.

The EPT II and EPT III scenarios can use the rules of EPT IV.

Contents:

- about 200 counters to be cut and mounted

name: Blood in the Fog
description:
Description from the designer:

Blood in the Fog is a two-player game recreating the 1854 Battle of Inkerman, one of the most fascinating battles of the Crimean War. An Allied force made up of French, British, and Turks had laid siege to the major naval port of Sevastopol. Desperate to lift the siege, their Russian enemies probed the allied line for a weak spot. They found it on Mount Inkerman, held by less than 7,000 British. On October 27, the Russians initiated a brief skirmish to test the British defenses (later called "Little Inkerman"). On November 5, they were ready to crush them with over 35,000 Russians.

It did not go quite as planned. The disorganized Russians had their forces divided in two parts, under the command of three generals, each of whom had a different, contradictory, battle plan. A cold and dense fog allowed the Russians to get the drop on their enemies, but visibility was so poor that there was little command structure in place for either side. Regiments and companies had no choice but to fight (or flee) on their own initiative, giving Inkerman the nickname "the Soldier's Battle".

While the fog reduced the range of the Allied Minié rifle, it was far more accurate and deadly than the Russian muskets, especially at point-blank range. The Russians relied on ferocious but bloody bayonet charges to make up the difference. But as Russian morale started to flag, the fog began to lift, and nearly 9,000 Allied reinforcements arrived-- particularly the fearsome French Zouaves-- the battle turned in the Allied favor. In the end, there were 4,676 Allied killed and wounded, and over 10,000 Russian.

The game uses a unique variant on chit-pull activation mechanisms, with each player alternating pulling from their own pool. The number of activations per turn is tied to the current Fog level. At the start of the game, it's somewhat difficult for the Fog to rise, but once it starts to do so, it happens rapidly. Russian morale is simulated via its own chit-pull pool, and like the Fog, it begins the game in solid shape but once it starts to flag, it quickly collapses. In this way, the odds start to shift to favor the Allied Player. Generally speaking, the Russian Player is strong in the early game and his opponent in the late game.

Step-losses and the gradual erosion of fighting strength is modeled using the "stack of steps" mechanic featured in some earlier Tom Russell designs, such as 2012's Blood on the Alma. The game is Regimental in scale, with each hex representing roughly one-tenth of a kilometer.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

description:
This promo card "Penguin Habitat" is for Essen Spiel'18.

When use the advanced setup of this game, add this card to other advanced cards. Shuffle all the advanced card and draw three of them without looking the front and put those cards on designated space in main board.
