name: Okinawa!
description:
"Okinawa!" is a two-player wargame recreating the land, sea, and air struggle for the possession of the Japanese island of Okinawa, from April to June 1945. Seen as the last steppingstone for the final jump toward Japan, the battle was important for both sides. The US had to prove it could overcome enemy resistance, securing airfields, and, after the bloodbath on Iwo Jima, keeping their casualties low. The Japanese had the chance to test their new air tactics relying on simultaneous strikes from multiple groups of Kamikaze and conventional strike aircraft escorted by fighters. They also had a full Army on the island backed, with one of the highest concentrations of Japanese artillery even seen during the Pacific War. They had to hold part of the island or inflict a level of casualties on US forces to cast enough doubts on their ability to later sustain a larger operation on Kyushu and then Honshu. Stakes were high on both sides.

The game covers the land battle for possession of Okinawa (focusing on the more military relevant southern part), and the concomitant air and naval struggle around it. On land you have Marine and Army regiments, tanks and amphibious tanks, Japanese forces that run the gamut between highly experienced machine gun battalions to raw conscripts. At sea Carriers, battleships, Navy and Marine air groups, Japanese Kamikazes, and even Yamato’s last sorties. Even the Commonwealth makes an appearance with Task Force 57, the British Pacific Fleet.

In addition to the campaign, shorter scenarios are included as introductions to the game system, as well as highlighting critical moments of the epic struggle. We've also included designer's notes an a nice example of play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Hungry Life: Europe
description:
Hungry Life is an environmental education and awareness card game played between 2-5 players and for the whole family, schools and holidays.

It comes in two versions: A Europe continent (English, French, German) and a North America continent (English) featuring species unique to that continent.

Each player starts with their own deck of 20 cards plus five in their hand (player count dependant). You start by placing a primary producer/Base Card to create a new habitat. Each animal card will list what it can eat leading up to an apex predator. Each new habitat is connected as the game goes on, but with human projects such as roads and housing estates these habitats can become disconnected. Animals that could once be moved are now trapped. You must strategically place your animals, human projects and natural events to thwart your opponents. The game mechanics have been designed to practically demonstrate how humans are causing issues but also how we can help in a simple and family friendly game lasting 25 - 45min.

Each animal card will also feature data about that animal so you can learn things like their weight, population size/trend as well as where they fall on the endangered species list.
In the rules you'll also find a list of organisations that are working hard to protect our natural world.

The first player to place all their cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Chaining, Lose a Turn, Move Through Deck, Open Drafting, Take That, Tile Placement

name: ÐÐ¸ÑÑ Ð¸ Ð§ÐµÑÑÐ¸ (Feasts and Devils)
description:
When the quarantine ended, the people of the medieval villages poured out into the streets to celebrate with a great feast.

At the sound of joyful songs, the clinking of glasses, and the clatter of dancing feet, all manner of evil spirits and devils crawled out of their holes.

Anyone they knew could be a werewolf or a ghoul. The atmosphere is unhealthy!

Now ghouls drink the blood of babes in the comfortable streets of your cities, devils tempt monks, and knights prepare for battle with the dragon.

A new type of inhabitant has been added called UNHOLY CREATURE, these characters stand on a green background.

They are mixed into the usual deck of suffering inhabitants, they can be drawn and, as usual, put into your town or into the town of your opponent.

Among all sorts of evil things, two special cards, a ghost and a werewolf, have been added to the Feasts and Devils expansion.

Now you can make your favorite resident immortal or turn a useless Leper into a ruthless and savage killer.

With the new addition you need to:

Disband all the Plague Doctors
Put away the vials with the traces of epidemics
Isolate the Leper
Kick out all the useless peasants


But don't be sad, they'll be replaced by all kinds of evil and other characters!

A new holiday deck has been added. It has 13 cards.

For example, the Bellethain Spring Festival requires each town to burn one of its inhabitants.

The old relics in Feasts and Devils have been replaced with new Cursed Relics.

name: Destination Fun Combo Pack
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Destination Fun Combo Pack features three full expansions for each game in AEG's Destination Fun series: Trains, Planes, and Automobiles.

Trains: Coastal Tides features all-new cards and strategies for you to build the best rail system in Japan. This expansion not only features new cards, but also three entirely new boards. Two of the boards are designed specifically for two-player games, while the Okayama map is a new challenge for 2 to 4 players. Route bonus cards are also included, allowing you to score additional points for being the first to connect specific stations.

Planes: Round Trip features two new boards, providing more airports to explore. An entire deck of new playing cards allows players to experience the game with new actions and goals. New planes tokens gives players more options to customize airport boards with endless variety.

Automobiles: Racing Season includes three new race tracks, including two that are tighter for two-player games. New garage, pit, handling, performance, and engine cards offer more options for customizing your race car. Season campaign rules allows players to race a series of tracks to determine an overall winner, complete with unique driver skills and wealthy sponsors.

name: Magic Dragons
description:
Make bids to capture the correct amount of dragon clans and outwit your opponents in Magic Dragons. In this trick-taking adjacent game, you will be working on as many as 5 or more “tricks” at a time, using your hand of 7 cards with the goal of winning 0 to 4 tricks each round. Each trick consists of a stack containing one clan (color) of dragon. Control of each clan stack (trick) is determined by who played the highest dragon card on that clan stack. But your opponents may have spell cards in their hand that they can use to freeze, destroy, or suddenly change the color of any dragon clan stack.

Play continues in multiple rounds until at least one player attains a cumulative total of at least 40. Points are gained for controlled clan stack cards and matching your bid prediction for the number of controlled stacks. Points are lost for cards remaining in hand at the end of the round. Each round is a full refresh: the whole deck is reshuffled, hands dealt, and new bids made.

In each round, players place cards one at a time, in turn order. Unlike traditional trick-taking card games where all players play for one trick at the same time, in Magic Dragons each player in turn may play on any active stack (trick) or may be able to create a new stack. Control of all stacks is determined at the end of the round when all players have placed all the cards that they can from their hand for this round. Points are then scored at the end of the round.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: QUIZscape: Der goldene Buchstabe
description:
A box full of surprises, three exciting time travel adventures and a unique combination of quiz questions and escape feeling - that's QUIZscape! The game box is a time machine with which the players must complete three adventures. The novel game concept by Arno Steinwender alternates various puzzles with quiz questions: Wrong answers increase the time pressure! And the game is full of surprises. The title tramsöates to "The Golden Letter"

The 1st stop on the journey through time takes the players to medieval Mainz. None other than Johannes Gutenberg needs help.
The 2nd adventure takes the players to 18th century Venice on the trail of Casanova.
The 3rd adventure takes the players to the United States: In the middle of the Cold War, the first manned moon landing is in danger.

The game is suitable for beginners and offers a quick start. Everyone can start puzzling right away in just a few steps.

How to play:
The players play together through 3 different adventures. In the process, they have to answer quiz questions and solve puzzles. Additional clues and secret messages are hidden in the box. But be careful: time is running out, and time is deducted for each incorrectly answered quiz question.
Can the players find the clues and solve the questions and puzzles?

name: Xodd
description:
IntroductionXodd is an elegant connection and territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (from now on points) of a square board, which is initially empty. The suggested size is between 9x9 and 14x14. Both players must have access to a sufficient number of black and white stones. The goal of the game is to end up with the fewest groups on the board. Draws are not possible.



DefinitionsA group is a set of orthogonally connected, like-colored stones. A single stone is also a group.



RulesStarting with Black, players take turns placing one or two stones of any color on empty points. On his first turn, Black can only place one stone.

At the end of each turn, there must be an odd number of groups on the board (i.e. the sum of the number of Black and White groups must be an odd number).

Players can pass their turn at any moment, unless it violates the previous rule (this means Black can't pass on his first turn).

When both players pass in succession, the game ends. The player with the fewest groups on the board wins.



Notes on gameplayDouble placement serves as both a first-move equalizer and a way to make the game playable under the group restriction rule.

Meanwhile, apart from the intended goal of eliminating draws (they would be common otherwise), forcing an odd number of groups at the end of a turn has many interesting tactical implications. For example, groups separated by two empty points can't be merged on a single turn, since the player runs out of stones to restore the group count to an odd number. Also, the diagonal connection is safe if the opponent has exactly one or three groups touching the two empty points adjacent to both stones, and unsafe otherwise.

Endgames are also quite tricky under this rule: you'll often want to join two of your own groups or create another opponent group, but you'll be unable to do it because you can't restore the group count anymore!

name: Trampling Out the Vintage
description:
From the publisher's webpage:

In 1864 General Sherman's march to Atlanta faced the heart of Dixie with the prospect of bloody fighting such as had already devastated large swathes of the Confederacy. And yet, despite a superiority in men and material, his task was a daunting one. Tied to the single-line of the Western and Atlantic Railroad for supply, and marching through a wilderness, Sherman could not afford to run up a huge butcher's bill. A too bloody summer's victory in Northern Georgia could easily result in a November defeat for President Lincoln in the forthcoming general election. On the other side General Johnston, commanding the defending Army of Tennessee, was no less vexed. He had attempted to whip his flagging forces into shape, despite sagging morale and a lack of reinforcements, but he knew this was a battle he could not afford to lose. Only reluctantly appointed to command by President Davis, Johnston would also be hamstrung by a divided and uncooperative staff.

Trampling out the Vintage is a simulation of the 1864 campaign for Atlanta. Both players maneuver and fight their units in an interactive sequence of play that places a premium on planning and decision making. Can you as General Sherman present the city of Atlanta to President Lincoln in a time and manner that will hasten the end of the war and ensure a second term for the Republican administration? Or, as General Johnston, can you stave off the Northern host and save the heartland of the Confederacy from capture and ruin?
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Microgame Design Group

name: Long Distance Double
description: One of the best games in the Lambourne replay sports range, this one covers both the 5,000 and the 10,000 meters race.

name: Starfire: Sky Marshal #1
description: Module for Starfire (3rd Edition) covering all aspects of the Starfire Universe. It contained scenarios, fiction, and clarifications of rules and ship design and strategy.

name: Legends of the Ancient World: The Gates to the Underworld
description:
From the publisher:

"Only the Necromancer can help you summon back the demons of the underworld that have risen to plague the land. But you must first seal the breaches through which the demons entered the world of the living before undertaking the journey to Hell itself. "

This is a paragraph-system game with a hex board and counters, inspired by Metagaming's Melee.

name: Babylon 5: A Call to Arms (Second Edition) â Powers and Principalities
description:
From the back cover:

Powers & Principalities is an essential companion to Babylon 5: A Call to Arms, 2nd edition. Packed full of new rules, scenarios, campaigns, and exclusive background material, this supplement will transform your games and give you more tactical flexibility with your fleets.

Inside you will find:

Fleet Command: A Wealth of unique rules for fleets, stressing the indivicuality of each race. Start playing with Abbai mines, Shadow screams, and many more!

New Ships: All new variants of your favourite ships, tweaked for specific tactical duties.

The Gaim Intelligence: The complete Gaim fleet list, allowing you to bring the Hive Mind to the tabletop.

Space Stations: Build your own space station, for any fleet, with an easy to use construction system.

Unique Admirals: Powerful heroes who can influence an entire battle.

New Background Material: Never published before source material, uncovering the secrets of the Earth-Minbari War and the Narn fleet.

THE UNIVERSE IS EXPANDING
Delve deeper into the Machine complex. Utilize the latest technology of the UNE to defeat bigger, badder, meaner robots than ever...or maybe not.

This book contains descriptions and rules for:

name: Ascend
description:
Ascend is a Decktet climbing game for 3 to 4 players.

You and your opponents try to be the first duck to reach the peak. During the ascent you will be set back by bombs falling from the sky. Therefore, it takes quite some personality to persist the ascent in order to be able to crown oneself as King of the Quackers and flush the opponents straight back to the swampy pond they came from.

The game is played over multiple hands. Every hand you get dealt some cards. After each hand, you score points according to how quickly you got rid of your cards. Your points accumulate from hand to hand and once someone collects enough points he or she is declared the winner of the game.

name: Star Fleet Scramble
description:
This is it, pilot. The ultimate battle.

Your fleet is flying toward the enemy, breaking formation to engage individual ships. Each ship charges toward an enemy sector, raising shields to prevent attacks. You have three classes of ships, and your goal is to destroy enough fighting capacity of the enemy fleet to defeat it.

A Star Fleet Scramble set includes:

- A Star Fleet Scramble flexible A4 board.

- 9 blue acrylic ships: 3 battlecruisers (largest), 3 destroyers (midsized), and 3 corvettes (smallest).

- 9 red acrylic ships: 3 battlecruisers (largest), 3 destroyers (midsized), and 3 corvettes (smallest).

This is the 3rd nestorized Icehouse game.

name: Emperor's Garden
description:
Japan in the year 1150 AD: the Fujiwara clan has held the emperors of Japan in their hands for more than 200 years. Now a new emperor has come to the throne, and he is determined to reassert the authority of his office and destroy the power base of the Fujiwara clan.

The emperor has summoned great warlords from across the land to assist him in this great undertaking. However, the agents of the Fujiwara clan fill the capital, so it is necessary to meet in private in the emperor’s garden. Even in this secluded place, it is not possible to meet in person. The great warlords must visit various locations and decipher the clues that the emperor has hidden in his garden.

The warlord that can decipher these clues will be the one to destroy the Fujiwara and will have taken the first step toward becoming Japan’s first Shogun!

Emperor's Garden is a tile laying and movement games played with Treehouse pieces and Hanafuda cards (Japanese playing cards).

name: Continuum Run
description:
prelude

During the middle ages, a powerful wizard obtained a unique item after years of searching. He secretly hid it in a royal treasury hall, that no one dared to enter.That was one of the most important tasks of his life. Centuries later, an archaeologist excavated the same item the wizard had placed in the treasury hall. The archaeologist, also hid the item in a secret place called the Continuum Vault. His purpose was the same as the wizard’s. To leave the item in the Vault, until the proper passing of the centuries, like a good wine in a cellar. In the far future, an agent that had access to the continuum vault, extracted the item she had asked from the wizard and the archaeologist to keep safe through the centuries.

THE GUILD. The Wizard was a founding member of a Wizard’s Guild that managed the impossible. To travel without moving. Although, the moving wasn’t through space. The Guild discovered that when you manage to travel without using the dimensions of space, you travel through time. Hence, the new name of the Guild was based on the event of that movement through time, the Total Inertia Moving Event Guild, or simply T I M E Guild. Centuries passed, the coming of the Nano Age totally reformed the Guild into a T I M E Agency and gave a new agenda to its members: The molecular processing. The Agency could combine almost anything in order to create new properties it could utilize. But, some items needed to be centuries old in order to evolve or to become suitable for the processing. Therefore, the Agency decided to cooperate with its members from times past in order to bring items to the future in their desirable state. So, there were many ways for one to do that. You could simply travel back in time instruct someone in the past, to hide an item for you in a place that you knew, and travel back in your time and take the item, which now would be centuries old. Or, you could take an item from your time and hide it somewhere in the past by yourself and take it back when you return in the future. But, the T I M E Agency has many members, so that it can function properly in all Eras. If you travel back in time, too far away from your Era, it could be hard to adjust in the ways people had in the past, so, the help of another person from that Era makes the procedure easier. Usually, a Mission that includes the keeping of an item through the centuries, is concluded by 3 members: A Wizard, an Archaeologist, and a T I M E Agent specialized in traveling through the ages.

Components.
1 board.
4 player sheets.
12 pawns (3 for each player).
108 cards.
1 rulebook.

GAME-PLAY.
All players begin the game with a mission that requires at least 4 items of different properties. Each player during his/er round uses his/er 3 pawns, which are the Wizard, the Archaeologist and the T I M E traveler. The board of the game is divided in three regions that represent three aspects of time: Past Present and Future. Each pawn starts from one of these regions and moves in order. First the Wizard can move in regions of the Past to collect information about powerful items and artifacts and then gather the items and/or artifacts for which he possesses the proper information. Then, the Archaeologist, moves in the Present regions in which he can also gather items that are somewhat different from the Past items and he can gather some more info about artifacts of the Past that might help the Wizard find them. Last, the Time Traveler moves and starts from the future areas, in which she can also gather info and items. The difference in the future region is that, items gathered here are built for time travel, which means that they evolve as the centuries pass. It is best for the Time traveler to travel back in time and leave these items in the Past or the Present to age and become stronger. Each item in Continuum Run has tiers, 3 sometimes 4. When an item is new, it begins from tier 3. Some areas on the board allow the players to store items and take them back from another time period. For example in the Present regions there is the Continuum Vault. If the Archaeologist stores an item of tier 3 in the Present it stays there until someone takes it. The Continuum Vault has its future version, in which the time traveler can go and take the item the Archaeologist has stored. But, centuries have passed, so the item must be replaced with a lower tier. Tier 2 in this case. Different tiers have different values. So, if a player requires for his/er mission an item with a value of Ruination 3, and s/he possesses a future item that has Ruination 2, s/he may store that item in one region and take it back from the next.
GOAL.
Any player that has at least 4 items that his/er mission requires may cause an endgame, during which, a last round is played and then players score Victory Points for each item and/or artifact they have managed to send to the Future Area called Molecular Processor.

name: BattleTech: The Battle of Coventry
description:
From the back of the book:

REMATCH: CLAN vs INNER SPHERE

A failed alliance tears a nation apart. Ancient rivals join forces. The winds of change are blasting across the worlds of the Inner Sphere, and the battle for Coventry is the center of the storm!

In early 3058, following the disastrous Trial of Refusal with Clan Wolf, Clan Jade Falcon launches a brutal campaign against the Lyran Alliance to regain its status among the invading Clans. As the Lyran Alliance tries desperately to marshal the necessary troops to stop this invasion at Coventry, military forces from all the major powers in the Inner Sphere converge on the war-torn planet. With massive troops poised on both sides of the conflict, the battle for Coventry threatens to explode into an all-out war with the Clans once again! Will the Truce of Tukayyid hold?

The Battle of Coventry is a BattleTech scenario pack that describes the savage conflict between Clan Jade Falcon and defending forces of the Inner Sphere on the planet Coventry. A detailed description of the hard-fought battle, along with seventeen scenarios and special campaign rules, allows players to recreate the events that unfolded in the BattleTech novel Malicious Intent - and perhaps even change the course of history.

User comment:

This is another Clan vs the Inner Sphere scenario pack from FASA, containing 17 assorted scenarios and the details on one new Clan OmniMech, the Cougar, which was reprinted a couple of years later in BattleTech Technical Readout: 3060. This scenario pack is similar to the earlier Luthien scenario pack, in that it brings along a multi-national force to represent the Inner Sphere; with units such as the Com Guard, Wolf's Dragoons, the Eridani Light Horse, the Davion Heavy Guards and others to choose from, it's a good opportunity to play your favourite unit from the novel on which the scenarios are drawn. Thanks to the inclusion of the Com Guard Invader Galaxy, it's also possibly the only scenario pack where the Inner Sphere player will go into a battle or two equipped to the same technological level as the opposing Clan.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Northwind Highlanders
description:
From the back of the cover:

Since the distant time when mankind knew only one sky and one sun, soldiers of the proud units that became the Northwind Highlanders have won brilliant victories against often-desperate odds. From small-scale uprisings in ancient Scotland to epic struggles between mighty star empires over countless worlds, the Northwind Highlanders of every generation have added to their forebears' battlefield glory. Fiercely proud warriors, the Highlanders have left their legendary mark on the universe -- and will do so as long as war rages in the Inner Sphere.

The Northwind Highlanders is a BattleTech scenario pack that follows the career of this phenomenal unit, from its inception on Earth in the 18th century to the latest battles of the 31st century. Fourteen scenarios drawn from different periods in the Highlanders' distinguished history let players recreate the unit's greatest battles -- beginning with the First Kearny Highlanders' near-fatal first engagement in 2366, all the way up to the year 3059. Also included are a detailed unit history and a complete military roster. Players can use optional rules that reflect the specialties of each Highlander regiment in conjunction with the BattleTech: Field Manuals series to create their own Northwind Highlander scenarios.

User comment:

Part sourcebook, part scenario pack, this expansion gives more detail on the Northwind Highlanders than any previous sourcebook, alhough the fluff section makes up a smaller part of the book than the scenarios drawn from the Highlander's history including a small campaign against the Clans, details on the various Highlander regiments and a couple of items of new equipment. While the new equipment has been reprinted in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 3060 this particular expansion is out of print, and not currently available from the present licence holder.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: The Battle for Cyprus: 1941
description:
"The Battle for Cyprus - 1941" is an expansion for Air Assault on Crete and depicts the proposed plan for a German airborne assault on the island of Cyprus in mid-1941.

This wargame uses the rules from Air Assault on Crete with variations and expansions. This expansion was original published in Avalon Hill The GENERAL Vol.18,No.3magazine. The map was included as an insert to the magazine and mounted counters were available via mail order from Avalon Hill.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Good Help: Evil Doctors and an Angry Mob
description: In Evil Doctors and an Angry Mob, an expansion for Good Help, evil doctors get special abilities and several townspeople are added to the action card deck. Once a monster roams the board, the townspeople become a mob and can confront and fight monsters. If you can control the mob, you can control the endgame!

name: San Guo Zhi: Heroes of the Three Kingdoms
description:
San Guo Zhi is a series of board game based on the epic battle of the Three Kingdoms (San Guo), and its first game in the series published in 2009 is Heroes of the Three Kingdoms, an original design collectible card came (CCG).

Heroes of the Three Kingdoms CCG is designed based on the historic characters and events. Therefore, the game rules that each card in the draw deck must be unique, and the same character can not appear on the battlefield at the same time.

During the game, player send generals to the battlefield based on the type of weaponry prepared. Player can also preset strategy card or play it from the hand. When one player's provision depleted, other player wins the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Collectible Components, Novel-based

name: American War of Independence Scenarios 3
description:
Includes 11 scenarios in a 64 page full color softcover book. The scenarios are:
• Long Island (1776)
• Harlem Heights (1776)
• Princeton (1777)
• Bound Brook (1777)
• The Hudson Forts (1777)
• Indian Field (1778)
• New Garden Meeting House (1781)
• Guilford Court House (1781)
• Petersburg (1781)
• The Cavalry Action at Gloucester (1781)
• Fishguard - The Last Invasion of Britain (1797)
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Simulation

name: PoÅrÃ³d Gwiazd: Zestaw 7 dodatkowych kart
description:
7 additional cards added to all pre-orders of the Polish edition of Among the Stars. The 6 cards include new locations: the Casino, Intergalactic Market and Waste processing station.

The seventh card is a new task to fulfill.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Walled City: Borderlands Mini-Expansion
description:
The Borderlands Mini-Expansion contains 4 new Guild Cards for use with the Borderlands map in Mercury Games' "The Walled City".

The 4 Guild Cards can also be mixed into the Londonderry cards as per the original rules. The cards are as follows:

- Masons (Build Wall/Road instead of Road/Wall)
- Gamers (Your citizens are untouchable)
- Cutlers (Score full points on neighborhood tie)
- Pewterers (May place all on same side of Road)

name: Malifaux: Fate Deck
description:
Malifaux uses cards, not dice, and the beautifully illustrated card pack is called a Fate Deck. Show your faction loyalties by purchasing the Fate Deck linked to the color of your faction.

Fate Decks are ALL THE SAME, only the box and the outside of the card has changed color, the number and face cards of the playing deck are the same.

Two Fate Decks are needed to play the game, one for each player.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Shadowrun: Crossfire â Las Vegas Expansion
description:
Vegas: A Night on the Strip

This mini expansion was a GAMA Trade Show retailer exclusive. It comes with new missions and 2 copies each of 5 stickers that add an ability to a Runner card only during Vegas missions. It also adds 8 new cards to the game. Gambling and tourism are the major thematic elements of the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombicide Survivor: Azaghal
description: Brazilian gaming personality, Azaghal, from the Jovem Nerd website (http://jovemnerd.com.br), now fights against the zombies. This survivor/zombivor character is a promo that was made readily available in Brazil.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Cool Mini Or Not, Guillotine Games

name: Catan Scenarios: Catanimals
description: The Catan commodities as funny Plush Animals that actually score points when you get them. Similar to longest road, who ever has the most houses adjacent to a resource gets that resource's plush toy, and with it an extra victory point. Can be used in the base game or with any of the expansions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Munchkin Knights: Four More
description:
A fearsome foursome of kooky knights. A promotional set of Munchkin Knights. A ziplock bag containing four knight cards for Munchkin with a fifth card detailing the publisher's information.

The four knights are: Level 1-Weak Knight, Level 6-Sir Plus, Level 8 - One Knight in Bangkok, Level 10 - Santa, Silent Knight.

Originally included in Game Trade Magazine #200.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: KRON
description:
Spanish game based on a ficticional battle between the "Attack Group of KRON" and the "Omega Commando" of 'The Leader'.

Released by 'Star Play S.L.' Publisher at early '80s, this game probably combines the titles of "Krull" (1983) and "Tron" (1982) films and was another Sci-Fi game resulting of the great success of Star Wars Trilogy.

The game components are:

- 01x Rulebook
- 01x Quick-introduction sheet
- 01x Map representing outer space and a cosmic shuttle
- 14x Warriors (7 for each player) including The Leader / Kron
- 01x Six-Sided (D6) Dice
- 01x Dice Cup

They are 4 types of different troops:

- Heroes: Kron Strength 5 & El Líder - Strength 6
- Laser Gunner: The only one who can attack from far, but need to be his Hero in game to use it - Strength 1 / Shoot 4
- Android: The worst warrior type Strength 2
- Humanoid: The best in melee fight) Strength 4

How to play:

We have a space shuttle in the middle of the map. Each team, has 5 asterisks in the outer space. They are the starting point of their troops. The players will have 7 warriors, and they have to decide which 5 will start the battle. After it, the game secuence is: move (1 or 2 hexas) any of all of their troops, shoot with the gunners, melee attacks and call for reinforcements.

You can fight into the shuttle -there is an aditional asterisk on it that you can use for warriors entry after occupying the star point- or in the outer space, but you can´t cross the space ship except from the entrance / exit doors.

The player who conquest all the enemy's asteriks will be the winner.

name: Crossing Olympus
description:
Fed up with the foolishness of mortals, the Gods of Olympus have gathered to debate the fate of mankind...

An exciting, strategic 2 player game puts the power of the 12 Olympian Gods in your hands!

NOW AVAILABLE ON TABLE TOP SIMULATOR: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=26291...

Take control of the 12 Olympian Gods and Goddesses and use the powers of Zeus, Hera, Apollo, Poseidon, Hermes, Artemis, Athena, Dionysus, Ares, Aphrodite, Hephaestus, and Hades. Each brings a unique ability that can alter the fate of your competition.

Who will be the first to cross Mount Olympus?

HOW TO PLAY

Each player is provided 12 Gods of Olympus cards, light and dark.

The gods and goddesses have individualized health points, movements, attacks and special abilities that match their characteristics, to deeply tie theme in with mechanics.

The game is played on a 9x9 diagonal board. The first space on both sides are the "gates" spaces. It will be your goal to either eliminate all the other player's characters, or move any of your characters onto your opponent's gate space.

On your first turn, select a character to "summon" onto your gates space. On subsequent turns, you will choose to move, attack, or bring additional characters into play.

All of the cards are balanced so that they are equal in power. Zeus has twice as much health as Hermes, Hermes has far more mobility and provides a "Winged Sandals" ability that increases the movement of other pieces. Athena has even less health, but a powerful "Aegis Shield" ability protects other pieces. All characters will be equally important to achieving your victory.

Expansions will add deck building and asymmetric gameplay options.

Try playing chess with each of the 12 Greek Gods as your pieces.

name: Die Heisse 6
description:
»Hot Six« … is a trick-taking game, where you try to guess your tricks. This might seem traditional, but the deck is quite innovative: All the suits are made up of a different amount of cards. Additionally, you might want to avoid the »hot SIX«.

Deal all the cards and reveal a new trump-suit for this round. Then, a game round consists of 3 phases:
a) Card swapping: Everybody swaps a card with their right and left neighbour.
b) Betting: Count to three. Then everybody indicates with their fingers, how many tricks they want to make this round.
c) Playing: One player leads a trick, the others have to follow suit.

After the last trick, add up the scores for every player:

+ 1 point per trick

+10 points, if you won your bet
-6 points, if you have the »hot 6«
When a player has 50 or more points, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.
NOTE: You'll find a 2 player-variant here on BGG.

–––––––––––––––– GERMAN –––––––––––––––––––

Heiße 6 … ist ein Kartenspiel, bei dem man seine Stiche voraussagen möchte. Dies wird etwas erschwert durch die Tatsache, dass alle Spielfarben eine unterschiedliche Anzahl an Karten haben. Außerdem gilt es die »heiße 6« zu vermeiden.
Eine 2-Spieler-Variante findet sich hier auf BGG.

–––––––––––––––– FRENCH –––––––––––––––––––

Hot 6 est un jeu de plis, où vous essayez de deviner les plis que vous allez remporter. Cela peut sembler traditionnel, mais le jeu est assez innovant : toutes les couleurs de cartes ont un nombre différent de cartes. De plus, vous devez essayer d‘éviter d‘avoir le „hot 6“.

–––––––––––––––– DUTCH ––––––––––––––––––––

Hot 6 is een slagenspel waarbij je het aantal slagen dat je gaat halen probeert te voorspellen. Dit lijkt misschien op een traditioneel slagenspel, maar het kaartendeck is innovatief: alle kleuren hebben een verschillend aantal kaarten.

name: Forged Realms: Shadow Woods
description:
An expansion to the Forged Realms game.

Add all new cards to the Forged Realms Core Set with the 2nd add-on pack containing 16 non-random cards including Crow Knight, Dire Wolf, Nightmare and powerful spells such as the Pyroblast and Goblin Elixur.
—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wake Island: A Heroic Defiance
description:
A Few Men Against the Might of the Japanese Empire

War has broken out in the Pacific with the Attack on Pearl Harbor. Now Japan moves for its next target Wake Island. Japanese forces have been sweeping across the Paci c attacking other US bases. The American forces on Wake Island were told they would be rescued if war broke out. The US Marines and civilian construction workers must hold out against overwhelming odds brought to bear on them by the Imperial Japanese Navy. Wake Island a Heroic Defiance incorporates both the air and sea components of the battle. Players can play either the Japanese or American forces.

—description from the publisher

name: Albedo: Space Pirates!
description:
Albedo: Space Pirates! features innovations for the Albedo base game like spaceship cards that can be rotated to retrofit them and simultaneous action selection resulting in minimum downtime and a uniform game length. In addition, the expansion includes new planet cards, a new faction, and new mechanisms like the planetary fighter garrison.

The base game is needed in order to use the expansion.

—description from designer
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Star Wars: Legion â Droidekas Unit Expansion
description:
Versatile and extremely destructive, Droidekas are a threat to even veteran squads of clone troopers and skilled Jedi Knights—and when B1 Battle Droids fail, droidekas are often sent to execute their primary function: annihilation of their targets. Rolling swiftly into battle, droidekas unleash their arm-mounted twin blasters, pouring out withering torrents of fire.

The Droidekas Unit Expansion lets you support your droid forces with some of the most powerful combat droids in the galaxy. Four finely detailed, unpainted Droideka miniatures identical to those found in the Star Wars: Legion Clone Wars Core Set represent your Droidekas as they speed across the battlefield in wheel mode and unleash suppressive fire in their attack configuration. Meanwhile, a unit card fully outlines the Droidekas abilities while three upgrade cards give you the freedom to modify them with comms systems.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Savage Wilderness: The French and Indian War
description:
Savage Wilderness - The French and Indian War is our second game simulation of the French and Indian War, the North American theater of The Seven Years’ War fought between the English and French. One of the key aspects of this conflict was control of the two rivers that served as critical trade routes for both nations, the Allegheny and Monongahela.

Designed by Bill Molyneaux, Savage Wilderness provides gamers with a fast-playing, introductory-level wargame covering twelve engagements of this war, including alternate variants for you to explore. Using easy to understand rules, each scenario is designed to be played in about an hour. Special scenario rules expand the experience further, bringing unique flavor and mechanics specific to each engagement while staying historically correct.

Battles included in this game are Grand Pre, Petitcodiac, Fort Bull, Mercer’s Massacre, Fort Oswego, Kittanning, German Flatts, Battle of Fort Ligonier, La Belle Famille, Beauport, Bloody Morning Scout, Bloody Run, Devil’s Hole, and the 30 turn campaign: The Battle of Fort Fredrick.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Lock 'n Load Publishing, LLC., Superior Print On Demand (POD)

name: Above the Horizon
description:
Flying over the fabled mountain range the Roof of the World, your plane suddenly went down. Luckily, you were on your way to have an expedition in the mountains and your supplies were not ruined in the crash. Unfortunately, you have no idea where you are, or how far it is to civilization. Your expedition has started earlier than expected!

At the start of the game you draw between two to four goal cards to try to complete as you journey through the mountains. You also start with two items, either the rope or telescope, or the compass or map. Place a mountain token at the 10 spot of the fatigue tracker.

Now you are ready to explore the mountains!

At the start, draw a Mountain card from the bottom of the Mountain deck. This is the starting mountain, where you crashed. You do not have an Encounter on this card, so ignore the dice shown at the bottom of it. Then draw a Mountain card from the top of the Mountain deck and place it to the left or right of the starting card.

Each time you move to mountain, roll two dice. You are trying to either get your dice to match, or equal the dice on the bottom of the card. Then flip the card over and read the Encounter linked to the number of successes you rolled.

The game continues until you win by reaching all your goals, or you lose as your fatigue reaches 0.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Mythology, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Move Through Deck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Tank Leader Terrain Tile Pack #2
description:
Second terrain expansion pack for Sherman and Tiger Leader games.

This expansion includes ten extra Terrain Tiles with new Terrain types: Riverfront/River, Industrial, Bogging and Urban, as well as a rules sheet explaining how to use the new terrain types.

This new terrain will allow for different scenario layouts in either the Sherman Leader or Tiger Leader games.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: Holly Jolly: Gingerbread House Promo Card
description:
Insert the Gingerbread House card into the deck of gifts mixed in with the presents and stockings. If you end the game with the Gingerbread House in your collection, you can 5 points.

Since the card is a stocking, players will not know if the card they choose contains this added high value card. This is similar to the Robot stocking card and adds another reason you might want to go after those hidden stocking gifts instead of a known present card.

There are two versions of this card. One is a generic house and the other was available in the Tantrum House season 8 promo Kickstarter and has the logo on the house.
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Hidden Victory Points, Set Collection

name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol â Jean Grey & Cassandra Nova
description:
One of the first and most promising students of Xavier’s School for Gifted Youngsters, the mutant Jean Grey is gifted with the power of telepathy and telekinesis. She uses these powers as one of the founding members of the X-Men, a team of mutant heroes who protects a world that fears and hates them.

Cassandra Nova is the mummudrai of Charles Xavier, a parasitic being born to the astral plane. Her psychic entanglement with the powerful Xavier has given Nova incredible powers, including the ability to possess the bodies of others. As Charles’ dark reflection, she seeks to destroy everything he holds dear.

This pack brings both powerful characters to Marvel: Crisis Protocol with beautifully sculpted Jean Grey and Cassandra Nova miniatures. These new characters are two Team Tactic cards that unlock their full potential as well as everything else needed to include them in games of Crisis Protocol.

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Fashion Game
description:
What outfit would you wear to a party, outdoors, or a café? Layer and Create new outfits to express your Style!

This is a game in which players enjoy expressing fashion outfits that match the theme by layering cards with clothing patterns and shapes.

Express your sense of style in two ways of play:
"Guess the Theme?" A fun guessing game for everyone!
"Editor's Request" is Easy and simple for the family and kids!

"Guess the Theme?" 3-6 players / 20 min. / 10 +
Let's each make a fashion outfit on a given theme and guess what it is!
The number of guesses and guesses received is the score.
The player with the highest total score wins!

"Editor's Request"3-6 players / 15 min. / 6 +
Fashion communication to express and present an outfit that fits the theme requested by the editor-in-chief role.
Repeat with different editors and the player with the most points after one round win.

Japanese Title: Fashion Coordinate Game konnatoki nanikiru? #nanikiru

name: Chamber of Wonders: Black Market
description:
Kickstarter exclusive expansion for Chambers of Wonder.

It includes:
1 new board: Black Market
1 new area: Slums
2 new contact cards: Claire, Gaz

name: Pizarro 1532-1537: Conquest of the Inca Empire
description:
The sixth game of the Gold & steel series, Pizzarro 1532-1537 Conquest of the Inca Empire is a historical simulation featuring the “first war of the worlds”; Spain, the rising European power and the South America dominant civilization, the Quechua people.
This a medium to high complexity 2 players game. One turn is 2 months, and the game is played in 6 turns (scenario 1) or 18 turns (scenario 2).
One player plays the role of the Inca Empire and its Indian allies and the other player plays the Conquistadors led by Fernando Pizarro and his brothers.
The objectives are to take control of the different territories (Cuzco, the main capital), to win pitched battles or major sieges, to eliminate units, leaders and the Emperor!
This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map showing Meso-Indian South America and units fighting on a tactical map featuring a typical XVIth century battleground.
Spanish units are swords & bucklers, arquebusiers, crossbowmen, ginetes (light cavalrymen), and early cannons (from 40 men at full strength, 30 horsemen or 2 cannons of all calibers). The Inca units (Quechuas, All other Indian peoples) and guard units such as Hanan and Hurin, javelins throwers, bowmen, axemen and most feared by Spaniards, the slingers and bolas throwers (4 000 men per unit).
The ambience of that period is added with tactical chits with specific application for the fights – shooting and close-combat – (for the Conquistadors: war dogs, infantry or cavalry charge, fight to death, kill the leader, Santiago!, tercio, palisade and for the Incas: arrows and javelins harassment, scary noised, flaming stones, shock, hidden units, smoke) and events such as rain, sacrifice, fight to death, no fight or betrayal.
The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ Spain
1) Reinforcement, replacement, withdrawal, recruitment
2) Strategic move
3) Attrition phase
4) Combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Inca Empire
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
Change of alliance
Check for victory
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Minimap Resolution, Simulation

name: Terracotta Army: Dice Tower 2023 Promo Tiles
description:
Originally available in Pack Bard from Dice Tower 2023 Kickstarter campaign.

Two new tiles with new abilities for the Footman and Kneeling Archer.

During setup choose if you want to play with both or one of the promo tiles, then cover the corresponding specialist on the main board.

Footman - Each Scoring Phase: Count all warriors in the 8 spaces surrounding the Footman. The player who has Domination among these Warriors can flip to its active side one chosen Weapon token. There is no reward for Presence.

Kneeling Archer - When placing, rorate so that the Kneeling Archer faces a Warrior. Counts as a Warrior of the same type as the one it is facing. Breaks ties for the player whose Warrior it faces. When built, it is worth 1 VP per each Warrior in a group with that Kneeling Archer.

name: Magic: The Gathering â  Mirrodin
description:
In a distant corner of the Multiverse lies Mirrodin, a plane made entirely of metal. Discover a new Magic story with new characters and new Equipment cards, all set in an artifact-rich environment.

This 306-card, black-bordered set introduces several new mechanics to Magic (Imprint, Affinity, and Entwine) as well as the new Equipment card type, adding power and reusability to your deck.

'—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Rolling Realms: Potion Explosion Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Potion Explosion.

To play this realm you must assign dice to potions. Upon completion, you unlock a powerful one-time ability that will help you in this realm and in other realms. Complete all three potions to score 6 stars.

-description from developer

name: Combat Zone
description: Combat Zone is a tabletop miniatures skirmish game in 25mm scale. CZ is set in an alternate near future where corporations have walled off cities to protect their economic interests. Economies have crumbled as corporations have turned to military warfare as a means of assuring their financial futures. Destitute gangs, corporate para-military and combat robots all take part in battles to scratch out an existence in this Mad Max-esque world.

name: Age of Steam Expansion: Cuba & Sicily
description: Age of Steam Expansion: Cuba & Sicily has two new maps, with a new "Gunpowder" special action delivery to recognize the revolution in Cuba, which is a solitaire map. In the two-player map Sicily, the players struggle against the Cosa Nostra, a third virtual player.

name: Battlecrest: Metronn Base Game
description:
Metronn: a massive city filled with neon color and alien architecture. In the labyrinth of alleys between districts a grinning sentrybot chases a twisted figure, bent by dark magic. As their battle explodes suddenly in the middle of the street, bystanders run for cover while cameras broadcast every move to giant screens. Finally, a spectacle worthy of Metronn.

The Metronn Base Game includes two heroes, Kaladeos and Exa (and her minion, Sparkles), and the Metronn map. All in just 18 cards, packed in our little wallets. No additional components are needed to play, though it is compatible with all other Battlecrest products (including the Fellwoods Base Game, the Imperator Solo Expansion, and the team play rules).


What is the mark of a true champion? Legendary heroes clash across the Neververse to find out.

Battlecrest is a card-based tactical skirmish game for 2 players (1-4 with expansions). With perfect information, players must truly outwit their opponent to win.

Characters are composed of 6-card sets featuring a hero card, a health tracker, and action cards. Occasionally a minion or item will replace an action card.

The map is built of 6 cards as well, with the cards randomly placed in a set pattern.

Players take turns maneuvering their characters around the dynamic, and often dangerous map while unleashing powerful attacks. As action cards are used they open up new possibilities and empower the character’s battlecrests. Build up to decisive strikes or refocus to get powers back. Every character has a unique set of actions and preferred tactics, so no two battles play the same.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Dig Your Way Out: Dig In Expansion
description:
Dig In is an expansion for DYWO that introduces the prison warden and 7 new places. Bringing many novel options and strategies to the table, this expansion pushes DYWO’s already great replayability to its limits!

As its beautiful cover hints at, Dig In contains the prison Warden. This non-playable character walks around the board and sends bad-mannered inmates to solitary confinement. On the other hand, you can go to her office and bribe her in advance with cigarettes so she can help you get an edge over other inmates later.

This expansion also offers 6 new places that can be used as alternatives to existing places on the board. They change the actions available in each place and add many more options to dig your way out. Each of these new places is optional and independent from one another, allowing you to build a different and unique prison layout, every time you play.

In the Library you can rehabilitate yourself to get a new Background as well as get smart enough to spy on the hands of other players.

In the Gambling cells you can gamble using cigarettes but you can also plan (on toilet paper!) your next moves in advance.

In the Laundry joining a gang becomes easier and you can also get bandages to craft or heal yourself later.

In the Workshop you can hone your digging skills or upgrade the Tools that you already have.

In the Gym you can work out to be prepared for future fights, or even start a brawl with every player in the place!

Finally, if you send prisoners to the Psychiatric ward, they will get psychological Trauma that will hinder their actions, until they can heal it.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Memory
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Memory
publishers: Bannan Games, Borderline Editions, Game Harbor

name: Quartz: O Jogo de Cartas
description:
Once again, the mining dwarves went in search of adventure and, while exploring a set of rocks at the foot of a mountain, they found a mysterious cave with a bright light coming from within. As they approached, the dwarves were impressed with the variety of crystals there. So it was decided: whoever gathered the most valuable collection of crystals by sunset would own the newly discovered mine. Everyone immediately went to work, eager to secure victory at the end of the day. Even if, for that, a small sabotage in the work of the other competitors was necessary.

In Quartz: The Card Game, on your turn you have to decide if you explore the mine or if you protect the crystals you already found.

If decide to explore the mine, you must reveal cards from the Mine Deck until you decide to stop or if an accident happens. If you decide to stop, collect all the crystals you found. If an accident happens, you lose them all! Some crystals may be discarded to hire Assistants that can either help you or mess other players' turn.

If you decide to protect the crystals you found, all the crystals of the same kind may be stored in your chest, so your opponents may not take them away.

At the end of the game players get points for the sets of crystals you found. Whoever get more points is the Mine owner!

—description from the designer

name: Monstervania
description:
A twins, Marta and Lucas, a terrible misfortune has befallen. Mordekai, the Dark Magician of the Forbidden Forest of Vania, has kidnapped their father and he is now their most valuable hostage. If there's one thing for which those lands are known, it's for the terrible dangers that surround them. They say that these lands are inhabited by some of the most violent monsters, which used to have a reputation for being quite peaceful. With the help of the young squire Sura, they must uncover the origin of this behavior and rescue their father. They possess the spirit of hundreds of powerful knights and their hearts are still pure, but will they succeed?

Monstervania is a 1- or 2-player action and platforming game in book format, following the true style of metroidvania video games. Embark on the adventure by guiding the heroes, uncover the whereabouts of their missing father, the Defender Knight, and give your all to solve the mystery behind the behavior of the monsters in the Forbidden Forest of Vania.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Wavelength: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A pack of 8 new cards (and 1 title card) for Wavelength, created by the Dice Tower team!

Cards include:
Good Game/Bad Game
Cooperative Game/Competitive Game
Best Pie/Worst Pie
Tiny Game/Huge Game
Short Game/Long Game
Boring Movie/Exciting Movie
Good Hot Dog Condiment/Bad Hot Dog Condiment
Necessary Clothing/Unnecessary Clothing

name: Giant Battle
description:
Giant Battle is a 2-player print and play game about the brutality of the factions during the time where great wars occur to prove who is the better faction.

In this age of power and greed, every faction in the world are battling it out to find out who is better king among all kings. Players will take turns maneuvering their unit on the battlefield, making clever decision to eliminate the opposing faction's leader. And in this game if one of the leader of either faction dies, the game ends and the faction with the surviving leader considered victorious.

You will control either a dwarf clan or the orcs battling each other on a 5x5 board. Each turn player have 2 moves and 2 actions at their disposal. Some unit have special ability triggers by just be adjacent with their leader. Some unit have the ability to attack from afar and have the healing ability. Both player will try to eliminate opposing leader to win the game.

Visit us and play more games at http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Atlantis
description:
This game was invented at the Technical University Twente in The Netherlands.

Atlantis is very original in its mechanisms. The board is built up from segments, each consisting of 7 hexes: one in the middle and six around it. The board can be made quite large, but is usually something like 4x4 segments; the game takes longer as the board gets larger. Each player has pieces of a single color. Pieces can be stacked, but when the stack gets as least as high as the number of neighbouring hexes, it explodes, spreading one piece to each surrounding hex and eventually destroying the original field. Once all seven hexes of a segment have been destroyed, the entire area disappears and segment is removed. Thus, during the course of a game the board (Atlantis) sinks into the waves.

The goal of the game is to conquer as many free hexes as possible. An area is conquered if it can be only touched by hexes without enemy-pieces. But beware: Exploding hexes have the nasty tendency to turn into an unstoppable front of explosion and destruction.

As far as I know this game has not been released commercially, but nevertheless it has a large playing community, since the University Game Club (Fanaat) has now more than one generation of offspring players. The game plays best with 2, 3 or 6 players, for symmetry reasons. 4 players is possible, but since the board is not mirror-symmetric the players will not have equivalent starting positions.

name: Classic BattleTech: Technical Readout 3060
description:
The Clan's New Secret Weapon Revealed!

The Great Houses of the Inner Sphere have created a new Star League to end the Clan threat, launching an all-out attack against the most powerful Clan, Smoke Jaguar. During this campaign, the Inner Sphere was assaulted by a new and deadly creation: the ProtoMech. Swift and deadly, these half-size 'Mechs proved agile and difficult to destroy. Now, other Clans will quickly field this potent new weapon against the Inner Sphere, hoping to once more tip the balance of power in their favor.

Classic BattleTech Technical Readout: 3060 provides descriptions, game statistics, and complete rules for using the Clans' newest weapon in your BattleTech game: the ProtoMech. Additionally, new Inner Sphere and Clan BattleMechs and OmniMechs are included, as well as Clan vehicles.

For use with Classic BattleTech.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: WinkelzÃ¼ge
description:
In the game, each player owns two types of three-dimensional blocks of wood:
angles and rods.

It can be played two different versions:

Reach the middle of the board from the corner sections by touching the stones of a color on the surfaces.

OR

In the second variant to get rid as many pieces as possible, and only touch the stones of one color at the edges.

---
In dem Spiel Winkelzüge hat jeder Spieler zwei Arten von dreidimensionalen Steinen aus Holz: Winkel und Stäbe.

Es können zwei verschieden Varianten gespielt werden:

Entweder von der Mitte des Spielfeldes aus die Eckfelder erreichen, wobei die Steine einer Farbe sich an der Fläche berühren müssen
Oder in der zweiten Variante so viele Steine wie möglich verbauen, wobei sich die Steine einer Farbe nur an den Kanten berühren dürfen.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Assimilated Vessel 80279 Klingon/Borg Expansion Pack
description:
Klingons tell their children tales of the Bird-of-Prey taken by the Borg following the Battle of Wolf 359, the Klingon warriors spirits sapped and their ship assimilated by the Collective as they were taken away to the Delta Quadrant. Though their ship was never seen again, the personalities of its crew surfaced when Seven of Nine made contact with a Borg Viniculum aboard the U.S.S. Voyager.

This ship is the competitive prize for Month 2 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Resistance is Futile.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Singidunum
description:
A precursor of Pergame, Singidunum has been conceived as a game to bridge the gap between traditional wargames and abstract games. It mainly relies on the use of only four types of units and simple movement and attack rules. The main principle is that a ready unit can make only one move or/and attack during a turn of the game. This will allow and even entice players to cleverly coordinate their moves and anticipate their opponent’s actions.
The game still retains some of the wargame appeal by using dice to simulate fortunes of war and giving the players a chance to immerse themselves into the brutal fighting between Huns and Romans on the Balkan Peninsula.

The game is designed to appeal to wargamers looking for a fast game as well as abstract gamers. It is also quite welcoming to the younger players (and their parents) as it offers a fun and easy gateway to wargaming.
The small box dimensions (171x151x36mm) make it perfect for gaming on the go.

name: Three Cheers for Master: Feats Expansion
description:
Three Cheers for Master: Feats Expansion adds 8 Feat Cards, 4 Minion cards, and 6 Tokens to the base game.

Feat cards are drawn to an 'unclaimed' area, and, as the game progresses, may be claimed by players who accomplish a drawn feat. Upon claiming a feat, players must immediately choose between the rewards on the card - a token, an immediate effect, or points.

name: Riga: The Grand Masters
description:
Contained in Brettspiel Adventskalender 2017 for day 19.

Includes 8 Grand Master Tiles: Riga, Visby, Stockholm, Tallinn, Danzig, Money, Knight, Merchant.
Also includes a rules sheet in English and German

The tiles are double sided and, except for the Money tile, you use a random side in each game.
The two sides are "MAX" and "1".
You also only use a random 4 tiles per game.

Every time you erect a building you check if you can claim one or more Grand Master Tiles.
The requirements depend on which side of the tile shows.

You can steal MAX tiles if you have more the the required items than the current owner.

Grand Master tiles are scored at the end of the game.
In general it is 4 points to the owner of the tile and 2 points to the player who has the 2nd most number of required items for that tile.
Details vary depending on if you are playing with the MAX or the 1 side.
The Money tile scores a bit differently depending on the number of players.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Take That

name: Magic: The Gathering â Shards of Alara
description:
The plane of Alara was once a mana-rich world in balance. Then came the Sundering, and it split into five divergent Shards, each unaware of the rest. This set introduces Mythic Rares, the first multicolored Planeswalkers, and several new game mechanics (exalted, devour, and unearth). Each Shard lacks two colors of mana, too, resulting in five strategically unique approaches.

Shards of Alara is the first set in the Shards of Alara block. It’s a 249-card expansion set with randomly inserted premium cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Glorantha: The Gods War â Dragons
description:
The Red, Black, and Brown dragons add a balancing aspect to your Gods War game. The Black Dragon draining enemies of power, the Red Dragon drains enemies of victory points and the Brown Dragon generating runes for it’s controller. Every turn the player with the lowest power during the council phase will end up controlling one of these monstrosities, sowing havoc across the board.

Contents:
Huge Miniatures
3 Dragon Loyalty cards
3 Dragon Gifts

name: REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat
description:
Build your army, deploy it to the battlefield, upgrade your forces and command them in simultaneous combat!

REDLINE: Tactical Card Combat is an exciting expandable card game that features simultaneous combat and mission based objectives to secure and hold. REDLINE, blends the tactical maneuvers of tabletop wargames with the fast paced gameplay of card games.

Winning requires careful resource management, and tactical cunning thanks to REDLINE's unique mission and combat system. Unlike many other card games, the battlefield exists in the form of mission cards that grant bonuses when captured. Players give mission orders using secret dials before combat that allows for the setting up of maneuvers such flanks, feints and ambushes. Or, create a gap in the front and rush your units through to attack your opponent's deck. In REDLINE, how you fight is totally up to you. just remember, no plan survives first contact!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Pieces as Map, Simultaneous Action Selection, Zone of Control

name: Slingshot
description:
Slingshot is the fourth game in the SNACKBOX Mini Game Series.

The annual Kylor System race has arrived. Only the finest pilots have dared to enter. But, who is the best racer in the Galaxy?

Strap in and work your way through the system. Complete each Planet’s orbital requirements and slingshot to victory!

A supersonic dice game of planet-hopping rocket racing. Match orbitals, spend bounty, and slingshot to victory.

Be the first Rocket Racer to pass the last Planet (finish line) in the system.

Complete Flight Sequences by rolling dice and matching Icons, to pass each Planet. First roll combinations can gain you Crystals, and abilities can help slingshot you to victory.

Look out for Asteroids if they are in play.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Matching, Point to Point Movement, Race, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Time's Up! 21st Anniversary Edition
description:
All dressed up in a brand-new box, this Anniversary Edition comes with the best of the original game and a huge collection of all NEW names! The party-perfect celebrity charades game builds the laughter and excitement in three hilarious rounds. You have 30 seconds to get your team to guess as many celebrity names in the Deck of Fame as possible. Round 1, say or do anything; Round 2, use just one word; and Round 3, gestures only ... no words allowed! Comes with hundreds of new names, the basic sand timer, PLUS expanded rules that allow for an odd number of players! Winner of Party Game of the Year and a host of other awards!

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Donkey Bridge
description:
In Donkey Bridge, players must take randomly drawn symbols and objects and create stories from them, ideally memorable and fun stories that will enable other players to recall the objects around which the stories are centered. Whoever builds the best mnemonics – and listens well to the stories told by others – has the best chance of winning the game.

Changes compared to EselsbrÃ¼cke (not exhaustive):

Removal of blocker cards, boards, thought bubble, and linen bag.
No fixed rounds. Based on player number now.
The game is no longer one player telling a story on their own, and then the next player telling the next story, etc. Now a player plays ONE card and tells PART of a story and then the next player does the same, and then the next, etc...
Game is now played in TWO distinct phases: The Narrative Phase (where players come up with the stories) and The Recollection Phase (where stories are recollected).
No blocker cards means that whole part of the game is gone.

name: Silver Screen
description:
In Silver Screen, players try to complete movies from the 1920s by collecting sets and claiming movie cards. Points come from three sources: making movies, winning awards for your movies, and making movies with the correct elements in them. Players have to balance auctions, drafting, and set collection.

Silver Screen is a card game rendition of Knizia's Dream Factory / Hollywood Blockbuster // Traumfabrik board game. In contrast to the board game, Silver Screen has more hidden information and more emphasis on balancing alternate paths to victory.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Survival of the Fattest
description:
Ol’ Grizz slowly opened one sleepy eye and peered out from his den. The snow had all but melted in the warm sunshine and the smell of spring filled the air. The old bear found no joy in the beautiful scene though, he had survived enough winters to know the work that lay ahead. His mind reluctantly turned to thoughts of hunting and hoarding; stashing as much food as possible while the woodland was awake and bountiful.

The bear’s brooding was interrupted by an annoyingly cheerful voice:
“Look Huni, another big juicy berry! This will be our biggest stash yet!”
It was those two ridiculously radiant rabbits, Huni & Bunz. As he watched the little bunnies bounce from bush to bush a cunning plan started to form. Maybe he wouldn’t have to make such an effort this year? After all, there were plenty of other critters already hard at work! Ol’ Grizz pondered this new revelation. If he could apply a little pressure, maybe twist a tail or two, he might just be able to convince his new best friends to share...

In Survival of the Fattest, you take the role of a woodland critter and use your unique tricks and abilities to forage for food. Spend your gathered food to complete delicious recipe’s from the Market for in-game bonuses and end-game victory points. After 3 seasons, if you’ve fed your critter and accumulated the most victory points, you shall be declared the winner!

Survival of the Fattest is a visually stunning family-weight game using action selection, hand management and unique critter abilities!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Legends of Sleepy Hollow: The Ghost of Tarry Town
description: This expansion includes two bonus standalone chapters for Legends of Sleepy Hollow, with new epic relic and skills upgrade cards and chits. Plus advanced difficulty game mats for all the chapters in the base game.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Novel-based
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Dice Hate Me Games, Greater Than Games, LLC

name: Ogre: Vulcans & Friends Counter Sheets
description:
This Ogre unit promo pack is a result of the Ogre Kickstarter project. These set was one of several given as a Backer Exclusive Promo.

The last of three exclusive Kickstarter counter sheets has a pair of Vulcans, Nihon and Vatican command posts, Combine and Paneuro Engineers and Heavy Weapons Teams, a Mark VI, a Doppelsoldner, and more!

This double sheet set includes Sheets P1 and Q1.

Available for Kickstarter backers (only) to order.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: SQU
description:
INTRODUCTION

In SQU, players alternate turns placing stones on the board with the aim of creating the largest ‘squ’, an arrengement of 4 stones in the corners of a square.

SQU adds up to the family of other ‘square-creation games’ such as Dakapo (Stephan Miksch) or Quartetto (Artyom Tchebotaryov). It also uses the 1-2-2-2… piece-entering mechanism of Connect6 to balance the game.

EQUIPMENT

10x10 orthogonal board (checkered for clarity) with an inner 8x8 board for shorter games, 50 red discs, 50 black discs, 4 red pyramids, 4 black pyramids, carrying case.

HOW TO PLAY

Definition: a Squ is an arrangement of 4 discs of the same colour on the corners of a square with the sides parallel to the sides ot the board (this is, the square must not be rotated).

Each player has an allocated colour (Red or Black).

The board starts empty. Decide the size of the board (8x8 or 10x10).

Red places one disc onto an empty cell of the board. Then, starting with Black, players alternate turns placing 2 discs of their colour onto empty spaces until either one of the players resigns or all cells are occupied.

If, at the end of a player’s turn (after placing both stones) a squ bigger than any previous squ of any colour has been created, the player places one pyramid of her colour on each of the 4 corners of that squ (covering each of the 4 discs). This is, the pyramids are used to keep track of the largest squ of each colour. Notice that the discs covered by pyramids still count for future squs.

HOW TO WIN

When the game ends, the player with the largest squ wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Monstrosity, The Card Game
description:
In Monstrosity, The Card Game players are contestants in a reanimation competition hosted by the fictional monster building conference MONCON. The goal of the game is to collect body parts, assemble a unique monster, and harness a power source to bring it to life...think Frankenstein, but DIY. Players choose a unique heart card at the beginning of the game to guide their strategy and must assemble a monster that is compatible with the heart they chose. Every heart has unique requirements which heavily affect's the players build strategy. Throughout the game, players take turns assembling body parts, upgrading parts, sabotaging their opponents, and using action cards to stir things up. The player who is able to reanimate their monster, and score the most points, wins the game.

Monstrosity the card game can be played in a competitive free-for-all or as a 2v2.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement

name: Dziennik: Zagadkowa podrÃ³Å¼
description:
Go with Karolina, Kazik and the otter Jacinta to search for their missing friend. Thanks to the clues of Zagadroid, you will travel together through 7 chapters in all corners of the world and solve over 40 puzzles.
Especially with children and adolescents in mind, the authors created a completely new mechanism for reading answers and prompts. Thanks to this, when solving puzzles, we do not have to use the help of smartphones or computers, as we did in Journal 29: Interactive Book Game or Trip 1907: Interactive Escape the Book Game!

name: Kluster XL
description:
Kluster XL is a dexterity game for 1 to 8 players, very short, easy to transport, incredibly fun, really simple, accessible to everyone and still full of strategy!

Kluster’s rules can be explain in no time: Magnetic stones are equally shared between players, who must, in turn, place one stone inside the area delimited by the cord. The first player to get rid of his or her magnets wins. But beware, when stones kluster together during one player’s turn, he or she collects them!

That’s all you need to know to play Kluster XL!

'Kluster XL' is a package that consist of two full games of Kluster and an additional longer rope.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Party Game

name: The Cottonwood Contest: Cousins
description:
The Cottonwood Contest: Cousins is a stand-alone solo game. Two decks can accommodate two to four players.

The Cottonwood Contest: Cousins has more types of goods than The Cottonwood Contest, and it introduces a new type of item: vegetables that can be planted in fields and then processed after being harvested. It also does not include any field/pasture cards.

GAME OVERVIEW
