Your grandparents were so impressed with the outcome of your parents' contest that they decided to have one of their own. You and your cousin are competing for a large parcel of your grandparents' land in the small but growing town of Cottonwood.

You have three years to show that you can make your farm more profitable. You may plant grain and vegetables, raise animals, and gather apples and mushrooms from the countryside. You may sell goods at each of the three Markets, and enter the income in your ledger.

Your cousin does not want the work of going to the annual market, and made a deal with a local store to receive the average price for each good sold. To determine your cousin's score, you will multiply goods sold by their average price.

The cousin who has the most money in their ledger after the third year wins the contest.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Farming, Print & Play

name: Helionox: Mercury Protocol
description: Helionox: Mercury Protocol is the first stand-alone expansion to Helionox: The Last Sunset. It contains a new set of cards, new planets, and ships that integrate with a pick up and delivery system. Combining it with the original game allows for a 4-player game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Tales of the Northlands: The Lost Trilogy
description:
This is a mini expansion consisting of three new invention cards which are added to the inventions deck of the main game. Based upon three erstwhile 'forgotten' Noggin stories from books published in the 1960's.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Farming, Medieval
mechanics: Action Points, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Mining Colony Duel
description:
Mining Colony Duel is a 1-2 player "BYOP" (bring your own pencil) adaptation of Mining Colony, a print-and-play game that requires no components other than the printed sheets and pencils.

In the game, you build a mining colony on a distant planet. At the start of each round, players bid for resources, which include polyomino tiles, domes, landing pads, and science stations. After players reveal their bids, the players place (draw) the resources onto their sheets, trying to accomplish various things, such as having multiple items of the same type in a row or column.

After eight rounds, players score based on the development of their colonies.

name: Mint Knight: Expansion
description:
This expansion includes new cards and components to play Mint Knight as a two-player cooperative game.

This expansion includes:

Ability to play 2 player co-op with another player.
Bonus Terrain from Galactic Conquest
Miniature + more cubes to support 2nd player
8 page fold out rule book to replace base game rules. No rules have changed, just bigger font, better explanations.
Fix/errata cards


Fix/errata cards:
Some earlier orders of Mint Knight had printing errors and or errata to make cards more clear. This expansion contains several cards to replace the troubled cards in the original game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Heart of Ice
description:
Heart of Ice is a solo adventure game in which you are an explorer searching for a mysterious artifact in a dangerous, post-apocalyptic winter world. In 23rd century GAIA, the AI system who controls the weather satellites brings the eternal winter to the Earth. Only you can change the future of humanity. The end of this story depends entirely on your choices.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Environmental, Exploration, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Multiple Maps, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: NUCK TATS
description:
"Nuck tats" are messages tattooed on someone's knuckles. If it fits, anything goes.

Each round in NUCK TATS, one player reveals a customer — a celebrity, character, mythical creature, whoever — and everyone else writes nuck tats for that customer. The best tat wins the round...and if your friends make you laugh, feel free to throw them a tip. It's that easy!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Drawing, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection, Targeted Clues

name: Covert
description:
Under the concept "Playing with Art", Rui Alípio Monteiro came up with Covert, a game that is based on the Rock, Scissor, Paper game. The "Thread" has been added to balance things out. Although mainly for kids, this is a great game to be played by adults alike.

The idea is to make kids become familiar with geometric shapes and colours as well as doing basic maths at the same time.
- The Scissor wins against both the Thread and the Paper.
- The String wins against both the Rock and the Paper.
- The Paper wins against the Rock
- The Rock wins against the Scissor

So, according to the power of each object, these are worth either 1 or 2 Points. Each shape appears several times, so players will be able to make calculated guesses on what would be the best piece to play at a given time. The stakes increase if both players play the same piece simultaneously, since these will accumulate to the Victory Points.

A game to be played in little time with net to no set-up time! Check out more info here:
www.criacoesasolo.com

name: Katag: Le jeu de Carte
description:
Katag: Le jeu de carte is a two players card games.
Each play have is own deck and try to defeat the four other players heroes by playing object cards and action cards.
On his turn, each player is playing one of his four heroes.
Then, according to each hero's action points and object points, a player can give objects and actions from his hand to his engaged Hero.
By comparing attack and defense, one of the hero defeats the other.
First player to defeat the four opposing heroes is the winner.

—user summary

name: Chile 73
description:
"Chile '73" is played in two phases.

In the first, Pre-Coup phase, each turn represents weeks or months of assorted furtive activity. Players secretly choose factions uprising against (or supporting) President Salvador Allende, and take turns recruiting units to their cause, or interfering with other players, in preparation for the impending challenge to power. Players may draw random chits from a Control Pool, which gives them a chance to assume secret control of a unit (Civilian, Paramilitary or Military), or deliberately choose from a selection of Action Chits which allow them to investigate, infiltrate, neutralize or block what other players are doing.

The second, Coup phase, begins once one player declares a coup d'etat. Each turn represents one to several hours, as gameplay changes from secret plotting to open, active warfare. Players choose sides and maneuver and fight for control of vital points on an area-movement map of Santiago, capital of a Chile in chaos.

The true winner of the game is not obvious until its very end, when players reveal their hidden agendas and score according to the plans they had all along!

The game includes:

105 counters including 44 units, chits to Control them, and Action Chits to play
A 18″ x 12″ area movement map of downtown Santiago as it appeared in 1973
Rulebook and storage bag

Players: Two to four or more (maximum limited only by number of players available)
Duration: 45 to 90 Minutes
Complexity: Medium-Low
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Modern Warfare, Political, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing â Reklar Expansion Pack
description:
The Reklar is a Cardassian Galor class ship commanded by Gul Lemec. It was the flagship of a fleet which secretly hid in the McCallister C-5 Neblua while preparing to attack the Federation planet Minos Korva, but their plans were thwarted by the S.S. Enterprise-D under the temporary command of Captain Edward Jellico.
This expansion comes with one new ship and a new set of cards for Star Trek: Attack Wing.

Reklar Dominion Expansion Pack is part of the Wave 13 expansion packs from WizKids Games.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Yavalax
description:
Rules for Yavalax

Goal: Simultaneously create two or more rows of exactly four stones of your color.

Components: Square grid board at least 13x13 in size, with a
sufficient number of white/black stones to fill the board.

Note: n-in-a-row counts both orthogonally and diagonally.

Play: White starts by placing a white stone at an empty cell. Players then take turns placing two stones of their color at empty cells, one stone after another.

In each placement, players are not allowed to create a single
4-in-a-row of their color, unless that placement simultaneously
creates at least one other 4-in-a-row of their color to win the game.

This means that players may NOT make a single 4-in-a-row of their color on the first placement of their turn even if they can make a second 4-in-a-row on their second placement.

In no event are players allowed to create 5 (or more) -in-a-row of their color.

The first player to make simultaneous 4-in-a-rows of their color wins immediately, whether it was their first or second placement.

Yavalax is inspired by both Yavalath and Connect6.

name: Dwar7s Fall: Dwar7s Winter Promos
description:
Dwar7s Fall promo pack that was included as a stretch goal during the Dwar7s Winter Kickstarter campaign. It adds a new variation to the game called "Allies". It includes the following cards:

7 Allies cards
2 Rules
4 Ogree cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Territory Building
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Tourcoing 1794
description:
La bataille de Tourcoing covers the battle fought on 28 et 29 floréal an II (17th and 18th may 1794) between a French army under the command of general Souham and an army of the Coalition under the command of the prince of Coburg.

La bataille de Tourcoing is the fifth game of the series "les soldats de la République" and is edited by VaeVictis.

The game includes an A2 map and 216 counters and markers.

It is possible to play this game with the standard rules (provided in the game) or with the simplified rules (already used for the game about the battle of Hondschoote - VaeVictis 146) that can be downloaded on the website of VaeVictis.

3 scenarios are proposed for this battle : one for the first day of battle, one for the second day and a third scenario that links the two days.

An additional scenario about the battle of Mouscron (10 floréal an II - 29th april 1794) is also provided.

—description from the description

name: DUEL BOY
description:
DUEL BOY is a trading card game with unique seven-card packs. The game was first distributed at the 2022 Fall Tokyo Game Market. The packs include seven cards for playing the game, one divider card, and a sticker the owner can wear to help find opponents to play the game.

The game was designed to be played while standing (for instance, while in line to buy a game) and does not require a table. After a match, the players swap two cards, with each player leaving with five cards they entered the game with and two of their opponent's cards.

After an initial shuffle of cards, a player has one chance to reshuffle, but otherwise must play their hand as it has been drawn. A game is made up of several rounds, and the first player to win three hands or cause their opponent to not be able to play a card on their first turn of a hand wins the game.

Players can play cards only from the rightmost end of their hand and must pay the cost of cards with the cards from the left end of their hand. Once per hand, a player can put the cards from their discard pile on the bottom of the deck — in the exact order they were discarded.

name: TSWW: Operation Merkur â The Invasion of Crete, 1941
description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to Crete!

Not quite what the New Zealand, Australian, Greek and British troops said to the German Fallschirmjaeger as they descended to Crete in May of 1941.

Operation Merkur is the new TSWW mini-game which deals with the Axis invasion of Crete, using a cut-down set of rules, half month and five-day turns. as well as including for the first time a competitive play rule using optional units to tailor force structures.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Mutternland
description:
from English Rules:

Where is our motherland? We must build it!
With 70 nuts we build a different motherland every time. It is settled by up to 30 marbles and built up into nut towers. The first to climb a four floor nut tower is the nutland queen.

Materials
70 nuts, 30 marbles, these rules.

Objective
After the players have laid out a nutland you place your opponent’s marbles. By marble and nut moves you try to form nut towers, trying to occupy one or more four floor towers with your marbles before your opponents can.

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game â The Champion's Purse
description:
"Life is not a song, sweetling. Someday you may learn that, to your sorrow." –George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

The Champion's Purse, the second chapter pack of the "Conquest and Defiance" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, offers players new themes and strategies to explore. As the Great Houses of Westeros clash over the Iron Throne, players must continually evaluate whether the reward of bringing powerful new cards into play is worth the risk of losing those cards to the enemy. Whichever House you lead, you'll find iconic characters, like Viserys Targaryen and Wex Pyke, leading you closer to The Champion's Purse.

The Champion's Purse includes three copies each of twenty new cards and introduces the "prized" keyword, which balances tremendous risks and rewards in deck-building and play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: MERCS: Recon â Terminus Maneuver
description: Terminus Maneuver adds MERCS from the Sefadu faction to MERCS: Recon. Included are five Sefadu MERCS and their corresponding player boards and special rules. In addition, the mission pack contains new missions and a new tile.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Ticket to Ride: Europe â London/KÃ¸benhavn
description:
Golden Ticket given away by retailers to people who came to see a Ticket To Ride Demo. This Ticket was also given away on the December 2017 issue of Tabletop Gaming Magazine.

This route is worth 8 points.

name: Book of Villainy
description:
You're a villain, but not very good at it — Take on the role of a B-list villain who didn’t quite make the cut! In an attempt to capture at least a little bit of infamy, you’re racing other not-so-super villains to publish a book about your misdeeds. Travel around the city hiring dastardly henchman, building outrageous gadgets, and committing pranks and petty crimes. Then write it all down for your (hopefully) best-selling novel!

In Book of Villainy, you move around various locations in rondel fashion, collecting sets of henchman to complete chapters for your book. You score points by collecting chapters with certain themes and arranging the chapters of your book in ascending order.

Once any player completes their book, the game ends.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Claim: Alliances
description:
Once upon a time, things were just fine. You were gathering mercenaries from ruthless factions across the realm to battle it out and claim the dead king’s throne. It was exactly what you wanted to be doing. However, your perfect life has become disrupted: an ancient threat from deep below has risen to claim the whole realm. Now, you must form an alliance with a former rival to defeat this otherworldly evil, so you can set things back to normal.

Work together to fight and defeat the enemy. The game is played over 2 phases. In the first phase you recruit followers and select alliance cards. Alliance cards differs from enemies who you will have to fight and hourglasses which will give you time to think. In the second phase you will collect factions and of course fulfill the requirements of the alliance cards. If players succeed in commanding certain factions and defeat the enemies, they will win together and you can get back to the fight against each other.

In Claim: Alliances players will follow the same flow as in a standard game. The game is played over 2 phases.
Instead of winning the most factions, you now have to work together to defeat the enemies and win the favor of a couple of factions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction: Once Around, Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Trick-taking

name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Wakakusa Yamayaki
description:
An Experience promo card that was given to all backers of the The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences Kickstarter-campaign.

This was added in December from their KS update #21
We thank you for your patience and understanding of this issue. We are really sorry for this small and yet significant delay. As a "thank you for your patience" we decided to include one more brand new Experience promo card in everyone's package

As for availability:
It will be made available in the future for our Essen backers as well. We will post an update about it.
mechanics: Income, Open Drafting, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Quick Joust
description:
QUICK JOUST

Quick Joust is a fast 1 to 6-player Jousting card game where your knight faces off against another knight, trying to either unhorse him and win the match outright or win by breaking three lances.

The cards represent the Knights, list, the shields and the movement of the lance! You setup the game by creating the list and as you race down the list you must react to your opponent shield movement and readjust your lance tip with a HARD or FINE PULL to compensate for the movement. As you reach the point of contact your final lance tip location will determine whether you unhorse your opponent, break your lance, or miss all together!

At the end of the run you can earn points which will add up to decide the Tournament Champion!

1 point for shield contact!
5 points for a broken lance!
10 points for unhorsing your opponent!

Play time: 20 Minutes plus "Will be much longer if played with 2 or more players!"

Total card count: 92 cards - which includes the Knight Status cards

[2] Playing tokens.

name: Dump The Ump!
description:
The premise is simple: Two teams take turns pitching and batting in this fast-paced, head-to-head battle of wits for three intense innings!

To start, the batting team selects from one of five batters, each with different player abilities. Avid baseball fans will appreciate the fact that each batter mimics the talents of some of baseball's greatest legends.

Once a batter is placed in the batter's box, the real fun begins! The pitcher and batter take up their respective tokens and begin to take the next few seconds to formulate a game plan. The pitcher can choose to throw a "Ball" or "Strike" and the batter can choose to "Swing" or "Take a Pitch." When the batter "Swings" at a "Strike," the batter rolls the dice out of the "Ump Cup" to determine the result of the play. Make your selections wisely, as you don’t want to be too risky, too safe, or too predictable!

This game is easy to learn, fun to play, and hard to put down. It travels easily from the kitchen table to the local pub and everywhere in between.

Now go ahead, see if you can out smart your opponent in this poker-meets-baseball challenge fittingly dubbed “Baseball’s Fastest Board Game.”

Batter up!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Magic: The Gathering â Planechase: Metallic Dreams
description:
Metallic Dreams is a five-color deck built around artifacts.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. When the game begins, the player going first reveals the top of his or her planar deck (or the shared planar deck), which is the plane the game starts on. Each plane card has a name, a type, one ability that applies at all times (either to all players or to whoever is the turn player at the time), and one "Chaos" ability.

Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." Each Planechase pre-constructed deck comes with a "planar die" that has four blank faces, one "Planeswalk" face with the "Planeswalker" symbol, and one "Chaos" face with its own symbol unique to Planechase. During a player's main phase, that player can roll the planar die, with three possible outcomes. A blank roll of the planar die does nothing. If "Chaos" is rolled, the "Chaos" ability of the current plane card triggers. If the "Planeswalk" symbol is rolled, the player "planeswalks away" from the current plane (put it on the bottom of its owner's planar deck) and he or she reveals the top card of his or her planar deck, which becomes the new plane that has been "planeswalked to." A player can roll the planar die as many times as he or she likes, but successive rolls cost an additional one mana for each time the planar die has been rolled this turn.

Other than the above, the normal rules of the game are followed, and Planechase can be adapted to any multiplayer variant.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Island of Gems
description:
In Island of Gems, you are decorating the beaches of the Gem Islands to entice visiting tourists. Enlist in the help of magical seahorses that give you extra victory points and encounter scuba divers that allow you to alter the board.

Fight the incoming tide every three turns while you alternate moves in this highly strategic duel game. Sometimes the tide carries in diamonds, requiring you to decide when and where to focus the most attention. Earn the most seashells and win the favor of the inhabitants of the Gem Islands!

Your turn is simple. You will place one of your gems on an open space of one of the islands available. The island you are sent to depends on where the previous gem was placed. Picture each island as a representation of the whole 3x3 board. Whichever of the nine spaces are chosen is the island that the next gem must be placed. For instance, the blue gem is placed on the middle right space of the island. This means that the next gem will be played on the middle right island. This will continue until all 27 gems have been placed.

Battle it out with your rival islander to complete patterns, control each of the islands and recruit seahorses.

Every game is different! With 14 islands to choose from, no two games will ever be the same. Seahorse cards score in two different ways from the orientation of the player, meaning any one card has different value for both players!

Tide cards dictate the flow of the game, either flooding an island or revealing diamonds that can lead to victory.

—description from the designer


Cardboard Edison Runner-Up 2022
LUCI Award Finalist 2022
Board Game Design Lab Challenge Runner-Up 2019
Note: This game is completely changed from its 2019 iteration. While using some mechanics from the old version, Island of Gems in its current state has been adapted for 2 players with fundamental scoring changes and differences in components, component count and presentation. For the purpose of BGG, this is still considered related to its old version but the similarities are very minimal. The videos on the BGG page reflect its old iteration and not the new one. This is a complete rehaul. The game was an attempted KS that I cancelled and no copies of this game have been sold as this game is still looking for a publisher.

name: Azimuth: Explore. Camp. Settle
description:
Follow your inner adventurer and explore uncharted lands in the 16th century to create a new frontier colony. Roll your dice and use them wisely to explore, camp, and settle your way to victory. Explore areas to benefit yourself while disturbing other explorers. Make yourself a camp for better reach, and build your settlement in a well-charted area for victory!

Start the game after the direction of the compass is determined, flip all the 7 face-down tiles and every player places their starting camp on whichever tiles they like. Roll the dice to determine what actions you can take. Each player takes turns to use the dice with the corresponding direction of the hexagon compass to explore (place a tile) or place a camp. You can sacrifice dice to reroll for the rest of the unused dice regardless of your turn.

Placing a camp expands your starting point for exploration and potentially develops into a settlement for victory points. To develop a settlement you need dice with the corresponding number of pips according to the settlement score which is determined by the terrain adjacency of the mentioned settlement, place the dice used as settlement below the pre-existing camp. every player can only develop a settlement once per round. after the players use all of their dice, the round ends and take all the dice not used as a settlement, and start a new round by rolling the dice.

The end game triggers after 2 stack of exploration tiles exhausted or a player have created 4 settlements, finish the present round as usual and starting the last round. The player with the most amount of pip from the dice used as a settlement win.

-description from designer
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: ã¾ãããâããã£ã¹ãªã¼ (Magical Patisserie)
description:
Each player is in charge of producing a type of sweet, but they dont know what!
Deduce from what your opponent's have made and try to bluff them into thinking they are in charge of something else.

Players are given a card that they cannot see, that is the type of sweet they want to make more of.
Each round, players may play magic cards for various effects, afterwhich they must make a sweet.
After making five sweets, the round ends. Players score 2 points for sweets of their type, 1 for their opponent's types, and -2 if they make the Maestro's sweets.

Game ends when a certain amount of points have been accumulated, whoever has the most points is the winner.

—user summary

name: 18BE Railways in the Coal Dust
description:
18BE is a one-to-five Players complex economic board game openly inspired by the share-trading and railroad operating 18xx games series originated by Francis Tresham and Leonhard Orgler.

Belgium, 19th Century. The air is thick, charged with coal particles. The land is dark, muddy. Coal Mines spread everywhere. Yet people are starving. The Belgian industrial revolution is in motion and Belgian Railways Companies are about to emerge.

Players act as investors in the emerging Belgian Railway Companies. Their largest shareholder is the Director, and they alone make decisions for the company. Players will spend their starting funds to either launch, promote, upgrade, operate, or develop their companies in an effort to accumulate the greatest wealth in cash at game end. To achieve their goal, players may also invest in companies shares, speculating on future returns and market values.
18BE introduces a 3D map board with overlays and unique features to ensure each session delivers their very own challenges. Companies may purchase different types of trains, invest in different trade opportunities (the so-called "Links") and/or Upgrades. Thus each company will most probably be played in a totally different way from one session to the next. Experienced gamers should be able to play the game in less than 6 hours. The rules also include a solo mode, and a challenging 2-player mode.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Connections, Hexagon Grid, Investment, Market, Negotiation, Network and Route Building, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Variable Set-up

name: One Deck Dungeon: Felisi
description:
Felisi is a new hero for One Deck Dungeon.

Felisi’s heroic feat allows her take a daring leap, rolling three heroic dice, and collecting any double or triples. But if all dice are unique, then she takes damage and uses time. A very press your luck feat.

Her 1 player skill allows her to reroll 2 dice, and 4 if she used a daring leap (regardless of daring leap success).

Her 2 player skill allows her and her partner to reroll 1 dice, and 2 if she used daring leap (regardless of daring leap success).

This promo was given out at Gen Con 2022 to promote One Deck Galaxy.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Sir Holland: A Fuga da Torre
description:
On a dark night, the Kingdom of Nhekos met the wrath of The Dark Wizard and the Black Night, Sir Holland's greatest enemies. All of the kingdom's subjects have been captured and kept in a tower, a dreadful and threatening place.

However, some bold heroes are not to be so easily defeated. By finding a breach in the dungeon, they will try to escape from the tower...by climbing it! They will need all their skills to dodge the villains and try to get to the top as quickly as possible. Such a journey is never made without setbacks, and in Sir Holland: A Fuga da Torre ("Escape the Tower') our heroes can accidentally put their friends in danger — and the villains will have an eye on every step they take!

name: BattleLust: Mediaeval Battle System
description:
BattleLust is a gaming system for medieval or medieval-fantasy miniatures reflecting the pre-gunpowder era of warfare. The game is designed for 25mm miniatures, but is adaptable to 15mm. Each miniature represents one warrior with his own physical attributes, weapons, and combat skills.

BattleLust is designed for any number of players. Each player typically commands a company of about twenty warriors, but an experienced player can operate two or more companies. BattleLust is compatible with our role-playing HârnMaster rules. The game can be used as a quick combat system for HârnMaster , or you can use HârnMaster as a source of optional advanced rules for BattleLust.

BattleLust provides a strong contrast to the usual fantasy miniatures game. There are no dragons and monsters here. While there are strong men and weak men, no single hero dominates the battlefield. There is no gunpowder, no war wagons, and no suits of plate armor. Instead, this is a game solidly based on the realities of medieval warfare.

name: Renegade Legion: Centurion â Harbingers of Death
description:
The 13379th legion the Harbringers of Death is one of the most renowned units in the Terran Overlord Government military. They also became the first all male unit in the TOG forces.

Because the Harbringers of Death is known to this day as the most loyal unit in Caesars army they have won the enviable assignment of testing new equipment under battle field conditions. As a result of so many years in this capacity the unit can claim the distinction of having fought more varied opponents than any other unit.

The Harbingers of Death are the most fanatically loyal TOG unit in existence. Elite, battle hardened troops tremble at the thought of serving with them. World populations panic at news of their approach. They have never known defeat. The First Cohort of The Harbingers of Death are the elite of this celebrated unit. Included in this scenario pack are unit personality profiles, unit history, combat readiness, and 15 scenarios.

Expands:

Renegade Legion: Centurion â Blood & Steel
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Olympos: Expansionnism
description:
Bonus tile that comes for free with Plato Magazine no 45.

The background is purple and you replace one purple discovery with this tile.

At the end of the game, the owner of this tile gets 2 points for each settler (disc) that he has retreived, but hasn't placed on the board.
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Operation Gertrud: The German Invasion of Turkey
description:
Operation Gertrud: The German Invasion of Turkey is a speculative two-player wargame about a German invasion of Turkey during the Second World War. The historical course of events during World War II precluded any likelihood that the Germans would invade their erstwhile ally, it is conceivable that a different turn of events could have precipitated a German Blitzkrieg into Turkey. The Turks were concerned about this possibility and they endeavored to remain neutral during the war. Unlike the First World War, the Turks could not hope to hold Istanbul in the event of a war, and any incursion by one side (Axis or Allied) would certainly invite an incursion by the other. The Turks were most concerned about Soviets, but if Hitler had conceived a notion of invading Turkey, the Germans' most daunting challenge would be the Allied response, not necessarily the Turkish Army. The Turks had been underestimated during the previous world war, and so it’s anyone’s guess how well they could have faced up to the Wehrmacht and Luftwaffe.

Components: 22x34 inch map, 176 die-cut counters.

World at War #49, April 2016
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table

name: Krosmaster: Arena â Season 2 Exp #6 â Dragoon Power
description:
This window box expansion contains 4 new figures with cards for use in Krosmaster: Arena.

Four new figures (Harry Sah, Diver Birel, Bonta Riktus, Sufokia Riktus)
Four Character Cards
Four "Bonus Elements" -- terrain & tokens
"Pink Dragoone" token (for Harry Sah)
"Living Shovel" token (for Diver Birel)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Storm over Hengyang 1944
description:
"Storm over Hengyang 1944 (è¡¡é½é¢¨æ´1944)" is a two-player board wargame that simulates the defense of Hengyang in late stage of Ichigo Operation, June 24 to August 8, 1944.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Defense_of_Hengyang

Each turn represents 1 week and each area is about 1 km across. One player commands the Imperial Japanese Armyï¼å¤§æ¥æ¬å¸åé¸è»ï¼and the other player commands the National Revolutionary Armyï¼åæ°é©å½è»ï¼.

In SoH, each player uses leader points to activate units in each area for moving or firing. In each turn, each player draws tactic markers respectively and roll for initiative. The units includes infantry, artillery, mortar, and engineer. The NRA side needs to hold two areas in the Hengyang City for 7 turns to win the game.

The components includes one 22*34 inches map and 180 5/8 inch die-cut counters.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area-Impulse

description:
18?? is an 1870 variant with a new map, a large selection of private companies, and some major rule changes designed to make each game play differently. The base 1870 game rules are used. The game kit includes a summary of rules differences from 1870.

The private companies vary game-to-game and players choose their company's starting city when a company opens.

A copy of 1870 is needed to play 18?? because the kits only include the new parts.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Stock Holding

name: Atlantis Rising: Medusa Unleashed
description:
Medusa was once a beautiful mortal woman, but that beauty attracted the attention of the god Poseidon. The gods saw mortals as their playthings, and Poseidon was no different. He sought out the object of his lust and seduced her while she worshipped at the temple of Athena, and then he retreated into the sea. The goddess Athena discovered the blasphemous act which had occurred within her temple, and she punished Medusa with a terrible curse. Medusa’s mind was shattered, her hair turned to snakes, and all those who gazed upon her would be turned to stone.

The wrathful gods have now come to punish the Atlanteans, sinking their island forever. Knowing that the Atlanteans are clever, Athena unleashed the gorgon, Medusa, to turn the entire populace to stone and thwart any efforts to save Atlantis. As the waters rise, you and your fellow Atlanteans must work quickly to defeat the gorgon and save your people!

Medusa Unleashed is a new module for Atlantis Rising and can be used with any player count. The new expansion introduces Monsters, persistent misfortunes that continue to hinder your progress once activated. Each round, Medusa is drawn to a random tile on the island. Any Atlantean workers on this tile are immediately turned to stone! If there are no workers present, she instead targets the populace.Petrified volunteers fill the island tile and limit the number of available action spaces.

The Artisan comes to your aid as a new playable councilor. The Artisan can create mystical items to equip your workers, granting them exciting new powers. In a twist on the ancient myth, you can even construct and use a fabled mirror shield to break Medusa’s curse! With her curse broken, Medusa turns her rage towards the gods and joins your cause, unlocked as a councilor for future games!

—description from the publisher
categories: Ancient, Civilization, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Mythology, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Police Precinct: Dice Tower Exclusive Character Set
description:
2 Character Boards that were available during the Kickstarter for Police Precinct: ONLINE!

Includes:
Richard Austria
Rapport: As a trained experience Community Resource Officer you can impact situations others can't:
At any time you can turn in a donut to add or subtract a pip to any die rolled in relation to your location if any punk tokens are also present

Respect: They look up to you, so interviewing juveniles when they are away from their cohorts works well:
At the end of your turn you may draw an investigation card from any deck if you are parked next to a lone punk token

Michelle Schroeder
Unorthodox: At any time before taking your action, you may discard any one of your police cards to temporarily increase your strength in any area by 1 (e.g. investigation goes from 2 up to 3)
Underdog: As a community service officer, you get more donuts for arresting than others (one donut for 1 or 2 punk tokens and two donuts for 3 or more punks)

Note: Richard Austria was available as part of a package during the 2016 Dice Tower Kickstarter, and Michelle Schroeder via the 2016 Dice Tower Convention in Orlando Florida.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Abeja Reina
description:
In Abeja Reina ("Queen Bee"), two players take turns moving their bee pieces on the hexagonal cells of the game board. Whoever eliminates the opponent's queen bee first wins.

The game board depicts a shared hive of sorts, with players starting on opposite sides of the board with a trench between them. The hive spaces hold only a single piece, while the trench can hold two layers of pieces. The queen bee and three workers move only one space to an adjacent hex space; the six drones move "diagonally" along a line leading away from the hex to the next hex. If you move a token onto an enemy piece in the hive, you eliminate that piece from the game.

If you move a token onto a piece already in the trench, you pin that piece; if you move a token onto an enemy that's pinning another piece, you eliminate that enemy token. When moving from the trench, workers and drones can move any number of spaces, allowing for long-range attacks. A queen can never step onto the lower level of the trench. After all, she's the queen!

name: Flamme Rouge: Dice Tower Stage Cards Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as a reward from the Dice Tower 2019 Kickstarter Campaign.

Features 5 double sided cards with one side for 2-4 players, and the other 5-6 players.

Includes:

Buonocore Boulevard
Vasel Valley
The Mandi Mile
Suz Side Road
Eric Avenue
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: ÐÐµÐ³ÐµÐ½Ð´Ñ Ð´Ð¸ÐºÐ¾Ð³Ð¾ Ð·Ð°Ð¿Ð°Ð´Ð° (Western Legends)
description: The Russian edition of Western Legends comes with two expansions already included inside the box: ÐÐµÐ³ÐµÐ½Ð´Ñ ÐÐ¸ÐºÐ¾Ð³Ð¾ ÐÐ°Ð¿Ð°Ð´Ð°: ÐÑÑÐºÐ°Ñ ÐÑÑÑÐ¸Ð½Ð° (Fistful of Extras) and ÐÐµÐ³ÐµÐ½Ð´Ñ ÐÐ¸ÐºÐ¾Ð³Ð¾ ÐÐ°Ð¿Ð°Ð´Ð°: Ð¥Ð¾ÑÐ¾ÑÐ¸Ð¹, ÐÐ»Ð¾ÑÐ¾Ð¹, ÐÐ¾Ð±ÑÑÐ¹ (The Good, the Bad, and the Handsome).
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Kawaii Chaos
description:
"The adorably chaotic card game you will love....or hate. Takes 2 min to learn, about 15 min to play and 3 min to regret your decisions." - from Kickstarter description.

Kawaii Chaos is a card game in which each player starts with a hand of 3 cards. On each turn, players draw one card and play one card. Cards may be points, which are played into a player's tableau, or action cards that protect your own point cards, destroy, nullify or steal other players' point cards, change the rules of the game, or bring the game to a premature halt. The game ends when a player reaches 500 points.

name: Supertall: Municipal Buildings
description:
You can't fight City Hall, but you can work with them. Municipal Buildings allows Supertall to be played with 4 players, and gives expanded options for 2 and 3 player games.

Adds 6 new - 4 Government plans plus an additional Business plan and Natural plan. The new government plans score 3 points per odd value of 3 points per even value.


Released in the July 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $20+ package, together with Supertall.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Devices
description:
Devices is a quick, but strategic card game about building devices in order to fulfill customer orders. In devices, you gather resources and build machines that process and change those resources in order to fulfill different customer orders. Every customer order is worth varying amounts of points.

Customer orders are placed in the middle of the table to draft along with the "parts shop", where you get the parts for your devices. Players start off with basic machine parts and 1 cube of each color. The game is played over several rounds. Players can choose between several basic actions each round: collect cubes, buy cards (using cubes), accept customer orders, build parts from your hand on to your device, dismantle your machine, or load cubes into your machine and run it. Cubes that go into your device come out in various colors and amounts--depending on the machine you've built! You can then store those cubes or use them to fulfill a customer order and get points. The first player to reach 30 points wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Rolling Realms: Underwater Cities Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Underwater Cities.

To play this realm you must build a network of cities and tunnels. Every city that is connected to the start city grants you new resources and stars. Will you complete the tunnel network and make it to 6 stars?

-description from developer

name: Le cirque de Lulu
description:
"Lulu circus" in English.

Each player receives a different illustration representing the circus spectacle.
They must find all the misplaced items.
A player draw a tile with an item.
Each player must then find it in his picture as soon as possible.
The first who shout "Given Lulu!" wins the tile.

The player who has the most tiles when all objects were found wins the game.

name: Rolling Realms: Onirim Promo Pack
description:
Expand your copy of Rolling Realms with this set of 6 promo cards, inspired by Onirim.

To play this realm, you must find your way through a mysterious dream labyrinth. Use dice to draw sun, moon, or key symbols. Open doors to gain resources. And remove nightmares to gain stars. Collect all 6 stars before you wake up.

-description from publisher

name: Colour Lines
description:
In Colour Lines, you try to reach the different colours on your game sheet as smartly as possible - with the help of two lines that get longer and longer as the game progresses! The dice show you what you have to draw – which can be tricky figures sometimes.

Whoever manages to navigate their "Colour Lines" most cleverly through the colours collects the most victory points – and those are hidden everywhere. A challenging solo mode, several variants and two different game sheets guarantee variety.

—description from the publisher

name: Dust Tactics: Recon Rangers Squad â "Recon Boys"
description:
From the publisher Website:
New expansion boxes for Dust Tactics will take your game to the next level! Featuring new tactical options for your Allied and Axis armies, these primed, unpainted miniatures will expand and enhance your existing forces.
For the Allies, speed and versatility mean staying one step ahead of the enemy. With the Recon Boys expansion, you can outfit your squads with the ability to adapt to nearly any threat.
Recon Boys excel at their primary task: scout, infiltrate, and capture. Their speed allows them to quickly find cover or control a strategic location, which makes up for their lack of firepower. Recon Boys carry a Victory machine gun that can cut through enemy troops, but with no anti-tank armaments, beware leaving them alone against armored units.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Shokudo
description:
Mr. Miyamoto has died, and now one of his 5 sons will be the heir of his great Japanese food´s restaurant. Each player represents one of the 5 brothers that will try to be enough honorable to win be in charge of the restaurant, by serving the customers...
...But beware, because the spirit of the old man is still walking around the restaurant and he may help you or mess you in a lot of troubles.

This is a card drafting game where each player starts with a different hand and level of honour. They must distribute their turn's actions to serve as many orders as they can to win the amount of honour indicated in that card. The first player to reach 10 honour points wins the game, but if an order is not served, the customer will be angry and everybody lose honour.


El Señor Miyamoto ha muerto, y ahora uno de sus 5 hijos será el heredero de su gran cadena de restaurantes. Cada jugador representa a uno de los 5 hermanos que irá atendiendo pedidos e intentará ser lo suficientemente honorable para hacerse cargo del restaurante...
...Pero tengan cuidado, porque el espíritu del viejo aún camina por el restaurante y puede ayudarte o meterte en muchos problemas.

En este juego, cada jugador comienza con un nivel diferente de honor y productos en su mano. Deben distribuir las acciones de su turno para poder atender la mayor cantidad de pedidos y ganar el honor indicado en éste. El primero en llegar a los 10 puntos de honor gana el juego, sin embargo si una orden no es atendida, el cliente se enojará, por lo que todos los jugadores perderán honor.

name: Pocket Planet
description:
Welcome to a new planet! Develop your space colony in this solo card game of strategy and resource management.

Pocket Planet is an easy to learn in-hand card game which you can play everywhere.

Theme: space exploration and planet terraforming.

Goal: Expand your colony by upgrading cards and creating combos, without running out of energy.

Gameplay : Each turn, the player will be able to choose a number of cards he wants to play (2 or 3) and then, depending on the resources produced, he'll upgrade his cards by rotating them and then move them to the back of his Plan. When the player reaches the Energy card, he loses 1 energy and he can re-arrange his plan by moving one card to generate better combos.

Creating powerful combos is key: by using 10 resources, a user can buy 1 energy and make the game last longer.

End of the game: the game ends when you reach 0 energy. You count your points to see how good an intergalactic colonist you are.

—description from designer
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Deck Construction, Ordering, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Cretaceous Rails
description:
Travel back in time to the Cretaceous era, build a rail network into the jungle, take time-traveling tourists on safari to see their favorite dinosaurs in the wild, and build a resort full of attractions to customize your strategy with exciting abilities. This quick-playing mid-weight Euro for 1-4 players features an innovative dual-action worker placement system, route building, tableau building, and resource management. Utilize the resources of the Cretaceous jungle to build the optimal combination of attractions for abilities and scoring.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Worker Placement

name: Polygone
description:
Each player has 12 bridges, each resting on two holes on a polygon board. Players rotate one bridge towards the opponent's side. Bridges that form closed polygons capture opponent bridges.

The player that captures 7 bridges is the winner.
publishers: Facabo, Giseh Verlag, Territoires d'Outre Mondes (TOM)

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing â Pegasus Expansion Pack
description: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Pegasus Expansion Pack includes one pre-painted miniature, upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Shared Dream: Night Terrors
description:
When a vicious Blood Drinker savagely hunts throughout the city, only the curse of the Moon Beast can stop it! Every night phase, players gain a chance to become the vicious Moon Beast, the only force strong enough to directly confront the Blood Drinker.

The Blood Drinker and Moon Beast can also be used as new characters to play any Shared Dream Scenario.

Darker still is the inclusion of a new Reaver type, the Malefic. Created by an abundance of Shadows, the Malefic floods the city with enemies, requiring everyone to handle the new threat.

The Malefic can be used to greatly increase the challenge of any Shared Dream scenario.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Storytelling

name: Voi, Bravi ed Infelici: Tolentino 1815
description:
"Voi, Bravi ed Infelici: Tolentino 1815" is a wargame about the Napoleonic battle of Tolentino in 1815, the decisive episode of the Austro-Neapolitan war fought by the King of Naples, Gioacchino Murat, against the Austrians led by General Federico Bianchi. This battle saw the definitive Austrian victory, with the consequent return of the Bourbons to the Neapolitan throne and is considered by some historians as the first battle of the Italian Risorgimento.

Published in italian board-wargaming magazine "ParaBellum", issue VIII.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Shadows Upon Lassadar: Siege at Dalnish
description:
The wars with the Grayking have taken their toll. Lassadar's defenses are not as they once were, the Wardens are greatly reduced in number and magic is seemingly drained from the land.

From the South now arises a new threat. Twelve dread barons have formed a pact and pledged to take Lassadar for their own. They have gathered their armies and new allies - the Trulls, hulking brutes that hurl stones like mobile catapults - and have come north to Dalnish, a border city and first line of defense against invasion, to lay siege.

The Tower of Dalnish stands ready to repel the invasion but supplies and soldiers are limited. As the Captain of the Guard, it is your responsibility to hold out long enough for reinforcements to arrive. Rally your men, ready your weapons. They are upon you.....

A solo tower siege game lasting about 20 minutes and is the first game in the 2nd Lassadar game trilogy.

You, and the forces you command, must hold out long enough until Reinforcements arrive (drawn from the Event deck). If you can succeed in this you will drive the Barons and their armies back across the Southern border. If all of your Tower’s battlements are destroyed by Enemy Units or all of your Tower Units are slain or destroyed you lose the game and Lassadar is invaded.

42 cards, divided into Defensive Units, Enemy Units and Events are payed on a 2 section game board. Each Unit has a set of attack and defensive values. Using Action Points units played by the player can be deployed, engaged and repaired.

Unique to this game are Damage Pattern footprints that players must use effectively to combat Enemy Units.

A series of Event cards act as an AI in the game changing game play as the rounds progress. These cards are drawn when sufficient damage is done to the Enemy Units

Dice counters have been provided along with the card files/player board. Players may substitute 8mm dice if they prefer.

1st Place - Best Science Fiction/Fantasy Themed Game - 2012 Solitaire PNP Contest
2st Place - Best Artwork for an Entered Game Category - 2012 Solitaire PNP Contest
Grand Prize - 2012 Solitaire PNP Contest
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rattus: Spoils of War
description:
Strange things are going on in Europe. People are disappearing and followers are changing faction. The plague appears to be stronger in some countries, but nobody really knows why. At least people are warned and new alliances are made. Let’s bring an end to this plague!

This is a mini-expansion. Rattus (base game) is required to play. For the Tamerlane card, Rattus Africanus (expansion) is required to play.

name: The Lion of Khartoum: Gordon's Last Stand
description:
"The Lion of Khartoum: Gordon's Last Stand" , designed by Jacques Rabier, is a solitaire, card-driven board wargame of strategy and resource management about the siege of Khartoum from February 1884 to January 1885. The player assumes the role of Major-General Charles “Chinese” Gordon, Governor and self-appointed defender of Khartoum, besieged by the Mahdi's Dervish rebel forces. As the Player, you will have to use your few military units and meager resources skillfully to hold out long enough for British relief forces to come to the rescue…or gloriously die like Gordon himself did.

The game is not intended to be a totally accurate simulation of the siege of Khartoum but is meant to create an interactive narrative and gaming experience in which the Player is required to make crucial decisions to have any chance of protecting the city and its inhabitants from the wrath of the Dervishes. The Player must improve the city’s fortifications, build makeshift Gunboats, mount daring raids and sorties, and tactically respond with military units and leaders to prevent the Mahdi's army from capturing key city defensive locations and, ultimately, the Governor’s Palace. All the while, you must manage to keep up the city’s morale in the face of adverse events and the continuing effects of the siege.

Are you up to the challenge, Gordon Pasha?

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Quartz: Promo Pack 1
description: On these promo pack you will find 3 pink Crystals, 5 new action cards and a small rulebook with 5 new variants to play Quartz.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That

name: Italian-Ottoman War 1911-1912
description:
"Italian-Ottoman War 1911-1912" is a two-player wargame using a variation on the system used in Windhoek (S&T #313) simulating the Italian invasion of the territories that became Libya in 1911 and the subsequent campaign that ended in the following year. The campaign saw the Italians seize the coastal towns, but the Ottomans, supported by local Arab and Bedouin tribes, fell back into the interior. The war came to an end via Italian naval attacks in the Aegean and elsewhere, with the Ottomans finally ceding Libya to Rome. This laid the foundation for the establishment of an Italian colony and had an obvious effect on the campaign in North Africa during World War II.
Scale: Each hex represents 45 kilometers, with each game turn one to two months. Units are at the battalion level.

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 176 counters.

This is the wargame contained in Strategy & Tactics Magazine #325.

name: Celestia: Matryoshburg Promo
description:
Matryoshburg City is an additional city for Celestia that was distributed at the Festival International des Jeux in Cannes in 2022.

Setup:

Place Matryoshburg City before the first city.

Rule:

At the end of a trip, place the aircraft on the Matryoshburg City. Each player chooses a bonus from the following three options:
* Draw an Equipment
* Discard one or more of the equipment cards in their hand and draw the same number again.
* Put a Treasure back under their pile and draw the one above it.

Then move the aircraft to Heolia (the first city) to begin a new trip, WITHOUT PICKING an Equipment card as is usually done.
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hidden Victory Points, Push Your Luck

name: Bus & Stop
description:
Bus & Stop is a card game in which you compete as bus drivers to bring passengers to their desired destinations, while avoiding overcrowding.

On a turn, you either pick up or drop off. To pick up, choose all of the passenger cards of one color from the row waiting at the bus stop, then place them in your bus — that is, the area in front of you, which can hold at most ten cards. Senior citizens aren't going far, so you score them immediately instead of placing them on the bus.

To drop off, choose a group of passengers on your bus that match one of the available destination cards — for example, all men, all girls, or one passenger of each color — then remove these passengers from your bus and place them under the card. You score points for each card depending on how many people you delivered at once, so aim for large groups. Whenever a player drops off, everyone else can make one of their matching passengers skedaddle, removing them from the bus and placing them in a personal scoring pile with their senior citizens.

When the bus stop can't be refilled with passengers or only a certain number of destination cards remain, the game ends. Tally your score, earning 1 point for each single card and the listed points for each destination card. If your bus is empty, congratulations! You earn a depot bonus for not stranding passengers on your bus. They will thank you for not doing that...

name: Mountain Goats: Green Valley
description:
The Green Valley is the place to be for Goats that could collect Victory Point Tokens in Mountain Goats, but the stack of Tokens already has dried out.
Move your Goat to the Green Valley and gain at least half the points in game end scoring.

—description from the publisher

name: Wheel of Intoxication
description: This is a drinking game which involves stunts and dares. A game for the adventurous. It will get very loud playing this game. Six well known drinking games are built into the game including Fuzzy Duck, A**hole, Thumbmaster, and Suck and Blow.

name: Le Tour du Monde en 80 Jours
description:
Each player steers two people, FOGG and PASSEPARTOUT in a journey Around the World in 80 Days, represented by 80 compartments. To move, players have tickets with two numbers. The first number is for FOGG and the other one is for his servant. All the players possess the same equipment. The purpose is not to finish first, but to make both of your travelers arrive in certain compartments at the same time. It is thus necessary to manage your tickets in a rational way, and naturally, the opponents have the same goal. The place is limited on compartments !


Chaque joueur dirige deux personnages, FOGG et PASSEPARTOUT dans un tour du monde en 80 jours, représentées par 80 cases. Pour avancer, ils disposent de tickets comportant d'un coté le nombre de cases pour FOGG et de l'autre le nombre de cases de son serviteur. Tous les joueurs possèdent le même équipement. Le but n'est aucunement d'arriver le premier, mais de faire arriver les deux voyageurs sur des cases particulières en même temps. Il faut donc gérer ses tickets de manière rationnelle, et bien entendu, les adversaires ont le même but. Pour corser le tout, la place est limitée sur les cases.

name: Knossos
description: This is the ancient board game from Knossos estimated 1.950 B.C. and have been recreated by Gregory Zorzos.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragon Quest 1 and 2
description:
Not two board games as the name would suggest, this is actually one board game based off the first two games in the Dragon Quest video game series.

The map is of an entire continent. You draw a quest card at the beginning of the game, and that gives you your victory conditions.

There's lots of different types of cards: other than the quest cards, there's monster cards, weapon cards, item cards, and event cards. For movement, two dice are rolled. The higher die roll is your movement. If you roll a '1' and a '6' however, then a monster appears in the center of the board.

Apart from the Japanese rulebook, there is Japanese text on most of the cards in the game, although mostly it is about two lines of text to go along with a picture.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Daisenryaku
description:
Contemporary war card game. There are six groups (mostly countries, but NATO is one of them) that fight, and each unit card is usable by only certain countries.

Air, naval, and ground attacks are all covered, and there are event cards for things like ammunition shortages as well.

name: Game of the Week: Sports Action in Baseball
description: NBC Game of the Week Baseball is a card-driven game using a simple chart, spinners, and a gridded gameboard / playing field to determine the result of each play. Each team selects a batting line-up from the two identical teams of individually-rated players (".210 medium left," ".300 heavy right," etc). The team in the field positions its players on the grid. The "pitcher" throws one of the ten blue "pitch" cards he holds at the same time the "batter" throws one of the seven red "hit" cards he holds. The two cards are indexed against the chart featured on the board. If the chart indicates the ball has been hit, the "distance" and "direction" spinners are used to indicate exactly where the ball has been hit. If that indication is the white dot of the grid on which a fielder is stationed, or an immediately adjacent dot, the out is made. Otherwise, it's a base hit, and extra bases depending on how far it is away from a fielder. There are additional rules for base runner advance, double plays, force outs, sacrifices, hit-&-run, pick-offs, and errors.

name: Weimar
description:
This game captures the political and economical going-ons of the first German republic (the so called "Weimarer Republik") from 1920-33. Players take the roles of one of the major political parties (from communists down to the Nazis), trying to win elections and have their politicians in the government. Laws are made in a roleplaying style, which change the rules of the game and influence the economics and life in Germany, while there are still reparations to be paid, and inflation threatens the economic stability.
Some parties have military and paramilitary troops which can be used to break other parties` rallies or to suppress public uprisings.
If the German Republic survives a certain number of years, the player, whose political goals are fulfilled, wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Ploughshares
description:
From the box:

In 1895 in Russia, a group of Christian villagers, believing deeply in Peace and Sharing, burned the Weapons given them by the Tsar. We become those villagers driving wagons through the countryside, visiting homes to collect Firewood & Weapons. We take these to the Village Center and make Ploughshares. Watch for the Tsar's patrolling soldiers who will confiscate our wagons and send us to prison. Learn love and courage so, with the guidance of our Wise Elders, we will remain determined in our Cause. We might even inspire some Soldiers to drop their weapons and join with us. It will be an Adventure filled with danger and great rewards. To fulfill our task, we must be gentle as a Dove and wise as a Serpent. This is a game of collaboration, learning and discussion; a game full of exciting strategy, with each of us making an important contribution.

An Esperanto version of Ploughshares was published by Esperanto AntaÅ­en in 2004 under the title "Sokoj".

name: I Giochi del 2000: Elemental Wars
description:
"Elemental Wars" is a non-collectible fantasy card game. It is played with a deck of 40 cards, 10 for each of the Element (Fire, Water, Air and Earth) with a Strength ranking from 10 to 1. The strongest cards (Strength from 10 to 6) have a Fame score of 11, 10, 4, 3 and 2 points.

The classical version is played in four, with the persons sitting in front of each other forming a team (but in the booklet there are variants for different numbers of players).

Before the game begins, one of the four players shuffles the deck and places it in front of the player to his left who must "cut" it. The dealer then distributes three cards to each of the four players (either singly or all three at once), in a counterclockwise rotation, beginning with the player on his immediate right.

He then uncovers the thirteenth card and places it prominently in the center of the table. This card, regardless of its rank, identifies the Elemental plane on which the Tournament takes place: the Dominating one. The remaining cards are usually placed, face down, as a stack on top of the Dominating card, but not obscuring it.

The game begins with the player to the dealer's immediate right, and goes around the table until the dealer has played last. Each round of four cards played constitutes a round of tournament. The winner of each rounf gathers all four cards and places them, face down, on his side of the table

The winner of each hand is determined by the Strength and the Element of the cards. The winner is the player that dropped the strongest card of the Element that has been played first on that round; but if somebody played a card of the Dominating element, the winner is the strongest of that element.

The winner of each round then draws one card from the deck. Then the others also draw one card, in sequence. Play continues until all the cards have been played.

At the end of the game the total number of Fame points is added up for each team. As there are 30 points for each Element, the maximum number of points is 120. The winner of the game is the team which scores 61 or more points. The score over 60 is kept to see which team wins the partita (the set) scoring a fixed amount of points.

The cards have to be cut from a booklet that belongs to "I giochi del duemila" ("The games of 2000") collection: a series of role-playing games, game books, wargames, card games and so on that included 23 titles. The name of the collection refers both to the end of the millennium and to the price: 2000 liras, that means 1.03 Euros, making them the cheapest games in Italy.

Reimplements:

Briscola (1800)
mechanics: Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Rules for modern naval warfare 1950-1985
description:
These rules have been designed to simulate a modern naval action involving surface ships, submarines and aircraft of todays (1980s) navies, using the recently introduced range of 1:3000 scale warships.

The rules were originally designed for a large scale naval campaign in which large numbers of ship8 would be engaged in combat. To achieve this it was necessary to generalize certain areas for the sake of playability this, whilst not giving absolute realism (which can never be achieved in a game), resulted in a very fast and enjoyable game. The rules are not designed for a single ship v. single ship combat, as it was considered “highly unlikely” that in any future Warpac/NATO conflict a solitary NATO ship would come across and fight a solitary WarPac warship. The more likely course of events 1s for the WarPac (Soviet) navies to sail (by devious routes) to prearranged rendezvous points several days before hostilities are due to commence. From there the “Task Forces” prime function would be to disrupt the American reinforcement of Europe; to intercept and destroy the Vital oil cargoes in the Arabian Gulf, off the African coast and in the Indian Ocean; to prevent the transfer of allied warships into and out of the Mediterranean, and to harass the US Pacific Fleet (with the idea of drawing forces from the Atlantic to keep the Pacific Fleet “in being” to counter any threat in the Pacific) A further option open to the Soviets would be to use the obsolete Kynda class cruisers to bombard US coastal cities with their long range missiles, compelling the US to keep back warships to protect their own coasts.

In any of the above scenarios the Soviets would use their ships ‘en masse’ to achieve their objectives. It was with those actions in mind that these rules were written, to enable the Wargamer to fight through the Atlantic convoys, to endeavor to keep the oil flowing or to fight for the glory of the revolution and crush the wicked capitalists (even if it costs you your life comrade). It is hoped that the users of these rules do know something of modern warships and win use this set as the basis of a campaign involving a number of wargamers as it is only when there are large numbers of ships involved that the maximum enjoyment can be obtained.

Scale
1 move = 2.5 minutes
1 inch = 1km
2mm/turn = 1knot

name: Hardy Boys Treasure Game
description:
In The Hardy Boys Treasure Game, private detective Fenton Hardy has agreed to let his boys (Frank and Joe - The Hardy Boys) help search for Mr. Applegate's missing doubloons, stolen 10 years ago.

In this roll-and-move children's game, players move along a winding path picking up Gold Doubloons which will allow them to acquire extra Bags of Gold at the Water Tower before racing to the Finish Line. The goal is to be the first to reach the Finish Line with at least 1 Bag of Gold.

Game Play
On your turn, roll the die, then move your pawn that number of spaces. After the first turn, you can choose to move either forward or backward, but you can never land on an occupied space. If you can't move the full number on the die in either direction without ending on an occupied space, you forfeit your turn. If you land on a space marked Message Card, take a message card and follow its instructions.

Along the track to the Water Tower and Finish Line, you can make detours to pick up gold doubloons. You do not have to roll exactly to reach a gold doubloon space, you can end your movement on the gold space and attempt to acquire it by rolling the number next to it. If you are successful, pick up the gold. If not, you'll have to return to the main track on your next turn, then try again if you want.

When you reach the ladder to the Water Tower, you move up the ladder toward the top space marked Take Gold. You must reach the Take Gold space by exact roll. Once there you can take one Bag of Gold, plus one additional Bag for each doubloon you've collected.

Then it's back down the ladder and a race to the Finish. Once you enter the area between the Water Tower and the Finish, you can not move back out of it. Watch out for the Black Spaces. If you land on a Black Space without a Bag of Gold on it, you'll have to place one of your bags of gold on it. If, however, there is already a Bag of Gold there, you can claim that Bag of Gold.

The first player to reach the Finish, by exact count, with a Bag of Gold, wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Last Action Hero 3-D Board Game
description: Enjoy the fun and adventure of the Last Action Hero movie in this easy to play three-dimensional game. Players travel from the real world to the movie world and back by using their magic movie tickets just like Danny does in the movie. But, watch out for the villains. Will Jack Slater be able to help you? Players try to be the first to complete the 3 scenes of the Last Action Hero movie and get back to Danny's house.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Starbattles: Mainline
description: Includes - 28 pages of rules, one 24" x 24" map-sheet, 17 Control Sheet Diagrams, 1 Combat Reference Diagram, 180 counters. An intermediate-level game of tactical space combat. The Designer's Notes state Starbattles is a game that was originally designed as a modification of another game, but meant to be a separate game." That other game is clearly Task Force Games' Starfire. The ship component system here is similar, but components are positioned on a hex diagram rather than being written in a single line.

name: Ship Ahoy
description: Two to six players race yachts around Long Island Sound through a diamond grid. Movement is by deal of a card with “wind” (event) cards adding a gust of uncertainty. There are simple rules for tacking, the wind direction changing and the possible “blanketing” a yacht downwind of another.

name: Chessapeak Challenge Chess
description: This is Truly a 4 player chess game that works and is fun to play! It can be played in 2, 3 or 4 player mode. With 2 or 4 players you play with 4 sets of pieces and the pieces opposite to each other are partners or teams. The object is to checkmate the other team Kings... so you need 2 checkmates to win ... or a checkmate and a stalemate to win! The Beauty of this game is when your team first gets checkmated you don't lose all that players pieces! Depending on what configuration everyone agreed on at the start of the game determines what pieces are removed when a checkmate occurs. So everybody stays in the game.... right to the end! Piece movement is the same as traditional 2 player chess... with just a few variations that are easy to learn.

name: And Then There Were None (Ten Little Indians)
description:
At the beginning of each game, all players are dealt several numbered cards. The player that is holding card number one in his hand , is the murderer for that game. The opponent who, by logical reasoning, first names the murderer and the cards the murderer is holding, wins the game. If the murderer names his opponents cards before being discovered, the murderer wins the game.

The rarest game in Ideal's Famous Mystery Classic series that also includes Fu Manchu's Hidden Hoard, Murder on the Orient Express and The Case of the Elusive Assassin.
mechanics: Area Movement, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Hidden Roles, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: What Happens Next
description:
This "Extension" Variant is for use with the Battle for Moscow FREE game by Game Designers' Workshop (GDW Games), which first appeared in "BattlePlan" Magazine, issue #7, by Thomas M. Kane.

This expansion allows the Soviet Player a means of continuing the game to 'play out' the Soviet Winter Counter-Offensive. There is a *NEW* set of Victory Conditions based upon victory points in which they are attained by eliminating enemy units, capturing cities and holding them by the time the game ends. For the Germans, there is a *BONUS* if they Capture Moscow.

This Variant has a Winter Effects Table, a means for Replacements to effect the creation of a Soviet 'Tank Army', and an extended Turn Record Track to display the entire *NEW* Game's length (including the Turns from the beginning of Battle for Moscow, which is required in order to play this).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Palet
description: Palet is a traditional French game, mechanically very similar to the well-known boules, but requiring significantly greater dexterity to play well. Cast iron, slightly convex disks are thrown onto a soft-wooden board ("la planche") from a distance of 5 metres. Players attempt to throw their palets closest to the "master Palet" (le maitre / the jack). Each Palet a player lands nearer to the jack than their opponents' palets counts one point. First player to reach 12 points wins the game. The more you play Palet, the more the board cuts up with dents and divots. When "la planche est faite" this adds to the unpredictable behavior and charm of the game.

name: Sackwas
description:
Each player has a man and a woman and starts on 16 fields a large common wood plan, which consists of the square wooden tiles. The goal of the game is it to fulfill as the first three different from five different victory conditions : be the first on level 3 OR 1 win one fight OR deliver 4 equal Nuggets OR deliver 3 Nuggets in 2 colors OR deliver 1 Nugget in 5 different colors . If one wants to fulfill a victory condition, which already a fellow player fulfilled, one must exceed this, therefore, for example be the first on level 4 or win 2 fights.

Who´s turn it is, can always do 2 actions:
1) move a figure one space, or bring it back into the game or move and fight or exchange partners.
2) Implement an action with the man or the woman.

The Action of the man exists in collecting Nuggets. He draws a Nugget from the Nugget bag and compares the color with the wood tiles around himself.
