Roughly translated from the back of the box:

"4 by 4 Go" is a puzzle game designed by pro Go player Chang Hsu (AKA Cho U 9 dan) for his four-year-old daughter, which is based on the rules of Go. The name comes from there being 4 lines to play on, each line being called "RO" (1ro, 2ro, 3ro, etc) and "YON" meaning the number four.

Instead of the black and white stones common to Go, the game uses red and green discs resembling apples and the board has been made to look like a tree. Included is a booklet of puzzles questions for children to think about and arrange on the board to try solving with friends and family.

Once the first step of basic challenges has been completed, a 2 player Go-like game called "Stone Capture" (ishi o toru) can be played. [Players take turns placing apples (stones), capturing each others stones until either the opponent has no place to play or the board is dominated by one color.]

The box set includes:
15 Red Apples
15 Green Apples
Question Booklet
4x4 Go Board

name: Classified: Special Operations Missions 1940-2010
description:
From publisher website:

"From covert actions against insurgent groups and daring sabotage missions to precision strikes against fortified positions and reconnaissance deep behind enemy lines, the special forces units deployed by many nations are the spearhead of modern combat operations. "Classified", the latest companion volume for Force on Force, allows wargamers to recreate any and all of them. With detailed background information, extensive orders of battle for the world's preeminent special forces units, and a range of scenarios, "Classified" gives Force on Force players a detailed and realistic experience of modern special operations missions across the globe."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: Football Bones
description:
Using individually rated player cards and dice "Bones" players select from 10 run or 6 pass plays on offense, and 12 defenses to play a simple to learn, yet very detailed game of football. Football Bones builds off the original Statis Pro model by Jim Barnes and updates to a Base-10 system allowing for greater variability and realism in the results. Advanced statistics previously unavailable have allowed us to come up with the most accurate player cards and that translates to accurate play on the field!

Play by Play has been studied and every ball handler in the game now more accurately reflects on-field performance. 3 yards and a cloud of dust, yup we have that!

One of the beauties of the original Statis Pro system was and is the simplicity. Cover 2, Cover 3 it’s in there, Wildcat got it!, 6 Offensive lineman got it!, 3 Tight Ends got it! More plays and strategies, weather rules, a new model for quarterbacks and ball handlers. Solo, league, and replay tested…… All the fun and excitement of the original Statis Pro game is there and we’ve added so much more……

name: Primary Moves
description:
In this game of tactics & luck, you try to outsmart your opponent(s) by conquering their pawns, jumping yourself to your Home Zone and taking the best spots on the board.
In this abstract game, the players try to get their pawns from their starting position in the oppenents Home zone, to their own Home Zone on the other end of the board.
This is done by throwing two dice, which have the primary colours, a black, a white & a joker side on them. By strategically using these colors you can jump forward, take over enemy pawns and get into waiting rooms or your home zone.
The first player to get all their pawns in their Home Zone, wins the game.

Authors note.
Primary moves is actually not as abstract as it first appears once you have played it. The board appearance is random for a reason, that was how I could build player 3 and 4 into the game.

The original games relies a lot on luck and quick decision making due to the fact that the drive mech is dice.
The end of 2015 saw a "couldnt see the wood through the trees" breakthough and allowed a new mech to be added in the form of cards that turn the table on the luck factor, making it a more pleasurable game for the planners and thinkers among us, all be it still very light to play.

what still never ceases to amaze me is how many variations and styles this 1 simple game can have all based on a few super simple rules.

name: Swatters: Large Scale Bug Hunting Miniatures Rules
description:
Based on the Song of Blades engine and written by Andrea Sfiligoi, Swatters lets players create sci-fi battles between humans and alien bugs from books, movies or their own imagination.

Each player or team pits their human or alien forces against their opponent using miniatures and a tabletop area to create a battlefield. The game includes rules for adapting several popular tropes (power armor, xenomorph aliens, alien arachnids, interstellar marines, etc.) and has several scenarios to play through.

Currently sold as a 45 page full-color PDF download from the publisher. The game is based on the Song of Blades miniature wargame engine that's been used for everything from fantasy to ancients to Napoleonic warfare.

name: Monopoly: Brave Collector's Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Brave Collector's Edition of Monopoly follows the heroic journey of Merida through the rugged Scottish Highlands. From the private chambers of DunBroch Castle where Merida first defies tradition, to the Wise Woman's cottage, where she is granted her ill-fated wish, join the adventure with King Fergus, Queen Elinor and the mischievous triplets as you buy, sell and trade your way through the kingdom and learn the true meaning of bravery. The game is based off of Pixar 's first fairy tale film, Brave and is released by Walt Disney Pictures.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: AT-43 Army Box: Cogs
description:
2000 point value army for the fifth playable faction for the AT-43 franchise.

Box Contents
• 1 unit of 4 Warmongers: basic super-soldiers
• 1 unit of 4 Sharpshooters: elite super-soldiers
• 1 Prowler: basic combat strider
• 1 Vandal: the most powerful Cog combat strider
• 3 heroes from the C-Naps line: C-Naps G09, C-Naps G36 and C-Naps G45
• 3 high walls
• 1 container
• Introductory Rules
• 1 Cog tactical manual
• 1 game poster
• 12 dice
• 1 “Cog” ruler
• 1 explosion template
• 8 game cards
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Fire Toad U.N.A.
description:
Toads are the Type * AFV of the UNA in AT-43 and come in four different flavours. Toads are quick with 25 movement, They are deadly, with a wide assortment of weapon loadouts for every situation, and they are cheap. While not having the armour of the Red Blok, Toads are very resilient when in a Mind company. This list gives all AFV’s a repair for free so a unit of 3 toads can repair 3 damage a turn. This is before you even start to throw Steel Trooper Engineers into the mix. The toads are fairly quick and are great for flanking the enemy.

Fire Toad
armed with 2 laser guns the Fire Toad is the jack of all trades. It can take out everything from afv’s to infantry. This is the most common variant of toad used in many lists because of this fact.

Light Prince
A hybrid between the Iron Rain and the Fire Toad, the light prince packs a MG and a laser gun. It is able to throw 3 mg shots and 1 lasergun shot at its target. It still retains the ability to engage AFVs while being able to put out enough fire to have a hope of killing infantry that are in cover.

Iron Rain
This guy is a battlesuit killing machine. A full unit of Iron Rain’s put out 18 MG shots a turn. When shooting at a type *** infantry unit in full cover you’re bound to score a few wounds due to the sheer number of dice. The Lancelot is better suited to killing more lightly armoured units and grounding those suits that don’t have stability (Red Blok and Therians). if you’re taking these guys, its to neutralize your opponents ungroundable battlesuits. Otherwise you’re better off with Lancelots.

Lancelot
The Lancelot is an infantry killing monster. with 2 grenade launchers it puts out a lot of indirect fire. Note that the card is a misprint and each grenade launcher only gets 1 shot instead of the printed 3. Even still, a unit of 2 of these guys can get the all important double damage template. This weapon grounds units and ignores cover so it is a better choice if you are facing Red Blok or Therians as their type *** infantry can still be grounded.

Contains:
-1 figurine: Fire Toad Mk IV, 2 light grenade launchers, 2 light laser cannons, 2 light MG
-8 cards - Fire Toad, Fire Toad Sgt., Fire Toad Light Prince, Fire Toad Light Prince Sgt., Fire Toad Iron Rain, Fire Toad Iron Rain Sgt., Fire Toad Lancelot, Fire Toad Lancelot Sgt.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: AT-43 Unit Box: Hekat Golgoth
description:
The Hekat is a light combat strider based on an ancient design, whose function is long forgotten. Terribly efficient in contact (it can even threaten even the mighty support golgoths), It moves at lightening speed and can carried out simple handling tasks such as moving low walls.

Paradoxically, this golgoth intended for close combat, is the dreaded enemy of any armored fighting vehicle! At first, the concept was met by the extremely fierce opposition of the most traditionalist overseers until it proved its efficiency on the battlefield.

Speed is the Hekat’s main asset. No other golgoth serving at the moment can challenge it in that field. Its powerful grim scythes allow it to tear through the thickest of armor. As for the infantry, it hardly needs any chewing.

The combination of its maneuverability and the simplicity in the use of its armament make it a remarkable armored fighting vehicle unit, whose deployment and use are exceptionally straightforward: Full throttle ahead, hit anything standing in the way, trample the infantry and slash through as many enemy striders as you can find until the unavoidable surrender.

This unit box contains a unit of 1 miniature, 3 low walls and 2 reference cards for AT-43.The Hekat is a light combat strider based on an ancient design, whose function is long forgotten. Terribly efficient in contact (it can even threaten the mighty support golgoths), It moves at lightening speed and can carried out simple handling tasks such as moving low walls.

Paradoxically, this golgoth intended for close combat, is the dreaded enemy of any armored fighting vehicle! At first, the concept was met by the extremely fierce opposition of the most traditionalist overseers until it proved its efficiency on the battlefield.

Speed is the Hekat’s main asset. No other golgoth serving at the moment can challenge it in that field. Its powerful grim scythes allow it to tear through the thickest of armor. As for the infantry, it hardly needs any chewing.

The combination of its maneuverability and the simplicity in the use of its armament make it a remarkable armored fighting vehicle unit, whose deployment and use are exceptionally straightforward: Full throttle ahead, hit anything standing in the way, trample the infantry and slash through as many enemy striders as you can find until the unavoidable surrender.

name: Nuclear Renaissance: The Tome of Tridlins
description: This is a major expansion for the game Nuclear Renaissance. It adds a full campaign system, along with hundreds of options for building gangs. It includes full rules for new gangs including mutants, beasts, zombies, robots, military forces, hover boarders, flying vehicles, boring machines and much more.

name: Blitzkrieg: The Reich Ascendant 1939 - 1942 â A Supplement for I Aiin't Been Shot, Mum!
description: Blitzkrieg - This supplement contains details for organising and fielding forces for the early years of the war in Europe, from the invasion of Poland up to Stalingrad this supplement has full details for using the following forces with I Ain't Been Shot, Mum! Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Great Britain, Holland, Hunagry, Italy, Norway, Poland, Romania, Slovakia and the Soviet Union. AFV and weapon stats are included along with national characteristics and details of what cards to use to best represent your armies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: This Land Divided: Skirmishes and Battles in Wilkes County February and March 1779
description:
This scenario supplement for Sharp Practice is set in Georgia in the American War of Independence and focusses on the campaign fought between loyalist, rebel and Indian forces during February and March 1779.

Meticulously researched by native Georgian, Chris Stoesen, this supplement presents twelve scenarios set in Wilkes County, Georgia during 1779, along with a comprehensive historical background, analysis of the troops who fought in the area, troop ratings for miltias and regular forces, and complete rule amendments to allow the gamer to use the main rules for this campaign in an American Revolution setting. Each scenario has a full colour map, briefings for both sides and umpire's notes to assist the game organiser
categories: American Revolutionary War, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: Bulwark: Tower of Secret Lore
description:
From publisher description:

Heroic Co-operative Deck-Building!

The Tower of Secret Lore is the acvademy where all mages are taught, and where the Council that keeps them in order meets and works. The main tower is host to an almost impossible number of floors, with huge buttresses and parapets reaching out from it and containing entire rooms themselves. Shining with crackling magelight, it is an unmistakeable landmark.

More Spells, More Problems

The Tower of Secret Lore is a new Location deck, fully compatible with other Bulwark decks. Its defence presents new challenges for experienced Bulwark players, but it equally suitable for new players. It has particular synergy with the new Hero decks Magister Kelemen, Magistra Csenge and Jakab Startouched.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Smash Bros. Melee Battle Cards
description:
Super Smash Bros. Melee Battle Cards is a 52 card game that came free in an issue of Official Nintendo Magazine.

Each player selects five cards from the character select pile. Next, each player randomly chooses one of their cards and places it in the middle. Turn over one of the stage cards to see which stage you'll be playing on.

Up moves beat down moves, down moves beat left/right moves and left/right moves beat up moves.

The player with the most cards after five rounds is the winner.
publishers: HAL Laboratory, Inc., Nintendo Co., Ltd.

name: The Outcast Heroes: Alternative Missions
description:
An exclusive double-sided promo sheet available at Spiel 2013 in Essen.

Playing The Outcast Heroes, you will become a commander of a Polish underground military unit and fight against Communism. The USSR wants to include Poland in its influence zone, but there are still people who resist and stand up for independence. Will you manage to stop the red plague?

The Outcast Heroes: Alternative Missions is a double-sided promotional item that can replace the "Free the prisoners" special mission card with two new missions, with alternative rules and different difficulty levels. Both sides of the item show real prison buildings from the communist times in Poland.

name: The Blackjack River
description:
The Blackjack River formerly known as Rivers is a solitaire tile-placement and set collection standard deck playing card game.

Ace through 10 represent river segments, each pip represents a fish. The face cards represent fishermen that can fish at a river segment or from the top of your deck.

Play river segments and fishermen to form distributaries of 21 fish off of the Blackjack River. Once the river runs dry, tally your score based on the amount and composition of fish and fisherman in your distributaries. Distributaries with pairs and triples of the same color or suit score more points!
mechanics: Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: ASL Comp: Bir el Gubi â Italian Redemption in the Desert
description:
Bir el Gubi is an expansion for Advanced Squad Leader that uses the Platoon Leader campaign game system.

From the Publisher:

Bir el Gubi is a cross-roads on the Trigh el abd and the route from el Adem to el Guasc. It was the location of a fierce struggle during Operation Crusader, a deployment of armor the British hoped would rid them of Rommel's aggression in the Western Desert and end the seige of Tobruk. It would not come to pass, partly due to unanticipated Italian resistance. British historian Richard Humble stated the following about Italy's performance during Operation Crusader, "…Crusader should be remembered as the battle in which the Italian army can claim to have recovered its self respect". Bir el Gubi served as an unexpected redemption in North Africa for the maligned Italian Army.

BIR EL GUBI FOR PLATOON LEADER 3.0 includes: North Africa Italian MMC/SMC counters and color overlays. The CG plays on geomorphic desert boards and provides new hill, small desert village, and desert track overlays.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Monopoly: Pittsburgh Steelers Super Bowl XL Champions Collector's Edition
description: The “Steel Curtain” has done it again! America’s favorite board game proudly presents the Pittsburgh Steelers XL Champions Collector’s Edition. Buy, sell, and trade the team’s stellar offense including Ben Roethlisberger, Hines Ward and Santonio Holmes and own their tough defense showcasing Troy Polamalu, James Harrison and Aaron Smith, in an effort to own the NFL’s best. Celebrate the Steelers’ unprecedented Super Bowl championship in this American classic, MONOPOLY!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Seattle Mariners
description: The classic Monopoly game with a Seattle Mariners theme. Beloved Mariners Players & Coaches replace the classic Monopoly properties. Ichiro and Safeco Field replace Park Place and Boardwalk. Home and Away Jersey cards replace classic Chance & Community Chest cards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tactica: An Historical Approach to Ancient Wargaming â Supplement Book 1
description:
Includes more armies, special rules, and clarifications/errata to Tactica.

New armies:
Armenian
Pontic
Late Roman
Early Gothic
Hun
Sassanid Persian
Late Byzantine
Ghuzz
Bulgar
Arab Empire
Lombard
Saxon
Viking
Norman
Sumerian
Mongol
Hungarian
Hsiung-Nu
Han Chinese
Early Japanese
Middle Japanese
Late Japanese

Clarifications/Errata include:
Catafract Units
Elephants
Macedonians vs Indians
Exhausted Units - The 25% Rule

name: Snowball Wars
description:
Snowball Wars has simplified game mechanics and the player usually controls a team of combatants. Events occur to interrupt the regular game by way of Wildcards drawn from a deck of cards whenever the attacker and defender roll the same number during combat.

Snowball Wars is a Print and Play minigame complete with full rules, figures, terrain, bases, game tiles and game cards.

You will need a colour printer, cutting tools, glue, foamcore and time. Assembly instructions are included.
a great introduction to tactical gaming for little ones.

Nominated for the 2012 Ennies Best Miniature Product Award

name: Password Lightning Round Card Game
description: The classic word association game of clever communication. Get your partner to guess the secret Password by giving one word clues. However, the classic game is now on the clock as you race to get as many Password cards as you can in 60 seconds. The Person with the highest score wins after three rounds.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Police Precinct: The Kit
description:
The Kit is a collection of Expansionary items for Police Precinct.

There have been several variations of "The Kit" over the years. The original Kit was designed for owners of the 1st Edition, then came one that focused on the needs of the 2nd Edition owners, and several versions have come since.

Basically the Kit grows with each new expansionary item that is released (as it is added to the package).

FULL MONTY:
Another type of Kit came out in early 2016 known as "The Full Monty". This one was (and still is) designed to help owners of the 1st Edition to Upgrade toward the 2nd Edition by swapping-out certain components:
The board (This is the 2nd Edition Board which includes The Unterbelly)
All of the Characters (This is the 2nd Edition Character array which includes 8 new characters and perfect gender balance)
All of the cards (both the larger cards and smaller, including the very popular 2nd Edition Event Deck)
The rulebook (The book supplied with The Full Monty is the Revised 1st Edition Rulebook which was the inspiration and template for the 2nd Edition book)
As an added bonus, the Full Monty also includes a copy of Crooked Lawyers.

STILL IN PRINT:
To see the versions of "The Kit" that are still in print from Common Man Games, visit the CMG website. Specifically this page...
www.commonman.com/2e

EARLY VERSIONS:
Looking back in time, here are the first two versions of the Kit:

1st Edition Kit INCLUDES:
The Heat (mini-expansion)
Rioting Gangs (Booster-Pack)
Mad Men 5-Pack (Booster-Pack, minus one card of the original 6-pack)
Promo Cards (Rocket Launcher & Dirty Bomb)
And...
The Revised Rulebook

2nd Edition Kit INCLUDES:
The Heat (mini-expansion)
Rioting Gangs (Booster-Pack)
Mad Men 5-Pack (Booster-Pack, minus one card of the original 6-pack)
Promo Cards (Rocket Launcher & Dirty Bomb)
This Kit is exactly like the 1st Edition Kit except that it does NOT have a Revised Rulebook (because the 2nd Edition will come stocked with the 2nd Edition rulebook).

“Anyone who owns Police Precinct should own the Kit too!”

name: Sorcerous Futures
description:
"You are sorcerous investors, speculating on the fates of various people and places. You might risk your sorcerous gravitas on the Forest and the Huntress, only to lose it all when a bad moon rises in the end. Or you might get a bargain on a Sailor and a Journey, striking it rich when your ship comes in on a favourable wave."

An arcane commodity speculation game of bidding and bluffing, where players attempt to purchase the most valuable cards with limited information about what their true worth will be. This information takes the form of cards dealt at the beginning, known only to their owner.

The game is played in turns, with each turn an auction. The active player chooses one card to put up for bidding, and the highest bidder pays the bank and takes the card. At the end of the game, the hidden cards are revealed and determine the worth of each purchased card, which the bank pays out. The richest player is the winner.

name: Next England Captain
description:
Fight to create the best career in the mad world of football! Use cards to build your stories and triumph in this quickfire game.

Next England Captain is a two to four player card game that faithfully models the career of a modern footballer; a challenge for everyone who's ever failed to earn millions by kicking things really well.

Welcome to a world where your celebrity wife matters more than the club you play for, but only if you have the right promo deals. It's a world where your status in the squad matters - but not very much - and where retirement is just another opportunity. Here, becoming England Captain has less to do with your footballing ability and more to do with whether you’re married with kids.

Starting with nothing, you gain points as you move to bigger clubs, increasing your on-field stature, sponsorship, and your off-field respect. Careers may go down as well as up - so you won't have it all your own way - but capping it all off with a wise retirement can make all the difference. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Storytelling

name: KiCKeT!: ARENA
description:
KiCKeT!-ARENA brings tabletop fantasy gaming to the floor with huge 10″ (25cm) miniatures that you push around your battle arena with your foot. It is a turn-based action, dexterity and tactical game. It is similar to the game Blood Bowl, but mixes in elements from curling and real soccer. With the special abilities and constantly expanding races, weapons and spells, you can fight over the control of the ball and then actually shoot at a miniature goal to score.

Actually, our greatest unique feature is that we take all of the action to the FLOOR! Rather than small miniatures on a table in a virtual environment, we have huge miniatures you actually kick and slide around in any environment; whether that is your living room, your yard, at the beach, on the street. You can play almost anywhere.

Our game puts you in control, using your own tactics, dexterity, and shooting action, rather than letting the dice decide the outcome. Another great feature of KiCKeT!-ARENA is that you can play with our basic rules for a simpler and faster game, or with our advanced rules that turn the game into a strategic battle.

Build your team with different talents, weapons and magic to play KiCKeT! in your very own arena set up in your living room, garden, backyard or even at the beach!

KiCKeT! Arena mixes up fantasy games and soccer to create a kicking, passing, and fighting action game.

Our curved solid wooden bases make the figures slide over many different surfaces including grass, carpet, and sand. With the addition of a base sock or an asphalt glider, you can even play on tile, laminate, hardwood, stone, or asphalt. Play almost anywhere!

In the future, we plan to offer even more figures, weapons, spells, abilities and obstacles to expand gameplay.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Simulation

name: Bunny Money Gunny
description: In this micro game, there are three types of cards: Bunny, Money, and Gunny. Players secretly select cards that allow them to put their meeples into lines next to the matching cards in the play area, and to rearrange the order of the cards in the play area. The first two meeples in line then get to hop to different lines (Bunny), or eliminate opposing meeples (Gunny), or score points (Money). The first player to score 5 points wins.

name: Monopoly: Juicy Couture
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μÏνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεá¿ν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other (fancy) elements of Juicy Couture, a brand name.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Blackberry Dice
description:
Picking Blackberries is a tricky thing. You can get caught on thorns, or inadvertently pick a berry full of well-disguised worms. But if you're careful, you wind up with a bucket of delicious fruit for basically free, so that's nice.

Blackberry Dice is a simple game that uses three custom dice. Players roll three times, Yahtzee-style, and get points for each Blackberry on the dice when they're done. Thorns can't be rerolled, and worms will eat the berries right off the dice. After each player has five turns, the one with the most berries wins.

name: Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #10
description:
The Mayfair Games' Limited Edition Promo Expansion Set #10 is composed of two expansions:

Bedpans & Broomsticks: Crazy Closets
Includes 2 Closet Tiles. During setup, place the two Crazy Closets tiles by the play area. When drawing a new tile, a player can opt to draw a closet tile instead.

Whitewater: Jutting Jetties
Includes 2 River Hex Tiles. You may place either or both of the 3-hex tiles anywhere on your river boards as long as two of the three hexes line up with river hexes underneath. Treat these tile river features as you would any on the standard the board tiles (sic). These tiles do not move during gameplay.

This is available in Game Trade Magazine (Issue 175 - Sep 2014).

name: Dungeon Twister: Father Christmas
description:
(5/1) (Goodies Christmas 2007)


The player who controls Father Christmas must select the contents of his bag before the beginning of the game.



The bag holds a useless toy (cursed object), a useful toy (common object: rope, key, or torch), a magical toy (ring, scroll, etc...) and a warrior toy (weapon, armor...).



The selected toys are put on the side of the board and cannot be chosen by the team that has Father Christmas (except for the common objects).



When he is adjacent to a characters, friend or enemy, Father Christmas can, for 1 AP, offer him one of the toys in his bag.



If the character already had an object (or two objects, in the case of the Paladin and Ice Witch), the object is given to Father Christmas in exchange.



If Father Christmas is already carrying one object, the object being given to Father Christmas is discarded.



Father Christmas can use the Flying Carpet (Lands of Ice expansion) without discarding combat cards.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Tooth: Kickstarter Backer Inspired Cards
description: This is a five card Super Tooth expansion inspired by backers of the Super Tooth Kickstarter. This expansion includes the cards: Abydosaurus, Pack Hunters, Tectonic Shift, Brood Parasite, and Dino Bones. Two additional cards, the Kickstarter Backer Inspired Cards reference card and the Dino Bones reference card, provide an explanation and rules for each card in the expansion.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Prehistoric

name: OrzeÅ 1943
description:
Expansion to Kursk 1943 that covers fights around city of OrzeÅ in the second half of july 1943, fought between German 2nd Panzer Army and Russian Front BriaÅski.

Game was published in 37 issue of "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Tampica
description:
Theme: You are a rich man from Mexico at the turn of the 19th century that has a hacienda in the surrounding regions of the newly founded city of Tampica. Tampica is a developing city under the yoke of General Santa Anna. The General in charge of this part of Mexico, rules with an iron fist this new city. Unfortunately, responsibilities prevent him to pursue his ambitions for military expansion. He therefore summons the richest people in the region (the players) to erect the city as well as produce the greatest possible weapons. As a reward, he promises to offer the keys to the city to the best candidate.

Gameplay: Players will have to send their workers to explore the surrounding regions to discover beds of resources and materials. They will fight for control of these resources, exploit them to construct various buildings, which in turn will enable them to build tools, pistols, rifles and machine guns, aiding them in production or combat. When the General is satisfied with a player, he gives him victory points.

Goal: Earn the most victory points during the game, the points represent that the General is satisfied with a player. Points are given to those who control the resources, that construct buildings, that produce weapons and that use certain special buildings.

name: Creepy Towers
description: Creepy Towers is a "story box full of games & surprises!" Within Creepy Towers there is a board game, short story, jigsaw puzzle, and deck of unique cards. The board game's objective is to race to random locations on the board and be the first player to collect three "ghouls" and then reach the finish space.

name: Malifaux: Arsenal Box â Ten Thunders (Wave 1)
description: We're entering a new world of hurt and this box contains all the guns, swords , and brutality you will need for you to survive your next fight. Inside, you will find every single stat and upgrade card for Ten Thunders featured in the second edition book. Now fight for your spot at the top of this twisted food chain.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures

name: Hordes: High Command â Castle of the Keys Campaign Expansion
description:
The Castle of the Keys has been a center of power since ancient times and then served as a lair for Pyromalfic, a dragon of immeasurable power. Multiple armies converged on the castle to wage a war of mutual obliteration, forcing Pyromalfic to the surface for his cataclysmic last stand. This battle shook the foundations of western Immoren. Will you endure it or be destroyed?

Customize your deck with powerful new cards and take command of the pivotal events of this historic war in the Castle of the Keys campaign expansion. Recreate one of the wars that changed the face of the Iron Kingdoms, and rewrite history!

name: Ogre: Uncommon Ogres Sponsored Counter Sheets
description:
Ogre Designer's Edition Sheets E5 & E6.
Sponsored by Walt Freitag.

Sheet E5 has a Mark III, Mark V, Admin Building, Laser Tower, and Turret in arctic dazzle colors. It also has a damaged Combine Mark III and a "marauder" faction Mark III.

Sheet E6 has a "Sons of Old Nassau" Mark III, as well as a Vatican Mark III, Mark V, Admin Building, Laser Turret and Tower (all compatible with the Barbarians at the Gate sponsored sheets). It also has a Nihon Mark III (compatible with the Nihon Empire sponsored sheet).

This product is a limited edition and no more than several thousand will ever be made.

name: Hylaria
description:
Like the name suggest, Hylaria is a game that invites you and a group of friends (or strangers) to have a wonderfully idiotic time. Set in a world that makes little sense, teams of players try to telegraph the content of their cards to their mates, without their opponents finding out what they mean.

Taught in under a minute, but endlessly replayable because the game taps into the creative nature of human beings.

name: Big Chain of Command: The Big Battle Notes
description:
From the publisher's website:

Our notes for playing large games of Chain and Command are simple and easy to add. They allow you to field one platoon per player for some really large games, and as they are so simple we’ve given them a simple name: Big Chain of Command. They are a no-frills set notes which, in truth, leave the main game rules are pretty much unchanged. We just have a few tweaks to the Force Morale in order to reflect the various platoons reacting to what is going on with friendly forces on the same table.

For the most part Big Chain of Command is really just notes to be read before the game. They show you how to rate your armoured platoons – tanks have always been support options in the past, you can now field whole platoons of them – and how to run through the patrol phase and game set up for the bigger version of the rules. The great news is that as the turn sequence in Chain of Command is not reliant on drawing chits, cards or dice, the system doesn’t slow down with multiple players and the core rules remain exactly the same throughout, so no great learning curve to embark on with Big Chain of Command!

To make things easy, we have added a number of pages to show how the various nations organised their armoured platoons so that you can follow historical precedent or just form an ad hoc “kampfgruppe” from the vehicles in your collection. However you enjoy your games, you’ll find that Big Chain of Command allows you to play these great rules in a more sociable big game atmosphere. You can download the Big Chain of Command notes for free here: Big Chain of Command.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Golem Arcana: Gudanna Expansion â The Khan's Pyre
description: The Great Khan carved out his Dominion with the secrets ar Arcanum Gudanna. Forged from soil and blood, these Golems attack with unrelenting speed and ruthless tactics.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Monegassen Ramsch
description:
Monegassen Ramsch contains one Dimension Card and 32 play cards (Ramsche). At the start of the game every player has seven cards on his hand and an empty discard pile in front of him. The goal is to get rid of your cards by placing them into the other player's discard pile. You get points for every card that's in the other players's discard pile.

The main mechanic is similar to Ramschrounds in Skat plus four special effects cards. As you play you can always choose in which discard pile you want to play your card. Sometimes you want to play them in your own, because of these effects like "mirror the discard piles" etc.

name: Dorado
description:
Dorado in the line SPIEL-O-THEK contains the hits ELDORADO and NUMERI by Rudi Hoffmann.

ELDORADO:
The aim of the game is to reach the Isle of Dreams ELDORADO. Each player receives four markers, which are one color (red, yellow, blue or white) on top. All markers are green on the bottom. Players roll a single D6 and move any one of their markers the total count on their turn. Markers can land on top of one another, and, in so doing, trap opponents' markers, or their own until the top one is voluntarily moved off the stack. If a player's marker lands on the white spaces (in the water), that marker is turned into an island (green side up) and is stuck there, able to be used as a stepping stone for other players, for the duration of the game. The marker(s) that reach ELDORADO are stacked in the order that they reach there. Final score is highest for the top marker (last to arrive) and decreases for those lower in the stack. The winner is decided by the player whose marker(s) score the highest total points in the final stack.

NUMERI:
Each player receives six figures of the same color, numbered from 1 to six. The number on the dice signifies the figures to be played. A player must move figures totaling to the amount shown. If he rolls a six he can move as an example pawn number 2 and pawn number 4. They always move to the next free space that is available on the board.
If the player succeeds in making a chain - that means 3 or more pawns in a row he rolls the dice again.
The game is finished when the last three, specially marked squares are occupied. Each player receives the number of points achieved by multiplying the number of the square by the number of the occupying pawn.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dust Tactics: Axis NDAK Kampfgruppe
description:
Another Earth. A different 1947. The Second World War has raged for nearly a decade and its grip has spread to every continent on the planet. War has advanced swiftly and strangely in the Dust universe through the application of Alien VK technology — a limitless source of energy in its simplest form, and an unthinkable weapon in the wrong hands. Out of the mind of Paolo Parente comes the world of Dust, a world where tanks have evolved into powerful combat walkers, where rocket troops take to the skies and the latest laser cannon, phasers, and Tesla weapons rule.

This army deal box contains all the units and cards you need to get started with the Axis faction.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board
